review_content: Our biggest hassle was tracking down our confirmation. We booked ours through HotelPlanner.com--would not recommend! Cut the middle man and go straight to the site and call to make the reservation. I just assumed that the site would automatically send you a confirmation notice via email like all other courteous, intelligent, place would--not this. I waited until the day of to check my inbox and spam--nothing. We had to look at our search history to identify the hotel and call the number on our credit card charges to receive the confirmation email with itinerary. The overall hotel room is clean. I was expecting the queen bed suite to be bigger, but it's still roomy enough for a family of five. The pool, however, was itty bitty!! Big enough for our three kids under twelve, but as soon three random, overly lonely, and awkward guys in their twenties stepped in and decided to wrestle with each other, it was time to take our kids out. They were like little twigs in a kiddy pool with three elephants. Luckily the hotel ha a partnership with The Heights, a fitness club, that's less than 3 minutes away. There's open swim and a splash area. The front desk gals there were ultra nice! Given the convenience and free access to this beautiful place, gotta give this experience a four-star rating.Beds okPillows okRoom coffee goodDon't stay on the highway side of the building if white noise all night will bother youReasonable breakfastFree faxingDecent, unexceptional Springhill location.I'm generally a fan of this iteration of the Marriott brand. They tend to have clean, modern decor and reasonable prices. This location (in comparison to others I've stayed at) was just okay.First, the staff is really nice - there are a lot of other reviews mentioning that, and they're right. From the front desk to the breakfast staff - everyone is friendly and welcoming. It's also a new-ish property so the decor is updated. Another nice feature is the fact that there are multiple restaurants and retail establishments within walking distance which is ideal if you don't have a car.In terns of the room/experience - wasn't a huge fan. No outlets at ALL near the bed. None. Nada. WTF - it is 2015 and people have stuff to charge and laptops to work from. Outlets, stat - please! The wifi is free but I had issues getting it to work/not drop, which is a bummer when you're trying to get stuff done.Also not a fan of the lighting situation - everything is florescent, and there are no bedside lights. Just a huge fixture over the bed that shines with the light of 10,000 suns. Someone else described it as "bright enough to perform surgery by" which is fairly accurate. Not restful. My bathroom was "meh" in terms of cleanliness, particularly the walk in shower stall which reeked of mildew. The room rate I paid was $189/night which I thought was WAY overpriced.Overall, this is a decent, but not great, place to stay for a single business traveler. I would be leery of reserving if you're expecting people to share rooms as there is not much privacy. For example, the bathroom doors are frosted glass so if you were forced to room with a co-worker or something, it would be SUPER awkward.Nice hotel located right off of Brentwood in St. Louis. This place has pretty much everything that a business traveller could hope for, decent amenities, nice and modern, friendly staff and a very convenient location. The room itself was typical for a Springhill property, nice and clean and fairly modern, with bright colors and a good size. Parking is pretty easy with a structure adjacent to the property. The lobby and reception desk is a bit on the small side but really not anything to complain about here. Overall, highly recommended for business travelers. Pros-Marriott propertyParking Free wifi Light breakfast QuietModern Spacious rooms Cons-Cheaper decor Small lobby Not many snack optionsGreat hotel for the area. We always stay here when we visit St Louis. It is out of the way, but close to everything. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is standard. Alcohol drinks can be purchased in the lobby. Staff are friendly. There's also lots of parking.Easy access to many amenities and free parking with great service. I loved how clean and big the rooms were. They also have free breakfast. I also liked how I could get tea at any time of the day for free. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. There is s parking garage next to it that is free and essily accessible from the hotel. One other bonus was that their standard free wifi worked so well. I hate when wifi is slow or cuts you off and this never happened to us during our stay.I have returned several times since my last review, and while not perfect, there have been improvements. I choose to stay here because it is a Marriott property and it's location.Excellent greeting by JC. Huge room, comfortable bed with office/living room area. Microwave and fridge are provided. The parking lot is spacious but could use a little more lighting for safety. Close to I64 and Washington University. Plenty of chain restaurants next to the hotel, along with a Lowe's across the street. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and it led to this high rating. Fresh strawberries and sliced pineapple along with hard boiled and scrambled eggs are all provided. There's also an abundance of toppings for your oatmeal and ham and cheeses to select from.it was cool....nice location especially for business travelers....not the best Springhill that i've been. Judy the house maid is a mental patient.... The TV channels here move super slow..... TNT doesn't even have sound...Why the hell don't they have VH1 and BET?? makes you wonder hmmm......(racist perhaps?) for 139+ tax per night? then again how many black people do you see in Brentwood, MIssouri.....lolEnjoyed our stay! Nice room for a Priceline bid of $80/night on a Saturday. Plenty of parking that's just walking distance from the lobby. A good variety of restaurants within walking distance or very short drive.I would love to give five stars to this nicely furnished and suite filled hotel but I can't. The rooms themselves are fairly recently updated and look clean and fresh. That's about where the happy ends. Upon returning late in the evening the employee behind the counter never looked up to see who had entered and was going to the elevator. This was an employee that I hadn't seen when I checked in and would have expected them to ask for the the room key or a photo ID. The walls are so thin that while I was asleep the guy in the bathroom that was on the wall where the headboard was woke me up every time he peed. The sound of your neighbors pee isn't the way to wake up. Yuck. When the night staff slid the bill under the door at 4am they lost balance and fell in to the door. I guess that is likely a one time mistake but it didn't add to my happiness. And I normally like the breakfast available but on this day the eggs smelled like fish. Old fish. And I wasn't the only one who thought so.I've stayed here three times in the last few months but will be trying a different location on my next visit.Cons: Found a hair (that did not belong to me) in what was supposed to be a clean towel. No complimentary bottled water. Heater was so loud it sounded like there was a blizzard inside the room. No shower cap. Cheap soap left a grimy film on skin. Pros: Quick check in/out. Free WiFi. Free breakfast (though not a very good selection so maybe this should be a con). Close to restaurants.Whenever I see a Springhill near where I'm going- I stay there. In today's day in and age, there are a few perks that have now become necessity. Free wi-fi is a must and though the internet speeds are not the best, it gets the job done. Free parking, because nothing annoys me more than seeing a decent hotel price online only to pull-in and pay a huge fee just to park. Free breakfast, because...well who doesn't love free breakfast? And it's a decent spread too: bagels, toast, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, pork sausage, coffee and other drinks, and a waffle station, among others.The rooms are incredibly comfortable with feather pillows and a soft bed. There are several outlets in the room so you can connect your electronics and like other reviewers have stated, a fairly large walk-in shower. An empty mini-fridge to keep your left-overs in and a microwave to heat them up.Within range of most must-see St. Louis neighborhoods by car and near the highway. I definitely would stay again.Clean hotelGood serviceAffordableFree breakfast+parking+Wi-FiI forgot my clothes in the lobby and they ship them to me for free.If I go to st. Louis next time I will stay in the same hotel.This is a fine hotel with nice staff and an above-average hot breakfast. However, I have concerns over the cleanliness. When I arrived (at 2AM) there were bottles of cleaning supplies in my bathroom. During my stay I found hair that was not mine and the towels often had weird dryer fuzz on them. The refrigerator was really dirty and smelled bad. When I called the front desk, the manager came up to my room and cleaned it himself. I was very impressed but I will not choose to come back.Nice place to hang my hat.Comfy bed. Fluffy white linens. A shower large enough to be featured on MTV cribs: orgy edition. There's so much to like about this place. Really, I could go on- and I will...Lots of clean lines, large rooms, in room microwave and mini fridge, flat screen, free parking, wifi, diy waffle (and more) breakfast in lobby, nice pool, 24 hour gym, divider separated area w/ pull out sofa bed should you have company, ipod dock/radio/alarm, check out wasn't until noon, and so much more. The lobby doors are locked at night for safety so if you're checking in late like us, you might have to wait outside until the desk clerk lady determines you aren't a threat... I don't blame her for not immediately letting us in though. It was a long drive and I had no make-up on and I'm sure I was looking all kinds of toe up in her upper mid-level all suite hotel. I would defo stay here again if in the STL area. It's reasonably priced at around a hundo a night + taxes and sh*t; and it's less than a mile from Whole Foods, Trader Joes, Nordstrom Rack, Target, Walmart, basically all the necessity providers in life. And a short 10-15 minute drive into the heart of STL.Oh, one last thing- FREE CHUPA CHUPS IN THE LOBBY CANDY DISH!!!My 14 year old son recently traveled to St. Louis with his school for the World Robotics Competition in mid April. Upon returning home, he realized he had left his glasses and case behind. We called the hotel and honestly, I was not very optimistic they would turn up during the room cleaning. Well, two weeks later I received a call that they had indeed found his glasses and were going to mail them back to us. I know this doesn't sound like a big deal but it really shows the level of customer service the Operations Supervisor, Kevin Juilfs, delivers. It would have been much easier to toss the glasses or ignore our request but he went above and beyond and actually kept my contact information and sent them back to us in Tennessee. We received them in the mail yesterday and just wanted to show our appreciation to the Springhill Suites Marriott for their kindness and professionalism. Excellent job!This Springhill Suites is as nice an urban hotel as I have seen in a long time. The design of the hotel is very European (reminds me of London) and the staff was very helpful with getting me around.The free breakfast was about what I expected, coffee was good and available 24x7, and the room was very large with lots of room to spread out and get some work done.They also were helpful in letting me check out late. Used my Marriott points so not sure how the cost is, but I am going to be staying at more Marriott properties in the future, based on my experience with this hotel.Large rooms with separate seating area. L shaped sofa and desk, micro and fridge, clean and comfortable. Good location. Close to shopping and food. Close to Washington University. Pool, breakfast, free wifi, gym, computer stations available. Not expensive. Lots of perks.Very similar to any of the other newly built or renovated Sprinhill Suites that are out there, and this is a very good thing. These places are always clean, usually has a shower (NO TUB!), free breakfast, nice atmosphere, free Internet, HDTV, good AC, parking garage and nice staff. This place is right off the highway so it is easily accessed. It is in an area with a bunch of shops and restaurants so you can get the stuff you want quickly and easily. The rooms are very fairly priced for the quality of experience you will get. I will definitely stay here again when I visit STL and need to stay west of downtown.
review_content_20: I wish every hotel was at least this nice. Newer hotel with big rooms. Separate work, sleeping, and lounge are in each room. Wet bar with microwave, refrigerator etc. Nice touch is including paper plates and plastic utensils for those eat-in nights. Super clean and very nice staff.This hotel was very nice! It was centered in my opinion to St Louis. Not a far drive to downtown. The rooms were nice and very clean had a king size bed, a big screen TV bedroom was separated by the entry which had a couch, table, fridge, microwave and sink. Kinda like a studio apartment in my eyes. It had a free breakfast, covered parking and nice location. Store's near by were: Walmart, Starbucks, Qdoba and easy access to highway. I was able to get a room right around last minute so I cant complain. The staff was friendly and helped us out of towners find our way to local shopping and restaurants. I would stay here again with my next visit.Nice hotel. Friendly staff.  Breakfast setup is nice with large high table with single chairs surrounding.We decided to stay at Springhill Suites for the weekend to accommodate our desire for a little haven away from the bustle of things we were in St. Louis to do.  It met our requirements in spades.  One of the things I hate about most hotels is the patent ugly 80's mauve floral decor is that is so prevalent.  Well, no ugly mauve here.  No floral either.  The decor is quite refreshing and modern, actually.  The king memory foam bed is separated from a living room space by a nice translucent wall that emits soft light from the other area. The bed itself was extremely comfortable with plentiful pillows, soft white linens all around and OMG a FITTED SHEET!!! I marvel at this only because the rates for the suite we booked were comparable rates to those hotels that do sport scratchy mauve floraly nastiness.  The shower was also a surprise.  Very roomy and modern.  Bonus points.  The only down side is that we were by the stairwell and could easily hear all the activity outside our room.  But this seemed pretty minor in comparison to the good points. All in all, given the room, the accompanying breakfast, the rates and the convenient location, I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.Just got back from June trip to St. Louis.Pros - location, free parking, amazingly friendly staff.Cons - Very ODD room and bath.  We had our grandson with us and he wanted to sleep on the couch.  The mattress had no bottom sheet, and the bedding only contained a top sheet and heavy blanket.  Called for a top sheet and got it almost immediately.  Room had HUGE desk and full-size office chair - great for business person but not so much for a family.  Took up way too much floor space.  The 3-drawer dresser had tiny drawers that were only 8 inches deep.  Dresser held very a nice TV that could be turned to face living or bedroom area.   Beds were separated from living room by large translucent panel in the wall.  Let in light if someone wanted to sit up and read.  The lights over the beds were strong enough to perform surgery, and the small area next to the single sink gave no privacy to someone getting ready in the morning.  The bathtub and toilet were in a huge room with only one hook for towels or clothes, and there was no place to set anything down while you bathed, unless you wanted to put it on the floor.  This room also had a translucent door that let light filter into the sleeping area.  The tub had a grab bar installed for safety, but the location was wrong because it was right next the shower head and not in the middle of the tub where it was needed.The tiny closet was placed at the end of the room next to one of the queen beds.  The space between the closet and the bed was about 10 inches.  Awkward when moving luggage into the room.  The bedside table between the two beds was huge - and the alarm clock made an annoying buzzing sound during the night.The walls were incredibly thin and we could also hear the people passing through the parking lot in front of the hotel.  This lot was shared by a Houlihan's, Wood-Fired Pizza, and a condominium.  Very busy.We ate breakfast one day out of our 3 days at the hotel.  It was OK.  Coffee was good.  It would be a great room for one business person, but for our family of 3 it was not a good fit.Arriving at Springhill Suites for a wedding weekend I was excited.  The staff at the front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful.  Entering into my room I witnessed a classic case of American over-abundance.  Two queen sized bed, fold out sofa, big screen HDTV, and my oh my, a walk-in shower larger than bedrooms in apartments past.All that being said, what a let down.  For a bed with seven (yes seven!) pillows on it, not one was remotely comfortable, I woke up every morning with neck pain no matter which one I chose.  As for breakfast, at such a seemingly nice hotel, it was not up to bar.  A stale bagel and a cold sausage & egg patty to put on top--come on Springhill Suites, you can do better.Overall my gut really says to give this place 2 stars, but I feel as if that would be an injustice to the great staff.  Just get some better pillows and breakfast, a good nights sleep and a good breakfast are the key to a good day after all!Clean hotel, quiet rooms and a friendly staff. Great place to stay if you a business in the Brentwood area.Being my first trip to the St. Louis area, this hotel was very easy to locate.  Check-in was simple.  Free parking in the garage was nice.  The hotel is on the new side, so the rooms are well thought out and decorated simply with a modern touch.  Unlike the previous review, I found the bed to be quite comfortable.  The best part about the room was the shower.  A large walk-in shower with glass doors.  Water pressure was amazing.  The only issue I had with the hotel were noisy neighbors.  It sounded as though the upstairs room inhabitants were practicing for a marathon.  They ran back and forth in the room and somehow created large thuds until at least 2am.  I did not call the front desk as I was finally able to fall asleep.   We were also able to hear patrons of the restaurant/bar in front of the hotel walk back and forth to their cars during the night .  Point being, the walls in this hotel are THIN.  But, the amazing shower more than makes up for it.This hotel met my expectations in every way: I recently led a field trip with 8 students and myself, and we stayed for two nights in this hotel. The beds were comfortable, had plenty of pillows, the A/C was divinely cold, the shower had good water pressure, the TV had excellent quality and diverse channels, and the rooms were spacious enough for everyone to not feel cramped. The Chupa Chups downstairs in the lobby were especially nice.  :)Only downsides were that I had to park across the street in the Wal-Mart parking lot...but I doubt this will pertain to anyone else, unless they're driving a bus. I can't really fault them for not having parking options for such an odd situation. Other downside was that the breakfast didn't have bacon (you should have heard the teenage boys on THAT topic), but again, this isn't anything to truly complain about.All in all, if our tournament is in St. Louis next year, I already know where we'll be staying!

review_content: I recently spent three nights at this hotel. I am a big fan of the Doubletree and Hilton brands. My expectations for Doubletree properties are high, and this property did not disappoint! From the moment I walked up to the counter to check in until the time I left, everything was exceptional. The staff was vey friendly, the housekeeping was incredible... The food was very good as well. Food quality and service is a hit or miss subject at Hilton properties as far as I am concerned. My only complaint and the reason I cannot give this property five stars - The service at the lobby bar was consistantly slow. For example, on the Tuesday night of my stay, I ordered a dinner to go from the bar. My food was delivered to me in a fair amount of time. The bar area was not crowded, maybe 20-25 people total and there were two other employees helping the bartender deliver drinks and food. I sat at the bar and waited over 30 minutes for the bartender to give me my bill. She walked past me many times. The steel domed plate sitting on the bar in front of me. By the time I got the bill squared and the food up to my room, the food was cold. Other than the slow service at the bar, the hotel is one that I would definitely visit again!Spent 2 nights in this hotel on a recent business trip and it was an alright experience.  The hotel lobby is really nice with very modern decor.  When I checked in, I was somewhat disappointed that I wasn't  welcomed as a diamond member nor offered their signature super delicious warm chocolate chip walnut cookie.  I was so tired from a long day of travel and encountering delays that I didn't notice the cookie situation (or lack thereof) until I got to my room. :-(  At that point I didn't bother going to the lobby to get one.The room was alright, the couch had a questionable stain, which I just covered with  a towel and ignored during my stay.  The bathroom wasn't super clean, but again I didn't feel like asking for another room since I just wanted to sleep.  The comforter was super thin and not very warm, so I had to blast the heat to get a good night's sleep during my stay. The matress was comfortable so that was a plus.On the 2nd night, I went to the restaurant and sat by the bar but after 15 minutes and no service, I left and just ordered a delivery to be sent to my room.  The restaurant was full and the bartender was very overwhelmed and was struggling to keep up with the crowd.The pool and hot tub were great (which is why I gave my review 3 stars instead of 2)! Loved that they were spacious and warm.  My only complaint on that is that in order to get to the pool, upon exiting the elevator you have to walk past the restaurant in your swim wear in plain view of diners. Just seems rather awkward.All in all, I don't think I would stay in this hotel again.  It didn't feel like the usual Hilton experience with warm service, great hospitality and very clean rooms.Exceptional service, big spacious room, fabulous WORKOUT facility and indoor pool - what more can you want!  5 -S T A R S  all around from this globe trotter!This hotel was really good, and this is coming from a guy who stays in a lot of hotels. The classic Doubletree chocolate chip cookie is always a delightful welcome treat. The beds are the absolute best: Serta Perfect Sleepers with a Fairview mattress topper for extra padding. And the pillows are the best, simply the best... This is huge leg up for this hotel over competitors because a good, deep sleep is a primary necessity at a hotel.The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. They had a good breakfast in the morning: A buffet for about $12 and you could have a tasty omelette made for you for an extra $3. And they have hot sauce!The only qualms with my room and my friend staying in a another room was that the bathroom could have used a little more attention to detail in cleaning. There were some hairs on the floor and the shower. Also, the lining of the toilet and the floor showed some unsightly stains. They need to put a new type of lining there. Inspecting my mattress for the name, because I am going to buy one for myself, I did discover a gross looking stain which I will include in a picture. Overall, you can't really go wrong with a Doubletree. They are up to Hilton standards of guest service and the beds are incredible.Clean rooms and common areas, very comfortable beds, great service, and c'mon, warm cookies of course!Going to hold back just one star for this property due to its age starting to show a little bit. Nothing major, just a little scuffed paint here and there. The staff is absolutely tops like most Hilton properties. Plenty of parking, very easy access, shuttles to the airport. Attractive lobby and bar area. Approved!I was at this hotel to host an event and stayed overnight as well. The service was great. Its not often you experience customer service at this level. From the room to the event everything was great. They did an outstanding job. Highly recommended to everyone.Nice and clean hotel. Beds were not as comfortable as I would have liked, but the staff was friendly and the hotel was pretty nice overall. Free wifi, free cookies, a nice lobby and bar area and plenty of parking. Can't ask for a whole lot more.Will I go back? Yes.  This was an average Double Tree property.  I found the staff to be friendly and the room to be clean.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet.  The pool was a bit loud and there was some rough housing going on.  A manager (I'm assuming) came in and told me the pool was closing in 15 minutes and walked away.  It was as if he was expecting me to announce to the rest of the people in the room.  That did not happen and was the only odd thing that happened on the trip.Great service. Example: We ordered a cab but it didn't come for 40 minutes (not the hotel's fault). The front desk employee noticed our long wait and gave us free drink tickets for the hotel bar. Booyah!I love Doubletree.  This was clean and staff very courteous.  I have no complaints.  No Free WiFi, which would have gotten them that last star.  It was a quiet room and I presented there and the conference rooms were well maintained and audio visual was without problems.Ginger in the bar is the best bartender I have ever had serve me drinks or work for me at my former bar. She handled. Full bar of 50 people solo and performed amazingly. Promote her and hire people she can train. The rooms are a little mustyHilton standards always seem to be a little higher than the rest. This hotel has all the standard amenities like fridge, toiletries, lobby bar, business center, ect. However, the staff really seems to be running on all cylinders. They were very helpful, courteous, and efficient. Highly recommended..Spent the weekend here for my bachelorette party and the hotel was ok. They put us in rooms next to each other, which is what we requested and the cookies are good, but the showers had VERY little pressure and the pool is pretty tired. The hot tub was fine until you try to turn on the jets... OMG! it's like it's going to explode. We had to get out of it until the timer went off. Oh and no free breakfast fyi.I was here for a convention of sorts.  We used the conference rooms/banquet rooms.  The staff was all very nice.  The rooms were large and seemed to be maintained very well.  I was not a fan of the food however.  The wings had very little chicken on them.  The wing sauce was passable but not anything to write home about.  The Toasted Ravs kept on coming out cold and tasted frozen (they most likely were).  The fruit all tasted fresh and they had some very large strawberries.  I did not spend the night here so I don't know how the rooms are but the hotel seemed to be very clean and as I said earlier the staff were all very nice.Went to a packed airport on a Friday afternoon and the airline offered me a voucher to fly the next morning. They put me up in this hotel for the night.  The shuttle driver to the hotel was friendly and helpful with his tips about restaurants and things to do around the area. Although, there is nothing in walking distance, there is a shuttle that will take you to the dining options. Shuttle service to the airport is available every half hour. The check-in staff however left much to be desired. Presenting my voucher, I suddenly heard, "here's another one." Not sure if the airline voucher was the cause of their confused and somewhat unhelpful attitude but it was disappointing after such a friendly shuttle driver. After asking about a hotel restaurant, they pointed down the hall and when asking about the food voucher given to me by the airline, they actually quipped " I have no idea." I wouldn't mind so much, except isn't that your job? 2 Stars for subpar check in staff. The rest of the hotel is nice though, with upscale lobby, bar and the rooms are modern, spacious, and clean. There is free parking and a mini-fridge. Ate at the bar and the bartenders blew the check in staff out of the water. Friendly, fun, helpful and never left me thirsty. They give 2 stars back for a 4 star review. Check out staff in the morning was much nicer and definitely made up for the prior experience.It was a cold, wintry night.  I'm talking it was so cold I nearly tried to work out a deal with the United employees to let me sleep on the plane because I didn't want to even be in the jet bridge of the aircraft.Nonetheless, despite the snow and unrelenting winds, a hotel shuttle picked me up and drove ever so cautiously to our destination.  From the moment I walked in, service was very good.  I was offered warm chocolate chip cookies (which I simultaneously politely declined and bit my tongue at the same time) and told there were two bottle of water waiting for me in the room.  Get to the room and its spacious, clean and comfortable.  Got situated and then went down to the bar/restaurant, Cooperfields.  It was the night of the big game (the one Venu F. went to Pasadena to see) and Cooperfields was packed.  However, the lone server, Ginger G., did such an awesome job of taking care of everyone and handling the orders as best she could.  She did great!  I ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and the triple decker club.  That sammich must've been as tall as an encyclopedia.  It was huge and I, not wanting to injure or embarrass myself, had to deconstruct it somewhat just to take a bite of it.  It was very good, though.Breakfast was complimentary for Diamond members and it was a nice spread.  I liked that they had organic foil packs of milk and chocolate milk.  I asked to take an extra chocolate milk to my room as a post jump rope drink and was told to take two if I wanted.  I'd absolutely stay at this hotel again and would hope to have the same people serve me next time as much as the last time; they were really, really professional all the way around.Oh, Doubletree. I wanted to like you, I did. Especially given that I was clearly given some sort of free upgrade at check-in, which was really nice of your people.But... that room upgrade, which was huge - hell, I had a conference table and 3 sofas in my room - wasn't all that. Luckily I was here for a total of 10 hours so I didn't have to deal with this place too terribly long. - The ceiling had really obvious water damage. It was super gross. - One HVAC system was on cold, the other was on warm. I must be a moron, because I saw no buttons (just a blank panel) to adjust the setting and my bed was on the cold side of the room. BRRR. - The TV volume wouldn't go up loud enough for me to actually hear what they were saying. Correction: it went up on the screen, but the actual volume never increased. - The open shower concept was fine, except I spent more time trying not to spray water all over the bathroom floor than I did showering. - Terrible bathroom lighting + no full length mirror = this hotel is clearly geared towards businessMEN and not women. - The bed wasn't that comfy. - The temperature in the fridge was so cold my bottled water turned to ice overnight. Just what I wanted when I woke up freezing thanks to the a/c issue.Free parking. Free WiFi. So, not all is lost.Just okay overall.Pretty standard DT property with downsides:-  A/C wouldn't cool the room past 74 degrees-  Difficult to find off the 270 ramp  -  No restaurants / stores within walking distance-  No Executive Lounge (although they offer free breakfast for Diamonds)That being said, it has a nice bar area with some big screen TVs and the rooms are decent.  The temperature problems were probably the biggest problem, it was only a problem a couple nights but then again it was only hot a couple days I was there.  I ended up staying at the Frontenac after a couple weeks here - nicer location, rooms, and facilities (gym is way bigger), but the rates are higher as well.Nice hotel not so great location.  Good van service to the airport..  Doubletree hotels have always provided good clean rooms in all their hotels I stay in.This place would have gotten 5 stars except that it is not the easiest place to find. Once you are there however, it is a very nice hotel. Great lobby bar, work-out facility, pool and rooms!.
review_content_20: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and enjoyed my time there. It was well kept, and quiet. The rooms were large and up to date. The staff was helpful and the roomservice was quite tasty yet far from cheap. The biggest perk however, were their delicious chocolate chip cookies. I'd stay here again.This place is alright. Nice lobby bar with plenty of TVs to catch whatever game you're interested in. Friendly staff. Good and free breakfast if you've got HHonors status. Same goes with the wifi. They have an omelet bar! It's right next to the freeway but it's deceivingly actually a good few minutes off driving. Yet again at a Hilton property, no upgrades available for me...lame. Nothing to do within walking distance that I saw so make sure you've got a car or be prepared to taxi it.The hotel itself is very convenient to west St. Louis and the airport. Parking was ample. The hotel bar was very nice although a little too loud to try and work in. My room rate was very reasonable and the heat worked well.Room service was good and relatively prompt. The only two issues I had were the fact the maid seemed to clean every other day (I was there for a week) and the high cost of wireless internet access. Never replaced the water glasses and emptied the trash once. She did make the bed every day and that was the extent of it. I did not confirm that this wasn't some sort of green initiative on their part, but it made coming back after a long day of training almost a chore.I probably should have said something after the third day, but I didn't want to complain.Typical Doubletree hotel; but the location is horrible if one doesn't have a car and wants to visit the sites and attractions of St. Louis. There wasn't even a Starbucks or a convenience store anywhere within walking distance of the hotel. Too isolated.. Going to see the Arch required waiting to take the hotel shuttle to the airport, then catching the light rail and taking it downtown...about an hour-long journey.Hotel itself was just ok but every single person I dealt with was incredibly nice and helpful. Front desk, room service, breakfast staff, everyone was great. Bed very comfy. No central air, the rooms have individual units so that's not great. I was near elevator but very quiet.I found a room in this hotel for $86 on kayak.com and was very happy with it. For the price and 3 star status, it's an exceptionally nice hotel. The location wasn't very good for our purposes, though. We had to drive 15-30 minutes to get anywhere we wanted to go. Still, I would consider staying there again, if the price were right.Very nice hotel. Very clean, great staff, very helpful. I got a room for $54 a night so it was a steal. Housekeeping was not the best, they forgot to leave a plastic liner for the ice bucket but thats nothing major. Its a really quiet place to unwind. I highly recommend it and will be booking again.real nice place. i live in hotels, at least 15 nites out of the month. service here was AWESOME, the bartender was real nice as well. this is a popular spot for a lot of airline emp's, and customers/employees for the many businesses aroundthey run a 24 hour shuttle to the airport, and since they're owned by the same group that owns the Sheraton at Westpoint, run that shuttle 24hrs too!got the room at corporate rate, so price was super good.they also gave me a breakfast coupon (but i lost it).room was comfy, kinda trendy/modern/boutiqey decor...the only mismatch in the room was the 1992 TV...LCD on the wall would have made it even better.definitely be staying here the next time im in town...What's that you say? Warm cookies upon arrival? Oh yes, it's true. And while that fact alone is enough to keep me coming back, there is also an indoor pool, spa, and a small fitness center. (Perfect for working off the multitude of hot dogs and beer inevitably consumed at a Cardinals' game!) Another handy fact: the rooms are almost assuredly sound proof. I know this after hosting a fairly loud private dance party (invitees: myself), then hosting an entire band/party later that night until sometime after 4:30 in the morning. I'm talking guitars and self-written tunes belted through the commotion usually associated with a hotel party. For fear of tainting my pristine reputation, all I'll say is that very acrobatic extracurricluar activites also went uninterrupted at all hours. The night shift staff was very cool about the assortment of characters I brought through; they have to be the most good natured tired people I've ever met. In fact, the entire staff was really helpful from cabs to late-night delivery, to dealing with 4 AM drunken ramblings......I think I love it here. You should go. No, really. Get into your car, drive to the airport and get on a St. Louie-bound flight RIGHT THIS INSTANT!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn St Louis-Forest Pk/Hampton Ave
review_content: This is a decently priced hotel if booked on Expedia. It isn't necessarily close to anything but it is very close to the interstate and easy to call a taxi. Edit: it is close to things. I realize I don't know the area well enough to make that kind of call and that we did book it to be close to the zoo, which I forgot because we didn't end up going. It was about a $15 taxi ride to the arch. The room didn't seem to be as clean beforehand - there were Cheetos on the floor by the bed and in the bathroom. There was a note left in our lock asking if we needed anything, which was nice.  We didn't know they had a pool and it isn't very well advertised. The air conditioner is super loud! No mini fridge. The bed is really hard (if you like soft beds). The TV is slow and there doesn't seem to be a guide channel. Overall we wanted a simple, cheaper place to stay and that's what we got so don't regret staying here.I like the IHG family of brands, and have spent a lot of time in HIE, HI and Crowne Plazas. I didn't know much about this property except from the reviews.This isn't the worst place I've stayed -- not by a mile -- but it needs major work.Let's start with the good stuff: Good location (right on the freeway), good pricing (I think I know why, though), friendly staff. Relatively speedy wifi for free.The cons:* The room's door didn't seem to ever shut correctly. It did, but I had to make an effort to close it and pull it closed. From inside the room, there was a gap where I could push the door back and forth, which meant that there was a gap in the seal. Translation: I could hear everything in the hall, and they could hear me. Bigger con: Someone (another guest) actually walked into my room one day. It was probably my fault for not pulling the door shut hard enough.* Related: The room had a balcony with a sliding glass door... which had one of those metal security bars across it. Kinda shabby to start with. But seeing how the frame of the glass door was actually cracking the pain and pulling away... not cool. Hearing the wind rattle the glass door: Not cool.* Further related: I could hear everything from the guy and his "escort"/special friend from the room next door. I mean EVERYTHING.* The hotel was obviously built WAY before the advent of electronic devices. The hotel has tried some neat tricks to accommodate these; they had a device on the nightstand that functioned like a power strip, with four outlets and two USB charging slots. Way cool. Not so cool: That device itself was attached to a power strip behind the bed, against the wall, on top of the box spring. On the power strip was the device, the lamp, the alarm clock and another lamp. I'm not saying it was a fire hazard... but I'm saying I would never do this at home because it's a little scary.I do appreciate that they have taken an older property and tried to modernize it. However, I won't be back here just because there's a general feeling of neglect. Some TLC could turn this into a much nicer property... but as it stands, I'm moving on.Note: This review is about the meeting rooms - no overnight stay was done by me. My work was having a special training class and the size of attendees exceeded the capacity of our in house conference room. We shopped around for a meeting room and since when we have employees from out-of-town visiting STL, we use this Holiday Inn, they gave us a good deal. The table and chairs they provided were comfortable and accommodating to our needs. Most importantly, was the sound. With all the meeting rooms in the hallway being in use, there was no distractions of hearing what was going on in the other rooms. My co-workers who came in from other cities and had to stay over-night in the rooms - I heard no complainants. If you work in the area and need a small to larger meeting room for your business or organization, this HI can fill your needs.As I was scheduled for major surgery at Barnes Jewish Hospital, we needed a place to stay for about a week. Since I didn't want to drop a ton of money on a hotel for what was decidedly not a pleasure trip, we went to Priceline and plugged in $70 and came out with this hotel. I wish we would have splurged for more, as it was certainly an unpleasant trip. First, the good: Free parking and wifi, which definitely saved us some money. Also, the location is pretty convenient to the 44, which made getting around Saint Louis quite easy. Finally, the shower had awesome water pressure. There, I'm out of good.Our first issue was with housekeeping. After our first night there, we left the room at a bright and early 830 AM. When we returned at 5PM, the room still hadn't been cleaned! I called down and they said it was because when they came by to clean the sign was up! Was 830 some sort of cutoff? After I insisted that somebody come and clean the room they obliged and we had to sit in the lobby for half an hour while somebody came and fixed the room. It was all quite awkward, but they were friendly enough and I was ready to just get on with our stay. Then this happened.My father and stepmother were in a different room and were very unhappy with the hotel and I couldn't figure out why, but they were unhappy enough to cut their trip short. Finally we learned they were switching rooms and I got it out of them: their original room was COVERED in mold. I went to see for myself and the entire A/C unit and the wall panel above it was flecked with mold. Lots of mold. This is a serious health concern! The room was rank and uninhabitable, only my poor parents HAD inhabited it for days. This will not stand. I ask my parents what the hotel has done to accommodate and they confessed that beyond the room switch, they had simply been offered a complimentary breakfast the next morning.I hightailed it to the front desk with the family in tow. A bit more aggressive than my parents, I wanted to make sure the manager understood that housing people in a petri dish is unacceptable.I laid out to the gentleman how I saw the situation, that breakfast wasn't fair compensation for keeping people in an unhealthy environment and suggested they comp the entire stay. To his credit, he didn't argue and did it right away. That right there is the sole reason for a 2nd star. Unfortunately for me, this place isn't the worst hotel into which I've ever stepped foot. But because of their cleanliness issues, I cannot in good conscious recommend to anybody a stay at the Holiday Inn Forest Park.I filmed a TV pilot in St. Louis in June of 2013. My crew and I got a great deal on a group deal at this hotel. The Pros:Spacious rooms and comfortable beds.Wonderful staff - They were efficient and kind with every request. They threw in one of their conference rooms with our deal and it became our production office. Location - Not far from downtown and in a quiet area.Cons:Air conditioning unit was so so. It either worked and was loud or did not work and we roasted.The layout is kind of cumbersome. It is a long walk from the entrance to the main elevators. The decor is straight out of the 70's and sometimes the hotel has a musty smell.Overall, it was a comfortable place to rest my tired bones for a week. The staff is really the main selling point. Because I travel for work,  I find myself really relying on hotel staff much more then I do when I'm traveling for leisure.I stayed 5 days. The location was very convenient but the property itself is lacking. My room was musty smelling with a small 70s concrete block balcony with view of the parking lot. I spent a lot of time in my room working and one day I waived off Housekeeping when they knocked on my door. The next day I personally asked Housekeeping to vacuum my room as there was debris along one wall. I don't think she knew what "debris" meant as I had to show her where I thought I spied a chunk of cat poo/kitty litter along the wall. When I returned afterward, the chunky bit remained as well as other bits that told me there was no vacuuming done... My white socks were yucky after a day working in my room. The Housekeeper the next day took care of my concerns. Really, is that too much to ask? Ugh, sticky carpeting... It was cheap though, less than $90 a night. But I think I'll go back to Home Suites.Stayed here for 5 days, staff was very friendly and housekeeping was very accomdating to us with extra towels and a lot of extra coffee. Really love that the bath products are bath and body works. Bed is comfortable,relatively clean, if you walk around without shoes beware of your feet turning black. Wish there were more outlets. Delicious FREE cookies made daily at the front desk. Elevator is slow and the carpeting throughout are dated with stains but a lot of seating one the first floor. Gym has 4 cardio machines and weights rack. Pool is nice and fast food in walking distanceIt is a Holiday Inn so I didn't expect the Taj Mahal. Great value. It felt like a boutique hotel. The front end staff were professional and baked chocolate chip cookies for all the guests. They called me in my room to see if I needed anything. Great place to stay.It was a good stay if you're traveling for business.  Not sure if is take my family.The staff were nice and explained the hotels amenities.  The a/c worked great.All in all a good place to stay on a business trip.We stayed for an overnight and while the hotel was clean and had just been updated, we were supposed to have a queen bed and we didn't.  Also there was a dirty towel on the back of the bathroom door and the bottom sheet was inside out which made me a little worried. We were put on the side of the hotel facing the interstate which didn't make much sense seeing as how there were only a few rooms that were booked. Even after we came back after dinner there was only 12 cars in the parking lot. The a/c was SO LOUD that every time it would turn on I'd wake up although it did drown out the interstate noise.Front desk was very personable and welcoming, did all he could to welcome us in and be accommodating. The place is decked out for the holidays and looks pretty nice. Has a security guard at night to watch the vehicles, not sure of the neighborhood, but front desk said there should not be any problems.Room was decent, lower end fixtures and carpet but it was in good shape. Only real complaint was the hair. There was what appeared to be dog hair all over the bed spread and sheets of both beds. They do allow pets for a $25 charge, but apparently they don't use the extra $25 to clean up the bedding.The hotel smells like wet dog and old cigarettes. My "fresh towels" had blood spatter on them that wasn't mine. Bed frame was broken.  Key card reader never works on the first go. Highway noise in the room. Stay somewhere else...We asked for a double when we reserved the room. When we checked in we were told they did not have any doubles available and the hotel was sold out. We had to settle for a single. They did offer a roll-a-way but that's not the same. The elevators are old, small and slow. The room itself was decent and clean with a comfortable bed. The staff was friendly as well so that helped.Convenient location, nice staff but I think the common areas need to be upgraded. It's a good hotel for the price I got from Priceline.Great room - great service - didn't use the amenities because it was such a short stay.The staff and location were both great. Other than that : mediocre. Nothing special. I've stayed at holiday inns before and was expecting the fountains and the indoor pools and hottubs and spas... This place had a "gym" and an outdoor pool which didn't help me in November. The room was standard, clean. The heat is motion activated so I kept waking up freezing. And there was random little things that were frustrating: I had to swipe my card three times every time for door to open, the side door didn't close you had to pull it with all your might to shut it, the elevator door closed almost beside you were in it. My wifi stopped working and I had to call their customer service department which is a teenager that answers phones with great ideas like "have you tried turning it off and on again?" But the worst part , the walls were paper thin. And there was a crying baby next door. And they were replacing Carpet above me until like 10 pm. I could even hear this person drop soap in the shower and the baby sneeze. I can never usually hear anything from other rooms. Doors opening and slamming shut all night. If you book through Priceline idk how much it is maybe it would be an okay deal if you don't want to sleep but going straight through hotel, WAY over priced.Stayed in this hole multiple times on visits to St. Louis. Excellent front desk service, nice and clean rooms, and overall a quiet neighborhood. Quick access to highway makes it easy to get where I wanted to go around town. Would gladly recommend this hotel to friends and family that I know need a place to stay while in town.I stayed here again and they have been amazing. It was really clean, comfortable beds, and the staff has been great. We booked through a third party for a discounted rate. We needed to extend our stay because of being snowed in and they booked us an extra night and matched the discounted rate. On top of that, they upgraded us to a room with 2 queens instead of 1 (which came standard with our third party booking). The hotel has a lounge and a restaurant, so being snowed in was not terrible. Awesome place. I HIGHLY recommend it.Good stay for the road warrior. Nice staff and convenient for where I needed to be.Booked here because of cheap cost. Won't book again due to 3 main issues. 1. First arrived and TV did not work for a day. 2. They try to save money by having air conditioning that shuts itself off after a time period. 3. Needs upgrades (ex. elevator claustrophobic, slow, and makes odd noises). Tolerable for a overnight stay but not as much for an extended business trip.
review_content_20: If I had paid full price I might feel ripped of, but seeing as I got a deal from Hotwire I'm fine with staying here. Over all I'm not impressed, this place could really use updating.The room itself was clean and everything worked, but a good example of the lack of updating would be the old-school, non-HD TV.Government rate allowed a $10 kickback for breakfast at on-site restaurant per day, but there were two of us; no continental breakfast even.  Bathroom was sadly out-dated and with no exhaust fan, although beds were comfortable.  Expected better for the price we paid.After party at the Holiday Inn. Despite the brand image, this place was actually pretty decent. Big room and clean.* Location poor - not in Clayton or near Forest Park as I expected* Elevator doors made scary rubber band sound when opening/shutting.  Management posted permanent sign to indicate safety inspection was on file.* Toilet not fully attached to the wall* Toilet seat not fully attached to the toilet* Shower had two temps:  scalding or freezing* Room had two temps:  sweaty or freezingWhat broke the camel's back?  Coming home after ten pm to an unmade bed, upon which I had left ONE JACKET, written on 'Stay Thoughtful' notepaper which read:"Personal Belongings on bed!!!  Couldn't make Bed"I tried to post a photo of the note on the Holiday Inn Facebook page and they wouldn't let me post the photo, so I came here.This was the last stop on a long family road trip.   We did the DSM-KC-STL triangle before heading back to the Chicago area.    It's a Holiday Inn.   It appeared to be updated recently with new linens, wallpaper, but the smell of smoke lingered in some areas of the hotel.  The exterior is an old stucco which was not very appealing and it's not exactly cheap.  What it is - a place to sleep with free wifi close to the Zoo.  The staff is generally friendly and willing to help out with recommendations.WOW!  A 5 star review for a hotel like the Holiday Inn?!  Yes, it's quite accurate!  And picky Yelper Richie is here to explain why:-They manager upgraded me to a double occupancy room for free at check-in.-Since I was staying 12 days (on a business trip), they brought in a microwave and refrigerator.-The staff was always really friendly and willing to serve you to their best abilities.-Even though the hotel is a bit older, it is kept up and clean (I found not even one hair on the bathroom floor at the entrance glance!  Hard to find!)-Gifts would always be left for me when I arrived back at the hotel after a long day of training.  Popcorn, snacks, a Happy Mardi Gras basket with a bunch of goodies and bead necklaces...-They give you a menu of pillows to choose from (in addition to the 4 mini pillows already on your bed).  I personally loved the Firm Pillow & U-Neck Pillow.-FREE WI-FI!!!!!! (Hence how I'm writing this review).-Automated wake-up call system that wakes you up 3 minutes before when you set it.-The room service is prompt.  I would order my to-go breakfast in the morning and it would be waiting for me at 7:45, along with the check to run out.-I left my phone charger in my room and they had it there are the desk.  They seem to learn who their clients are which makes it more personalized.-One of the managers told me that they're trying to become "green".  We'll see what happens but they'll have to get rid of smoking to begin.-The best for last...It was my 1.5 year anniversary with my boyfriend who secretly sent me an Edible Arrangement of chocolate-dipped strawberries.  They left a voicemail in my room and then called again later to let me know that something was in the lobby for me.  The desk worker handed over the gift, wished me a Happy Anniversary and winked.  Gay friendly staff plus.I was a bit concerned making the reservation at first due to:-Only an outdoor pool-Location far from MetroLink and only close to The Hill Italian neighborhood-There are smoking rooms still.  BE SURE to request the 3rd floor if you're allergic to smoke or are just not a smoker because the other floors are either every other room or the far end of the hall is smoking.-Simply it's a Holiday InnEverything worked out after all and it was a pleasant stay!Disappointing.  Understaffed front desk, small rooms, no hot water for several hours, sink nearly clogged/slow drain, bathtub faucet wouldn't shut off, heater would cycle on for brief periods, and light rain in the morning killed the TV's satellite signal.  It's definitely below the standard for what I expect in a Holiday Inn.A 5 star review? I must be crazy right? Well, maybe but certainly not for giving this particular hotel 5 stars. I stayed at this location for one evening and while the building is older and not at all flashy the staff is really what made the stay a 5 star stay. I really have never dealt with such a friendly front desk staff both at check in and check out and to top it off I received a really delicious chocolate chunk cookie. Chocolate, friendly staff and super quiet/private room....just what I love and just what I needed.

review_content: I did not know what to expect from the Hotel Magnolia as St Louis was a new destination, and we were traveling with our pooch. Located in the heart of downtown, a stone's throw from the convention center, the Magnolia offers boutique, customized service in this bustling area. From the moment we pulled up until our departure, service was accommodating, warm and helpful. Bobby, at the front desk, is a master of customer service.Our suite on the 12th floor was huge with comfortable and attractive furnishings. However, the bathroom layout is a bit weird and takes some adjustment. The sink is in the same space as the closet, which is in a seperate space from the toilet and tub/shower room. Odd at best and a victim to the refurbishment of an older building. The Magnolia's bar, restaurant, and common areas are very cool and work well within a boutique concept.For the price, location, room size, and gracious service, I cannot imagine any better choice for lodging in the city of St. Louis, Missouri.DO NOT STAY HERE. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND RACIALLY PROFILES GUEST...The hotel is nice in the inside. However the people in the inside are terrible. I came to this hotel a week prior to checking in and informed the staff I was having an engagement party and I wanted to view the room. I bought the gateway corner suite because it seem secluded. They never once said I couldn't have a party. Never once said I had a particular time that I couldn't have the party. I checked in and the room was filthy. The manager didn't take my word for it had to come to my room to approve if I needed a new room. Was granted a new room said he'd give me a credit but didnt. Then once the gathering started the men were just watching the basketball game and the ladies were just talking. Around 10pm I got a knock on the door the manager was mean and on edge and told us we needed to get out. He never gave us a warning. I spent over $300 for this gathering and would have gladly had it somewhere else if I knew I'd be treated so poorly. I wish I'd gotten some type of warning. I wish someone would have told me a party was not recommended there. The manager then called the police on my room! Which was totally unnecessary because we coroporated with him. We had to leave the hotel to go to a bar which I could have did that without spending close to $200 on a room! I called corporate and apparently this is a small company and they knew the manager... was not sympathetic to the fact that I was treated so poorly. No one warned me a party was not something that I could have after I informed them multiple times... I feel like they just took my money and stuck their middle fingers up to me. They didn't try to offer me a new room, a refund, or partial refund. They do not value their customers. They don't try to accommodate anyone that spends their money. They didn't try to help my situation. They didn't care that now I have to sit and plan another engagment party because they were thirsty for a sale. This whole situation could have been avoided! Again do not have any gatherings, parties here. Don't stay here period because there are a ton of hotels that would treat you 10 times better and appreciate you spending your money and time there. I couldn't go into great detail but I am telling you I wouldn't be writing this long review if I didn't get treated the worse I've ever have been at an hotel. Save your money go somewhere where they will treat you nicely.This is a review for the hotel bar, because I'll review the hotel itself separately.This bar is great. Janice is a terrific bartender, she's absolutely great. Really easy to talk to and pleasant. Mixed up a great drink for me when I wanted a variation of a cosmo-type drink with grapefruit, and she hit it spot on, it was a great drink! And she is really attentive to when you need another drink.The bar itself is really cool, it has a nice fluorescent bartop with changing colors. Very pleasant atmosphere to have a drink in this nice hotel bar. They have a TV if you do want a little distraction, but the sound isn't on if you don't want to be bombarded by it, I like that.Plenty of good selection of drinks and wines, great ambiance, and great service. But it doesn't stop there. The food at the hotel restaurant is very good too, apparently, because we ordered the macaroni and cheese, and it was absolutely fabulous -- I mean just outstanding - not in an I've been drinking and I'm hungry way, but in a legit foodie way. First of all, the macaroni was actually macaroni, not penne or fusill, good old fashioned elbow macaroni. Secondly, the cheese sauce, which was gouda-based, was the absolute perfect consistency - smooth, creamy, not chalky, not chunky. And it had delicious pieces of bacon in it, which added flavor, but without overwhelming the dish. I mean, this mac and cheese blows away all the others I've ever tasted.Anyway, this bar is great, lots of fun, great drinks, great food, great service. Come see for yourself!From the moment we walked in we knew we made a good choice on the hotel. The valet gentlemen were very welcoming every time we went in and out for our car. The front desk staff as well were very accommodating and always greeted us. ROOMS: The rooms are large in size and the suites with the extra room really did make a huge difference with a bigger group of people. 4 girls getting ready appreciated the extra room and the fact that the sink was separate from the toilet/shower. The only thing was that I wished there was in the room was a fridge. BREAKFAST: Such a great variety of food. I also like the a la cart option so that you can have fresh eggs and other hot items. DINNER: We also had dinner in the hotel and the ONLY aspect of our entire stay that I can complain about is that the tables are cute for happy hour but WAYYY to small for dinner. We had a party of 7 and it was really tight and a little uncomfortable trying to eat on them. Other than that the food, drink, waiter was fabulous.I would definitely recommend this hotel the location is a perfect walk to restaurants, the ball field and many tourist attractions.Four stars because I can't rate the hotel as a paying guest just yet. I went in to try the restaurant (Robie's) and couldn't help but take-in this beautiful hotel's decor.This building has undergone a major face-lift and it looks absolutely amazing; what a well done renovation! The contractors were able to keep a lot of the original features. My observations:Stained glass windowsBeautiful furniture throughoutSpaciousGorgeous Chandeliers Well litLots of private seating areas Restaurant Friendly staff Clean restroomsTrip Advisor Award AAA 4 Diamond Award Starbucks next door Bissinger's Chocolate at the front desk!!!!! What more do you want???My next staycation will be booked right here.Who cares how good the hotel is when they bump prepaid reservations due to "a situation."Oh, Magnolia... you seemed so nice... We stayed here on Labor Day weekend and overall had a lovely time. The employees were all friendly and helpful. You can tell they've been well trained and are striving to be a proper 4*. Where Magnolia suffers is that it even though it looks completely renovated, they only put lipstick on the pig. The walls are so incredibly thin you'll here everything your neighbor does... and, I mean, EVERYTHING! I spent most of the night laying awake wondering if they'd ever go to sleep.Loooooove this hotel!!! Im here once to twice a month. You can not beat the price for what you get. Rooms are amazing!!! Dog friendly!!! Its very gorgeous! Staff is amazing besides one brat of a manager. She was only rude one. Rest of staff is great! Food is amazing! They serve free warm cookies and milk every night. I cant help but have one, or five. Ha The gym here is one of the best. Very new and clean, with enough to get all my workouts done. I tell everyone about this hotel. Great location! Their shuttle is a Tesla car... I mean awesome!!!! This hotel is very unique and different than any I've ever stayed in and I have stayed in several hotels. This one is a must!!!I have had family and friends stay here on multiple occasions as I live next door. The rooms are cute, though the standard rooms are very small and most don't have good views. However, the beds and linens are comfortable. The Suites are much more spacious and seem to have more light. The building itself is beautiful and the renovations they have done so far really maintain the charm of the former Mayfair.The restaurant has a wonderful staff, particularly Rob who I often join at the bar for lunch. There's another woman who works with him who is also lovely. Additionally, Cyrus and the younger hispanic gentleman that works with him are friendly and attentive. Really, Robie's has an all around great staff!The breakfast is a limited cold continental breakfast, but enough to get you through to lunch. Milk and cookies in the evening are a nice touch, especially if you have kids.Check in is easy, although I've run into a few discrepancies about overcharges that took months to clear up. The manager nor the corporate contacts never returned my emails. Finally, I had to go in person months later to get everything cleared up. Luckily, a former employee of theirs, Iman, took care of it like he did with everything. I miss having him around! The new front desk staff is pleasant.Valet is for the most part friendly and efficient. They put up with my dirty car so I can't complain! They have complimentary car service in their company Tesla within a couple miles of the hotel, which is a nice touch.One thing I'd like to see, as well as all my neighbors at the Tower, is discounts for the residents. It would bring me, as well as many other people in a lot more, which would only increase sales! We have our family and friends stay with the Magnolia, giving priority to them as the go to hotel, and certainly would be more inclined to frequent the bar and restaurant more often if there was a discount. Come on management, you know we've been asking for this for a while...please!?!?Found the Magnolia hotel on the Expedia app! They were 25% off for the night and they were close to the wedding reception we had to go to, so let do it! 101 bucks after taxes and extras! Not bad! Downtown! Let's do it! Now this is not a review of the Expedia app but if it was I would say 1 star because they had not sent the info for our room yet! They sent me a confirmation but not the hotel! Lucky for us, the front desk man got it figured out and we were in! I appreciated it! The rooms are cool, very sleek and modern, nice couches, comfy beds, great tv, nice bathrooms! These rooms have been re-designed and awesome! There is a free hot breakfast! Free drink happy hour, and free cookies and milk from 8 to 10! The lobby is pretty small, but the restaurant bar was great! And the staff was top notch! No parking lot here, but they do have valet parking for 25 bucks, not bad for downtown St. Lou in a safe spot and you can just send them a text and they have your car ready in 10 minutes! Good stuff here! I would stay here again for this price!Easy 4 star experience. Was tempted to rate 3...due to terrible valet service. If you can avoid using valet...you should. It was so bad in fact...it almost overtook the great experience of everything else. Management: please work on this aspect of things.Bar was fantastic, spacious and well-appointed. Recommend suite instead of standard...gets you a better master bedroom and bathroom set up is improved.Great location within walking distance of anything you need: Cardinals, Rams, restaurants, Arch, etc.It's a lovely looking place and right in the heart of the city, but looks and location can only go so far. The service was friendly but woefully slow, and the continental breakfast was lacking variety and protein. Not somewhere I'd go again.Wow. Thank you so much for ruining my wedding weekend and putting me in tears the day before. I booked the best room Magnolia has 5 months in advance so that I could take pictures with my mom/grandma (who came in from Croatia ... No big deal) and bridesmaids while getting ready. Our wedding starts at 5PM on Saturday so I decided to book it for Saturday night with check in at 3. I decided to change my reservation to Friday night with late check out and was told by Brian that it was just a $15 dollar fee for late check out. Confirmed my change with Hotels.com to Friday night. Called Magnolia to be charged that $15 and the new person told me I wasn't allowed to have a late check out. Seriously? Spoke to Jason who is the manager there and he absolutely had no intention of making their mistake work in my favor. He kept calling it "miscommunication" and refused to help me out. Now I'm stuck in another hotel because all of the other suites are sold out. Awesome way to start my wedding weekendAmazing hotel! Loved all the chandeliers! Loved everything about the stay except when iI left there was a $28 fee for valet parking. Which you really have no choice but to do that. Kind of got upset because when I checked in noone told me that was the fee. Other than that hotel was amazing. I will be back but just not to valet.Best boutique hotel ever. Check in was fantastic- valet? Yes - free happy hour? Oh yes - cookies and milk before bed? Heavenly! Free car service? Did they say TESLA??? Bad azz. The room is huge. The decor and renovation is stunning. The bed feels like I died and went to the A-list part of heaven. The service is incredible. The ladies at check in are awesome, bartender Amy is fantastic and driver Kevin is the iron man of drivers. This is just day 1. I can't imagine the epic day two. This place is not haunted at all. I just woke and haven't even tried their free breakfast or fancy coffee. I woke up in afterglow.Day 2: the breakfast is great and the staff is nice. I ordered a scrambled eggs breakfast and it was perfect. The hotel was even better on day 2. We never had to use a taxi because the super incredible staff reserved the tesla for us and we could plan our day. The driver, Kevin, was on time and very nice. I don't want to leave. I'm so happy here I wish I could stay forever. Laying in bed while I write this review, it's so comfortable.OMG! I LOVED this HOTEL!!! I recently relocated to Scottsdale AZ from IL and decided to 'Roadtrip It'. St. Louis was my first stop along the way and I booked my room on Hotels.com. Got a super deal, under $100, and it was worth EVERY penny!GREAT location, close to the Arch, and from the moment you walk in it SCREAMS 'Elegance'!! Very friendly desk staff told me that I had '3 minutes' until Happy Hour ended which was a 'free' glass of wine, so I high-tailed it to the spectacular bar where I met some fabulous and friendly people (shout out to Dayna and Bartender Stephanie!:-)). Stayed for more than 1 glass and, by then, it was time for Cookies & Milk! Yum!!When I went to my room, I was astonished! It was a SUITE including a full living room and walk-thru bathroom with a separate Vanity counter and private shower/toilet. The bed was a King and SO comfortable I slept like a BABY!The next morning I went to the Fitness Room for my daily workout and found it well-maintained and functional with enough equipment to get in a good workout before I hit the road to Oklahoma City (I'm a Personal Trainer and a good workout is how I start EVERY day:-))Breakfast was included and FABULOUS! A wonderful variety to choose from and Modi, the waitress, was a HOOT! If I had 1 'negative' thing to say, it would be that the Valet service was outrageously priced ($28/night) for guests. My recommendation, park at the Renaissance garage on 9th St. It's covered and costs only $16 and is a quick 1-block walk to the Magnolia:-)If I ever find myself in St. Louis, there is only 1 place I will stay..The Magnolia!I am arriving tomorrow and have started out with a terrible experience so far.I emailed to request a crib (or pack n play) and a mini fridge. I'm breastfeeding and have to pump and bottle feed. I received an email back stating the location only has a couple so to give them a call. The gentleman I spoke with on the phone this afternoon was terribly rude. He said there was no way to reserve a crib and I probably wouldn't get one. He did explain they can store my milk in a staff fridge, however, a. That makes me really uncomfortable bc I don't know who is in and out of it and b. That doesn't help at 2 am when she wakes up and is screaming for milk. I asked if he had a cooler I could use with ice and he said no. I told him I have no clue what to do since I won't be able to feed my daughter efficiently and it will wake up other guests bc she will be screaming for several minutes while we wait for staff to bring milk and since she won't have a place to sleep I don't know what to do. His response was to not travel with children. I asked to speak to the manager and he said Jason would be there shortly (this was at 11:10) and that "I can talk to him all I want, but no one will be willing to help me". Jason never called back. I called back a second time and still never received a call back.I wasn't rude to this gentleman, I didn't say anything short or mean, yet he was so unkind and awful. I'm now dreading what is supposed to be a family Christmas and birthday celebration bc I won't be able to feed my child and neither one of us will sleep.Seems kind of nice, haven't even gotten to my room before having regret for staying here, the parking situation here is terrible, no in/out parking anywhere...moving cross country and not fond of leaving al my belongings in my car on the street in STL or in the hands of a valetHousekeeping stole my laptop!Do not stay here! Customer service is non existent. its a shame...made me hate St. Louis.Lessons learned..smh. Matt the manager is a dick and didnt even care i lost personal property. He rude and should be demoted. He doesnt smile and is not friendly. The rest of the staff is alright..Please do not stay here. This place sucks!This place was amazing. The staff were so helpful and nice. The rooms were up to date modern looks. The pictures are exactly the way it looks. They gave us a fruit and cheese tray in our room when we arrived, it was quite big. We also received two complimentary drinks upon arrival. The front desk staff was very helpful in helping us find some good late night food and giving directions. Our room ended up being close to construction and when we told the front desk, the immediately moved us and gave us an upgraded room for the inconvenience. The next day we forgot to set a wake up call or alarm and we called down and they said it was okay and to take our time leaving. They were very accommodating and helpful. I will defiantly be staying here in the future.
review_content_20: Nice boutique hotel. Great price for the location. Within walking distance to Busch stadium. Elevators were tiny and can only fit approximately 4 people, but there are three. Newly painted rooms with modern decor. 1 complaint is that our shower obviously wasn't cleaned from the last persons stay as there were multiple long black hairs stuck on the inside of the shower wall (gross)! Free wifi... Cocktail hour... Cookies, milk, and coffee hour...Continental breakfast. One recommendation is there was not a mini fridge provided, so if you have beverages or snacks make sure to bring your own cooler.Beautiful. And ... Above and beyond service here. I left my cell phone at a restaurant down the street (yes I'm embarrassed) but they went to get it and bring to me. THAT'S Service!!!!!!I really like this boutique hotel in downtown St. Louis. They have a beautiful modern lobby and bar, while keeping the old stained glass. A very nice mix of the new and old that really represents St. Louis today. It's in a great location, too, for downtown sightseeing. I'm impressed with their very large posh rooms, which is not commonly found in old hotel remodels. Everyone has been very friendly and helpful here, and I love the late-nite cookies and milk in the bar. I'm super impressed! And highly recommend!! Found absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel.Beautiful Hotel and so comfy and accommodating . Everyone is super friendly . There was a small hiccup in my reservation and they took care of me right away ! I would definitely stay here again on my next tripBest experience at a hotel ever! Not only was the place gorgeous and full of historical charm, the staff were absolutely amazing. So kind and friendly. Our suit was beautiful and clean, the food we had was delicious. Not a single complaint. Will stay here in the future and highly recommend for anyone wanting to have a stress free weekend! :)We were not familiar with Magnolia, but found it on a groupon & decided to check it out.  We really, really enjoyed it & are glad we got to stay here before everyone else discovers it too!  The decor is beautiful, the rooms are clean, the drinks are good, and the staff is extremely friendly, not to mention is right near a lot of activity downtown.  I have no doubt Magnolia's popularity is going to catch on fast & soon enough it will be hard to get a room, but as of now we were very pleased with our experience & very happy with the price we got.  Thanks Magnolia!My friend and I, along with our husbands stayed at this hotel for a baseball game. We were hooked by the idea of free cookies and milk. While the facility is beautiful, that is about all it has going for it. When we arrived late at night, there were three bell hops standing outside the door. We unloaded the car and carried our bags in on our own. I am not above carrying my own bags but I was under the impression they would help us as  that is in fact their job. When we were checking in, we were met with confusion when we were told our reservation was lost. After driving 6 hours we were tired and not prepared for this information. While they located our reservations, we were informed that 2 of the 3 elevators were down and we had to wait over 10 mins for the only available elevator to show up. This went on through the entire weekend. The manager suggested we take the stairs at one point. We were on the 12 floor. The rooms were very well decorated and nice. The beds were comfortable and new. The walls however were paper thin and we could hear every move through out the night. All of these factors could be ignored, however, the staff was not at all accommodating or flexible, much less polite. My husband was fussed at by management when he leaned up against a table and placed his beer on the top.
