There was a car service that was available - a brand new Tesla - which was nice but was never available for service.  This hotel while beautiful and has potential lacks in service. They have seemed to have invested their money in furniture and $200,000 cars but not in well trained staff and management.  Because of this experience my friends and I will not be at the Magnolia the next time we are in St. Louis and we would not suggest the hotel to anyoneSuch a BEAUTIFUL hotel! I travel quite a bit for work and ended up getting stuck in St Louis for a night, I was able to get a room last minute and was very well taken care of. I LOVE a good turn down service, which Magnolia does well. They have a great bar/lounge area with friendly staff and really yummy food! It was a pleasant, unexpected stay in St. Louis. Also- the beds are SO SO SO comfortable! I will definitely be staying here the next time I am in the area.Liked almost everything about this place.  The staff was very friendly, the rooms are big, and you can't complain with free beer and wine for happy hour.  Our only complaint was the plumbing.  Whenever someone would shower, a very loud vibrating noise would come from the walls.  We thought this was an isolated thing until someone on the elevator said the same thing happened to him.We got there late but check in was easy.  The room didn't have a working phone.  We went down to the front desk.  They sent some one up.  He said you are right and said I'll be back in a moment.  He was and said the room down the hall was available.  We check the phone and it was fine.  He said he would be right back with new key cards.  He was and we realized that we were in a suite at no extra cost.  We went down to have a drink and something to eat.  The food was quite good.  On check out we ask if we could leave out bags, No problem, we had 3 hrs. before the train.  When we got back from the walk we got some water at the bar.  I learned the old name of the hotel.  My grandparents had stayed there.  My grandmother talked about how grand it was.  Well it still is.This hotel was mentioned by a coworker who stumbled upon it and, after years of staying at one of two other hotels in St Louis, I decided to give it a try. I don't think those other two hotels will see much of me anymore (and they were great). Magnolia has such a charm about it. They kept the beautiful elements of the prior Mayfair hotel, adding in contemporary touches to make it sleek and cool. The rooms are amazing and so nice for my work travel away from home, giving me a bit more room and an at home feel. And most importantly the staff has been amazing. Rare do I find an aesthetically pleasing hotel with nice staff and similar people also staying there to enjoy wine with at the hotel bar before retreating to my comfortable room. Kudos, Magnolia.As a business traveler it is not often that I am pleasantly surprised by a hotel experience. Exceptional staff, a recent remodel that is just stunning and wonderful rooms. We were there for 4 nights. It was walking distance to the america center and way better than the other hotels in the area. This is a great hotel run by super friendly people who go out of their way to make your stay a good one. Genuinely refreshing.Yes, I am a fan. It was my first stay in St. Louis -- a two night stay -- and I'm happy with my choice of hotel. Why? The staff. And well-thought out service. My fifth floor king suite was spacious, updated, well-appointed, and clean, and the food was very good, but it was staff -- and how they did what they did -- who made my experience an excellent one. Valet, front door, bartender, room service, and front desk. Everyone. Including the kitchen. (Thank you, kitchen folks, for a cooking up an excellent "minutes before we close" late night meal after a long day of traveling! And love your coffee, btw.) The management should be commended for doing such a good job hiring and training their staff. And the kitchen and room-service teams should be commended for putting together a strong breakfast and dinner menu, good service hours, excellent and reliable service, and an easy to use system for ordering breakfast. Well done. There is a strong, team commitment to serving guests well at The Magnolia, and it shows. I docked a star for the reason mentioned at the end of this review and because I find the bar area layout, decor, and sound level obnoxious and not in keeping with the rest of the place (to be honest -- I like a nice hotel bar that "fits" and is comfortable to park myself in; I just really didn't like it and kept to my quiet, comfortable room, instead), but the rest of my experience was top notch. A minor issue was also handled very professionally by the front desk. The bartender is one of the best -- don't let her go! I recommend staying here when in St. Louis. Easy self parking one block over, as well. ** ONE RECOMMENDATION FOR THE HOTEL: Please(!) provide magnifying mirrors in the bathrooms or, at the least, have some available on request. It's pretty standard these days and a necessity for many of us. Better lighting for makeup application would be appreciated, too. :)This hotel met my expectations over on beyond. Everyone was so nice and friendly will definetly stay here again.I stayed at the Magnolia for three nights and experienced the best service with the daytime front desk staff! Extremely accommodating! The hotel itself is super cute and they have an amazing happy hour! The bartenders at the hotel were also fantastic!What a nice, cute boutique hotel!  My friend and I went up for a baseball game and chose this hotel for its great location!  The hotel is in walking distance of the ball park which is another plus!  The hotel has newly opened and it is gorgeous!  The staff is helpful and friendly and Wendy the bartender was great!  She was so friendly and made our evening after the game even more fun.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting St. Louis!

review_content: Last time staying here. Bummer. They need help with how they run this front desk. Nice people. Very respectful. Complete chaos. 3pm check in is notional. Chaos. Just chaos.Embassy Suites is usually a top notch hotel and we've stayed at different ones in different cities. I was expecting the same caliber of quality service however this hotel did not live up to the service you'd expect from Embassy Suites. When I called the day before our check in to confirm how to request the airport shuttle, the lady who answered the phone sounded irritated and bothered by my phone call. She had a condescending tone and was short with her answers. We are at the airport and try to call the hotel to request the shuttle. It rings a few times then it disconnects- like someone picked up the phone and then hung it up. That happened twice! All the while we are waiting with our luggage on the curb. I finally get through to the hotel and again get the sassy tone  when I confirm that we are waiting at the right spot. The shuttle arrived about 20 minutes later- other hotel shuttles passed us by twice before ours finally came. The check in was slow- one person handling the front desk. Check in is at 3:00 and we arrived at 6:30 yet we had to wait for a room to be ready. Luckily we were able to enjoy snacks (pita chips, hummus, crudites, and cheese) and soft drinks at the managers reception while we waited.The room was a little smaller than other embassy suites we've stayed at but it was fine. The decor and furniture were modern and tidy. Our room did not have a chair for the desk but our friends room down the hall did. The bathroom was large and spacious. The beds were soft and comfortable. We found a large piece of glass on the carpet. Luckily when we tripped on it we were wearing shoes but it was unnerving to find such a large chunk and it made me wonder if the floor was even vacuumed.Also I did not realize that the front door would not lock shut. I was in the bath room giving my daughter a bath when my son walked in. I had both room keys so I was shocked when he walked in and said the front door was unlocked. I checked it and sure enough you could just push it open. My husband had to jiggle and mess with it for awhile before it locked properly. The pool room felt like a sauna- no air movement or ventilation. Lots of chairs but towels run out quickly. The pool is not very large but that made it easier to supervise the kids playing. We checked out at very early so we missed the breakfast. When we checked in I asked about what time the shuttle leaves for the airport and if I needed to put in a reservation/request. I was told to just come to the lobby. I asked if there were specific times for the shuttle- again I was told to just come down in the morning. So at 4:25 we go down expecting to catch the shuttle and get to the airport at 5:00. We are told that the shuttle just left 2 minutes ago so the next one will be at 5:00. Overall if you just need a place to stay close to the airport this is a good deal. Just wish their staff would be more personable and helpful.This Embassy Suites is recently renovated and looks amazing. From the lobby to the room you will feel like luxury in this hotel. I stayed in their one bedroom suite which has a small kitchen area,  dining table,  combined with the living room which had a let out couch, and  television. The bedroom has a large closet, television,  en-suite bathroom with walk in shower. The hotel is conveniently located off the express which allows you access to a very short commute to the city. The staff were friendly and my check in process was swift. I did e-check in which means your keys are ready for you when you arrive; however I was informed when I arrived the e-check in malfunctioned and my keys were not ready. The front desk attendant apologized and quickly made keys to my room which took like 30 seconds.  The all you can eat breakfast was included and was great. There is a chef that makes omelettes and pancakes fresh and hot for guests. I would strongly recommend this hotel for those who are looking for a nice hotel in the St. Louis area. I will definitely stay here again when I'm in the area. Also,  it's a Hilton honors affiliated hotel so you can rack up hotel points.I work in aviation and am very familiar with hotels of all types.  I was very disappointed by the staff and service at this hotel.  The breakfast bar was filthy.  I was forced to eat at a table with another family's dishes at it.  The food was food in the same way that particle board is technically still wood.  I arrived in the morning for a two week stay after a tiring AM flight.  I was eager to get into my room and get some sleep.  The lobby was filled with people checking out.  After initially being told that they would knock out a room for me, I was basically told over the course of the next 6 hours that the room wasn't ready.  I was willing to pay for an extra day if it meant getting some sleep.  Instead I napped in the lobby for nearly 6 hours.  In that 6 hours, not a single staff member offered a Wifi pass, or a pass key to use the gym or pool.  I was treated like a piece of furniture.So I get to my room and no wash cloths and the room was not cleaned well. Then I look and there's no lotion or shampoo. So I call down and and am told well they are busy so it was missed. Umm. Ok. Can I have a wash cloth?  So they called maid service said she will bring. An hour later nine. The managers reception is going down hill. My spare blanket looked like someone had sex on it and put it back. I left a note but no extra blanket. Been staying here for years. Probably not going to again. It's really going down hill. Staff are great and friendly but man the rooms. Place needs some tender loving help.I stayed here with my cousin on Fourth of July weekend. We encountered filthy glasses in our room. One which had hard crust on it and a bug inside. We also tried to take a shower and when the towel was open an open condom flew out. We were totally disgusted. When we went to the front desk we were given a free nights stay and two free alcoholic drinks at the bar (each). We requested fresh additional towels. When housekeeping brought the towels they put them on the floor outside our room. This really was an awful stay. I recommended this  hotel to my cousin and I was embarrassed for my city. I love embassy suites I always pick them but this makes me think twice next time I refer a hotel or visit myself. I am currently on hold as we speak with guest services it had been 40 mins. They are refusing to accommodate us.I am a Hilton Diamond member who travels to this location to conduct meetings onsite at this Embassy Suites every 6 to 10 weeks.  I stay here because it is convenient.  I will say that Katherine (sales/catering manager) and Larry (who takes care of the meeting rooms) are fantastic.  Jackie and the other shuttle bus drivers are wonderful, as well.  However, this hotel is in dire need of an upgrade, renovation and/or thorough cleaning.  Half of the time when I check in, there is a problem with my room (e.g. plumbing issue, flooded bathroom, dirty sheets, dirty commode, no hot water, etc.)  The front desk always seems to be understaffed and although they are doing their best to accommodate the guests, their helpfulness does not resolve the underlying problems (lack of attention to cleanliness, poor food quality, etc.) Just this evening alone, I witnessed several guests needing to change their rooms due to standing water in the bathrooms and other problems.  I wish that I could rate this hotel higher for the sales/catering staff, Jackie, Lewis and a few of the front desk staff, but I feel that would be misleading given the numerous problems at this property.I love all embassy suites, and this was my first stay after the company did renovations on all of their properties' lobby areas with modern color scheme and fountain wall.Room was spacious and clean.Due to flight delays, I arrived very late, yet they were gracious enough to keep the kitchen open long enough for me to get in my late-night order. So I'd say service was great.2 downsides to this property:I had a room at the very end of the hall. The pipes must've been close to the exterior because it took a whole 5 minutes to run my water before it started getting warm. I actually had to call front desk to ask them if there was a water broiler issue on the property, but apparently the problem was just isolated to me.The other downside is that I was craving made-to-order omelettes each morning, and neither morning had an omelette chef. (I guess I'm spoiled by other embassy suites morning breakfast service). Even though the Ferguson riots were going on a few miles away, I still felt very safe on this property.Super disappointed.  My first stay a couple months ago was good. Room was pretty good, food was good & service was good. This time, room was awful (dirty, noisy & service did not replace any towels or shampoo for me) & it seems there's a frat party in the bar. I will definitely look for other places to stay in the future!Adventure and good food awaits!Bad news.  They had a fire before I arrived last night.  More bad news, the lobby was a crisp 28 degrees or so.  And...you guessed it, slow service from the kitchen and bells and sirens (ongoing alarm issues) kept going and going.  BUT!  The ice cold shower made all the memories of last night go away.The breakfast was delicious though.  So was my California Chicken Club from last night.  Hey folks, you have to find the good things in life and focus on them.  Great to know even a major business can bounce back from adversity.worst experience in 40 yrs.!!!  Love Embassy Suites, but this one is extremely dirty, cob webs, carpet not vacuumed, dusty and lights that don't work.  Felt as if our lives were in danger, if you complained they would follow you around.  This location needs to be closed.  For lots of reasons: I don't think they even changed the linens on the beds!!, nonsmoking smelled like somebody had just smoked in the room.  The employees act like they are being put out having to work!!  As omlettes go, not even cooked.  And when they are within closing time, don't bother.  Sticky, dirty tables, crumbs, crap all over!  I think that it is even a health concern.  Go to another location if you need Embassy SUites, this location is scary and needs to be closed.I have been in more pleasant funeral homes. Right now am waiting 50 minutes for food. Drinks were good but the rest is not.It's almost 5am and I can't get a good nights' sleep.  Why? the mattress in my hotel room is old and springy! It's been a miserable night so far. I'm a business traveller who has stayed at many Embassy suites/hiltons across the country and never written a yelp review let alone a poor one.  This is unacceptable. I do not recommend this hotel. A very uncomfortable experience with one more night to go. The only pro about this hotel is the proximity to STL Intl Airport.Update:  The hotel Mgr did apologize and switch me out of the uncomfortable King bed suite to a 2 queen bed suite for the remainder of my stay.  So far these queen beds are more comfortable.I've been at this hotel for years. Today I arrive at the airport and wait for a shuttle. After waiting quite some time. Nada. I call and ask if they have a shuttle,... Response "Yes, but you need to call to have us drive to the airport". Whaaaat?Hotels by the airport typically run every 30 min. Right? Not this one anymore.This hotel was nice. The staff were friendly. The bar was filled with middle-aged businessmen who quite literally monopolized every table and space at the bar. I was not interested in being wedged between some douchey-enamored-with-himself senior manager from Boeing. So I ate in the restaurant by myself. Glad I did. It was quiet, I got to have a nice conversation with the server and the food was delicious...this was the best part. My room was a mini-suite and was okay, however, the bed was NOT comfortable at all.Sadly, when I got up the next morning, I literally could not stand straight. I had to get into the shower for 15 minutes and let hot water run on my back. (When I got home, I had to have xrays and it turns out my SI-Joint was completely twisted, which forced my L5 out and to pinch two nerves...in summary, their beds are NOT good). Yes, I blame it on the crappy bed. The other main complaint I have is the ice maker was not working on my floor and there was no change machine to get a soda. I was pissed. If there is one thing I cannot stand when staying at a hotel, it is when the accommodations that you would expect are broken down. A guest should not have to 'hoof' it to the main lobby in her pajamas for ice and/or a soda. I was too tired off of my flight to check out the pool or get in the hot tub, but you could definitely smell the wafting aroma of chlorine immediately when you enter the main lobby. They really should deal with that issue.Unlike the last few ES's we've been in, this one doesn't have the open out to the center atrium have people walk past your "front" window model going on.  It is set up more like a traditional hotel with hallways, etc.  Worked for me!Room was comfy enough as was the bed, they didn't have a mat for the shower so I threw a towel down everyday and the house cleaning staff never emptied the trash cans unless they were chocked full of stuff.  Eh, no big deal.Their offering for happy hour snacks were typical (fruit, chips and dip, chex mix) and thank goodness for breakfast they knew the meaning of putting out meat in the buffet line!!!  They even had a make your own waffle section.I would readily stay here again, the location isn't bad it's just getting in and out of it if you want to be on 70 requires you going down to the Rock Rd. and turning around.  Plus, if you aren't aware of the street to turn down to get to it when you get off of 70 you can zip right past it.I notice all of the other reviews were pre-renovation, so this is the first post-renovation.  I have stayed here twice in the past so I know how tired the hotel had been.  The hotel is much much nicer than before, including the lobby, bar area, and rooms.  I didn't have time to check out the fitness center or poolLobby - Stylish, contemporary, with sofas and chairs that still have that brand new look and feel.  The front desk with the long counter has been replaced with shorter, stand alone counters 3 or 4 across.Bar - A true bar, not the drink counter that many Embassy Suites offer during the free happy hour.  And usually the "manager's reception" offers one or two standard domestic beers only; this location has about a half dozen on draft including some foreign and microbrews I had never heard of.  I didn't try anything stronger than beer so I cannot say if the free happy hour features name brand liquor or if they offer just the generic booze.Rooms - My room was so nice.  The bed was very comfortable with soft plushy pillows.  Each room had a large flat screen TV although I didn't have time to watch anything.  I had a room that did not have a bath but a large shower stall with sliding glass doors.  Free wifi too.The money that Embassy Suites has put into the hotel has been well worth it.P.S. The hotel has a free airport shuttle too.This was the worst Hilton Hotel I ever stayed at. Terrible breakfast Buffett, very poor service, food all over the floor. Coffee stopped working in the middle of breakfast. No fruit, long lines for food. Cream ran out, undercooked food. When things ran out it took half an hour to refill, this includes forks and knives. The room was nice but short of towels and it took an hour to get them up to me. Had to wait to check in even though there were lots of people at the front desk. Most stood around talking while one person worked. Skip this place. Not worth it.While the stay, accommodation and staff were pleasant enough, please don't leave any items behind.  When I checked out of my room in the morning, I left a pair of shoes by the bed.  I called back to housekeeping and they advised no shoes were turned in.  While I blame myself for forgetting the shoes to begin with, there is no way the shoes would have been overlooked by housekeeping when they cleaned the room.  Someone is walking around in my $150 shoes and I am out of luck.  I called the Manager to request that he inquire with the staff.  He said he would and call me back by the end of the day.  He didn't call back so I called him back and had to leave a message.  We are all forgetful from time to time.  But an honest hotel staff would have turned in the shoes to lost and found.  I have left items behind before at another hotel and they logged in the item to the room and date so when you called back in to claim the property, it was easily located.  Moral of the story is don't leave things behind, especially at this hotel.Great staff    very clean.  Love the bartender.  Food is pretty good.  Its nice sometimes to not have to go out to ear.  This is why I only stay here when in stl.  My only gripe is that salmon is the only fish on the menu. How about some haddock. Bass.
review_content_20: Even after renovations the Embassy is still an Embassy. So with expectations not very high, me and the family stayed here for one night this past weekend. The beds were decent and the cable options were good. Nothing spectacular though and the area is dead, but for visiting family it worked. Breakfast buffet remains the best thing this property has going for itself. They also offer a happy hour, but we didn't partake in it.The hotel was beautiful! My problem, I'm a Hilton honors member. My credit card is always available. Whenever I stay at the Hilton hotels, I always pay in cash when I arrive. This hotel DO NOT take cash when you arrive only when you leave. The front office manager REFUSED to help me....But she was very nice, The hotel manager allowed me to pay in CASH! A very nice man.Here's the kicker...once I checked out, she had to come and check our room to make sure their were no damages! I was livid and humiliated. We stayed one night. Arrived at 6 pm and check out at 8am. My credit card was on file...she still placed a hold on my card! I paid in CASH and she still had to view my room.Never again will I stay at this hotel! Not everyone want to put a hotel on credit...if you have cash. We were on vacation! every vacationer usually have cash to spend!We are in a use your credit card LESS society and pay in CASH.I expected the hotel to be ok, but it was much better than expected! We stayed there for one night while visiting st. louis. It was about a 20 minute drive from downtown St. Louis, but we chose to stay by the airport because the prices were more affordable.The price was decent and the hotel was clean. The hotel looked like it was just renovated... you could tell because there were some areas that looked brand new and other areas that looked a little on the old side. The room was very spacious... In the living room area, there was a little kitchenette, desk, and a tv/couch. The bedroom was a good size and the bathroom was huge. Breakfast was included in the price, but it was kind of a mess in the morning. When we got downstairs for breakfast, there were lots of dirty tables and no plates at the buffet. We finally got our hands on some plates, but the selection was limited. It took awhile before they filled up the empty chafing dishes with fresh food.Overall, the experience was good. My only complaint would probably be that they were understaffed and/or underprepared for breakfast service.Nicely renovated, and very clean and neat.  The bar can make almost anything you want (a plus for a hotel bar), and the restaurant inside is pretty good.Unfortunately, I've yet to find much to do in the area (you're basically at the airport). I've stayed 2x's, and I'm sure I'll be back....I have stayed at several Embassy Suites and the ambiance of this one definitely caters to business travelers.  The decor is very masculine and cold, so you don't get a very relaxed feeling when walking in.  The first room we got had cockroaches, yes COCKROACHES which is just grody to the max.  When we told the front desk, they were very apologetic and gave us another room.  I thoroughly inspected the second room and thankfully there were no roaches.  The room was clean and it had two separate areas, a living room with a television and desk with chairs, and a bedroom with a bathroom.  The crib they provided was better then a standard pack and play, it had sturdy metal bars, and a mattress pad.  The hotel was very quiet for being so close to the airport, because we never had problems with noise.  When we checked out, our room was comped because of the cockroach incident.  I appreciate the comp, however I would never come back.POST RENOVATION REVIEWJust had to get that out of the way - some of the old reviews are snarky and I don't want them confused with reviews of the new, improved Embassy Suites - St. Louis Airport!So, pretty much this hotel was gorgeous! Upon entering you immediately see a legitimate bar area complete with jazzy (purple-ish!) decor and waterfall.  Off to the side of the lobby there are what they called little "interviewing" rooms - which upon further inspection looked like little mini living rooms where you could hang out for a more private convo with colleagues or the fam.After check-in, which was a smooth process - Stacey handed me a brochure and told me that an evening reception was available at the bar *every night* beginning at 5:30pm and that made to order breakfast (omelets, oatmeal, etc.) was available in the early morning. Score! That's what I love about Embassy Suites in general though...What I was really pleased to find; however, was that the rooms were not all centered around the atrium with windows that looked out onto the hallway. For some reason - those "inside" windows freak me out a little bit, just not a fan.  Instead this Embassy Suites had the traditional atrium (you look down onto the bar) with three hallways of rooms leading away from the central point. My room was on the very end of the front hallway and upon entering was greeted with the traditional wet bar area (sink, microwave, and 'fridge) and the seating area - complete with desk work space, two additional chairs, a couch, a pull out bench, and a flat screen TV.  I can't really describe the layout of my Suite - but it wasn't the traditional walk straight through the first room to get to the next - it was more like they were side by side.  The decor in the room was super modern - different patterns, shades of brown, blue, silver - just gorgeous in my opinion. The bed was the traditional white plush bedding that you would expect. Complete with a selection of five pillows that I got allllll to myself! There was a flat screen in the bedroom and a vanity area with tiny block seat. Very cute.  The bathroom had a sliding glass door shower and a large vanity area.The evening reception was very nice and busy! It was definitely good for socializing with my teammates.  The bartenders were nice and even crafted me "something sweet" upon my request - which the bartender ended up dubbing a "ghetto iced tea" - pretty much a long island but made with lemonade only. It was strong. There were also evening treats - which I did not partake in; however, on the first night I noted they had taco dip, hummus, and an additional Mediterranean dip.Breakfast in the morning was pleasant (except the tables filled up quick!). They offered a breakfast bar - with scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, potatoes, fruit, pastries, bagels, toast, yogurt, and fruit as well as a "made-to-order" area where you could get omelets (I got mine with egg white, spinach, and tomatoes - yum!) and oatmeal. There was also a refreshments selection - apple, cranberry, and orange juices, coffee, and sodas.The outside doors lock between 10pm and 7am - and even the front door said this - so I'm not sure what you do if you come in after that, but I wasn't up or out late enough to find out!Express checkout was easy - they slipped the folio under my door during the night and I just dropped my keys at the counter on my way out.The only complaints I have about the hotel are the fact that its ONLY entrance from the road is literally off of a highway and it's an ABRUPT turn and immediately after you need to merge with an on ramp. Definitely flew right by the first time. And the fact that there's not too much within walking distance.  There's a TGI Friday's, a grocery store, an IHOP, and a Home Depot near by - so take your pick.  Without a rental car, this trip kind of would have sucked. But! Within a 20-25 minute ride there are nice shopping areas, an ALL Spray Tan tanning salon (in Brentwood) and a Nordstrom & more shopping, Cheesecake Factory, and a Maggiano's in Clayton. Finally, the location is close to the airport - so it was convenient.  If I'm ever in St. Louis for work again - I would be a repeat customer!As a Hilton Diamond member, I get to stay at a lot of Embassy Suites.  This is clearly one of the best I have been to.  Both the rooms and public areas are modern and extensively renovated. The service is excellent - they knew what I wanted before I asked after only 1 day stay.  The atmosphere is decisively masculine and caters to the business traveler (showers-no tub), and the manager's reception is one of the best (marinated clams in the shell, cheese and deli tray, chips and black bean hummus), plus free drinks. It is very close to the airport with a free shuttle.  Parking is ample with easy access to I-70 and Lindbergh Blvd. Highly recommendedClean rooms, the doors were a bit confusing and they seemed to be in the way a lot for me.  The beds were comfortable, but I could not adjust the heat in my room. It wouldn't turn down and I had to turn the air on to get some relief. The hotel is very close to cypress parking too!Nice rooms that typically have a lounge area and a bedroom. Everything is clean and modern. I will never give an Embassy above three stars though because they charge you for Internet.Mostly good. Channel 70 Productions was in town to subcontract work to other video production companies. The shuttle came quick to pick us up at the airport and check-in was fast. Nice rooms as usual for ES. Good drinks and food at the restaurant. Friendly staff. Free wi-fi. However, it took FOREVER for outside callers to get the hotel operator to answer the phone. The little meeting areas downstairs were perfect for interviewing prospective contractors. We'd give higher marks, but someone needs to start answering the phones first.If you don't have anything good to say...come sit next to me!This is a tired hotel sorely in need of an Extreme Hotel Makeover. 80's wallpaper, can you say mauve? Big old TV's, at least there's two and bad housekeeping. How many hotels rooms do you walk into that after being cleaned have the toilet seat left up? Yes, I'm nit-picky, but this is just wrong and I experienced it twice. Then upon returning to my room today I found they "made it up" but didn't leave fresh towels. YES, I wanted FRESH towels. They collected the used towels, but didn't leave any fresh ones. On my way out to dinner I requested clean towels and when I got back I had clean towels...enough for the whole hotel. I'm one person in one room, I'll use 3-4 towels between tonight and tomorrow. I got 14 fresh towels. Talk about overkill! From none to 14.If you can, stay somewhere else. There are many better places to stay right in the immediate vicinity.booked in to here while on a business trip and they were in the middle of their $6,000,000 renovation.  the hotel was definitely in need of the renovation and i am sure it will be great once it is done.  however, i was in an old room which was very outdated.while there was nothing really wrong with the hotel i did have lot of allergy problems due to all the dust from their renovation.  i was reassured that everything would be complete by july but that didn't help my visit in april.staff at the hotel were all extremely friendly and apologetic for the state of the rooms and hotel in general.  rooms were clean and free wifi was definitely a plus.someone else mentioned the free happy hour, unfortunately it sounds like that will go away once the renovation is over.  they had bad food (pretzels, salsa, chips) and even worse beer (bud light) but at least it was free, hopefully the renovation will make up for that loss.breakfasts were definitely the highlight of the hotel.  massive omelettes, waffles, yogurts, juice, tea/coffee, etc... couldn't really ask for more.stayed there in April while it was under serious rehab.  the first night I didn't have hot water.  the phone didn't work, and the wall outlets did not function.  Parking was a mess because of the construction.  Hopefully by the time you stay there, the renovation will be complete.  Until then, I recommend taking a pass on this one.

review_content: Great hotel. Very clean and the staff was incredibly professional. Free parking included with your stay. It's nothing fancy, but great for a night out in CWE or if you have family at the nearby medical centers.Freezing cold rooms and hallways! ATM never worked and the front desk refuses to call cabs for guests. There is one guy who is in charge of cabs and if he's not there they make you call one yourself.Rooms are clean and spacious. Great TV channel selection!Nice old hotel. Always clean and neet. Fantastic staff.  Very professional and oh so polite.  BUT the lame ass breakfast food needs a major change.  Served the same items every day. Would stay here again in a heart beat. But I will walk across the street to Panera Bread for breakfast next time.Service is very good and the place looks clean and neat. Also,complementary hot breakfast was a good surprise. One person in special made the stay very memorable.  We had just driven for 11 hours and KAVITA went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and accomodate us while we were there.Great little hotel for what it is. Nothing fancy, but nothing skeezy either. Within walking distance to Forest Park and all the great little restaurants in CWE. Our room was clean and our bed was comfortable. That's all we really asked for.This used to be an ok place to stay when I had business in the area. Very disappointed to see they have put up signs they are now a free killing zone. The "good guys" are not be permitted to bring a gun. so the bad guys can have their way.Stayed here one night on our way from Fort Leonard Wood to NYC.  We were pleased with how fast and easy it was to get a room on short notice.  Parking is available through the garage at a small fee per night.  They honored our military discount as well.  The room was a nice size, clean and the bed was super comfy.  The view we had (on the 3rd floor) was the parking garage, not sure if there are better ones available, but you MAY want to specify on that.  The night person who does the billing screwed it up and noted a 2 night stay on our express check-out, so THAT had to be addressed, but it was fixed immediately.  The bathroom had an odd set-up where the door swung right in front of the toilet...someone did NOT think that one out.  The lighting in the bathroom sucked...like ONE really bright one...but - hardly something to complain about, and maybe it was just our room.  There are a few bars/rest. within walking distance too.   A nice option, only about a block or two, but it worked for us!!I stayed here on a visit to Wash U. School of Medicine - it's very convenient to the whole complex. On the plus side: very friendly and helpful staff, free and yummy cookies in the evening, free and okay breakfast in the morning, free internet, and reasonably priced overall. On the negative side: the room was a little shabby, uncomfortable, and poorly lit, the "window" offered a view of the indoor parking garage, the heating unit was loud and constantly on, and apparently its air intake was poorly placed (from time to time cigarette or more suspect odors would waft through the room). If you decide to stay here, request a room on an upper floor and/or with an exterior view.Stayed here one night for an interview in St.  Louis. Conveniently located half a block away from St. Louis Children's Hospital and Barnes-Jewish Hospital. There is an attached Applebee's which is open until 11 pm on most nights, if you're coming in late and are looking for a quick bite to eat. There are also many restaurants and cafe patios within walking distance. I guess the hospital employment provides a big lunch crowd.A room with a single King sized bed was $129 per night. It was paid for by my interviewers, so that was nice. Garage parking is an additional $5 per night. Within walking distance to the Central West End Metrolink and adjacent to Forest Park. It's also aboutt 2.5 miles from SLU. Complimentary breakfast provided in the lobby. I checked out early, but saw them setting up and it looked pretty basic: coffee, cereal, bagels,etc. The room itself was clean and spacious. The furnishings were a little dated, but that's nitpicking. I don't really have much to add. My only gripe is that there's no free or even pay wifi. I believe there's free wifi in the lobby and also free ethernet internet in the rooms. Overall a convenient place to stay if you're visiting the hospitals or SLU.This is an OK hotel in a great location. Keep that in mind: you're paying for the location. I loved how close it was to Forest Park. The room was surprisingly quiet and the bed was comfortable. Now the negatives. The free breakfast was TERRIBLE. It was the worst breakfast I've ever had. The wi-fi worked in the evening but not the next morning. Bottom line: stay here if you get a good deal and want quick access to the hospital or Forest Park, otherwise don't bother.The wifi does not work at all in the rooms here. It only works in the lobby...convenient. Stayed here for three weeks and never had Internet. Especially when you're working at the hospital and your work requires you to use Internet to do your job, but the hotel has none...Thanks a lotThis hotel is a gem. It's located in the medical district and is close to the metro which can take you anywhere in St. Louis. Parking is cheap and easy and the staff are fast and efficient.  Most importantly, the rooms are clean, spacious (even the bathrooms) and the bed is comfortable with nice sized pillows. It's new remodeled and it's a great place to stay if you're staying there for a medical reason or a weekend trip to the city.  Also, free cookies in the lobby in the afternoon. We've stayed there twice and plan to anytime we're in town.Terrible customer service. We stayed here for a wedding and were incredibly disappointed by hotel staff throughout the entire weekend. (The staff was even rude to the bride & groom.) Stay somewhere else! Many other great places in St. Louis that are more client-oriented.This is a good solid three star restaurant. It looks like all of the rooms for ungraded in the last 5 years. The beds were a little hard, but comfortable. Each room comes with a flat screen, microwave, and mini-fridge which was nice considering the portion sizes at St Louis restaurants.There is freshly cooked popcorn (burnt and salty) and cookies (disappear in 5 minutes flat) in the lobby, which is nice, but they need to take a cue from Doubletree and have these available all the time for their guests if they're going to offer it. Otherwise it's just a tease to step into an elevator that smells like chocolate chip cookies, only to have an empty tray waiting for you in the lobby.There is an Applebee's attached for convenient meals if you don't want to leave the hotel, but I'm too much a food snob to eat here.Convenient to all of Forest Park and a shuttle is available (just tip your driver if you use the service).While planning a trip to Barnes Jewish Hospital for surgery, we decided that the Parkway was the best option because of the skyway connecting to the hospital.  I called to make reservations.  I waited on hold for a long length of time.  Started to make the reservation, then again was put on hold.  Finally the reservation was completed and he was going to give me the confirmation number only to be placed on hold again.  I was on hold 12 minutes of a 15 minute conversation.  For this quality a hotel this is absurd.  I gave up and figured I'd get the e-mail confirmation faster.  When it hadn't arrived after 3 days I called back.  No reservation had ever been made!!!  The gal told me there were no rooms for those dates.  No apology. No offer to try to help in any way.Never again.  We're staying at Residence Inn where for less we get a kitchen and real bedroom.1. No toothbrushes, not even for sale in their "store."  Nearest convenience store a mile walk away.2. No bathmat.3. Stole one of my razors.4. Horrendous coffee.5. Hidden ice bucket.6. Had to try room key a half-dozen times each time to get it to work.7. Illegally tried to charge state taxes on official federal government business.I live in the same neighborhood as this hotel and it's the place I have my out of town guests stay if they're not in the mood to couch surf or inflate my air mattress.The Parkway has a great location and is Metrolink accessible (meaning you can get there from the airport very easily).  The price is always good (ask them about their AAA discount, it's something like $10 off a room) and the hotel is always clean.  It's still relatively new and in great shape.  The last room my guest stayed in had a flat screen TV as well as microwave and mini fridge, discretely hidden in the furniture.  The Parkway includes breakfast in the price of your room and has afternoon snacks.  It's not as fancy as the Chase Park Plaza, but for the price it is a really solid, clean, new-ish hotel.  If you're looking for a place to stay in the Central West End, I highly recommend it.Acceptable staying accomodations. This is a pet hotel though so make sure you request a room that is not pet friendly lest your room smell like doggie pee.Nice clean hotel with easy parking for $5. Right next to the Central West End with multiple unique bars/food. Not walking distance to Forest Park, but a short trip on the Metrolink.I've stayed here a number of times on business trips. I've always found the staff friendly and helpful. Rooms are always clean and comfortable and have free internet. The parking garage is a bit funky but is perfectly serviceable. The free breakfast is OK, not exceptional, but good and it's FREE.If I have to make a criticism, it would be that there never seem to be enough outlets to plug in all of the assorted phone and computer chargers that follow me around, but that is really a minor thing. The Applebee's off of the lobby is not so good, service stinks, but that is not the fault if the hotel. Fortunately there are lots of great places to eat just a few minutes walk away. Close to lots of other stuff to see as well. Great place to stay if you are in St. Louis.
review_content_20: My bff's parents rescued the two of us by getting us an extra night at this hotel instead of leaving us to our own devices and the horrible whims associated with sleeping over at the apartment of a college aged boy, mid move-out, as he plays computer games and does other unsavory activities instead of cleaning.  Thank you Parkway for keeping me and my New Kids pillowcase clean.  The rooms were clean and pretty standard and the service was friendly.  We definitely took advantage of the free continental breakfast, or more specifically, the free juice.  They also have free, freshly popped popcorn in the lobby.  I was sad there was no pool and the parking garage is laid out in such a way that you may never find your way back to your room, your car, or anywhere else for that matter, though I think that's because of construction mostly.  Also, you cannot take your firearms into the hotel.  See photo.We stayed here for a wedding and had a good experience.  The parking lot is a little goofy is the only beef I have with the place.The rooms were nice and clean.  Free breakfast in the morning which consisted of  Biscuits and gravy !!Cute area with a nice St Louis Bread right across the street!Front desk staff was really nice and accommodated our early check in.Short and sweet is my style. These days, I am only compelled to review a place only if I disagree with other ppl's reviews, just so that everyone can see that there's always two sides of a coin.The current reviews do not do this place justice. What more can you ask for besides a clean room, lots of free amenities including free wifi in the lobby, free internet via ethernet cable in the rooms, a free "business center" where i printed my boarding pass for my flight out, a decent small gym with all the essentials, and friendly customer service? I've gone to 5 star hotels in NY and Chicago that didn't offer free internet.I prefer creature comforts and necessities over bling and this place has done a fine job of making me feel comfortable away from home. They even have a small convenience store where I bought a stick of deodorant, which I forgot at home.Thank you Parkway HotelNot the best stay! Getting into Parking garage was a fiasco. Had to wait 10 minutes for someone to come lift gate. The bed was extremely hard. We were woken up at 6:00 am on sunday by an alarm going off in a vacant room. Took 20 minutes for hotel to get it turned off. Overall disappointing visit.stayed here for 5 days for a conference so had the opportunity to get to know the hotel well and definitely highly recommend! friendly service with complimentary shuttle service to local area spots (except doesn't go to/from airport), great location (basically on campus, a short walk to the metrolink station, easy to get to cute restaurants on euclid). there's complimentary breakfast (cereals, oatmeal, biscuits and gravy, OJ, milk, and apple juice) along with all-day coffee, tea, and apples and fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies in the evening. they also have an exercise room (but no pool) and a computer with printer in the main lobby. wifi downstairs but unfortunately only ethernet cord in the rooms (but complimentary - sweet!). rooms are clean and i REALLY appreciated that the air conditioner works efficiently and isn't too noisy. beds are comfy with goose down comforters and plenty of pillows, coffee maker, microwave, and fridge in the room (along with the usual iron and board, hair dryer, robes, and shampoo/conditioner/body wash/soap).Complimentary snacks!!  sunchips, granola bars, nutrigrain bars, bottles of water.  Coffee.  First time I have ever encountered this at a hotel!and FREE INTERNET!!  (wireless in lobby, ethernet in room) annnd they have conditioner!  (some hotels don't have this and I am seriously unhappy with my tangled hair)Also, very friendly staff with a hotel shuttle that will take you to local places free of charge.Stayed here a part of a group of 11 for work.  Everything was fine.  Nothing was awesome, but nothing was terrible either.  It was a perfectly acceptable hotel.  The continental breakfast was not great, but the included breakfasts at hotels rarely are.  Beds were okay, rooms and common spaces were clean, staff were friendly when you could find one, shuttle service was nice, though one driver we had obviously didn't know the area very well.  Overall three stars - its nothing fancy, but completely acceptable.Great hotel - location is incredibly convenient to the Washington University medical campus and Central West End. Room was nice and bed very comfy. The free cookies and popcorn in the lobby were a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again.For what this hotel does, it does pretty well.The Parkway Hotel is conveniently located near the Central West End metrolink stop in a fun part of town.  Unfortunately the staff is not readily knowledgeable about a lot of things, fortunately they will happily do what it takes to get you answers.There's always coffee, tea, and popcorn in the spacious, marbled lobby and rooms are big and comfortable.  There are loads of channels on the television and the thermostat is fast and functional.  Cleaning staff is very friendly and approachable and consistently thorough.This hotel does not have a pool and it's fitness center consists of two treadmills in a teeny tiny room.  But I guess it does the job, right?  Hilariously, the hotel restaurant is an Applebee's, but a NICE NEW Applebee's.  I'm no snob, it also does the job.  Fortunately continental breakfast included lots of single serving bottles/cartons of water, various juices, and milk so were great for stashing in your bag on the way out.  Unfortunately, the bagels were bags of Lender's emptied onto trays (I have visual proof!)I was between a three and a four on this review.  I guess it all boils down to the fact that for the essentials, this hotel was lovely.Awesome hotel, I spend 2-3 nights a month here.  Always clean, ALWAYS!Free internet, amaaazingly comfy beds, great location. The walls were thin, but once I was asleep I didn't hear a thing.I dont really know too much about hotels, but this one gives you free cookies and popcorn at the front desk and their staff (the ones I bumped into) are really friendly. Theres also a cute lounging area downstairs that looks perfect for a tea party (theres a fireplace!!)My only qualm with the place is that the lobby smells (minus when theres freshly popped popcorn) very sterile; I think it may be due to its location next to Barnes Jewish though. I think many of the long-term patients end up staying here if not in the apartment complex across the street.I have stayed here in the past and received a military discount since I'm a retired U.S Army Combat Veteran and the place was great.  I recently reserved a room like I normally do and a reservation agent named Christina e-mailed me advising me they only offer Government Rates to Government employees with papers showing them to be working in the area of the hotel during their stay in St. Louis and the front desk manager confirmed this ridiculous policy. I can understand being careful of people claiming to be Military to get the discount (genuine Veterans never do this) but this is why we all have ID cards showing we are Veterans and Active Duty Military.  Everyone may not feel the same as I but, I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN AND NEITHER WILL ANY OF MY VETERAN BROTHERS AND SISTERS!!My husband had surgery at the hospital and since we were from out of town we needed a place to recover before we were cleared to fly home.  The Parkway hotel is the closest you can get to the doctors and hospital.  We elected to go for a larger room that gave a bit more space for us to move around in.  The hotel was clean and quiet.  Location was perfect.  We made use of the shuttle multiple times - drug store, food shopping and a drop off at the balloon festival.  The driver was so nice and made it very easy.  Great cookies in the evening.  The room only had one internet connection so I brought a splitter plus some extra long cables so both of us could connect if needed.  Wi-FI in the lobby. The coffee maker was your typical hotel room coffee maker so if your picky about your coffee you will need to bring your own (coffee maker + coffee).  They do have coffee in the hotel lobby.  The Barnes and Nobel bookstore serves Starbucks coffee if you really need strong coffee.  The staff was very nice and the entire two weeks could not have been better given the stressful situation.A terrible experience.  If you are staying in St. Louis and have any other options, take them.  When I had problem with breaking out into hives everywhere my skin touched their bed linen (I know... I'm such a complainer) The staff and management were rude and combative.  If you have reservations here, my advice is cancel them immediately.I recently stayed three nights at the Parkway and can't say enough good about it. My room was spacious, immaculate, and silent.  It had refrigerator, microwave,  clock-radio, large TV, coffee pot, iron and ironing board,  extra blanket,  good reading lights, room-darkening draperies, an easy chair, and a desk for work.  My king-size bed had eight pillows, plenty for propping up to read. The bathroom was perfect with very hot water, a tub drain that worked, a great shower, large thick towels, and complimentary toiletries. The toilet flushed with a mighty swish. There was an actual closet, not just an overhead bar a la chain motel,  and it had plenty of hangers, including pants and skirt hangers. An (included) full hot breakfast is served in the lobby, where guests are also (all day long) offered complimentary hot coffee, fresh fruit, cookies, and popcorn.  There is a 24-hour mini mart that supplies a few groceries, toiletries, and personal items. A complimentary van takes guests anywhere the the Central West End. The staff was gracious and efficient---they've thought of everything. And the price was more than fair.   I would definitely go back to the Parkway and will recommend it to friends.The view isn't great. I looks out over the highway, or the hospital. Now that I've got that out of the way... The rest of the hotel was a pleasure. I really think that they care about the guests. I felt special at least. They suggested great places to eat and shop and visit. Their roomservice included the Appleby's downstairs. Their beds were devine. Their a part of the Starwood group, so you can get points for staying there. Also, did I mention the beds were excellent. I was nervous enough my first time there, being in town for an interview. But the sleeps that I got were wonderful. Smack in the middle of the Central West End, it's probably the safest walking citified neighborhood in St. Louis.

hotel_name: Pear Tree Inn by Drury - Union Station
review_content: We attended a wedding in the area for a nephew. The wedding couple reserved a block of room in this hotel because it was near to where the reception was to be. Calling in to reserve a room was very pleasant. The person on the other line--I wish I could remember her name--gave us different options for us to make an informed decision. The information she gave included room options, hotel amenities, credit card requirements, breakfast, etc. She answered all my questions before I could ask them.Check in was very swift. It took less than 5 minutes. The gentleman behind the counter was very pleasant, informing us of amenities--like gym, afternoon beverages, breakfast, etc--along with his 'Thank You' for staying at Pear Tree Inn. The breakfast area was just adjacent and I saw a coffee machine. He informed me that coffee was on 24-hours a day and coffee was always available.The room was really nice. Pleasantly decorated and updated. There was a fridge, microwave, iron, ironing board, and a coffee pot. All table lamps had outlets for charging electronic devices. And the lamps were not bolted down to the table. I saw only two towels on the rack but there were more under the sink. Instead of little bottles of shampoo, conditioner and gel, there was a dispenser for such glued just under the shower head.Parking is a little cumbersome, as one has to go through a bunch of hoops to find a spot. The parking deck is gated with a numeric touch pad. When you put in the number, you stare at a camera right in front of you. Once the correct number is plugged in, the railing goes up AND afterwards, the swinging arm goes up too.Breakfast is heaven! Although in the two days that we stayed, the breakfast menu did not change, it was still nice to get hot breakfast. Scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuit and gravy, lots of fruits and danish. It was something to look forward to.There is an indoor pool which I did not use. My wife worked out in the gym one morning, complained about the age and the sounds of the equipment. There is a door that goes to an adjacent restaurant/bar. We poked our heads in one late evening and it was packed.The one black mark of our stay was a fight that occurred in the hallway one early morning. I am sure it was an isolated incident but it rattled our nerves a little bit.The view from the hallway was magnificent. One could see the skyline of downtown St. Louis. It was right in the middle goings on in the city. One morning, we saw a whole bunch of young girls planting and gardening in a small gardening patch just outside of the hotel premises. I didn't know what group that was but it was nice to see on a beautiful October morning.Will I go back? You betcha I would. It was really one of the best hotel stays we've had, even with the $129 nightly cost.We stayed at this hotel earlier this year. While our stay was nice enough, we selected this hotel for its St Louis Blues hockey package - which included signed hockey pucks. My kids are huge hockey fans and were looking forward to the fun souvenir. At check in, we were told that none were available but they'd be getting some in before the end of our 5 day stay. At check out, we were told they would mail us 2 pucks. Since leaving, I've called and emailed the hotel as well as emailing the corporate Drury offices. The emails go with no response. The calls are left with empty promises of mailing the items. I'd hoped to be able to surprise the kids with the picks for Christmas...no luck.UPDATE - Following this review, I was contacted by the management of the hotel.  The manager apologized for the service that we received.  He offered several options to remedy the situation and immediately sent the hockey puck to us.  We were impressed and surprised by how quickly this review resulted in action.  Thanks, Pear Tree!Place appears cleaner than when I was here last. My room was nice and clean and did not have any odor. I love that they use a dispenser for shampoo and soap. This concept cuts down on waste and I'm sure has a huge impact on expenditures.Great price, free snacks and drinks at night, hot breakfast, clean and modern rooms, nice sports bar that is attached and very friendly staff. It's what I have come to expect from Drury Hotels and this place didn't disappoint. I think I have found a new place to stay when I come to St.Louis!It's a basic hotel. A basic Drury Hotel. Wifi and breakfast is included with the room rate. It is convenient to Scottrade Center if in town for a concert. The room seems clean and for a $10 a night fee I could even bring my small dog. Parking is secured in a gated garage. They have snacks and drinks after 5:30pm but we missed those. The ice maker, cups, hot water (maybe coffee) and vending machines on the first floor were all accessible for a cheap late night, after concert snack. Total side note but there is a beautiful community garden facing the parking lot. Lovely. The downside is the bar across the street appears to be rocking every night. Here on a Sunday and you could hear the music from anywhere inside the hotel until well after 1am. The cool thing was Pear Tree had security out to make sure the bar crowd was not parking in the hotel lot! The breakfast is pretty much exactly what the website said, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy. Not much else. Cereals and breads. I was down by 7:30am and it was crowded and the food, in steamers was cold. :-( I found the hotel staff to be friendly and accommodating. The front desk staff who had checked my sister in over an hour before I arrived remembered her and was on the lookout for me and my dog! :-) I've stayed in a few St Louis hotels and for the rate I would return. Oh and they have lots of available discounts if you book online (paid at the hotel). The senior rate starts at 50yrs old (which is NOT a senior but who am I to argue with discounts).We stayed here two nights for our sons enlistment to the Navy.Pros: Nice, clean and comfortable hotel. Every employee, and I mean every employee, I encountered had a smile on their faces. They were so helpful and truly seemed to enjoy their jobs. The managers attended breakfast by helping the costumers, asking how our stay has been, and even cleaning the tables. This morning an employee coming in for the day passed us and said "Good Morning." Just nice people.The rooms were a little small but very comfortable and clean. The breakfast has a nice selection and it's free. Coffee and sodas in the lobby are free and available at all times. Parking, breakfast, wi-fi, sodas, coffee, popcorn, nightly drinks are all free!!Cons: It's a nice walk to the arch and Busch stadium. However, the hotel is in a shady part of town so we didn't feel comfortable walking back after dark. A cab from the stadium was just under $10. Not bad considering parking by the stadium can run you $20 or more.All in all, I would DEFINITELY stay here again!!!Do you need an affordable place to stay?  This is it!  Even if you are going to save $10, just say no.The staff is friendly and most of them are knowledgeable. You have a bad apple in every bunch. There is free parking, in/out, for the duration of your stay. Checking in is quick and simple. However, there are only TWO elevators for the entire place. I stayed on the ninth floor and found myself taking the stairs often.The pool area is small but it is nice. The hot tub is ALWAYS overrun with children. There are tons of children left unattended at the pool. The hotel could offer some sort of attendant. It would be nice to enjoy a hot tub as an adult.The breakfast is phenomenal. Eggs, sausage, yogurt, biscuits and gravy, waffles, donuts, muffins and cereal. This is complimentary. There is also soda and popcorn offered free throughout the day. In addition to all of this, there is happy hour which gives each adult in the room three free drinks. Wine or Beer. But hey, free is free. There is a restaurant in the hotel but it is ok. The staff is not knowledgeable and gave me misinformation. Something the hotel should keep tabs on. Their guests will be affected.So the restaurant runs a shuttle to the game. $2. Fantastic, right? Well it is but there is NO organization, no line...so it is a giant pile of chaos and there is lots of bad blood between guests. The rooms are clean and everyone comes with a fridge and microwave. The hotel provides shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Overall, I would definitely stay there again.We had a nice stay for the price we paid.  Location was great for seeing the Arch.  The on site restaurant was good and parking was free and secure.  Hotel was clean, beds were comfortable, shower worked good and they had a nice hot breakfast in the morning.  BUT the walls and towels are thin  (Motel 6 kind of thin).Well...several things made this hotel not so comfortable:1) If you are facing the street, maybe you noticed Harry's bar and restaurant, which turns into a night club at on the weekends, with lines out the door at midnight and beyond, and booming bass-y music that can be heard even in our 10th floor room. I awoke several times during the night hearing the latest jams blasted from our next door neighbors. 2) There were college-aged women going in and out of the hotel lobby in miniskirts around midnight when we arrived, presumably taking a break from the club next door, but doesn't positively add to the ambiance of the hotel check-in area. 3) There was a security guard patrolling the hallway who perched right next to our room door. I guess it's meant to make you feel safer, but somehow this did not provide a peace of mind, and certainly not a lot of privacy.How could you not give this hotel 5 stars? Free beer/wine/soda & snacks like nachos and popcorn during happy hour???? Awesome.If your headed to St. Louis for baseball or football, this definitely was the more affordable way to stay in comfort, giving you the ability to walk or cab it to the stadium.We had a very clean room, a great bed, and a nice view of St. Louis the entire visit.The employee's all showed great enthusiasm in trying to assist with anything needed, and offered nice suggestions for dinner/desert choices.We had completely FREE parking the entire stay for 2 cars with a gated parking structure. Not having to pay for parking is always an added bonus!The pool was small, but still added that little bit of extra enjoyment. The hot tub could have been a little hotter....and by no the fault of the hotel, was completely packed with 5 and 6 year olds....What the heck parents!!!!!The soda fountain station is only ON during limited hours...but it's free soda, so I'm not complaining.Breakfast was GGGGGGGGRRREAT!Large spread of eggs, sausage, waffles, biscuits/gravy, bacon, toast, muffins, yogurt, fruit.....One of the better hotel breakfast's I've seen offered. Over all a great hotel. If...I mean when I head back to St. Louis I'll definitely be staying at the hotel again. 5 stars!!!!!!!My choices were the Double Tree or the Pear Tree Union Station.  My first time in Saint Louis (I'm from Alaska), I chose the hotel where I could walk a little outside but was still close to the conference.  With their free wi-if, free drinks in the evening, popcorn after the drinks, and free breakfast I am 100% sure I made the right choice.  (I'm talking full hot breakfast here!) Right at this moment, I am sitting in the lobby while families play cribbage, military guys cheer on the Cards, and the smell of popcorn wafts throughout the lobb, as I drink my free glass of winey.  The staff has been stellar, I travel all over the country and this staff at this hotel has, BY FAR, outshined the places I've stayed in the last couple months:  Portland, Seattle, Anchorage, DC.  They're friendly, helpful, always smiling, and ready to help.  And don't get me started on the view.  We are right next to a community garden, with full view of the downtown and Saint Louis Arch.  This may not be too important, but for me, the garden has been my place of refuge.  I am in love with this hotel!  If I ever make it back to STL, this will definitely be the place I stay.  Thank you Pear Tree, I appreciate it.  (PS, the room is not too shabby, clean, fridge and microwave, king size bed, lots of space!)First off let me start by saying that overall this hotel is fairly nice at first glance.  However, once I made it to my room I noticed the bathtub was dirty while  the room appeared like it hadn't been dusted in weeks!!  Also I was put in a room with double twin beds when I asked for a single king.    Then I find out that you are charged 18 dollars in taxes per day!!!  I've never been charged like that before to my knowledge.   The Drurys have outstanding hotels throughout the U.S.   This one however left a lot to be desired.Very nice and helpful staff! Indoor pool with hot tube was very clean.  Free hot breakfast that was nice from 6:30 to 9:30.  Also free parking.   Rooms were dated but clean.  One person who stood out was Cathy who seemed to be everywhere.  Working the front desk one evening and then the buffet the next morning with a nice smile and great attitude! She was friendly and easy to talk to.   Will be back Thanks!When booking a hotel in a city you've never been too sometimes a lack of pictures or an accurate review can leave you & the family wishing you booked another hotel or even worse, wish you could just live in the minivan for a week. Pear Tree Inn by Drury has positive reviews & for good reasons.  The staff was at the top of their game.  From the lady at the front desk who spent all of two minutes to check us in & give us our key, to Reggie who worked the bar & kept the snack area filled.  The rooms were clean, the bathroom was clean and the pool & surrounding areas were well kept.  No matter what time of day the cleaning crew were sweeping up the community dinning area where they had a free breakfast buffet every morning & free snacks and pop from 6 until 10.  One thing I thought was cool is adults receive 3 free beer or wine tickets each day from 6-830.  This helped keep costs down when going out to dinner.  I've never stayed at a hotel that offers free fountain pop & snacks for the kids every night and created a feeling like we were at home, they even had a cart full of board games.  Laundry services were an area that could use some attention, 2 washers & four dryers.  The dryers didn't work that well & we had to use extra quarters to dry them twice.  This hotel is showing its age but what this hotel lacks in curb appeal it makes up with hospitality & convenience.  My only complaint was the private parking garage.  It was very narrow, lots of giant pillars, full on weekends & if you see oil spots on the ground, the odds are you'll have a giant rainbow stain on your hood in the morning.  The hotel is located in the middle of everything we wanted to do, minutes from downtown and not to far from the Hill and other parts of the city.  If you don't feel like going out they have a nice bar & restaurant (Sybergs) located next to the pool.  The cost to stay here is hard to beat!  Throw in the free morning buffet, beers, pops & snacks and a stay at this hotel is a no brainer.  I wish they had more hotels in the cities I plan to visit because they have an awesome award program that rewards with you with several free nights.  I enjoyed my stay & if I was to return to St. Louis a stay here would be probable.Great hotel.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  Front desk awesome.   Great at giving directions.  I can see what others had said about kids,  but I had 3 older kids of my own, so the younger ones didn't bother me. Loved the wine in the evening.  That may have been my favorite part.  After days of traveling it was nice to sit and enjoy some wine.  Pool and hot tub were very clean!!  Breakfast was good.  I had to take one star off because as I was down at breakfast house keeping came in to clean my room and and taken my purse and belongings to the front desk.  Not cool to touch my stuff when I had not checked out.best sleep i have ever had not at home, wifi was good shower was good parking was ok but what was great was i was able to talk to allot of what i need to do hereWe stayed here over the Memorial Day Weekend and had some pretty high expectations for the $163 a night price tag. Our expectations plummeted at check in. The gentleman at the front desk swiped our credit card multiple times, causing it to eventually decline. He had somehow missed that it had been accepted prior to declining. We were rather confused when he said our credit card had declined and ended up using much of our vacation cash to pay for the room. We spent nearly a half an hour on the phone with out bank, which confirmed that the card had been run several times and had processed. We went back in and talked to the front desk staff, who continued to insisted it had never processed. Finally the front desk manager said he would call his IT department and look into it. Some time later called us and said that we were correct and he would give our cash back, making the comment that "we are only as good as our computers". When he did meet us, during dinner at the on site restaurant (Sybergs), to return our cash, he continued to make light of the event. After a very long day of driving, the last thing I expected was to be embarrassed at check with an unexpected credit card decline and the ensuing stress of "figuring it out" and then trying to convince them to take a closer look at the transaction. There was no offer to make up for the stress/anxiety that they had caused. As far as the amenities:Parking was free. It was a small parking garage just behind the hotel. If you are not unloading/loading your luggage at the drive up overhang, it will be a pain to walk through the garage with your luggage. Rooms were clean and average. In our room, their was no vanity/sink outside the bathroom (it was in the bathroom, like at home). Hair dryer, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner provided. No plastic laundry bag. Towels were some of the thinnest I have seen at a hotel. Beds were comfy. The view wasn't spectacular, but it was better than the backside of a parking lot. I liked that the windows were tinted, so you could keep the windows open and without being seen from the outside.Manager's reception was sparse...pretzels, tortilla chips and salsa along with your drink card, good for three drinks within the time frame. Choices: Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Chardonnay, Zinfandel and Budweiser (maybe it Bud Lite, I can't remember). I had Merlot for two drinks, but they ran out of it and I had the Cabernet for my last drink. Both were okay. Watching other people, I learned that they did not let you get your drink and someone else's, nor could you use someone else's card after exhausting yours, each person had to redeem their own card. The pool are was nice enough and our 10 year old niece had a blast swimming in the three feet/four feet and five feet sections. We had hoped to get in the whirlpool, but it had been overtaken by a group of kids splashing around in it and running out other users. Pool towels were provided.The morning breakfast was great. Scrambled eggs, sausage patties, biscuits, gravy, bagels, toast, muffins, doughnuts, waffle station (in a separate room just to the side of the breakfast area), grits packets, oatmeal packet, hot chocolate packet, bananas, oranges, coffee, soda and juice. The morning dining room staff (Pearline, I think) was super; genuinely sweet.The only drawback to breakfast is that the dining room tables are tiny.All in all there were some great things (breakfast and free parking) and some average things (the room) and some disappointing things (whirlpool, manager reception snacks). For the price, there should have been much more great things. *Our check in experience took this review from a 3 star review to 2. Mistakes happen, but to dismiss us, then make light of it when we are right and blame "the computer" wasn't the proper response. Especially without offering to make up for it in any way.Not at all what I was expecting based on website and some of the reviews. Poor customer service, the assistant during check-in was not friendly and I had the feeling he was quite put off by working. The lobby is in major need of renovations. The website said there was a business center, great breakfast, drinks, pool.. All if these things were in one small area. When I went to get the drinks I had assumed it would be a bar. Instead it was like a cafeteria with people eating KFC at the table next to us, children running around screaming, scantily clad individuals walking through to the pool. I was just very shocked at the reality of the place. However the rooms are quite nice, parking is free. It's a decent location but you could spend the same amount on a better hotel located just as nicely and likely to have similar amenities.Ok the staff gets the 3 stars, the hotel, MAYBE two. Dig the location, dig the sports bar being attached with shuttle to the Cards game. Breakfast is no better than and Comfort INN, the refreshments at night were ho hum, and the beer flat. The Rooms were nice, you get a view of the dog kennel or the bar across the street. Got to point out the soap dispensers, keep in mind this is a DRURY hotel and they have soap dispensers, EW. Loved the dispenser that was dripping onto the shower handle, good times. All in the name of going green, no they are not, they are cutting corners. The towels, I highly suggest you bring your own, they are well worn and not sure if they ever saw a dryer! Better towels at resale shops. I did email Drury Inn and of course they are sorry and of course they will speak with the manager. Place is going down hill.I stayed in this hotel a few weeks ago as part of a wedding.  I saw the reviews and didn't expect much, but this place could use some updating.The staff were really friendly throughout our stay, but our room was kinda scummy.  On the second day we realized the ceiling of our bathroom leaked every time the person above us took a shower.  We notified the front desk, who sent someone from maintenance to look at it.  Nothing was done about it, but he did come to look.  This was clearly not a new leak, as the ceiling was bowing.On the plus side, the free breakfast is actually halfway decent.  The scrambled eggs and the biscuits were good.I probably would have given the hotel 3 stars if I hadn't been hit with gross ceiling water while trying to pee.  I wouldn't stay here again.
review_content_20: We came to St Louis for a family vacation. We stayed here through a priceline deal and we were not disappointed. Clean comfortable rooms, an evening beverage reception and a friendly staff. One of the big bonuses to this hotel is how close it is to everything! Union station is a block away. Gateway arch a mile and a half and so on. Free parking, central location and lots more. By tues night we couldn't park in the covered parking but the weather was good so that was ok.I stayed here for business, so I didn't make the reservation and don't know how much the rooms cost. However, I would not pay 3-digits for a room here. Reasons:1. There are lots of high school/college age students hanging around, in their party buses, being loud. I was awakened several times past midnight. As a result of all that partying, there were broken alcohol bottles in the parking lot that I drove over with my car the next morning.2. The building is dated. Another guest and I were temporarily trapped in an elevator when the door failed to open and then the lighted buttons all went dark. Fortunately, we were able to get off on another floor and hop into a different elevator.Andy Samberg as Mark Wahlberg:"Hey partridge! How's it hanging? Where's your pear tree!? ... Oh!
