I will be back.Hallways and elevators needed some cleaning but I will not cut a start off for that.Oh, the Drury. I have many NYE memories from oh, 15 years ago, but fast forward to today & I'm doing more adult things like going to weddings & not passing out in bathtubs (what?). We stayed here on a recent trip to STL for a wedding at NEO on Locust. Drury is still one of my favorite hotel chains, the rooms are always in decent condition & the customer service is great. This location was no different, though the room we were in could've used a little bit of updating. We were also in one of the interior rooms, so our only window looked out into the hotel, instead of outside... if we were staying for more than 1 night I would've asked to be moved because that always makes me a smidge claustrophobic. Pros: Comfy bed, afternoon food/booze freebies, free parking, reasonable price, free wifi.Cons: The dream my fiance had about a ghost being in our bed, of which I am now convinced was real, due to me having a legit feeling of a ghost in the room before he ever told me about said dream. Not to mention the noise app I have on my cell phone kept turning itself off inexplicably? So.... yeah. We also somehow could not find our way out of the stairwell & onto the first floor, but that could've been the amount of booze we drank the night before.Other than that, I'll probably stay again, but I will most definitely request a room with a real window!This place has good solid mid American values and offers a really great value proposition for the budget traveler. The food for the buffet dinner and breakfast is good, you get a beer and wine ticket when you check in good for three, yes THREE happy hour drinks and the rooms are very nice with extremely comfortable beds. This hotel made a pretty ghastly flying experience over two days completely saved.Great, clean hotel with hospitable staff that answered all our questions & offered to print us maps, itineraries, etc.- Free Parking- Pool & Hot Tub- Police station in hotel (safe)- Good location (10 min to Soulard, 10 min to Arch, 10 min to the hill)- Free drinks & food from 5pm-7pm- Free warm breakfast- AAA DiscountWishing this chain of hotels could expand nation wide but looking forward to our next Drury stay!Very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Any staff you would see always said hi asked if your stay is Ok if you need anything.The room was nice. Clean,quiet. Beds were comfy. Wish the pillows were a tad fluffy. The maids were quick and very nice made our kids beds with their blankets and pillows.The pool was Ok temp could be a tad warmer. Hot tub was good. Was busy after 6. Lots of towels they were always bringing in more.The food was great. We had dinner twice each night was a tad different. And breakfast. As for the dinner it was amazing and nice to come back and kickback like the signs say and that's what we did. The food isn't anything special but we liked it all. The bonus to dinner the drinks and the late snack of popcorn that was awesome. Thank you. Breakfast was good. I would like to see hard boiled eggs. The eggs were good and biscuits and gravy yumm. This is a great hotel.This is very nice hotel and great location ,superb service and like they say the extras aren't extra in The Drury's Inn and suites !This hotel is great! MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE...+FREE (COVERED) PARKING: OMG. This is why I am writing a review of this hotel on Yelp. The garage is FREE and EXTREMELY SAFE. You need a hotel room card to park inside the garage, AND there is limited entrance into the garage from 7 PM to 7 AM if you don't have your hotel card. At night time, the garage is completely closed to the outside; they even have those metal chain dividers, IN ADDITION to the room key activated bars. I felt SO safe leaving my car in the garage, and even if I did leave any valuables in my car, I would be able to sleep soundlessly through the night because I know they will still be there the next morning! I don't see how any intruders will be able to get in. The extra's: +Complimentary, HOT breakfast: No worries. You won't find the continental type of breakfast here where all they serve is dry cereal...there are sausages, tater tots, cereal, bread, juices, waffles, oatmeal, etc -you name it! There are also PLENTY of tables to situate everyone, so you don't have to worry about arriving too late to breakfast and scrambling to find seats. +Complimentary, DINNER & DRINKS: It's a rarity that hotels serve dinner, but this Drury Inn does! The menu can be found on their website, but it's pretty much a rotating selection of pasta and chicken tenders, along with soup, potatoes, etc. They also provide free alcoholic beverages!! Sit back and relax! +Clean Rooms: The rooms smell great; beds were comfortable; HD TV; free wi-fi. +Friendly Staff: Staff were extremely friendly in providing directions to attractions, numbers to rental cars, and anything you need help with.THANK YOU DRURY INN UNION STATION for providing these impeccable services! Money well spent.My husband and I used the Drury for our May 2014 wedding. They were more than accommodating to us and our guests, especially given that we had to keep enlarging the number of rooms in our 'block'. Breakfast, FREE PARKING and location were great amenities for our guests and we were able to rent a room the morning after our wedding for gifts. We heard no complaints about the rooms as all were cleaned well regularly and the suites were all spacious (be cautious of the one in the basement though - while it's great that you have privacy because it's the only room down there, there are no windows). The hotel is also historical and a good change of pace from the usual hotel feel. The staff were professional and easy to get ahold of with any concerns - I would definitely recommend them for any stay in St. Louis or bridal party.Absolutely the best hotel stay the family has ever had. The beds we're very comfortable and the service was superior. For the cost you couldn't beat it. Free breakfast and dinner that is way more than the simple appetizers you get at other hotels. The hotel under promises but over delivers which is unusual in this day and age. The location was close to everything. The building itself had a ton of character. The only negative was the towels were sort of rough.The place is beautiful. They offer great service and clean rooms!!! Plus, they offer breakfast, dinner, and 3 drinks for free. The only down fall is the gym is real small with very little equipment. But other than that they have a awesome pool!!! Trust me guys its a great stay!!!What an awesome place to stay!! My boyfriend and I made a last minute decision to visit STL for a concert that happened to be the same weekend as Mardi Gras. While the rest of the hotels in the area were either sold out or way over priced, we found this one for $130 a night. The man who checked us in was very welcoming, he joked with us and didn't seem stressed by how busy it was. Fortunately we arrived during happy hour so we sat down and had some snacks and drinks, all for free. They had a pretty good variety of snacks- popcorn, hotdogs, nachos and to drink I had a cranberry & vodka and a tequilla sunrise. It took us a while to find our room.. This hotel is HUGE. Our room was clean, beds were comfy. My only complaint was the noise, we were woken up the next morning by kids running around and screaming. I think there may have been a ball tournament because kids were EVERYWHERE, I know it's hard for the hotel staff to control so it wasn't a big deal! Overall, our stay was very nice. Wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy the pool and more happy hours :) Thinking of visiting STL again in July and definitely will stay here!Great place to stay. Clean and cozy. Great area walking distance to downtown. Great happy hour food and drinks and breakfast.!Clarifier - this is only a review of their breakfast buffet. This might be my favorite breakfast in St. Louis. My sister, mom, aunts, and grandparents were in town visiting and I had the buffet twice. The service was amazing - their staff was friendly, conscious to filling your cups and catering to your needs without obtruding. The buffet costs $15 and comes with complimentary, unlimited great coffee and fresh orange juice. I'm a snob for both beverages and was absolutely pleased. On top of this there is a fresh fruit bar (watermelon, melon, strawberries, and blueberries that had a Whole Foods quality measure about them), micro smoothies next to that,And an oatmeal station with all the fixings (pecans, walnuts, apricots, golden raisins, dried cranberries, brown sugar, honey, dot dot dot). And then their are croissants, pastries, donuts, bagels, bread...And an omelet bar...And a prosciutto, cheese, I never seen this at a buffet but I love that it is here kinda station...And And And And when are you going?Drury Inn will throw your ass out in the cold at 3:30 in the morning in the middle of one of the most dangerous cities in the country when all you're doing is standing right inside the front door waiting for a cab (not even in the lobby). F U, Drury InnAny hotel that does this: countercurrentnews.com/2... should have no business given to them. Please find an alternative placeThis is by far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The beds were comfortable and the staff was very friendly. The pool is large and there is free parking! It is right across from union station and the Hard Rock Cafe. This is an overall great hotel and I would definitely recommend this to anyone!Best hotel experience I've ever had. Staff is super friendly but not fake. Room was clean and comfy. Lots of free food and drinks. Excellent value!!This Drury Inn is just like many other Drury hotels. We try as hard as we can to stay in only Drury hotels. They are so clean and the food is so good! You guys please me! Keep up the good work! Overall GREAT place to stay!Whaaaat? This place is AWESOME! And I'm a Four Seasons kinda girl. I actually considered cancelling my upcoming Four Seasons STL stay for Drury Inn because IT WAS THAT GOOD. (I didn't cancel... I mean, it's the Four Seasons... but I did consider it!)This was the perfect spot for a Blues Game because it is so close to Scottrade. The parking is free, I loved the free popcorn and soda, the "kickback" and breakfast in the morning was a pretty solid selection. The pantry closet with all sorts of treats was a nice touch. Reasonable pricing. The pool and hot tub looked so inviting after being out in the cold but I didn't bring my suit. Fail. The decor in the lobby is lovely... dark but grand and very clean. Everyone was happy; guests and staff alike. I smile thinking about my stay here.We woke up at 9:45 (long night) and asked for late check out because I didn't feel like getting out of bed anytime soon. They pushed back checkout 2 hours, to 1pm, no questions asked. Oh the little things make such an impact on an experience. I left that hotel with a smile on my face, mentally planning my next trip. All of this for around 110/night. Seriously affordable vs other options in the area, and you get SO MUCH MORE. I snagged a Drury Inn at the Arch stay for 3 days for the Opening Day Cards series and I'm thrilled. Can't wait to try another location.I never never write reviews, but this hotel's accommodations are horrible! The hotel was full, so I was put in a smoking room, even thought reservations had been well in advance by the organizers of the convention. The front desk was rude and even annoyed that asked to be switched out of the room, if they didn't have enough rooms to accommodate everyone in a clean smoking free room they shouldn't have hosted the convention.
review_content_20: This is a great place to stay.  1 block from Union Station.  Free parking.  Evening snacks and beverages and a great hot breakfast.  The Drury's are a great value!I've never stayed at a hotel in 30 years as spectacular as this one. It was almost as if I was warped back in time back to the good old days of the 1980's or better yet, early 1990's. Back then, things and life were complimentary, before greed set in and everyone was nickled and dimed. Several things impressed me about Drury Inn. I would stay here again without even thinking about it. Rooms were clean and big for what I spent for the night. Beds were big and the bathrooms had shampoo dispensers as well. Most impressive was the complimentary service. Free parking, free breakfast buffet. I don't mean the shit breakfast buffet everyone is used to, with bread, processed juice from 18 years ago, and a glass of water. Waffles, toast, bagels, syrup, cereal, you name it, they had it. Customer service was excellent, helping me to navigate around the city. They were excellent. One can only wish others followed Drury's lead, but then again, life is just not that simple.Old but free breakfast buffet. And very nice. I was here for a volleyball tournament and they extended breakfast hours for us. It's a very fun place to play elevator tag!For a weekend trip to St. Louis, this turned out to be the best place. Good: The location is across the street from Union Station, one of the attractions in town I planned to visit. The location is about a two minute walk to an LRT station (at Union Station). Awesome, free, hot breakfast. I've enjoyed many free (included in the price of the room) hotel breakfasts over the years. This is the best I've experienced based on the variety of hot meats, eggs, waffles, cereals, biscuits, gravy... I could go on and on. The style/decor of the hotel is great. It is an older building completely restored and up to date (it was originally a YMCA back in the day). There is plenty of parking in an attached, multi-level garage. Bad: Not much was bad. It wasn't the cheapest price in down, but I felt it was not that expensive and a good value.Dog stays free. Car stays free. Free breakfast. Free happy hour and apps (hot dogs, mac and cheese, nachos). Good location, nice rooms, friendly staff. Indoor pool and hot tub. The freebies saved us a couple hundred dollars for the weekend. If you have a dog and a car, there is no better place.Location is great - close to lots of restaurants, pubs etc., as well as Union Station.The price encompases free parking, breakfast, happy hour (3 free drinks, finger food) - and while not the least expensive hotel, you get value for the money.The staff are fantastic - very friendly, happy to help.The area is safe to walk around in.The rooms are clean, and everything is in good repair.All in all, happy with our choice.The on-site restaurant gets good ratings on yelp (rightly so) which is one more plus.Would I return:  yesWoudl I recommend:  yesThumbs up!  Stayed here the night before the Rock N Roll marathon.  Fantastic location in the historic former Railroad YMCA, very cute lobby, decent pool and nice big whirpool.  Free parking made in and out a breeze.Ditto to what others have said about the breakfast and dinner buffets.  I was very impressed with the friendly staff, and especially grateful the  opening of breakfast an hour early on Sunday to accomodate the runners.  Very cool!Room 419 was a little weird....we had no window at all.  However, the room was spacious with a king bed, large sofa bed and reclining chair.  The bathroom was the tiniest I've been in outside of Hong Kong (and it may be a tie!)We had an easy walk to the starting line and back from the finish line.I will definitely book a room here next year for the race.Nice room. Coming from Chicago, I appreciate free garage parking!Yummy line of free food nightly. Complete with 3 free drinks! Make a meal out of this and spend the rest of your money on drinks. Pool area looks nice.Great location.Great hotel! Free breakfast, free happy hour/dinner, free popcorn, free soda from the soda machine in the lobby! More tv channels than most hotels! Sparking structure that is locked down pretty good. You need your room key to get in or out. The staff is really nice too! We really enjoyed our short stay here!I really like these hotelsnever had a bad exp at any of the ones I stayed in.Nearly choked on the cloud of toxic chemicals they used to clean the room. Sure enough, I woke with a headache the next morning. Glad some people like it. For $109, I expect some attention to this aspect in this day and age.What an absolutely beautiful hotel! The staff are incredible. Included in the price of the hotel are free breakfast & dinner buffets. The hotel is very convenient to the MetroLink. I stayed here when U2 was in town. The hotel was filled & I could not have been happier with where i stayed. I would definitely recommend.The Drury Inn at Union Station is the best hotel in Downtown St. Louis. It's located directly across from Union Station and there's always something to do within waking distance. As with all Drury Inn's, the have the 500pm free happy hour which is really nice considering they pour top shelf drinks. This location also offers free parking which is somewhat of a rarity.Like staying here.  The rooms/baths are always clean. Theres in room refridgerator.  No problems in getting extra towesl or pillows.  Pool also provide towels.  Breakfast is always a hit with waffles and hot items like biscuts and gravy, sausages, eggs, and fresh fruit.  Go early for breakfast because the lines get long for the waffles.  They also have happy hour cocktails one free drink per person per night along with horderves.for what it is, this is seriously the best place i have stayed.  sure, i have stayed in some of the nicest, most hip places around but for a night in st. louis where all we needed was a place to crash, this was it!it was very reasonably priced.the staff was nice and accommodating beyond words.there is free popcorn and fountain soda in the lobby!you get 3 free drinks during happy hour!you also get an hour of long distance calling for free.bottom line, if you are in town for a wedding like we were, or a concert, ballgame or something similar, book your stay here!  they are so nice and great that you will feel right at home.Just stayed here with a Girl Scout troop and the service was awesome! Great location, free food at breakfast and at 5:30pm, self serve soft drinks and popcorn from 3pm-10pm.  Clean rooms, smallish pool but the girls still enjoyed it.  Walk to everything from here and if it's a little too far for you, take the very clean and reliable Metrolink that is located about a block from the front door. Would definetely stay here again!I'm giving this four star rating on the basis that this is the nicest two star hotel I've stayed at. When I first walked in I was nervous because this is an old hotel and everything is dark wood, floral, green marble, etc. Not exactly what I look for in hotel decor. However, what the decor lacks, the hotel staff and amenities makes up for! The room was what I expected with floral decor, green carpet, and older furnishings but the bed was comfortable, there was FREE wifi, and the bathroom was just fine. I checked out both the happy hour and continental breakfast and both were good. They had decent wines at the happy hour (for free) and the breakfast was a hot breakfast which you don't see at too many two star hotels. Finally, what really pushed my rating to four stars, was the hotel staff. EVERYONE was friendly and went out of their way to make your experience as nice as possible. They even called after you checked in to see if there was anything they could do. Nice touch for sure.It's a classy joint.

review_content: Not only was this place beautiful and had great rooms and food, but I have to make a special shout out due to some unforeseen circumstances...I am a flight attendant and when our original hotel caught on fire, the Chalet took us in and gave the whole crew complimentary rooms, food, and drinks. The staff was more than helpful and very welcoming.I just wanted to thank them for all of their hospitality!Our reservations were mysteriously cancelled upon arrival, instead of handling the problem, front desk staff tried to turn us away as the hotel was "full." When I demanded we get the rooms that as of two days prior were confirmed, the man behind the counter claimed that was impossible. When I asked to speak to a manager, both gentlemen at the desk claimed to be managers. They then teamed up to make all of this seem like our fault. They kept saying they couldn't help us when we were angry, but what they were really doing was attempting to bully us into leaving through angry and condescending behavior and speech. One was especially bad. He had what seemed to be a violent temper. He had to walk away at one point and compose himself because I wouldn't just accept the fact that our reservations were lost (did I mention my colleague had checked in under the reservation two hours prior?) He was scary, and probably does not need to work with the public. He seemed proud of his behavior, like he could treat me that way because I was powerless. I asked him to call the reservation line to find out what happened. He held the phone to his ear for a while, said he was on hold and that he could call me when he knew what happened. I gave him my cell phone number. I went to our to put down luggage in the rooms they found us that had previously not existed, and when I walked through about ten minutes later to move my car, he was not on the phone nor had I received a call. I asked him what happened and he said they couldn't tell him anything. I told him I didn't appreciate how he had handled the situation, and as I walked away he yelled at me to mention his name when I called to complain. Why would a person say that? No concern or compassion for customers. I think he was mad that made a mistake and had to work to fix it, which is his job. What's really upsetting is that when I called the corporate reservation line later, they said I had had three rooms when the reservation left their system the day before. I would never stay here again. I felt like the staff couldn't handle a mix up that most likely happens on occasion. We were not going to leave after our colleague was already able to check in, with no place to go and no idea what happened, and the hotel must not have been "full" if they found us two rooms for the night because we wouldn't leave.The rooms were below average, but the scary staff is the reason to stay away.We stayed here for a couple of nights, and I would recommend it. But, just barely.   First, the staff here is amazing. Anytime we had a question or issue, it was promptly handled. We were offered recommendations on places to see around town, and we even got a map printed for us when we mentioned our GPS apps on our phones were having issues. The staff here are a major asset. When we first checked in, we were given keys to someone else's room. This was a little unsettling, but it was rectified by the front desk immediately. Seeing this pop up in another review makes me think there must be some issue within their computer system that needs to be addressed . . . immediately. The building itself is just alright. From the outside, it's pretty cool, with a European/medieval feel. The inside, however, is a different story. The lobby looks amazing, and I wish they would carry this bright, modern experience to the rooms. Now, don't get me wrong, it's comfortable and clean, but feels cramped, dated, and put through the wringer. A few issues I noticed were chipping paint, stained carpet, curtains, and poor water pressure, especially in the bathroom sink.We both like our room a little cooler and noticed if we lowered the temperature, 30 minutes later it was already reset. I don't understand having a thermostat in a room if the guest can't actually set it to a temperature they feel most comfortable. We were woken up by construction happening by the pool several mornings. I think it would be reasonable to hold off on that until 10:00 or so, but I understand they have a business to run.  Just a small note, these rooms don't have mini fridges or microwaves, so if you're eating out, eat up! The restaurant here is pretty great. Granted, I only tried the buffet ($15 for breakfast and coffee).It's located next to a plaza area with a few restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and a comedy club.  It also has pretty easy access to 270.  So, would I stay here again? I'd actually probably toss a coin. It almost seems like a tale of two hotels. The staff here are worth 5 stars easily, but the overall building and the stay itself, maybe 3 if I'm being kind.We had a great experience here. My wife was sick and called the front desk looking for a place to get some soup. Adrianne at the front desk was so awesome! She took upon herself to try to find the soup for my wife! The entire staff here was great but she was a stand out. The room we stayed in was newly remodeled. The only knock was the fact that they at were remodeling the floor below ours so on Friday it was a little noisy. The plaza has some fun food options. Imos pizza is a must!Yea, it is a bit weird hotel: Swiss style chalet, with strange shaped rooms, and layout of property. Yea, rooms, particularly bathrooms, are dated too, and so is infrastructure. But there was some remodeling, it is clean, staff is friendly, price was right. Major draw for me was location. Westport Plaza is quite nice, with several places worth visiting, good food and entertainment, plus only 15 mins to airport, and free shuttle. Good for short trip.This is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in, and I've stayed at plenty of sketchy motels and felt just fine. I'll start from the beginning... We were given room keys to a room on the fourth floor. When my work roommate and I got up there, I heard a TV blaring from outside the door. Regardless we both tried using our room keys to get in and neither worked.  After a few tries we finally knocked and a haggard voice responded "Yeah?!" to which, for some reason, I responded "Is someone in there?" which obviously received an affirmative reply.  Anywho, after we told the front desk we got a different room on the first floor, which is 2 floors down from the lobby.Our first night there, I went to drink excessive amounts of wine with some co-workers at the hotel bar (the only good thing about this place) while my roommate went to retire for the night. She later said she couldn't get into the room and when the hotel staff investigated, they had to completely replace our door handle because the battery inside of it that accepts room keys had died.  When I came back to the room a few hours later, my room key didn't work and the front desk had to give me a new one.So, the next day I had set my alarm for 7am.  At about 6am I awoke to EXTREMELY LOUD   sludge hammering outside my back door (we had a back door which opened out yo their ghetto parking lot).  Some doofus was pounding away at the sidewalk a foot away from my door. I asked him what he was doing and said he woke me up, to which he begrudgingly apologized.There was also mold in our shower. My group of like 20 all had terrible things to say about this place (one co-worker said his room was right next to an ice machine that loudly banged against his wall all night).  Bottom line.. Do not stay here!!It's nice. Nothing to write home about the rooms are pretty small. But clean. I'm really having an issue with the Wi-Fi I've tried to get connected to it numerous of times I also called the front desk and numerous of times and they give me different passwords every time and it never works. So that was a big turnoff for me because I love to use my computer. But they were nice about it when I called a numerous of times. Sheets are nice and crisp. And it the room  doesn't smell like smoke, smells pretty fresh. The next  morning when I woke up my back was hurting, didn't sleep well at all. I slept better at the casino queen.I was actually pleasantly surprised by the quality of my stay at the Sheraton Westport Lakeside Chalet.  When I found out that I would be attending a 2-day conference there, I immediately checked out the reviews, and I was a little nervous about the mixed bag that's out there. I booked my room through Priceline's "Express Deals" feature, which gave me a much cheaper rate than I would have received if I had booked my room as a part of the conference's block rate.  One of the most impressive aspects of the hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff - from the people at the front desk, to the bar/restaurant workers, to the event/catering folks - the service was truly excellent throughout our entire stay.I was also surprisingly impressed by the quality and cleanliness of the common areas throughout our stay.  The decor of the public spaces is somewhat contemporary, and cleanliness was never an issue during our stay.  The lobby is inviting and comfortable, the fitness room seemed clean and well-equipped, the hotel bar is a really cool space with a decent selection of beer, wine, and liquors to choose from, the meeting rooms and grand ballroom provided a perfect venue for our conference, and the food that was served to us throughout the day was always fantastic and plentiful!My only complaints about the hotel were with our room.  We stayed in a double room on the second floor of the hotel.  The room itself was very large in size, with a small balcony that overlooked the courtyard below, but the furnishings in the room were fairly minimal/basic, which made the room seem way bigger than it needed to be.  The bathroom, on the other hand, seemed somewhat small.  It provided a lot of shelving, but the strangest thing about it was that it didn't offer anyplace to actually hang a towel.  The shower was also a little odd, with a shower head that couldn't have been more than 5.5 feet high.  Not great for a taller guy like me.  The hotel offers a fairly large selection of TV channels in the rooms, but where it matters the most - the beds - I've definitely slept much more comfortably.One last comment - as nice as the downstairs common areas are, the upstairs hallways could definitely use a little facelift.  For me, they just felt too dark and dated, and they left an impression of a much cheaper hotel while walking through.The outside is peaceful. Scenic. House keeping needs to be a bit quicker. I am a tad nervous with the 3 day conference. I am surprised how pleasant the staff has been. Overall nice, I will book again.This is one weird hotel.  From the outside, it looks like an old-fashioned swiss chalet, but on the inside, it is modern.  The rooms are okay, but the heating system never shuts off and was blowing the curtains around all night.  The bathroom is a little tight a well, but the bed was very comfortable.  Staff was very nice and check-in was quick.I also thought it was weird that my room had a door to the outside that would not open, yet I saw someone the next morning exit from theirs.  That would have been extremely helpful to get to my car since parking is at a premium here and you have to walk a mile to get in and out.I only stayed overnight, attending a conference in the adjacent building, so I didn't get to use room-service or see what the housekeeping was like.  Wi-fi was complimentary on my stay, but is normally $9.95 - I would guess it was comp'd as part of the conference package.Lame bar staff but decent rooms.  It's a bit away from anything interesting. Would recommend the Sheraton Plaza before staying here. If it's full this is an okay place to sleep.  Just know you should Uber to any restaurants.Not good. Stayed there 3 nights on the 1st floor. I had cold showers with horrible water pressure, the first floor was musty and damp. I didn't get room service for two days so they could spray freshener in my room, on the third day my room smelled like a boys locker room. I will never book this hotel ever again. At $155 a night, you better have great water pressure and clean rooms and free wifi. Wifi is $9.95 per day for guest service slow use.. Save your self some money, do not go to this hotel.The staff was friendly and great, the hotel is HORRIBLE!Not a bad little hotel, but definitely not the same high-end feel I've felt at other Sheraton locations.Goods:* Extremely friendly and helpful staff. It is unfortunate things like the printer broke while I was there and that the line at the bar for a couple nights was atrocious, but that's no biggie. Everything from check-in, to housekeeping, to asking random staff members random questions, to requesting more towels, or requesting more information about the area was a friendly and professional experience.* Bathroom was clean.* Meeting rooms we used were nice and the gal we worked with to organize our event was very helpful.* Walking distance to a number of little bars and restaurants which meant late night eating and drinking didn't require additional things like taxi fares or rental car gas.Bads:* Didn't seem as high-end as other Sheraton's I've stayed at. I think the quaint chalet, old-style feel is borderline cute. I almost feel it is barely a Category 2, personally. But take what I say with a grain of salt because I don't travel much. Note that I still gave it a "Yay! I'm a fan." rating.* Pillows seemed kind of awful. I had 8 total pillows in my room between 2 beds, and none of them were comfortable. And they are just the wrong size where two is too many and one is too few. They were also lumpy. Is what it is.* Walls are thin, or at least the doors are. If you plan to sleep past 8am, expect to be woken time and time again by stairway doors and other room doors opening and closing over and over and over and over and over.* SPG Gold didn't really do anything for me. I wasn't greeted in any particular way, I wasn't offered a room upgrade, and they didn't seem to have any information about the Free In-room WiFi benefit.Other than that, however, I enjoyed my stay and I had fun. The price wasn't bad and I would stay there again (though I'd probably bring my own pillow).On the basis of the friendliness of the entire hotel staff, I would like to give them at least four stars - but there are some major issues that get in the way.  First, the good stuff:- The hotel is cute, chalet- style, with every room having a little wooden balcony with a couple of chairs.- Every single staff member I've had reason personally to connect with has gone out of their way to be helpful and to meet my needs. - The room is adequate - not huge, and the bathroom is a bit squished, but overall it's okay.- If you have their "frequent guest" card, there is a little card saying the bottle of water in the room (which otherwise would cost $2) is complimentary.  We'll see when I get my bill.- The large, fluffy pillows are great!The not-so-good:- Accessibility - One of my meetings was on a patio. I enquired about handicap access and was led to an elevator. You take the elevator down the stairs, open a heavy (and unmarked) door, climb several stairs, walk again. Then another heavy door, and a walk to the patio.  NO, this is not "handicap accessible."- Security - every day when I come back from meetings, the door to my balcony is wide open. The Front Desk Manager, Adam, and I hypothesized that it was a faulty lock, and the door was pulled open when I open the main room door.  Except that we then closed it tightly, and it has not re-opened. Which brings me back to the housekeeping staff.- Beds - I'm told they do not change the sheets every day (which is okay -- but a whole week?)  Basically, what the housekeeper does every day is just throw the sheets and covers back up, and toss the pillows into an approximation of the right position. If you leave the fitted sheet slightly pulled off the mattress (I mean, if that's how it was when you woke up), that will be how it is when you go to bed. So, the best I can do is  three stars, and most of that is because of the staff's friendly and helpful attitude. Housekeeping not so much.Great price for a short stay! The bathroom is a little tight. We were able to enjoy the outdoor pool but the little man-made creek next to the pool gathers mosquitos. The staff is friendly and check in is quick.Worst experience EVER!  Moved from first room because of musty smell, second room bug in coffee and pubic hair and stains in bed.....third room musty....just happy the sheets were clean! TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!Stayed at the Sheraton Westport Lakeside Chalet Hotel this past weekend.  We were very impressed with the Hotel and our Room.  The room was clean, updated and very spacious for a 2 full-size bed room. It was great to have a balcony.  Adrianne at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.  Her upbeat attitude paved the way for a fantastic overall experience!  Would definitely stay here again.This hotel was my home away from home last weekend. My husband and I, along with several friends, were in town for a friend's wedding. Overall our experience with the hotel and their staff was extremely positive. We opted to pay a bit extra ($16 for the whole weekend) for club lounge access and were to happy we did. The lounge had a refrigerator with pop cans, bottled water, and bottled juices, as well as an expresso machine and regular food (including delicious cookies and crab rangoon). The free breakfast in the club lounge was also nearly the exact same as the one some other friends paid $15 for on Sunday morning in the restaurant on the ground level. Totally worth the $16!!! I honestly didn't spend too much time in our room, but I was quite happy with the comfort level of the beds. The staff was happy to help accomodate our request to move our room near our friends. The rooms seemed to have been recently updated and were quite roomy. The only reason for the missing 5th star is the fact that on our final morning here the hotel room had a strong mildewy smell and the shower spout is strangely short. Not sure what was up with the smell - especially since that was the first time we had experienced it. Also, I'm only 5'5" and the shower came out of the wall at next level... very strange! Otherwise our stay here was great - I would definitely consider staying here when returning to St. Louis.Ms T's sister, her husband and niece stayed at the Chalet during an October 2010 high school softball tournament.  The teams stay together and this was the place they chose.  I guess it was OK until the final night.Apparently neither the Sheraton nor Westport Plaza is capable of providing security for guest parking.  Ms T's brother-in-law parked their Chevy Avalanche in the surface lot assuming it would be safe.  Sometime in the middle of the night they received a call asking if they meant to park it with only two wheels.  Someone had decided they liked the wheels and helped themselves.  See the photo.The family spent most of a Sunday trying to find replacements so they could drive back home.  If you choose to discount this review, I still suggest you park in the parking ramp.  It might be better.On a late arrival check in,  no one was at the  desk for almost 20 minutes.  Rooms are comfortable and large.  No wifi, in club room area you can request a code but it only lasts one hour.  It was a pain getting wifi dropped.  Next day they never made up my room at all.  Notified front desk.  Following morning no hot water,  hotel folks says it happens often this is unacceptable especially when it is 1degree outside.  Ice cold shower is not a good way to start the day.  Wish I could give zero rating.
review_content_20: This is a standard Sheraton, it seems to have had a recent update of decor but it is an older hotel with Very Slow elevators and some musty areas here and there.  The bathrooms are small but adequate.  What makes the hotel is the staff.  All staff are happy to see you and want to assist you.  Service from reception (really fast check in ) club lounge (I saw them go down to the kitchen to get a child a certain cereal) to housekeeping, you will be impressed.  Food is above average for a Sheraton and again the service in the restaurant was top notch.We had a great experience this past weekend for a wedding.  The rooms in the Chalet were plenty comfortable and roomy, we were upgraded to the lounge level (totally worth it if you're down for free breakfast and appetizers) Plus I may or may have not raided the soda cabinet for at least a 6 pack.  All of the staff was helpful and we never needed anything.  Parked out on the exposed lot and in spite of the weather it was fine.  The  gym is only cardio, didn't get to go swimming, but it made for a very comfortable stay, definitely a great sub 100 dollar value.Horrible hotel.  Filthy rooms.  No hot tub and no pool.  Their website lied and said there was a hot tub and a pool.  For $200 you would expect at least a pool and hot tub.  The staff was rude when we complained.  Reviews on other sites said it was a good hotel but clearly they're paying for fake reviews.  AVOID!Stayed here for work and was not disappointed. Very close to a nice shopping center with good food options. Lucked out and got an upgrade to a suite with a really nice view of town.When you hear "chalet" you don't really get the vibe that you are going to be staying in a room that overlooks a dumpster. A room that at 3 am you can hear loading and unloading. no, not really. The area looks like it could have been cool but there are no commercial places in the huge area that surrounds the hotel. The only real bonus was the company I was with and the woman in the parking garage was HILARIOUS. Would never ever stay here again!Um. Our room faced a dumpster. At 3am trucks were unloading goods and dumping trash. Path from garage to hotel involves no elevator if you have hands full. No wifi. Internet was incompatible with VPN. Ugh.Staff was kind enough to refund our stay, but still...will never be returning.At least they validate parking.Stayed here for work. Place is ok. Nice view and looks nice from outside. Inside is a bit rundown but its okThe Chalet is definitely the more down market of the next to each other Sheratons in Westport (the Plaza is recently remodeled and more recommended), but I have enjoyed my stays here- while the outside is dated, the rooms are comfortable and there are good dining options next door in Westport Plaza. There are worse places to stay in West STL.........like the Marriott STL West for instance.The room was comfortable, but the hallway on the fourth floor was very hot and had a smell. The elevator was extremely slow.  The rest of the facilities were very well kept.Sheraton should invest in a ventilation system for the floor or install fans.  They should also increase the speed of the elevator.  This hotel is OK for a one to two night stay.Stayed here for work for four nights and moved 2 times.  First got put on the first floor.  Typical old hotel, not a problem.  The next morning a gigantic spider was crawling around outside the bathroom.  I thought it might be the first floor problem so I asked to move to a higher floor.  The staff was very nice and understanding and moved me to the 4th floor.  So the next morning in the 4th floor...another spider.  This time, it was in my shoe that I was about to put on and just happened to see it.  Later that day, I heard buzzing in the window and found the biggest wasp I'd ever seen.  I was able to kill it with the curtains and I freaked out.  I asked if there was any nicer room...I didn't want to spend my whole time there killing bugs.  They moved me to the "newer renovated" part of the hotel to the 6th floor.  I didn't have any further problems there.  Once again, the staff were awesome, they offered free food and stuff, but I felt bad for complaining as it was and only took the room change.  This hotel needs a serious renovation...it's very dingy and they obviously have a bug problem.  Staff I give 5 stars, hotel...I'm being generous with 2...I couldn't wait to check out. If you stay here, ask to stay in the newly renovated part on the left hand side as you walk in the hotel lobby!!!Teenage party in hallway all night :(  Another guest tried to shut them up, failed. Staff or security did not try; although our room was within fifty feet of the front desk & lobby!  Door-slamming started again at 5am.  $60 on priceline but front desk insisted $99.We were supposed to stay at this hotel for two days this week for my husband's business trip.  In fact, he was the speaker for one of the conference events in the hotel, so the room was to be complimentary for us.  When we checked in, I was impressed by the look of the lobby, although the exterior of the hotel looks rather dated.  After being given our room keys, we headed down a long hallway to our room, and I started to wonder if the carpet floors had recently been flooded because I thought I smelled water damage.  The smell got worse the further we walked, and after hearing a few dogs bark from behind closed room doors and seeing signs such as "Do not open door.  Chow inside", we realized that we were smelling dogs, and lots of them!Now, I adore dogs, but I do not like sleeping in rooms that smell like a kennel, so we walked back to the front desk to asked to be placed in a room that is not one in which animals are kept, nor near the barking ones. On the way back down the hall, I saw tufts of dog hair on the carpet, and my eyes were watering by the time we made it to the lobby.  The front desk worker informed us that there were no rooms away from dogs, as 300 dogs were attending a "Chow Convention" in the hotel!  I said I was amazed that they did not warn guests who might have allergies, and that I could not believe that there were not rooms that are set aside for people who do not want to stay where a dog has stayed.  She said, "Well, we charge them a cleaning deposit".  My response was, "A lot of good that does us right now."I next asked them to find us a room at a sister property, and she claimed that all king or queen-sized rooms were booked.  So, we had to get on the Hilton site and find a room 10 miles away from this hotel where my husband had to work the next two days.I just went in to see him at the hotel conference room here, and they have done a good job of trying to mask the kennel smell by spraying disinfectant or room deodorizer everywhere, but you can still get a whiff of the tell-tale sign of dogs.Rest assured that if you stay in a room at this hotel, it is a room that a dog has stayed in, too.We stayed here for a recent wedding and reception we attended.  It seemed like a good value for what we paid (group price).  Plus, we got the "Club Level" that included free breakfast and a place to hang at happy hour with free apps (alcohol not included).  Visited the pool and it wasn't too full of kids, a nice place to retreat for a few hours.  The staff seemed friendly and rooms were clean.  Reception food was very good, a higher quality than many other hotel receptions I've attended.  Much more updated inside than it looks outside.  I'd stay here again!This hotel is ridiculous... the short description: when you stay here, you're paying for the name of a Sheraton and the 'cleanliness' (which you would receive at most other hotels in the area).Here's the breakdown:1. Water was turned off at 9am until 3:30pm due to "construction"2. Hammering and drilling started at 8 in the morning (not considerate). Other hotels that have undergone construction while I was staying there at least waited until 10am to begin. This Sheraton's decision to start so early is just a further sign of disrespect to the customer.3. No free breakfast. Just because we spent the money at the Sheraton, do they expect that we LIKE to spend money? Free breakfast is the norm... Sheraton needs to get on the ball4. Staff was irrespective to requests for blankets... it took more than an hour at night to get the blankets, and by that time i was was asleep.5. No free wifi in the rooms. WHAT? are you kidding me? I have to pay for wifi? It's almost as if I got in a time machine and went back to when wi-fi was a new technology reserved for rich people.6. They have the USA today in the lobby (a good thing)... but I can get the USA today in my room if I had an internet connectionI will never stay here again. save yourself the time, empty stomach, lack of attention, and lack of internet connect.Phenomenal hotel, great staff, wonderful facilities.If you reserve, get a room on club level and make sure you take advantage of the club lounge - cheaper drinks than the hotel bar from 5-8pm weeknights!My only complaint would have to be the hotel bartenders... the only one that's really worth the visit is Ryan - the rest are mediocre at best.My new wife and I stayed here the night of our wedding before we left for a Napa, CA honeymoon. The room was perfect and the service was excellent. I wanted to take our luggage to the hotel in morning (before check-in) so we wouldn't have to worry about it that night, and even though the room wasn't ready yet, they held the luggage and let me partially check-in. When we got there, the luggage was in our (apparently very nicely upgraded) room and check-in was super easy. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this place.It's fine for what it is - a Category 2 Starwoods property.  As long as you temper your expectations and realize this is no Taj Mahal it should be fine.  It sits in the middle of a complex with a bunch of restaurant options and has a small lake which makes for a nice little run in the morning.  If you do go on that run around the lake -- Beware of the geese!!I am suprised that i am first person rating this place. However, that is not why i am writing this. I love, love, love this place. I have been here several times in the past few years and have been pleased by both the hotel and the services for other things.I should specify this by saying that i have been here for a few conventions (gaming) and a wedding.Hotel:-The staff were helpful and nice when we needed something for the room.-The rooms were clean, nice and the beds heavenly. I love beds high off the ground, and nice and clean.-Bathrooms were nice, and every time we needed something they were they quickly.-The restaurant and bar onsite were well stocked and drinks and food delicious. Espically the breakfast buffet! yummy!The grounds itself:-Very well maintained, and kept clean.-plenty of outside places to sit.Facilities:-The ballrooms are very beautiful and so nice for both weddings and meetings, or conventions.-Plenty of space to spread out, espically with conventions because you always need a room for meetings, or a party at night. Space is good with more than 500 people comming to do things.-The lobby is wide and spacious and plenty of comfortable places to sit (i loved the little alcoves near some of the windows with window seats!)-i was impressed with how they had weddings, or more to the fact that it was seamless from the wedding, to a cocktail hour and then the reception itself. The grand ballroom was simply beautiful!Good times, Good times.Everything in the room is clean and "moderately" up to date. The rooms are, however, not very sound proof - my neighbors have taken many showers... The plumbing is pretty loud. Definitely nothing too disturbing. My biggest complaint would be the lack of free WiFi. They are asking $10 for 24 hours of WiFi. I feel like at this point, WiFi should be a free hotel amenity... Especially since this hotel doesn't offer a lot. Also, the door to the staircase is broken so it slams shut rather than slowly shutting like most doors. This is very loud at night. In addition to the door, the hotel attracts many families with kids. Every night and every morning kids ran down the halls - which is loud enough - but then if we were lucky, they slammed the door. On a more positive note, the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and you could make the room very cold if you liked. There are also a lot of food choices right outside the hotel and there is only a 15 min drive to a couple of malls. For the price, the hotel was fine.Want to escape to a cottage on the lake complete with ducks and geese? That is also in the midst of a hip plaza with lots of bars? Well, then this is the hotel for you when in St. Louis. I was in a ground room floor within sight of the pool and it was perfect!! It was a patio, just like home, that was surrounded by a lake with a fountain complete with wildlife. Westport is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel which houses all the eating and drinking imaginable. Just a real, fun great place to stay. Oh, might want to book ahead though. They get busy. The weekend I stayed there, Friday night was an Irish step dancing contest in the banquets and Saturday they were hosting the wheelchair basketball tournament. Provided quite the fodder for my group!!
review_content_40: Smallest bathroom Ive ever seen in a $180 a night room.  Saving grace is all the restaurants and stuff around the hotel

review_content: I stayed at Hilton at the Arch October 13th thru October 19th. I am writing this to give special acknowledgement to everyone in this hotel especially Mark Sugars the assistant general manager. I  myself am in the hotel industry and work for a Waldorf-Astoria property in Phoenix. We are part of Hilton and receive a generous employee discount at other properties. When I was looking to book my trip there were several days of my stay that were unavailable under my employee rate. I called the property and was helped by Mark. Mark was able to extend my stay during what was a very busy time in Stl since there was the rock and roll marathon and postseason baseball in downtown. His quick response and generosity was above and beyond what I expected. This was very important to me because it allowed me to extend my trip to visit my hometown, family, friends, and i was in the 1/2 marathon. What he did really changed my trip overall by allowing me extra nights. I got the pleasure to meet him in person on my arrival and he was just as courteous as he was on the phone.Everybody I encountered during my 6 nights was more then pleasant. Valet, bellman, housekeeping, bartenders and front desk consistently always acknowledged my presence. One late afternoon I went down for a margarita at the bar. Not knowing it wasn't open until 4 p.m. I asked the front desk where to go. Instead of telling me it would be open at 4 they made a phone call and gentleman came to the bar and made my drinks before they opened. Now that is service!I know what the service standard requirements are for Hilton and this property far surpassed all the other ones I've stayed at. The lobby is beautiful and immaculate. The gym was very clean and had everything I needed. My room was beautifully updated and very comfortable. The location really cant be beat.. especially if you're a baseball fan. Im counting down my days until my next visit home and this will absolutely be my first pick to stay at. So, thank you Hilton at the arch! Thank you to all the service staff for always being on point. And again, thank you Mark you truly made a difference.               AdrienneAs a Hilton honors member I like to stay consistent with my hotel selections during work travel in order to acquire points. This hotel is satisfactory but nothing amazing. I arrived without remembering to bring my travel toothbrush and toothpaste kit. The clerk informed me that they are out of stock and offered no resolution. I had to go out and buy my own which given the location, isn't the easiest to find in this area. This happened when St Louis was particularly cold and rainy so I wasn't happy about this.The rooms are not outfitted with microwaves and the entire hotel shares a single microwave located in the hotel store on the ground floor. The rooms do have a personal fridge which is nice but doesn't make sense to me given that there is no personal microwave. The rooms also do not have a hairdryer, I don't typically use one so this wasn't a problem for me but I imagine would be irritating for others coming out of the shower to realize this. You may be able to ask for one but I did not.The rooms are clean and slightly above average but the halls look dated and smell stale. The entrance is impressive but after that everything is about standard.It's the people that make this place special. I stayed here the night before my wedding and I couldn't be happier with how I was treated from check in to the check out Mark (front entrance Valet/Bellman/Superman) was extremely helpful and I would come back and stay here anytimeArrived to find a sign outside saying valet parking full, with directions to their garage.  Greeted by the valet who asked if I was on their list for valet parking.  He stated I wasn't on their list and refused to take my car.  I have a fundamental issue with a hotel that lacks enough valet parking for all of their anticipated guests.  Look, I don't care if you have to shuttle valets to another location, a hotel offering a valet service should never have to turn a guest away. At the front desk I asked for a room with a king bed.  The front desk agent was adamant that the hotel was sold out and a king bed would not be available for upgrade.When asked if I was parking a car, I explained me situation with the valet, and how poorly he handled himself.  I explained how inappropriate his behavior was, and that no hotel guest should ever be treated with such disregard.The front desk agent asked how she could help.  She suggested two beverage coupons--I don't drink.  She suggested free breakfast--I'd be at work before they even open the restaurant.  Then she suggested a room upgrade.So the same hotel that was sold out, suddenly has rooms available for upgrade.  Not just one, but three different king rooms to choose from.Not only did they insult me, but then they lied to me.As it turns out I returned my rental car to the airport and took a taxi to the hotel.I return to find my room completely dark and extremely hot.  The least they could do is leave on a night light when you check into the room.  As for the temperature the hotel has been kind enough to lock out VIP mode from their Inncom thermostat.  For the guest that means the room won't completely cool to the temperature they want, and the fan won't go to any level above low.  Pure misery in a town that routinely has 90o summer days.The sad part is I've had previous stays at this location that were decent, hope this isn't a downward trend.My boyfriend and I chose this hotel based on its close proximity to the Arch and Busch Stadium. There is another Hilton property closer to the stadium but this one had so much character! The building itself is historic and used to be a bank, so they had actually converted the bank vault into a small gift shop and business center. The decor is modern yet still had it's historic downtown charm. Our first night there, a storm had hit the city so we were stuck inside and decided to have dinner at the hotel bar. The food was delicious and service was decent. We also made use of the jacuzzi spa which was very relaxing after a long day of traveling. The room itself was small but cozy. My only complaint regarding the room was that the door was incredibly hard to open. It seemed as though the hotel had been renovated recently so perhaps new paint made it sticky or it could've been due to humidity. I had to have my boyfriend open it every time we got back to the room. The furniture in the room was in excellent condition. The bathroom is really small but for 2 people, it was fine. I also want to make note that the self parking was great (parking structure across the street). We were provided a key card that opened the door to the structure, so we felt safe going in and out. It was easy and convenient. Overall, we love this property and hope to be back again in a couple of years!Very cool looking place. stayed there for a week. Lobby employees are great. Unfortunately the room cleaning are horrible. They took money from me. I stepped on on earing from the last person that stayed in my room and it went into my foot. They never replaced my dirty towels. And also ate food out of my fridge. The manager just tells me action are being taken but nothing ever happened. I will never stay at a Hilton in my life and thanks for ruining my st Louis stay. The Hilton really made it the worst vacation I ever took.Ideal location, right downtown. There's a larger, cookie cutter Hilton closer to Busch Stadium but this has old school character and charm. We had a large corner room with a view of the Arch and it was perfect. The self-parking lot is in the building across the street. You'll get a key card which will allow you to come and go as you please...there are signs everywhere reminding you to have your key card with you at all times. The price though, being downtown, was a hefty $19+tax/night. Yikes! Easy check-in and easy check-out. Just what I like!The hotel room gets a four stars but the restaurant and bar gets -3 stars. Less than desirable food which was very slow coming out of the kitchen and extremely slow service. The bar is not any better waiting for the bartender to turn around and acknowledge we are there and then can't make the drinks requested because they are out of the mixes. We tried to print tickets at the office and the computer don't work. This was the worst experience I have ever had at a Hilton. So disappointing. They did print our tickets for us at the front desk but I had to give them my usernames and password. I'm changing that now!!!Stayed here the weekend before Thanksgiving 2015. Nice hotel. Clean, decent size, nice view of the arch. Close to a lot of activities and lots of great places to eat. We even forgot some of our luggage when we checked out and the hotel mailed it home to us at no charge. We would defiantly stay here again.Thought we were staying at the other Hilton by the ball park. Booked two days.Arrived around 5pm on a Sunday, waited about 20 minutes for valet to make an appearance. Got checked in. Yes, we are diamond members, yes that makes us have higher expectations.   The room was just okay. The air conditioner sounds like a loud truck is running. We were on the second floor with a view of the alley and building across the street. The sound proofing is non existent, we were woken up a few times by other people staying on our floor. The extra blanket in the closet, was dirty. Staff seemed neither particularly accommodating nor knowledgeable about customer service. There is no club level at this hotel, big drawback.My biggest pet peeve, is when house keeping knockoffs on the door when the DO NOT DISTURB sign is on the door. Can anyone explain this to me? The best part of the stay has been Shonda at the Starbucks bar. The gym/jacuzzi is clean. Next time we will make sure we pick the right Hilton as their level of service is on point.Stayed at this hotel last month for a business meeting, and it was a really nice experience.  Room was comfortable, a little small, but I've stayed in much smaller rooms, so it was manageable.  It had the feel of a boutique hotel, which I really liked.. Comfy bed, nice shower, good blow dryer, free wi-fi, and decent meeting room.Service was good - the person who checked me in seemed a little preoccupied, but other than that, it was good. The location is really good if you want to stay downtown. Also, they have a small Starbucks in the bar area of the lobby, but if you want a real Starbucks, there's one a few blocks away.Clean safe.everything that the HILTON Ballpark location isn't. do yourself a favor and stay here and save the your money!!! Staff is great!I haven't been here in years, but they did a nice job remodeling the rooms. I'm not too crazy about the 'modernization' of the lobby is just OK. I kinda like the old vintage look since this was an old bank. The older photos show the lobby. But it's a very nice hotel, everyone has been super friendly and helpful!Great hotel, nice staff, clean rooms, great local bars in walking distance, but not the safest place in town. If you go sight seeing, go during the day, but always keep your eyes open for shady characters.  Stadium is 2 blocks over, so if your headed to the game the is the perfect spot!WARNING: This place is swanky.Set 1 block form the Arch. Old world construction with a grand entry way. I believe this place used to be a bank? The business center is located inside an Old but HUGE Bank Vault (swanky).Valet only, tips are appreciated but everything else is comp'd. The views from the rooms are decent (assuming you get one facing waterside).Not to be confused with the much larger Hilton-Ballpark, this hotel has a great downtown location with nicely appointed rooms. The gym is also great.Fantastic Hotel in downtown St Louis. We live in St Louis but have tried several of the area hotels for 'date night' out on the town.The lights on the desk having built in USB ports was awesome. The TV was alright, the jetted tub in the suite we stayed in was awesome. Parking was a little bit of a problem, but was sorted out shortly after arriving. This is a great place to stay!Cons: have to pay for wifi, room is a little oddly arranged( bathroom is right next to bed),  no vent in the bathroom, housekeeping came super earlyNeutral: have to pay for parking, pillows on the bed Pros: beds are amazing, nice spa, great location, nice to have restaurant and bar inside, staff super sweet,Pro's;* Nice rooms- comfortable* Nice staff , very attentive* Great breakfast- free continental and 5 dollar upgrade for full* Good location- right downtown* We got free drink tickets every day* Angel at the front desk(really helpful and positive)- Rae at the bar(fast, attentive, friendly)Cons;* Loud- Our room was outside the housekeeping closet and they slam the door about 50 times between 8AM-9:30 AM. I even left them a nice note asking them to be more considerate, this just made them slam the door louder.* Lobby- We tried to have a meeting in the lobby (on a Wednesday morning we were pretty much the only ones down there) and they had 80's rock on volume 10! My wife asked the manager (guy with a red beard) if he could turn it down just a little and he said "he would see what he could do" - this is code for NO at that hotel. - We had to go after about 25 minutes because we could not hear each other.* Our room had a view of an alley - which on Mondays and Wednesday had a garbage truck emptying dumpsters, maybe as many as 10 from 615AM-645 AM. I think we all know what that sounds like. All and all the cons outs shine the pros for us at this hotel, so we would probably stay somewhere else next time. They get 3 stars because of the staff.Comfy room--close to everything.  Park the car and walk, for sure. SushiPizzaSteakIt's all downtown. Ballpark, river front, arch, are just a stroll away. This Hilton had a lot of vacancies, but my Gold upgrade was lacking in wow factor (just a corner room--woohoo).  Nice, clean room.  Comfy bed.
review_content_20: Love the old traditional style, especially compared to the sleek modern options nearby with the Hyatt and the Hilton at the Ballpark (though I did love the rooftop bar at the other Hilton)...it was a cheaper option as well. This old bank building is beautiful, preserving the old safe in the lobby (it's a gift shop, I think) and other features. Rooms are somewhat featureless, other than the high ceilings and old timey style light fixture. The bathroom I had in my king room was a little on the small side, but suitable. Modern conveniences like the flatscreen TV and free wifi made it a very comfortable and productive stay. The elevators, though non-airconditioned and stuffy, were pretty fast- I never had to wait too long for one. My room was located next to the service elevator though...some extraneous chatter noise from the hotel staff in the hallways were a constant, but luckily, the elevator noise wasn't too bad. Very happy with my stay- it was very convenient to the Gateway Arch park a couple blocks away, to the convention center where I was going for work, area restaurants on Washington Ave, and to the ballpark area (to the other Hilton, with the rooftop bar). For breakfast & lunch, I went to Monty's Sandwich right next door, and to Starbucks at the Hyatt. Check-in and check-out was a breeze, and the front desk staff was very accommodating.Stay here if you like:History, Architecture (converted bank), Convenience to Gateway Arch & Washington Ave, business (free wifi).Do not stay here if you like:Modern styles, Rooftop bars, pools, Starbucks (none on site, but within walking distance to 2 close by).This is a great location if you are visiting St. Louis and don't have a car. It is close to the Metro link, which runs from the airport. The Arch, Old Capital and baseball park are all within a very easy walk. The lady at the front desk that checked us in (Angel) did a great job. Our room was not ready, however, she took our mobile number and called us when the room was ready. She made arrangements to store our luggage and sent us on our way with good directions. The rooms are a nice size, clean and well decorated with flat screen TV, coffee maker and refrigerator in the room. Ask for a higher level room, and if you are lucky, you will get a room with a view of most of the Arch. After saying all those good things, I must register one major and one minor complaint. The minor issue was the bar tender. We got a drink one night (would have had more),and the guy acted like it was a tremendous chore to walk down to our end of the bar to take our order. Then he brings my wife a beer without a glass, and doesn't ask if she would like one. He does bring one after she asks. All the while, he is talking to another lady (maybe he was trying to set something up for later), ignoring us. He never comes back to check on us, never asks if we want another drink or anything else. Does not bring a bill, we just leave the money for the drinks and walk away. Needless to say, the rest of our drinking was done elsewhere. The other issue is that in 2015, it is just expected that you stay connected to you social media, even when you travel. The WiFi service in the room was absolutely terrible. It would connect for a minute or two and then go out. Then repeat the same action. Oh, it worked fine the lobby, but in the room, forget about it. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.My Husband and I chose this hotel for our 1 year anniversary. Saint Louis has always been our romantic getaway and Hilton gave us just that. We stayed over Mardi Gras weekend and never once felt like we were in party town. We arrived Friday evening and was immediately greeted by Mark ( who parked our car valet) and Alex the lovely lady at the desk. We had the Romance package and received a complimentary breakfast and two free drinks at the bar. They made us feel like family coming to stay the weekend!When we entered our room, it was NOTHING like what it used to look like. It is a historical bank building with a upscale modern touch. Our room looked brand new. We stayed in the room with a jetted tub and it was fantastic. The water pressure was wonderful and the tub is definitely big enough for two. There is also a standing shower in there as well. Cleaning-wise everything was spotless! We do a lot of traveling and we always inspect our room top to bottom when we arrive and this passed with A ++!The room was a good size and the drawers and a closet for our clothes. We had a side chair and desk where we set up our things. We were also greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and champagne! The bed was a queen and very comfortable to sleep on as well. We stayed a total of three nights and would absolutely recommend the Hilton downtown to anybody coming to stay. We walked to many restruants/bars etc and its also a 10 minute cab to the Soulard area where the Mardi Gras events happen. We never waited for a cab because Mark always made sure, when we were ready, he flagged one down so we weren't standing in the show! The only Con that seemed a downside is where this Hiton is downtown and doesn't have good views in there jetted tub rooms. It didn't bother us a bit though because we were out exploring STL anyway! The staff continously, throughout the whole weekend, told us happy anniversary, which felt so personal to me. Great Job!Pros: The location is really nice. Everything is a short walk away. The staff is really friendly. The rooms are kept well. The lobby in the rooms have a modern look.Cons: parking and breakfast is a little pricey unless you get a package. If you are here on business, you can do about the bare minimum with the Wi-Fi that is here. Don't even think about trying to stream TV shows or movies. You don't even have the option to pay for premium Internet bandwidth.No customer service at all. I'm a Hilton guy and this place has no respect for customer care. Definitely not staying here againWe really enjoyed this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby sparkled. The world outside was covered in snow and just murky, but once we walked through the doors, everything was bright and polished. I immediately noticed the large vault doors beyond the reception desk and the bellhop actually told us a little about the building and how it used to be a bank as he took us to our room. Our room was spotless and mostly comfortable. The bed was really lumpy. I realize that doesn't matter to everyone, but it bothered me. Once I fell asleep, I was fine, but it was hard to get comfortable. The bathroom was very clean, but I kept finding long black hairs folded into the towels and, even though I wasn't actually worried about the cleanliness of the towels, there was just something about finding a foreign hair on my towel. And it wasn't just one hair or one towel, it was multiple hairs on every bath towel. Maybe I'm weird. Maybe it's not even worth mentioning. I don't know.The parking was easy and convenient. It's a little pricey, in my opinion, but I guess that's because we're used to parking for free. We had a key card provided by the hotel that gave us in/out privileges for the length of our stay. The garage was right across the street, so we didn't have to go far. It was a little scary (to me) late at night, but we could've used the valet service and we didn't, so obviously we were willing to take our chances. This would have been a five star rating if not for the lumpy bed and stray hairs. That being said, I would absolutely stay here again...and maybe ask for hairless towels.This was a very nice hotel. Clean, comfortable, courteous staff, great location. So, why the low rating? Price. I'm sorry but paying almost $300 for a place to sleep for the night is ridiculous. Apparently I'm not some jet-setter, travel-savvy, bon vivant. Just a retiree who wanted to see a hockey game. If you have such money to throw around, this is a nice place to stay. Otherwise, it's a lot to spend just for a place to lay your head.I honestly can't speak highly enough of this place. I recently coordinated a work training that required about 40 guest rooms and a meeting space large enough to house this many folks for 3 days. We settled on this hotel because they worked with us on getting our AV costs to line up with our budget. I received an upgrade to a nice corner room (no real view, but great room) that was complete with a little dining room table. My bed was incredibly comfortable and the housekeepers kept the room immaculate. My only issue here was the housekeeper on day one didn't restock my shampoo and conditioner, and as a former housekeeper, I think that's a pretty standard thing to do. But when I asked for more conditioner she gave me 3 bottles, so that more than made up for my minor issue.The conference room we had was large, with floor to ceiling windows and chandeliers. It was absolutely gorgeous and they set it up exactly to our requirements. All of the staff involved with this conference were so helpful and attentive, they really went above and beyond to make sure this went smoothly. I'd like to specifically point out Chris and Jason as two exceedingly helpful staff members.The bar at this place is great, the beer is cheap and the bartenders were attentive. The restaurant in the hotel was pretty mediocre, but I only ate here once so I don't know if it just happened to be an off day or something. I would definitely go back to this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to host a conference, the staff is amazing and you will not be disappointed.PS- the hotel is about a block away from the Arch and if you go to Washington Street you can find a lot of really great restaurants.A pleasant surprise. Wasn't familiar with St. Louis so took my chances and went with Hilton. Great location 2 blocks from the arch. Rooms and hotel have a historic look but all modern amenities. Staff was great and accommodating to needs. Valet was fast and efficient and while I usually don't like paying for parking at a hotel they were upfront about it and didn't pressure me to go with valet. Room service breakfast was great but ended being pricey -- next time I'd go around the corner to Monty's instead. I was upgraded to a larger room but being on the 3rd floor there was still some street noise. Not a big deal but might bother some. All-in-all I really enjoyed my stay here!I stayed here Saturday and they billed me for parking, without my authorization. I had already paid the attendant at the garage when I left the hotel, then saw an additional $19.95 on my credit card. They never even mentioned this or told me they were taking this charge off my card!! Mind you the garage only charged me $11.00. This hotel is scamming people right out of their money. When I called I got transferred 3 times to reservations, I got placed on hold for long periods. Front Desk transferred me to Accounting which didn't answer so I had to leave a voice mail. A couple hours later I told them about the charge, accounting stated that I had no proof that I paid for parking in the garage (even though they don't even own the garage). I then had to request to be transferred to a manager, which also did not answer and I had to leave a voice mail. After finally getting another call back, I spoke with the Manager who simply said he would refund my money and speak with the accounting. After everything I went through he didn't seem to care one bit or say anything else. He did NOT even comment on how the charge was never mentioned and just thrown on the bill, and didn't mention how they overcharge for parking and scam the customers. Completely unsatisfied and will NEVER stay at this Hilton location again. Wasted my entire day playing phone tag.If you choose to stay here check with the parking garage for the price and don't let the hotel know you parked in their unless you want to pay double!The east tower elevators are to small and slow. You can wait upto 10 mins for a ride. I often just walked up 10 flights of stairs. Even in off times, the elevators struggle with the cleaning staff using the guest elevators. The rooms feel worn with too many parties. My door was busted in the lower right corner. I couldn't tell if it was physical damage or water damage. In the bathroom, the hotel didn't install fan. It makes it tough for shaving after a shower. It does have a good location but I would recommend only fit people would enjoy the advantages of location and can walk stairs.The room automatic heating is twitchy. The thermostat seems to auto reset to 70 degree, and the windows are not double pane. The heating fan is off sync and very loud. The room is a little cold in the winter.
