I called the Marriott St. Louis Airport and they were happy to match the rate.Crown Plaze customer service SucksThe seventh floor of this hotel smells like a black and mild cigar factory, it is non smoking mind you. An alarm near the swimming pool went off for nearly an hour at 4AM... so much for getting any sleep.  The TGI Friday in this hotel is the worst restaurant I have ever eaten at and the staff there are completely useless,  although I doubt the hotel has anything to do with that. The Hotel feels old and dirty. I would have rather slept in my car and saved $130.
review_content_20: The good: +Very friendly staff +Given blankets our second night since roll in beds were taken +very clean hotel rooms and fitness center +Located close to the airport+Complimentary shuttle with experienced and professional drivers The bad:-Charged for self parking. $10 a night automatically added to your room fees. -Hotel was overbooked and took 20 minutes to find us a "locked room"-All the roll in beds were taken our first night and second night. -Breakfast was not complimentary -No fan in the restroomA beat up crown.Crowne Plaza in St Louis airport is rated 4+ stars; not sure how they got there, but that sounds quite fishy to me. From the outside, the architecture may be attractive to some.As you get in, the lobby opens up into an atrium. As you walk further, you notice the pool on the left,the restaurant on the right and conference rooms straight ahead. Not surprisingly, their homepage emphasizes that aspect of the hotel. The devil is in the details as it is commonly said. Beyond the lobby lies a beat-up, old 3-star hotel, with dirty carpets, cheap 1 star shampoo, conditioner and cream; the cheapest toilet paper I have seen for a hotel of that category. A staff that is all too willing to charge you for anything or nothing. Don't even think about taking your breakfast back to your room without paying room service. The quality of their delicatessen is cheaper than what you can get a local grocery store (schnucks) right around the corner... The carpet is so dirty that my feet turned dark grey after walking bare-footed for one hour in the room. I stayed in a suite; so you would think for that price ($200 to $500/night off season), I would get something decent. Suites are usually equipped with a microwave, kitchenette, bathrobes, decent coffee, water bottles, but they did not have any of that.. There was a tiny fridge and coffee machine that was propably as old as the building. It's was least 20-30 old technology. Did I mention their 56 kbps internet connection? Got any work to do using a VPN? Forget it. You might as well go back to the airport or go to a local coffee shop.When the central heating or air conditioning kicks in, you get that buzzing sound all night. Outside, there is no where to walk. I could not get a decent coffee either at their restaurant (if you can call it that. It is dressed up like a restaurant, but it is in fact a cheap cafetaria). Taking the stairs is always revealing and a good gauge of the management operating the building. I encourage you to go up and down the stairs. If you like their stairwell, you'll probably enjoy their rooms. They crowned themselves with a 4.3/5 rating on their website claiming that the reviews come from REAL GUESTS. How suspicious is this? It is really laughable. There are probably enough hungry people out there willing to get a perk for writing the 5 star non-sense.We had a very good stay. Cool room overlooking the atrium and indoor pool, but little noise and no chlorine smell. Room service is pricey, but there were many convenience restaurants nearby (we got room service anyway, since it's fun!) All the staff I encountered were cheerful and welcoming.Staff was friendly and even haver free buffet breakfast and bumped me up to the lounge level. The hotel may need a little updating, but the rooms were quite nice with modern LG televisions and the beds were comfortable. The windows only had sheer curtains though and highway noise was audible. WiFi was pretty quick and I even watched a standard definition movie over it.Julia Rosen at front desk had a big attitude. I stood there in front of her and she still chose to answer three phone calls, one of which was to make a reservation for April. That's a month away! And i am standing right in front of you, patron! trying to check-in to my room!!! Why would you prioritize answering the phone? Finally when she decided she had the time to check me in she gave me a roll of the eyes. Not a good first impression of The Crowne Plaza MO. David the custodian/handyman was very friendly though! He saw me standing there, he came to change a lightbulb and asked if i had been helped and if there was any way he could help me. Very sweet older gentleman.No dogs allowed.Room was comfortable, as was bed.Television was old school, round from the 90s. HBO was a plus.Shower pressure and temperature was great.Plenty of free parking though it gets full come evening and then it's tough to find a spot near an entrance to the hotel (might have to walk a bit).TGIF restaurant inside hotel (if you like overpriced American fast food).Minutes from the airport.On-call shuttle whenever you need it.I am glad we were forced to switch Crowne Plaza hotels midway through our trip, from the Clayton hotel to this one. This hotel was so modern, clean, and spacious, we were super impressed! First of all, the place is massive. There is a huge glass ceiling that makes the whole lobby, conference, pool, and restaurant area feel like it's a big atrium. It's neat to have the natural light andThis place is NOT for a weary traveller!  You cannot even get a nap during the day due to the noise created by kids in the indoor pool!The staff is uncaring and not professional!  If you try to park a large vehicle such as a bus the parking lot is NOT too good at all!Of all hotels I have stayed at I would rate this one at the bottom of the scale.The Crowne does it again! You may have seen my review on the Crowne Plaza near Cleveland or you may have not.  But rest assured (in a fantastic bed) that I had an outstanding stay in both! The entire staff was extremely friendly, very eager to please, and showed a true dedication to their job and hotel guests. They offer a complimentary shuttle that will take you anywhere within a reasonable distance - I used this benefit several times and really enjoyed my friendly conversations with each of the drivers. The housekeeping staff did a great job as well. Conveniently, there is a TGIFridays attached to the hotel that did a outstanding job as well. My server each night, Natalie, was accurate, friendly, and extremely attentive.  As a result of the consistency between all of my stays at multiple Crowne Plazas, and my recent disappointments with other chains, I will be making them my first choice going forward. Additionally, this location is in the process of renovating rooms so it can only get better. And no, the renovations didn't bother me at all. No sounds, no mess, no nothing except the end of a hallway blocked off which wasn't a inconvenience at all. Again, outstanding.My husband and I stayed here for a little reunion for his side of the family in January 2010. What a nice hotel! The lobby and common areas are gorgeous, and the rooms were nice, but a little outdated. I see from other reviews that they're updating the rooms, so that will be a plus. The beds were pretty comfortable. The pool and hot tub were great...indoors, as obviously we would NOT be swimming in Missouri in the middle of winter.We loved having the TGI Friday's there in the hotel...we met a friend for drinks one night, and our bartender was very friendly. We ate with his family two nights in a row since there was snow and ice...we didn't feel like leaving the hotel. It was very convenient, the food was great, and our waiters were great. The breakfast from the hotel was also very good. Had a lot of fun staying here!Great customer service at the front desk.  Natalie was awesome and she made check-in super easy!  Will definitely be back!I have been coming here for about eight years in conjunction with a yearly conference. I have been an attendee as well as on the event planning team. The Crowne Plaza team is very easy to work with, from the staff with which we negotiate contracts to the staff "on the ground" when our conference was in full swing. We usually get four conference rooms all weekend, plus have a banquet on site. The rooms are perfect and the staff is very flexible. We rent outside equipment, have musical events, rearrange furniture, ask for additional tables and chairs, and require room freshen-ups between sessions. Everyone that we deal with is friendly and attends to our needs quickly. The guest room rates they give us are competitive, and the rooms are modern and clean. The only issue is getting there. We have a lot of out of town people who drive, and getting into the parking lot (particularly from northbound Lindbergh) is very tricky and often we have people call us to say that they are lost - that they can see the hotel, but can't get into it. I took off one star for that.The pool, atrium, and other room amenities are great, and our attendees love them. I highly recommend the Crowne Plaza for your next conference.Here for a conference. Reasonably clean, close to the airport. Food for our event was great. Meeting areas were nice and roomy. Overall good place,  The room rates for people staying for the conference were very good.We stayed here over the T-giving weekend and we felt well taken care of. The atrium with the waterfall gave the place a fresh airy feeling. The rooms are clean and the restaurants (though limited through the holiday weekend) was good. Yes this hotel is out by the airport, but we found it accessible (once you found the road entrance) for driving around St Louis to see the sites. They do have shuttle service (to the airport and nearby Metro stops). They also have a stay-n-park option for those early or late flights for locals. The front desk staff was friendly and answered all our questions about where to go and what to do.The breakfast buffet was good but not overwhelming with hot selections. it was part of our package which included breakfast each morning. I ended up stopping by Friday's every night for drinks and food and it was a typical fun Friday's with friendly bartenders and wait staff.Hall way and room smelled. Bed OK. Front desk no help. Driver rude and possibly drinking. Bathroom not cleaned and outdated. room not cleaned well. There are much better hotel near by, only use this one as a LAST RESORT!bummer I checked in late at night and u packed.  walked into, bathroom and a washcloth was hanging from shower head and hair on the sink. hope they changed the sheetsStay at this hotel at your own risk.  Unauthorized charges on my card. Didn't get any room service or any pay movies....nasty attitude in accounting when I called.  They reverse the charges or I challenge them at my bank.  Again, I strongly advise you do not stay here.I was just here for a 2-day conference. I didn't stay the night but I spent something like 16 hours in their ballroom over the past weekend.  This is a run of the mill mid-range hotel by the airport.  It was clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful, yet unobtrusive.  The conference services were decent (fresh but weak coffee and dry danish all morning, etc).  The indoor pool is inexplicably part of the lobby, which makes everything kind of smell like chlorine.  You can sit on the (indoor) patio of the TGIFriday's and watch people swim and take a dip in a hot tub about 10 feet away.  Oh, did I mention that there is a TGIFriday's in the hotel, as well as their own restaurant AND a bar?  I suppose if you're looking for a clean, reliably generic room near the airport, you could certainly do worse than this.Where do I start? Bed was uncomfortable. The air conditioner sucked. It was quiet but I had it on full blast and the room never really got cold. It wasn't warm but I like my room really cold. Room service was way overpriced. Go somewhere for breakfast. TGIF food was ok. Oh yeah the tv was from the 80's. Wi-fi was free but annoying cause you had to enter the stupid password every time you used it!!!!This is an older hotel, not really near anything. It does have a TGIFridays inside of it, but I don't know if that is good or bad. The rooms are spacious but the beds and televisions are old. The room seemed dingy and the chair in the room had stains on the fabric. There is an indoor pool but it is in a large lobby and makes the whole lobby smell like chlorine. There are better options for hotels near the airport, skip this one.TV's, carpet, room interiors and wall paper seem like they  are from 80's. Towels provided were tattered. Breakfast is not included in the room rate and was very expensive. TGI Friday was bland and below average. Only positives are proximity to airport and brings back memories from past, that is from 80's. Who wants to live in past though....
review_content_40: great hotel to stay at, check out the atrium!!!!?If you can get into the parking lot, you'll enjoy yourself. The entrance is hard to see, and you can only get to it from one side of the highway. We stayed here for a family wedding, and the room was very nice. The pool was uncrowded and our kids had fun. Nice decor, service.

review_content: Enjoyed my stay here on first floor - spacious new rooms (must have recently remodeled, can still smell fresh paint in my room). Also a short walking distance to the local schnicks supermarket, starbucks/froyo, panera, and plaza frontenac mall.Overpriced laundry, lots of rude staff - good restaurant onsite, and fairly large rooms.I really did like this hotel but some things made this place a Nikki meh. It smelled all over the hotel like someone had spilled cheap perfume. The scent was overwhelming. I did like my room, the staff, and the main restaurant which I had the breakfast buffet. If the fragrance hadn't been so strong I would have enjoyed it.I had to stay in this hotel several times because of work. This hotel is disgusting. Housekeeping and management should be replaced. Spoke with a manager and an assistant manager about housekeeping issues. Nothing was improved. My room had not been vacuumed for several days, and the 9th and last day I was there, after the two complaints, it was still not vacuumed. During one of my stays, a huge cockroach was in my room on the third floor. This is what happens when a room is not properly cleaned. One time I asked for water and these two girls knocked loudly at my door and in an arrogant manner gave me the water and walked away with an attitude.  They need to clean their utensils, plates, and coffee mugs better instead of placing them on the table with stains.  The hotel appearance from outside is nice but very misleading. TO HOTEL MANAGEMENT - please don't bother writing your comments to this post, just fix the problems you have.I don't know how a hotel can have roaches the size of my thumb and continue to be called a Hilton.I stepped on a roach.The sheets for the pullout were placed in the bag while still wet. Very unpleasant smell.The robe had red/brown stains.When I checked out and told the front desk there was a roach in my room her response was. "Ewww, have a nice day. Bye."Stayed here two nights for a friends wedding. Neat and welcoming hotel. It's one of those hotels that are older in construction but pretty much make up for it by good renovation and modernization. Since I opted for the wifi+breakfast package, I was given a room in their 3rd floor, dubbed "executive floor" since it had this amazing place called Executive Lounge. They had light breakfast, cereal, fruits, milk, sodas, coffee, all day snacks and get this, night time desserts....all included in the breakfast package! This truly enhanced the experience. Other notable points: - the gym was spacious and one of the better equipped ones that I have come across in such hotels. - there's a Panera Bread , interestingly marked St. Louis Bread right next door.- a grocery store across the road looked convenient although I didn't need anything. - free airport shuttle is a good service, but they can take their time to come and pick you. The rates were good too so I would happily stay here again or recommend it to friends.Arrived late at night,we think this must be the smallest Hilton hotel in the world?No elevator so the baggage man has to lift the baggages. The front desk man is nice and helpful, but the hotel room is so old,we can't believe this is a "Hilton".Old hotel that is under renovation.  Rooms are dated, but staff is super friendly and go out of their way to make you feel welcome!   The fitness center is great and reason enough to stay here.  The location is walking distance to lots of restaurants and shopping.  The grocery store across the street is great for a snack as well.Very charming older building.  I stayed in the executive floor. Room was nice and bed was comfortable.  Bathroom was in good shape.  Despite some users saying the construction was better and more sound proof, I beg to differ.  I had a con joining rooms in both sides and could here the rude person next door making calls at 11:30 at night.  Also heard the same individual waking up, showering, and clamering around at 4:40 in the morning.Hotel staff was very nice.  My only interaction was the check in and check out.Gym was superb.  One of the best gyms I have seen while traveling.  Brand new equipment and lots of it.Pretty good menu for brunch. They had an array of cheeses, meats and breads. Omelette stations, fresh waffles and even baked chicken arm others items to decide from. The price was a bit on the high end. 30 bucks per person for the buffet. This is a special kind of place only doe special occasions.This is an older, more run down property. Usually short-staffed, especially the restaurant. Staff occasionally displays an attitude (the wrong kind). We've stayed here about a half dozen times, but seriously looking for something better in west county. Alas, the choices are slim :(I experienced terrible service and waited 3 hours to check into my room even after check in began. Very nice appearance that makes up for the not so charming service.The price seemed right on this hotel during a holiday weekend. Overall decent place to crash after a wedding. Pros- Immediately located off the highway so getting to and from the hotel and wedding location was a breeze. - Friendly staff and prompt morning room service.- Style is a bit outdated, but the room was clean and bed was comfy. Cons- If possible, avoid getting the interior rooms with "windows" that looked out into the hallway. This style of room was noisy and you could hear people walking down the hall and talking in normal voice volumes. For a light sleeper, this would make it hard to get rest. - They need to replace their shower curtains. The one in my bathroom smelled like mildew. Ick.Had my first stay here last week for 3 nights while in town for meetings.  A few of my coworkers were grumbling about it, so I had low expectations, but honestly, there was only one hiccup in the whole process for me.  Other than that, the staff is superb, very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good every morning, and the room was big, clean, quiet, and comfortable.  I tend to like older properties.  Yes, they need some TLC, but the rooms tend to be bigger and the building overall is built more solidly and quieter.  My only issue was when I checked in, my room was stifling hot and the air conditioner showed absolutely no signs of life.  They made me wait until almost 4 to check in.  Are you telling me the maid cleaned the room when it was this hot?  I'm shocked they didn't have the A/C already on to cool it off.  I had to call the front desk because my unit wouldn't even come on.  The maintenance dude arrived about 15 minutes later and had to crawl underneath it to do something to it, and then the thermostat on the wall was working.   Soon the room was the temperature of a meat locker which is the way I like it.The A/C units are covered with a wooden cabinet to make them look nicer.  Well, when the handyman was working on mine, he must not have pushed the unit all the way back up or something because it chose about 2:30 a.m. to fall forward, hit the floor, and damn near make me wet the bed.  I'm sure the inhabitant of the room underneath mine was none too happy either.  That was not cool.But I'm a self-sufficient gal, so I slowed my heart rate, got out of bed and put the cabinet back over the unit, and shoved a chair up against it so no more of those falling off the wall shenanigans would take place.Overall I would definitely go back again.  The location is great as well with several good restaurants within walking distance, a grocery store across the street, and a mall & movie theater across the other street.Nice and comfy place to stay.  Friendly staff. Gorgeous decor in the front lobby. Close enough to downtown.  And far enough away too. If you want peace and quiet.  Easy on and off to freeway. And a nice grocery store across the streetOld. Badly in need of renovation. Very musty and smelly throughout. I am a Hilton gold member but will not stay here again. Courteous staff.Gorgeous hotel decor. It seems it was an independent hotel or manor at one point because it has too much character and unique qualities to be a typical Hilton hotel. We had a king junior suite. There was a lot of space but for some reason the bathroom was extremely small compared to the rest of the junior suite. We came here for a dear friend's event. There is a barber there but not sure of hours. The room service closed at 11pm on a Saturday night :(   They provided complimentary toiletries which was great. It had some old, broken down features but not too bad. It has a mall across from it with a Neiman Marcus and other high end shops. There is also a sort of grocery store near there across the road. It has free parking and you will not be guaranteed a room in the main hotel building and they have other buildings with other rooms in it. Free wifi in the room but not outside or in the banquet rooms. It was nice overall.Nice older style hotel in a nice area. Nice restaurants close by, with a supermarket across the street. Friendly and helpful staff. Room service is inexpensive considering it's a nice hotel. I would stay again.The hotel is so promising from the outside into the front entry way.  Once you enter this named propoerty you really really feal like you are in for a treat.  Man was I wrong.  I will say the staff was the only redeeming part of the stay.As i left the classicly decorated front desk to find my room I encountered some frayed carpet and maitnence opportunities.  This was not of real concern till I enetered my room.  What a disaster.....Good:Bed was pretty comfortableStaffBad:Hair in the shower - looked like someone shaved a chiapetA/C - did not workRips in the rugsBad weight roomOverall dirty everywhere.In my opinion this hotel needs some love and a face lift before I will go back.Loved staying here. The location (15 minutes to downtown) was great. It's a beautiful hotel and the staff was very friendly. The workout room was also very spacious with more accessories than your typical Hilton. Highly recommend.
review_content_20: This is my "go to" hotel when I visit my family in St. Louis.  I like it since it has a great location for easy access to everything, has an excellent staff, and is generally a clean, safe hotel.  I also like the beds as they sleep well.  The rooms are generally quiet and restful, the bathrooms exactly what you would expect from a Hilton property.The secret to staying here is accessing the hotel on the side where the traffic signal is - it makes for a much easier entrance and exit.  There is a food store across the street and a neat German restaurant across the street, too.I noticed that the televisions receive the high definition signals and a vast array of cable channels that will make those staying a while happy.  My Hilton Radio did not work, but I didn't really need it since I used the wireless to access my music services.  All in all, I had a great visit here and would certainly come back again.Extremely disappointed with this hotel.  Paid extra to stay a little closer to our destination and was expecting something nicer.  We ended up in their north annex which was outside of the main hotel overlooking the highway exit ramp (although room was soundproofed nicely.  The carpet was worn and stained and the annex lobby was musty smelling. Ick.  The beds were comfy though.  After staying many nights at Hampton Inns we thought the Hilton would be step up.  Oh well, we love Hampton Inns so much we will stick to those.  No free breakfasts at this place which is another minus.Short staffed, poor service and excuses in the bar/restaurant, over thirty minutes waiting for a steak that never came, very poor service for a conference hotel.Maybe  Nerium should contract somewhere else?The best thing I can say about this Hilton is LOCATION LOCATION!  Right next to  highway 40 (or is it 64?) It's on Lindbergh so if you chose not to hit the highway you could zip up and down Lindbergh to get to a lot of places. It's across the street from a grocery store and next door to Plaza Frontenac with all of its stores and eateries.The staff is very nice, check in was a breeze, the room was a nice size, and a nice pool right in front of the hotel.  That may or may not sit right with some people because anyone from Lindbergh can see you as they drive past.  There is a nice bar inside, a restaurant, and meeting and ballrooms galore if you have an event.  So why just a 3 star?It is not a very modern Hilton.  They charge for their WiFi unless you are a club member (no biggie, most hotels do that now).  The beds are nice enough but the room and the decor is so dated and old.  I had to call housekeeping as one of the glasses in our room next to the ice bucket was broken - but still sitting there with it's "protective" cap on it. WTH?Parking is a bit weird too as it is pretty much all over the grounds and there is one garage.  We had a server in the restaurant who was not too with it that day as well.  Wiped off the table with whatever was in/on that rag and it left a less than pleasant aroma.  Our breakfast included juice but we had to flag down another server to get it as ours went missing on us.  Perhaps it was just our turn to have a hotel with some problems, but it wouldn't stop me from going back and staying.  I'd just eat breakfast someplace else.First off, the staff is great, they couldn't be any better.The problem, though, is that they are working in a hotel that is straight out of 1973 or so.  The whole place kind of needs a reboot to bring it into the current century.  When you see the Hilton sign, you kind of expect a certain standard, and this place doesn't live up to that (other than the staff as mentioned.  They are first class Hilton all the way).In some ways, I kind of feel sorry for the staff because they deserve a nicer place in which to be so friendly!Location wise, it isn't really all that great but isn't all that awful.  There are some dining options nearby but if you have business downtown STL, you are probably better off at another hotel closer in.  The area of this hotel is suburban/residential for the most part...so if you are looking for Strip Mall Takeout Chinese, you are in luck.It isn't awful, if this place was a Holiday Inn or Red Roof Inn, it would be 5 stars.  But judged through the Hilton lens, it need some work.Most of the  time when I travel for work, I don't really have a choice in my accommodations, but I am always pleasantly surprised with what our travel services department comes up with.  On a recent trip to St. Louis I found myself at the Frontenac Hilton.When we pulled up to the entrance, I liked the fact that it didn't look like a conventional hotel.  The entrance had a large foyer which reminded me of an entrance to an old fashioned estate home.  There were many different hallways and rooms around the place.  I didn't find this disturbing, but more of an adventure to locate areas that I needed.  Like the bar.My room was just fine with a huge and very comfortable bed.  I sleep on a Tempur-Pedic mattress due to multiple back issues.  I was a little concerned that I would not sleep well and wake up in pain.  However, the bed was just perfect.  There was a little coffee maker in the room which provided me with a nice jolt to start my day.  The room wasn't large, but it really didn't need to be since all I was doing was sleeping, bathing, and heading out to meetings.All the folks I interacted with during my stay were polite and helpful.  The only small glitch was the surely bartender.  After checking in, I headed out to the bar area, which is quite large, and parked myself at the bar, next to an associate for a beer before we were to meet others in our group for drinks and dinner.  The bartender made a comment that, you got your name on your lapel... Yes, I was wearing a name tag since my company requested that we do.  For some reason this somewhat bothered him.  He made more than one comment about it.  It was a little awkward.  If I find myself in St. Louis again, I would  gladly stay here again.A bit dated, but truly beautiful in it's design.  Great housekeeping, a fully rennovated and excellent 24/7 gym, and conveniently located near major access points, a grocery store, and a swanky mall with movie theater.  Sure it isn't The Four Seasons, but at 1/2 the price I think the bang for the buck is on the side of the Hilton.Boo on this place!! I'm a Hilton Platinum member and they completely botched my stay. HORRIBLE!!!!The confluence of an evening event and an early morning appointment led to a stay here. The location is central, with bonus stars given for being across the street from Plaza Frontenac, with its bounty of stores and restaurants. I have stayed at a fair number of Hilton's standard properties and this location runs true to form, though it does seem that there are more ballrooms and meeting rooms lining the halls at this particular Hilton. The hotel rooms themselves are serviceable, though the windows could have benefited from some additional insulation as I could feel occasional drafts of cold air seeping through. Check-in/check-out were routine and there were no hiccups on this stay, always a plus in my book.Gorgeous entrance. Nice but not accomodating staff. That's it.I called to verify our reservation, it's there. I also ask if there is an airport shuttle. Yes. Our plane lands at 11pm and I call them for pickup. They tell me they stop running the shuttle after 11pm. I go to check in and ask for their airport shuttle to pick me up at 6 am. They tell me can't do that either, shuttle starts at 7 am. You've got to be kidding me Hilton. They tell me they have otherwise an 8 mi radius for the shuttle to take to other places. Have to go somewhere at 2pm 1 mi away, let's hope the shuttle isn't "on break" at yhat time.This am I am awoken to some wonderful conversation as the walls are that thin. You can hear every single word.Bed is soft, shower is ok, nothing extravagant. I'm not even done w my stay here and am not impressed. They probably put all the money into making that ridiculous entrance and stopped caring after they lured customers in.The place might not really deserve one star-- the staff is great and the beds are ok, and the gym is pretty good. But for the price, it is a miserable value. The hotel hasn't really had any updates in the 20 years or so since it became a Hilton.  Much of the furniture and by the looks of it, the carpet dates back to the 80's. The windows are drafty, rooms are dark, and the layout of the hotel is a mess. Hilton really needs to invest in this location if they are to get by on anything other than the location.We were able to get a room last minute because we were disappointed in the Sheraton across town.  The lobby is beautiful, front desk very friendly and helpful, and the room was nice.  We usually get room upgrades because my husband is a Hilton Honors member, but they apologized that all upgrade rooms were taken (not a problem, considering we had just booked at 9:30 that night!)The rooms were clean and very quiet, and the fitness facility was also nice.Not quite a Hilton.  This property is dated and worn.  Staff is nice enough .  First room had blood spatter on back of bathroom door, hair on the shower stall wall and a curly hair on one of the bath towels.  Front desk was kind enough to get me another room.  The rooms were both two room suites, a sitting area and a bedroom.  The sitting room was virtually unusable because the refrigerator was so loud that you couldn't talk or watch tv and the sofa was so worn out that I expected to see it on the curb with a "free sign on it".  Seriously, was unable to sit on it because the cushions and frame were so worn.  There was an upholstered chair in the sitting room, but it was so hard that it was unusable.  The desk chair was nice.  The fitness center was nice but only one of the treadmills was fully operational.  The neighborhood is nice and there is a terrific shopping center next door.I recently stayed in this hotel. What a complete let down.  Save your money and go to Best Western. You will get better service and more amenities.  This place is a complete joke and the free "executive" breakfast was so very sad.  If you want a nice place to stay near St Louis, go to the Sheratan.Compared to the standard Hilton properties (actual Hiltons, not Doubletrees, Hamptons, etc.) this place is not going to blow anyone's mind.  That being said, its a really nice property with a beautiful entrance and sort of a 'campus' feel with different buildings for ballrooms, the restaurant, etc.  The executive lounge is staffed at all times and serves booze along with the usual free drinks, breakfast, apps, and desserts.  The ladies working there were very nice and attentive during my visits.  The coffee in the lounge isn't Starbucks (unless they didn't advertise it), but its still a tasty and relatively strong brew (100x better then the stuff in the rooms). The rooms were nice and clean and it was always easy to find a parking spot (free) near the entrance of the building.  My only complaint was that the shower curtains are not waterproof, so if you have the shower head pointed towards them your entire bathroom floor will be covered with water when you get out.Otherwise, its a nice Hilton with a bit of flair and solid service.I don't live too far from this hotel so because of that reason I have never had an excuse to go in to it until recently for a school function.It is a nice hotel, presentation is nice and the staff was very attentive and whatnot to make sure our function ran smoothly.  I do have to say I wasn't too much impressed with the food they served us, esp for the price that our parents paid to have it.  It was pretty simple setting and food service wasn't spectacular.  They weren't clear on when dinner was going to be served and personally if the wait staff is supposed to serve the wine, they should be more attentive and be at the table once someone is looking at the bottle.I do have to say that from general looks of the hotel you don't realize just how big it is until you have to drive around to see the ballroom you're supposed to be in.  Then you'll see there's lots of other stuff on the grounds of the hotel as well.I would like to see other parts of the hotel...one day.From the moment I checked in the staff was condescending and sobbish.  I was hassled for refusing to give a credit card even though it was on a company paid trip.  I was then told my rewards wouldn't be honored because I didn't give them the CC.  I have never had hilton staff be so rude.  The hotel is very old and dated.  They spray the rooms with fabreeze to cover up the musty odor that is present just about everywhere.  If this hotel wasn't chosen for me for work I would never come back.I found this to be a great facility.  A little different than most Hilton properties, but I thought it was mostly a good thing!It is definitely a 'spread out' property.  My room was in a different building than the front desk, and there were several places to park (including a covered garage).  There is dining on-site, as well as an old-fashioned barbershop (I haven't needed one of these for 20+ years), but if you don't shave your own head, I guess this is pretty cool!This would definitely be a great facility for an event - wedding, conference, etc.I liked it.  Definitely different, but in a good way.I flew in for a business meeting and had a pleasant stay. The staff was warm and courteous. The room was clean and well-appointed. The room service breakfast was pretty greasy but that might just be a normal occurrence. (I prefer light healthy fare). Great value. Free WiFi. I would stay here again!I think this place's nadir was in the 80s - things need freshening and updating in the common areas.  I have not stayed here, but I will say that the grill does solid sandwiches, an afterthought at most places like this.  And, it was reasonable, and there are not many of those choices in this neck of the woods.  That bumps it up to 4 stars.
review_content_40: I stayed here for a family weekend recently and overall it's a nice hotel. There were some mix-ups with hotel rooms and the suite we were supposed to have (in order to have a private common room for the 8 of us) was given away. Meh. The rooms we did end up getting were spacious with lots of seating area. We were also out on a floor with an "Executive Suite" so basically a decent snack room for the floor. We stayed in the main building but there are several surrounding buildings which could make it annoying if you need to leave a building to get to the restaurant for breakfast. The fitness room was in one of the surrounding buildings, but a short walk from the main building. Fitness center is pretty small but has all the basics - treadmills, weights, etc. I don't see a lot of people using this though (only 2 people there on a Saturday). Parking was free which was nice since we had our own cars. However there were two events happening when we were there, so you are battling for spots with people not actually staying there. There is a grocery store and a high end shopping mall across the street. It is also right off of Interstate 64 which makes it easy to come in and out of the downtown area. Overall a decent experience.3 1/2 stars is probably a more accurate rating.  The hotel itself is nice.  The rooms were well sized and well kept.  The pool was a major plus (two kids). Location was so-so, it is about 15 minutes to downtown St. Louis and the hotel is right off Interstate 64.However, given the quality of the hotel and the reasonable price, I gave 4 stars.If you don't mind a 15-20 minute drive to most major St. Louis attractions and you want a good dollar value I would recommend it.  If you want walkability and price is not a big deal I would recommend downtown hotels.This hotel is not worthy of the Hilton name. The entire property is in desperate need of an update.I just returned from a convention at this lovely hotel.  It's a state convention with nearly 300 people in attendance. We ate in the hotel restaurants and also had food prepared and served at our breakfast, lunch, and dinner meetings.  We have yearly conventions--one in the northern part of Illinois, one central, and one in southern IL or St. Louis area.  This was the best hotel of all!  Food was fabulous! For once we had enough staff to serve us so that one table wasn't eating dessert while the table at the other side of the room was being served a salad.  Hotel rooms were clean and had comfortable beds.  Meeting rooms were set to our specifications--and when we had issues with temperature, all we had to do was mention it to one of the friendly staff readily available in the hall and it was addressed.  Whenever we passed a hotel worker in the hall or on the elevator, we were greeted with a smile and polite, "Is everything okay with your visit?"or something along those lines.  I plan to go back with my husband or friends and stay at this hotel--conveniently located across from an upscale mall.  If we choose to take Amtrak from Northern IL suburbs, we can get off at the Kirkland station and the hotel offers a shuttle to their door. I think the hotel has addressed all of the complaints that were addressed in other comments, because I saw none of them.Really old Hotel and poorly laid out...It's a little confusing to navigate at first with multiple elevators.  The rooms are averagely small, and nothing really worth mentioning.  The bar is not too bad and serve a limited menu, but poorly staff.  The restaurant closes up really early and the staff are not friendly about it at all.Rooms are clean and food was decent (i ordered the ravioli), they also helped me find a late night spot to order from on one of the nights when the kitchen had closed, which was very nice.  The hotel bartender is sweet and the prices are VERY reasonable. I also ended up having an eye infection and needed a special kind of solution, which they got for me from the gift store. I don't know what the rate normally is at this hotel, so I can't tell if it was reasonable or not--- I was here for a wedding and had a group rate. The only other thing that was a little frustrating was the gentleman at the front desk. He wasn't overtly rude but just not particularly friendly, and a bit standoffish --which is not something an east coast gal would normally complain about when visiting St. Louis. Lastly, and this is not a big deal, but the elevators were gross. Considering there is a nice fountain outside and the inside is well kept the elevators were really out of place. Regardless though, all in all a good stay and they provide a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport every hour!So, ok this is not a New York Hotel. If you're a New Yorker traveling to the Chesterfield area lower your expectations stat. The Hilton Frontenac is basically off the highway and across the street from a large strip mall. Not thrilling. The entry way has a big old chandelier hanging in it which only serves to heighten the expectation that you probably shouldn't have had from the beginning. The layout is really odd with certain areas of entrance and egress not really panning out which I learned the hard way, Frontenac style.So, the cheery front desk guy gave me my room key card and a map. He did the whole "You Are Here" circle and pen pointed the path to my room. I, being just off of a flight and having only fifteen minutes to freshen up before leaving for my meeting didn't really listen to chatty Cathy. Instead - eyes glazing over perma-grin intact - I quickly traded in what would prove to be valuable nuggets of information for the opportunity to think about how I could simply find it on my own by reading the signs once this dude stopped babbling. I'm on the second floor. That's really all I need to know. So, I thanked my kind clerk and exited stage left for the elevator first briskly passing under not only the Dynasty chandelier (I waved to Blake and Crystal) but also under a South Fork style balcony (I winked at JR and Sue Ellen) with sweeping staircase. I just don't get this place. I dragged ass into the elevator and began my assent to 2. What's this? These room numbers don't make sense? The fake fireplace with fake fire in it was burning oh so bright (not so much crackling) at one in the afternoon but my room was nowhere in sight. What's that? I think I hear someone calling my name. I look down from South Fork to see that same cheery clerk waving me back onto the elevator. I cannot get to my room from this part of the second floor. I had gotten into the wrong elevator. Drat! I was weary and weight with luggage. Geez, this is so stupid! "Sorry Mammmm!" exclaimed front desk guy. No problem, grumble, grumble. Why does it smell like dog? Grumble, grumble.I finally make it to my room way-way-way back in the hotel and it's well, ok. Pretty standard room with two beds, television, coffee and tea machine, A/C but NO mini bar. It was clean, didn't smell funny and held the promise of a quiet and comfortable nights sleep. I slept like a baby. The bed was very comfortable, as were the pillows - not too lofty, not too flat. It was freezing, however, and though the temp could have been a spoiler I just grabbed an extra down comforter off of the spare bed and got to snoozing. Turns out the working temperature gauge for the A/C was on the wall and was not the fracking foogazi on the unit. So even though I turned it down it never changed the temperature in the room. Oh well. Thank goodness for extra bedding. In the AM my bill was under the door. I had an early call so I skipped breakfast, paid my bill quickly and peaced out of the Frontenac. The staff made sure a car services was waiting out front for me to take me to work which was great.Overall, I just don't get it. This poor baby just has a severe case of the blahs.The Blahs:* Not a first choice hotel.* No personality*Staff needs a make-over (somebody dial up A. Leon Tally)*Played out balcony and chandelier*Too much concrete on the entrance*Decor is weird and needs some realization from a design teamThe Aahs: *Kind staff*Comfy bedI hope you enjoyed my review! - CB

hotel_name: Hampton Inn St. Louis-Downtown At the Gateway Arch
review_content: Ok, this begins with location, location, location. Right next to sports arenas and entertainment options, I can't imagine a better setup. Hampton Inn amenities, but in a classic downtown hotel style, which to me is the best of both worlds. Can't imagine there will be another choice for me in Downtown St. Louis!Nice clean hotel directly in the heart of downtown St. Louis. When we first arrived we were greeted very nicely our room was cleaned above 100%. The hotel is right across from a hotel/casino & plenty of eateries. I would stay @ this location once again. I was a very happy & pleased customer. I have already referred someone to this facility.Amazing location. Good price. Great amenities and top-notch customer service. Very clean. Would definitely return to this hotel again. Lots of great establishments are walkable from this location. The Metro is also nearby.Really enjoyed our stay! This is the perfect location downtown and walking distance everywhere. Check in was easy and the front desk gave us plenty of suggestions on places to eat and things to do, some of which we did. Breakfast every morning and views of the arch. No complaintsOur stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown St. Louis location was a treat. Wonderful staff, spacious rooms, plentiful amenities -- even a view of the St. Louis Arch!The staff at this particular hotel were fantastic, though the stand out was a fellow named Andrew. He was working the front desk most of our stay and provided exceptional service, great entertainment recommendations, and even talked some local history. He was able to direct us toward some great restaurants, watering holes, and night life spots. He also set us up with some complimentary credits at the nearby casino. What a guy! The recommendations were especially useful as the Hampton Inn downtown is fantastically located. We were able to walk to find most everything we wanted, and even the couple spots we needed to drive to were easy to hit as the hotel is right off the highway.With that said, the hotel is also connected to a great bar/restaurant (a convenience I always appreciate). The Tigin Irish pub offers delicious food (traditional Irish dishes, but also above-par American pub fare), Guinness on tap, and a great atmosphere; there was a group of musicians playing traditional irish music on the night of our arrival. Feel like staying in? They also offer room service.Other amenities include complimentary breakfast, a business center, large pool and hot tub, and even a 24-hr game room (I'm a sucker for pinball!).Great hotel, great room, great location, but the standout is the staff. Highly recommended.Nice place with nice rooms. It's a bit pricey but that's too be expected downtown. There are tons of great restaurants within walking distance and the view is nice. My experience with the staff has been wonderful. They are very friendly and helpful. Parking seems secure as well. Cable and wifi in the rooms!We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown St. Louis. The entire hotel was extremely clean, and the staff was very helpful. However, location is  key in a big city, and this hotel had it. The highlight of our stay was the view. We had an unobstructed vista of the St. Louis Arch, which was just blocks  from our room! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting St. Louis.Best thing about this hotel is the location.  It is old and a bit tired.  The hot tub was out of service the two nights we were there.  We left at 8:30 and returned at 1:00. Our room had not been serviced. A knock on the door a minute later and hskp asked if I really needed my room cleaned.  My grandson was trying to nap so I said "no" but we could use fresh towels.  About 4 hours later while we were out again fresh towels were delivered.  However the damp towels we had used were still in a pile on the bathroom floor.  Unless you can get a deal I would stay somewhere else.So tonight I am in the "nicest room" as they say. Not very impressed especially at $149 a night although top floor corner with a Arch view is nice. Think it's time to check out the newer properties, I'm curious if the bed frames will fit the mattresses there.This Hotel has a perfect location, we are on the 17th floor looking at the Arch. It is GOOD for the price, but needs to be updated. It is a little tired, but for the location and price EXCELLENT! You can't find a better Front Desk Staff, knowledgeable, friendly and professional!Megan and Nejra (as well as the entire Hampton Inn crew) were absolutely fantastic! Upon check-in, we were greeted with smiling faces and a warm welcome. When they found out that we were on our honeymoon, they upgraded us to an arch-view room! After that, they gave us two drink tickets to Morgan Street Brewery as well as a gift card to their hotel bar. And THEN, if that wasn't already more than enough, they knocked on our door and brought up a sweet goodie bag and sparkling wine with 2 glasses! We were blown away- they did everything they could to make sure we had a wonderful stay...and we did!The continental breakfast was the best free hotel breakfast we've ever seen- hot eggs, potatoes, plenty of fruit and pastries, cereal and yogurt. Tons of options! Lastly, the room was modern, clean and the bed was super comfy! If we could give extra stars we would!The lobby is nice, but the room was depressing as shit. The lighting and the setup of the room was so gloomy. Biggest issue with the room was the carpeting. The carpeting was so unappealing and unfortunately it was the first thing I noticed when I walked in. It seemed old and dirty. Please change the carpeting. Like, please. Like, now! Lol The comp breakfast was pretty OK, the sausage patty was kinda like Mcds breakfast sausage patty, it was good.This hotel is really close to the arch which is probably it's best amenity. It was only about a 10 minute walk. The room itself was decent but nothing special. There's an indoor pool which we didn't check out and they have free hot breakfast which was okay but we only ate it once and went out the other two mornings.If I were to visit STL again I would probably stay in a hotel a little farther west in a different neighborhood...perhaps with more restaurants, bars, and attractions within walking distance. But it was nice to see the beautiful arch every time came or went from the hotel and it wasn't a far drive, metro ride, or walk from most places we wanted to go.First of all... you can't miss it, just make your way to the arch.  It is in a place where you can easily walk to many things.  Second, the staff here have to be the friendliest bunch I have ever met.  And it wasn't just some of the staff... it was all of the staff: the front desk, the maintenance guys, and even the ladies putting breakfast out in the morning!So why only four stars... I had a super lumpy bed which made it quite uncomfortable to sleep on.  Our air conditioner seemed to cool the room a bit, but it was always sticky and muggy inside.  WiFi was a bit spotty in my room... which complicated things further because apparently I wasn't receiving cellular coverage in my room either.Otherwise, the one cup coffee brewer in our room was awesome.  The view was great and parking was fairly cheap ($14 per night... compared to some places at $45).  Breakfast was really good!  Highly recommend their French Toast Sticks!!!!  Seriously addicting.  Or you can make your own waffle.  And they have a lovely Irish Pub/Restaurant downstairs that has good food!  There is a refrigerator in the room, but I didn't realize that you could put water and things in it... I thought I would get charged for opening it... oops.  And on the table between the two beds, there was a convenient plug in with four plugs and two USB plug ins... this way you don't have to crawl behind the bed.  If you are looking for a place to stay, I would highly recommend it.Wonderful hotel, was cheerfully great as the customer of the day which came as a surprise, small gift bag of goodies was waiting for me when I arrived, location is excellent to down town, room was clean and smelled clean unlike others I've stayed at that requires a can of air spray.    Breakfast was nice and wide variety to choose from, even had a table reserved for us which was a nice surprise.   Highly recommend this hotel.Great hotel. Near the Arch, near the stadium and near the river. There is a trolley you can catch near by that takes you all over town.Great hotel........very clean, friendly staff, reasonable price. Close to the dome, Busch stadium, the Arch, and many other area attractions.I stayed here for one night during the middle of the week on my way to California. I had a great view of the arch from my room. The breakfast was free, and there was a huge room to accommodate everyone. The staff was friendly and nice. The guy at the front desk was funny and joking around with me because I was wearing a redsox 2013 World Series shirt (they beat St. Louis). The location was great, short walk to the arch and Busch stadium. The rams dome is also right next door to. One of my favorite cities I've been to and nothing to complain about during my stay.Great hotel and value!  Super friendly staff; free hot breakfast (eggs, ham, waffles, etc). Located 2 blocks from Edward Jones Dome and a short walk to Busch Stadium and the Arch. I liked that the parking ramp was very secure (parking fee was $14). Very comfortable beds and pillows. The only issue I had was that the elevators were rather slow.Great hotel, great staff, great location, parking and free breakfast. The only issue was that the elevators were a little slow. Otherwise everything you'd expect from a chain hotel. Great experience.
review_content_20: Front desk staff was very helpful with pointing us in the right direction for food. Beautiful view of the arch from the 9th floor (but you pay for it). Elevators are a little scary, and the hot tub jets didn't work at the time of my stay. Otherwise, very cozy!I'm happy to say that the Hampton Inn St.  Louis-Downtown At the Gateway Arch surpassed my hopeful expectations!  I had the opportunity to be in St. Louis for 3 days to tour the city,'especially wanting to see the Arch, but never having been there I didn't have a clue where to stay.  When I saw their website and location I thought, perfect!  Having stayed several times at the Hampton Inn-Foothill Blvd. in Salt Lake City and been very impressed, I decided this would be a good choice.  When I saw the picture of a room with a view of the Arch, the late afternoon sun brightly shining off the side and the boat sailing underneath it, I knew this was the one.  Arriving late in the evening after a sleepless  overnight 17 hr. flight with 4 rushed transfers, I was really hoping I had made the right decision to stay there.  I barely set foot in the lobby before I was cheerfully greeted by the reservations staff.  Within minutes I was checked in, and she said she had given me a room away from the elevator. When I opened the door, there was the view, exactly as pictured! I rushed over and took pictures to send to my family.  It was a great trip-the staff was friendly and helpful, the room immaculate,  and the jacuzzi and swim in the pool, also with that signature view, was so relaxing.  The breakfast, like the one in Salt Lake, was delicious. It was thoughtful, too, that there were play areas by the pool and breakfast areas for the littlest guests.  The kind housekeeper left a sweet note for me, welcoming me and wishing me a blessed day. I'm saving that note with my pictures as a heartwarming reminder of the nice staff. This was my first time booking on-line and I'm relieved that it went so smoothly. It couldn't have been better! I've recommended  it to others and hope I can return one day soon with my family so we can all share the same wonderful experience!We had a wonderful stay at the Hampton this weekend.  It was my daughter's birthday and we could not have expected more. We had a beautiful view of the arch.   Staff was incredibly helpful and kind.  Andrew C. went out of his way to make sure our stay was fabulous and my daughter's birthday was unforgettable. I will always be staying at the Hampton from now on whenever possible. Thank you Andrew and all other staff! :)Location is great, next to Arch, restaraunts, bars, football stadium, and two metrolink stations.  Room was clean, free breakfast was good, free wifi was good.  Staff was helpful.  Only slight problem is that layout of parking garage is a bit odd, some spots can't be reached.Wonderful hotel with fantastic service! My husband and I used this hotel for our wedding block. Not only was there no charge to hold 30 rooms for our guests, but when we filled those they added a few more for us. Price was very reasonable for being in the middle of downtown. I think on our wedding night our group used 1/3 of the hotel. The service was great. All the staff we encountered were welcoming and helpful, all the way down to the people cleaning rooms. We found out later that two of our guests (who don't know each other) had both requested random pictures be placed in their rooms for their arrival. One of dogs and one of a 90s tv character. Both requests were honored with a sense of humor! Can't praise the staff enough. The whole hotel was nicely decorated and spotless. Breakfast was good, pool and hot tub were nice with a great view of the arch. The arch view rooms have a full view of the arch. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to St. Louis and looking for a place near downtown, the arch, the football stadium, the convention center, or Laclede's Landing.Fantastic staff!  I stayed here recently for work, and enjoyed my nights.  The staff were personable and very professional.  Pricing was reasonable for a medium range downtown hotel.  Fitness area is a bit small but has the needed equipment, 2 treads, 2 ellipticals and an assortment of dumb bells.  Breakfast was great, good starches, and fruits.  A typical Hamptons hotel, but definitely distinguished by an excellent staff.  Kudos!LoactionLocation location.Rooms are available with a stunning view of the Arch along the river.  1 block from casino, 3 blocks to the Arch.  1 block from football dome.  3 blocks to americas center.  Free newspaper, clean rooms. Friendly staff.tight parking lot at a $12 per night kind of sucks.I noticed something new about Hampton/Hilton properties over the past week...  Everyone on the staff is friendly saying Hello, Have a good day, good morning, etc.  and when I say everyone, I mean everyone!  This hotel is older, but adequate with good amenities and a nice view of the arch.  Would recommend for a short stay.Convenient location just a short walk to the Arch, Lacledes Landing, America's Center, the Edward Jones Dome (Rams stadium) and the Lumiere Place casino.  Clean, comfortable rooms with a friendly staff.  Parking is a bit expensive at $12/day.The room was very nice and quiet.  They initially gave me a room next to the elevator.  I have had issues at other hotels with the noise from the guests entering and leaving the elevator early in the morning waking me up so I asked if they could move me to another room.  The staff was able to quickly accommodate my request.  In the morning they have a decent hot breakfast buffet: oatmeal, muffins, waffles, coffee, juice, etc.In addition to the breakfast buffet served in the basement, they have an "On the Go" breakfast available in paper bags in the lobby.  The bag included an apple, a breakfast bar, mints and a bottle of water.  They have an indoor pool, exercise room and a small arcade all on the same floor.   There is a view of the St Louis Arch from the pool area.For some reason, everytime I needed a room in downtown St. Louis, the Hampton Inn is more expensive than either of the Hilton Downtown or Hilton at the Ballpark. However, I did end up staying there on night because I wanted to get annihilated at Laclede's and didn't want to drive all the way back to Arnold. Decided I'd just stroll in and get a room but both Hilton's were booked. And by booked, I mean I am a diamond VIP and they still couldn't accomodate me. And they have moved people to other hotels for diamond VIP's if they haven't checked in yet.So I ended up getting a room at the Hampton Inn which is literally a block away for a little more money. Gotta say that the Hampton Inn is still very nice. The one here is a lot nicer than some of the other Hampton Inn's I've stayed at in the country. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. Though not as comfortable as the ones at the Hilton but I did get a very nice sleep after walking the nice girl out of my room in the early morning. The funny thing was that she was actually staying at the Hampton Inn too.You do have to pay for parking. Not sure what the price was but I do know a parking garage right across from the Hilton Downtown that is $3 for the night so I park there instead. The location of the hotel is pretty solid. It's literally a 2 minute walk to Laclede's and they have a restaurant downstairs where you can pregame hard and get some food in your stomach which is what my friends and I did that night. They got a room at the Best Western which is a little bit further from where we were partying and they did envy me not having to walk further at the end of the night. Well. They also envied the fact that I had a hot brunette around my arm too. Probably more so than them having to walk further to pass out.My boyfriend and I stayed here a few nights ago and its a very nice place. Comfy beds, friendly staff, good breakfast, fairly easy to find. All in all a pretty nice place! Our only issue is that they charge for parking, $14. Which we later found out was really steep. Now maybe other times of year its harder to park but we saw all day parking for $5-$10 all over the city. We felt a little jipped.GREAT location! A reasonable price at that. Close to both stadiums, arch, and downtown life. Comfy beds, good complimentary breakfast, and responsive maintenance when we had an issue with our shower.Great Hotel!  My family stayed here on the way to take our daughter to college, I flew in and drove back home with my husband.  He wanted to stay here on the way home as well.  I see why...the staff was super friendly, the bed was wonderful, the dining options were plentiful and within walking distance.  The view of the Arch from our room was fantastic, and we also enjoyed the walk to and around the Arch and the view of the downtown skyline.  We would stay here again!I am a Hilton Honors member and I usually like what I get at Hampton inns, but this was an exception. The facility was fine and the staff at check - in were nice. However , as a HH member I request a room on a high floor far away from the elevator. I got the first floor  next to the elevator. I realize that sometimes they can't accommodate the preferences. But, at 5:00 am I heard the treadmill running and the runners pounding on the treadmill. My room was also right next to workout room.  I told the woman when I checked out and she barely apologized. So, don't stay in Room 508 and you should be just fine.I was extremely impressed with this location! We arrived early in the morning and the staff found us a room way before check in time! The rooms are clean, the breakfast is very satisfying and the attractions are close by! The staff was very knowledgeable was very friendly and able to answer any question I had. The staff also set up transportation for a ride to the airport...again very professional and all went soothly!I look forward to coming back to St. Louis...would stay here again and again! Loved the Irish Pub on location as well!The hotel is located in an ideal location downtown, by the arch, close to several great restaurants/bars, right off the 70. The breakfast is great (love the waffles!). The staff are entertaining and accommodating. The downsides are that it feels like an older hotel, the elevators are slow, and while the parking feels secure, there are not enough parking spots and the spots are tight.With the exception of the parking (which was paid..$12 for the night and in a very, very small parking lot) this hotel was top-notch. I'm actually use to way, WAY, way crappier hotels/motels being as most of the time I'm just passing through a city on the way to one coast or the other. This one was great though, it was impeccably clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and there was plenty of room for us to just chill. And best of all you cannot beat the location. We walked the the Gateway Arch in less than 5 minutes and the football stadium was right outside our window!I feel tat 4 stars was a bit high. Just spent the weekend there. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. However, one morning there was no hot water and on another day the housekeeping showed up around 6:30pm after we had been out all day. It wasn't a bad stay, just not my greatest experience with hotel stays.Very nice Hampton.  Best hotel in St Louis for the price.  Complimentary parking and Internet.  Very close to restaurants, casino, Arch and ballpark.We wanted a room with a view of the Arch & we got it! The room was clean & the service was friendly to boot :) Nice location with the arch, shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Bars are not close enough to cause pandemonium near the hotel, but close enough so that your cab ride home won't cost you an arm and a leg. Those appendages are important :) Overall good experience!
review_content_40: First things first: this is a great value, and a great location. We came here for the AMA Supercross race at the Edward Jones Dome. Forty thousand people, downtown STL.  Parking is $14/a day - cheaper than any "event" parking. We were at most two blocks away from the Dome. So - no end-of-event insanity driving to the western suburbs, a close and quiet room, nicely appointed, wifi included, free coffee around the clock. Front desk staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly - given the fact that they were at 100% occupancy, that was very good. Yes, the rate was high - but with our AAA discount, it was only about $50 more than Red Roof was, and we saved $10 on parking! We didn't get to use the pool, and we slept through the complimentary breakfast, so can't comment on that. But the beds were great, the water pressure in the showers (a real bugaboo for me) was good, the sheets and linens were above average, the view of the Arch was wonderful, and everything was spotless. We were pre-checked-out, receipt delivered to our room overnight. If a hotel can deliver that on maximum-capacity weekends, we'll be back, for sure.The first room I was given was already being occupied.  The person was not there, but all of their stuff was, including a laptop I could see on the bed.  Luckily for that person, I am not a thief.  THAT SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN!  Train your hotel staff to do a better job!!!! NOT SECURE!!!!!  Room:  The (2nd) room was quite large. The bathroom was huge.  Everything was pretty clean.Noise: I was on the 15th floor, however the traffic below was LOUD LOUD LOUD LOUD LOUD LOUDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD.  Unless you are deaf, you likely won't get a good night's sleep at this hotel.Location:  It is downtown, near all the attractions.With the noise and the security concerns, I won't be staying here again nor can I recommend it to others.After a string of iffy hotel stays on this trip, I availed myself of the wifi at the rest stop and pegged this place as where we'd stay for our day in St Louis - and so glad I did. Great location (walk to the Arch), *great* pool, friendly staff, very decent hot breakfast bar (compris), clean, cushy room with an Arch view, comfy beds and extra pillows. Very happy me.Clean and close to dome with free breakfast.This hotel is in a great location, everyone was helpful and friendly.  It was super clean, smelled nice and had free breakfast.  Not to mention a warm pool and hot tub.  I would highly recommend!Awesome hotel! Friendly staff, free breakfast, clean hotel, plenty of parking and nice business center. It is not as old looking as the Drury hotel nearby that I have used. Can't wait to go back!Solid location, perfect for losing your shirt on the casino and stumbling home in a drunken stupor or dancing your face off at a nearby bar.Rooms are nice, nothing special.  Incredible toilet flushing power...if you are the kind of person that needs that.Some rooms have a nice view of the Arch, which is great for about two seconds, then you get bored because it's just a giant Arch.After diligently researching for a hotel to spend our St.Louis wedding weekend at, we came across Hampton Inn, wich was nothing less than hospitable and friendly since our initial contact. This specific weekend was a hectic time to book a stay in St. Louis; the world series, marathons, and other events. Originally we were looking into staying at the Westin, but Hampton Inn was more fitting to our budget and frankly; the service was at the caliber of a 5 star hotel. The moment we arrived at Hampton Inn, we felt like royalty. A specific employee by the name of Portland, went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable; letting us know where everything in the hotel is located, parking our car, cracking jokes and listening to our needs; a very simple, but refreshing act of service. Their security guard was probably the nicest guard I've met. He gave us tips where to go,  he even offered to take a picture of  my wife and I on our way to the wedding. The room was nicely upgraded, with absolutely no complaints. The hotel is within walking distance to many downtown attractions. For the price we paid, we were beyond impressedAll in all, a wonderful stay, and we would DEFINITELY recommend this to anyone, and we will DEFINITELY return!I don't think you can beat this hotel for the price. The area is fantastic, as Charles W mentioned, great for stumbling home from the casinos/landing area. The rooms are standard Hampton Inn, which is fine, though there is no wireless in the room. There is free internet on the hardline, but bring a longer Cat5 cable if you want to work from anywhere but the desk. Parking is cheap at $10 a night and secure. If I ever find myself in St. Louis again, I will make my best effort to stay here, even if it means I am sucked in by that evil monster Gamblar, taking my money.What a great place. Free internet, nice big swimming pool, a gym with treadmills and weights, free apples and coffee in the lobby, even free breakfast. Very nice staff, too.stayed there for one night had a great stay front desk was courteous and helpful gym on 5th floor and a great size indoor pool and also a laundry room (great for my situation on the way of completing a long trip) room was great awesome view and walking distance from some of the best places in Saint LouisWe spent three nights here and everything was great! The staff was pleasant and very helpful and the room was clean, roomy and bright. The adjoining pub was great and the walk to the arch and nearby restaurants & bars was easy.  We also had an easy walk to the baseball stadium. Kudos to the management and staff.I love Hampton Inns.  You know what you're going to get: well-designed, comfortable rooms, free internet and breakfast, at a good price.This one is conveniently located just off the northeast corner of the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial (the Arch).  The staff were super-helpful.We paid $116+15% tax for a room on a busy Friday (big Cardinals game), and parking was $10.Stayed here for 2 nights 3 days.  The staff were helpful and friendly.  The room was clean, it also had a little refrigerator. I was on the 5th floor near the gym room, swimming pool and game room which were pretty small, but seem to work for me.  The view from my bedroom was not that great but i didn't care since i plan to be out most of the time  Elliptical machine was really cool.  Location is absolutely wonderful.   Close to many restaurants, metro link which can put you close to Forest park near all the museums, zoo and fun stuff in the park, which all have free admission    Don't forget around the corner from the hotel, you can walk to the arch, another place to visit.  The only reason that I didn't give this review a 5 is because at random times the bathroom would make odd noises.  Didn't bother to mention it because I didn't stay in the hotel most of the times, but it was pretty annoying waking up to the bathroom flushing noises.  Bonus. Free breakfast.   Was not bad.  I loved making my own hot waffles and the coffee was very good.   I would recommend this place and would stay here again.

review_content: I normally stay at the Ignacio when I come in town to visit my son. However they were undergoing renovations and recommended that I stay here is a comparable property. Well, the truth is that they are two very different types of hotels. The Park Plaza is full of old world charm and reminds me of a step back in time. A step back I really like! My room/suite was well apportioned. The lobby is classic. Yet the feel of being old school is well complimented by easy and strong wifi access and recent movies in-room. The location is easy for the Central West End, a hipster area, and there is a movie theatre in the hotel. This may become my new place to stay in Saint Louis!I only stayed for one night at the Chase but it was quite decadent! My boyfriend and I took a one night 'staycation' and had a great time. I was worried that because I booked through Expedia (only $100!) we would get a bad room but it was wonderful! Huge, huge room with lots of amenities and a pretty view of Maryland St. Only 4 stars just because of the parking cost. Why pay $18 a day (?!?!) when you could park a short walk away in the residential part of the CWE for free? We didn't really explore the hotel but every employee we ran into was kind and courteous. I especially liked that there wasn't any surprise charges upon checking out. With all the mediocre reviews for this hotel I was expecting the worst but we had a pleasant night!I'd been in the Chase Park Plaza several years prior, but I only stayed at the hotel this past year during the summer. You can valet the car at the front or self-park around the back; I did the latter, and it's plenty easy enough - after you have checked in, you just swipe your room key to go in and out. The only downside is that the lot is also available for general use, and given there are plenty of spots at the edge of Central West End folks like coming out to, you could end up on one of the higher floors. Walking inside from the front, you have a small but grand-looking lobby; at night, if you walk further back, you'll have musical entertainment near the bar, and there's a very small, retro movie theater that you can swing by if you're in the mood for light entertainment. Back where you walk in, there's plenty of meeting rooms and convention space. The folks at the front desk were very nice and accommodating - no complaints there.As for my room - I ended up getting parked at the end of the northwestern end of the building. The view was mediocre (no direct view of the park, really only of traffic), but there were two things that bothered me. First, I had an extremely loud cooling unit in a door that looks like a closet, making it somewhat difficult to fall asleep (I was there in the middle of the summer, so it was on quite frequently). The second, more bothersome part was that my room was never made up. Perhaps it was too far to make it down to the end of the hallway, but I was disappointed to come back during the only full day I was there and discover that nothing had been changed or made up. Given the price of the hotel, some hospitality should be expected. Amenities on balance were a bit on the older side, and some things (like putting the only cups in the room in the dresser beneath the TV, instead of any in the bathroom) were puzzling.While the location is hard to beat - you are right next to the park on one side, and the popular haunts of the neighborhood on the other - I felt like this was a bit on the pricey side for the quality of what you actually get. I know the hotel has a grander, older feel to it, but there's certainly no harm in redoing the rooms and updating them to make it feel like you are truly staying in a luxury hotel, instead of one that looks like it on the outside but feels more worn once you get to the place (the room) that you are actually spending money on.We stayed in a small suite here for NYE.  The room looked a bit dated, but was very large.  We ordered room service 2 times and both were pretty good-margherita pizza and then the breakfast with eggs, sausage, toast, and potatoes.  The roomservice staff was excellent and quick.  It is a central location, the lobby is beautiful, service is very good...just a little dated in the rooms.  But for the price, it was a nice little NYE get away.I scored a great last minute deal with a friend so we decided we had to check it out! We were upgraded complimentary to an executive suite (score!). The lobby and 1st floor is very well done and I wish I had scheduled more time to have a cocktail and explore. The room itself was large and spacious, however felt fairly dated and drab. The room had a full kitchen, but again outdated and very 1983. I made use of the sleeper sofa, however there were no sheets and the mattress itself was stained. My friend also noted that his mattress wasn't terribly comfortable. We ended up hitting the road earlier than planned. All in all, I thought it was a nice space, good location, but not worth more than I paid for.Second time I've stayed here - both times for meetings. Very conveniently located (next to a huge park, upscale grocery, and nice restaurants). The hotel is very cool (has movie theaters, restaurants, bars) - had a remodeling effort a few years ago and it really shows. The rooms are huge, have really nice amenities, and are very quiet.
