We were told to swipe our room key to get admitted to the parking area. We were NEVER told there is a $10 parking fee per day, (we found this out at check out on our final bill!). The fee is understandable. However, I feel it should have been disclosed.Upon check in, nothing was told to us about internet services. We got to our room. I called down asking for the code for internet. I was told there was no code as there is a $9.95 fee per day. I CAN NOT TELL YOU THE LAST TIME I STAYED IN A HOTEL WHERE I WAS CHARGED FOR INTERNET!!! I feel this also could have been explained to us upon check in. When we got to our room it looked as if maybe it hadn't been rented out in a very long time. Dust on all the counter tops. You could easily write in it, it was so thick. Even our TV remote was dusty, (not in a clean cloth slip cover like most hotels.)On the morning we checked out, at 10:15 AM the maid knocked on our door. We told her we weren't ready to leave yet. She asked us how much longer we planned on staying. Well, she never needed to ask us that. Check out is 11:00 AM. When we left, we nearly tripped over her cleaning car as it was halfway blocking our door way.Very unsatisfied stay. Probably won't be back.A few bad experiences, mostly average and one good point.When I checked in the lady at the front desk wrote the wrong room number on my key card. I had to come back downstairs and deal with her attitude as she made up a new card and wrote the correct room number on it. She didn't mention her mistake, I figured that out when I came back upstairs and found myself at a different door. Later that night someone knocked and then entered my room. When I woke and asked who it was he said, "sorry, wrong room." Seems unusual for after midnight. I remembered to use the deadbolt after that.Room was average, tub is getting a bit grimy due to age.Very convenient to the airport.We decided to take an impromptu trip to St. Louis from Louisville since it was only 4 hours away and we've never been. We got a good deal through hotels.com and AAA to stay at the Marriott St. Louis Airport. First, the hotel is literally across the street from the airport but we never heard a plane. There is no valet parking or luggage assistance at the front door. Self-parking is $10/day. The outside of the hotel is extremely dated but the interior looks like it's been renovated. The front desk staff were courteous and did a pretty good job. We had checked in advance through the Marriott App since we are reward members and it made check in a little faster. The room was nice even though we got 2 double beds instead of the 1 king we requested. The pools were ok. Nothing special but we had a good time. Overall the hotel would get 3-3.5 stars if not for the lack of cleaning in our rooms bathroom. The tub had so much soap build up and grime that as I stepped in I totally ate it. I was so pissed off I almost left. My wife also slipped in the tub but luckily didn't fall. I know there are a lot of rooms to clean but how hard is it to spray some scrubbing bubbles and rinse it off. It would have saved me a nasty bruise on my elbow.ehh.. I have a hard time with rating this one. The lobby was beautiful, the staff was friendly. The bar had a nice selection of beer, the restaurant had a good (but expensive) breakfast. The room itself looked nice enough. Typical teeeeny tiny marriott bathroom layout - have to straddle the toilet to close the door! Definitely had been remodeled recently but I was stuck in the back tower and on the ground floor. Lovely view of the parking lot and all of the associated parking lot noises. Slamming car doors, stereos, dumpsters being emptied at 5 a.m. Not exactly a peaceful night's sleep. I wish they'd paid more attention to sound proofing the room when they remodeled. Overall there are just nicer places to stay in the area for the same price.Had to stay over because our flight to Houston was cancelled late on Saturday night. We got the airline discount for the room and got a nicely appointed, newly decorated room.Went to the bar for a snack and drink and Jenny waited on us. She sympathized with our stay and said they try to make it up when a traveler is stranded. Food was good (but toasted ravioli were dry) and drinks were outstanding. Jenny made a great gin and tonic, herself, and even comped an extra drink. It made a bad situation a great experience.I have stayed in more than 20 Marriott hotels this year and this was one if my favorites. Convenient location and gorgeous interiors. Breakfast was yummy and the staff was the friendliest I have ever met. They should train all Marriott employees to this location's standards.The hotel looks ancient from the outside. We were a little bit worried driving in, but there has been a lot of upgrading on the inside. The lobby and first floor had most of the upgrades. The rooms still seem a bit dated and could use some cleaning. It's not horrible but not 4 star. It is super close to the car rental place. There's a massive bar and meeting area in the lobby that was super popular. I did get tickets for free drinks, too. There is also a super convenient place to print out your travel items.Convenience and price means I could end up here again in the future.When I make quick trips back to St. Louis this is my go to hotel. I often take early and late flights and this hotel makes it so easy! The staff is quick and friendly. It's newly remodeled and very trendy. There is a place to print boarding passes and is directly across from Lambert. It's also next door to Budget rent a car. The bar is nice and there is a Starbucks in the lobby.This is a classic case of don't judge a book by its cover. We needed a place just to rest our heads but since there was a home Cardinals game, hotel prices were high around the downtown area. Thanks to Priceline, we scored this hotel (about 20 minutes from downtown) for $70. Driving up we weren't really impressed with the outdated and somewhat dirty exterior however when we walked in all was different. It was spotless, trendy and modern. In the lobby there is an array of cool lighting, a bar and ample seating. Check-in was easy and our rooms were comfortable with lots of space.Why 3 stars? Well, we had to pay $10 to park. For a hotel this nice a parking pass should be included in the fee.
review_content_20: Modern, decadent lobby, restaurant, coffee shop and meeting areas! Then there's the throwback hotel rooms with the big box TV, AC when setting heat to 76, remains at a cool 65. Started this review in April 2014. Now it's May 2014 and... hey now... check out the renovation! Great new room interiors, flatscreen TV, big fluffy beds and multiple electrical outlets! Reading light on the headboards, fridge... Outdoor pool with cabanas is coming eventually, while the workout room is warm and stuffy. Great staff, lobby bar and TVs! Top it off with a glass of La Crema Pinot Noir. Improvements are looking good. Weather is better in the rooms, too.The stars are for the staff, who were HANDS DOWN the most courteous and professional I've ever encountered at a hotel. Their attitude and demeanor, their smiles and posture, told me they were proud to work there, and I was a wearisome traveler whose flight was canceled. Not only have I decided that if I need to stay in St. Louis for any reason, this will be my hotel, but I may even MAKE ST. LOUIS my destination for pleasure BECAUSE of this hotel. Raising the roof for Erica, Jackeya and Simone.A quick overnight stay...but it felt so luxurious! Very friendly front desk staff, updated lobby, and the room was fantastic! The interior of the hotel has been renovated and feels modern and clean. My room was cvery clean. The Starbucks/bistro was staffed with friendly personnel as well. Unfortunately I did not have time this trip to visit the concierge room but I have confidence it is as good as the rest of the hotel. A great example of what Marriott does right!Beautiful hotel! Comfortable, modern rooms, friendly check in, great bar! The menu here is very tasteful. Bartender, Jason, polite and professional. Close to metro rail for downtown access. Airport shuttle. I'm always satisfied with my stay!Fine lower-tiered hotel, conveniently located right near the airport. Nice free shuttle to the airport.Friendly and knowledgable bar staff. Several local beers on tap and a few more in bottles. Service was fast -- but surprisingly chatty. Recommendations were given when we said we were from out of town, and the bartender even bought us a round of beers! Modern, lounge-like ambience also. I'd say if you're staying in St. Louis, this is a good place to spend the night (despite its somewhat dated exterior).Had an unexpected layover at stl and did a priceline.com search. Landed this hotel and I can't say enough nice things. The exterior may be dated but the interior is fabulous. Upon arriving I was greeted multiple times and was quickly service by wonderful front desk personnel who were so curtious and friendly. My room was clean and comfortable with modern amenities. They had live entertainment inside and outside by pool. I first remained inside, listening to the dualing pianos and had a wonderful roasted corn chowder at the bar. The management was very hands on and assisted the bartenders due to the crowd. They asked me my name once and I was addressed by it all evening, just a nice personal touch. I then went outside where Jason Chase was playing cover music. He was amazing. The poolside decor and furniture is wonderful...cabanas, a bar, two pools with sparkly floating lights. Great ambiance! Again, the servers were exceptional. Slept great and probably overstayed my welcome with the late checkout. Had a lot of time to kill before my flight so decided to lunch it. Again with the service! Wonderful! First name basis again and super attentive. Had a wonderful Bistro Burger cooked to perfection with yummy sweet fries. Getting ready to depart via the free shuttle service. I can honestly say that out of all my recent travels this was one of the most pleasurable experiences. It's so nice to be able to write a lengthy positive review! Keep up the good work!I highly recommend this beautiful hotel. The staff and management is top notch, treat you like you TRULY feel like a guest. I appreciate the attention to details and going the extra mile for their guests. Sexy lobby and bar area...oh and Marissa at the bar is a mixologist! Sweet dreams STL perfect ending to a great trip! Love this place!If this hotel was not going through a huge remodel - I would huge renovation I would have given it two stars. Either way - I will not return to this hotel. The check in line at 9:30 pm was 15 people deep - the place was a freaking zoo and the lobby is located a mile from my room - I thought I was walking back to the airport! The price was extremely high for this location and the overall hotel service was lacking.My room was small, but extremely clean with crisp bedding that smelled fresh. However, the only bathroom smaller then this hotel room's bathroom was on the airplane I flew in on - this was incredible small. The view stunk and the parking - though plentiful was normally a long walk to where you wanted to go and it cost to park there. Again - nothing impressive or good enough to make me want to return.The guest computers for check in worked - once you found them and the restaurant staff was very good - nothing great, but very good. The food was very good, but the price made it less attractive.The pool area was incredible though - even though I never found the time to use it. this is as good as this review will get, because I never plan on going back. It will either be downtown or the Renaissance by the airport for me!Had to kill a couple of hours before our flight and decided to stop at Marriott. Greeted by Nick at the restaurant...Introduced himself and gave us a great table. Then Debbie, our server immediately arrived with the same cordial greeting & intro. Her recommendations were excellent and service was outstanding. Very personable and accommodating, she made our time very enjoyable. Food was very good also. Hopefully, the majority of Marriotts are this pleasant.Very nice, great customer service, quite at night and the temperature of the room was very nice and comfortable. I would recommend this place to anyone.This is my first time staying at this hotel once I got here I was greeted at the front door with a very enthused staff. Which didn't stop there at check-in the service was top-notch again staff again was very gracious and made check in a breeze. Once I made it up to my room the room had a nice standard size king bed room which looks well-maintained and clean. after relaxing, my crew made it down to the hotel restaurant/bar I was the last of the three of us to sit at the table I was immediately greeted by Robbie who was not our waiter but was over the food and beverage department I hope I got that right he brought an extra menu and drink list to the table. upon walking up he was very friendly and engaged everyone in conversation made sure everyone was having a good time and if we needed anything to just let him know he was also very knowledgeable about what drinks they had available and if they didn't have something particular he knew what was similar to taste. Shortly after Jenny our waitress came over she asked us our name which I have never been asked before she was so upbeat and happy and knowledgeable of the menu and surprisingly she remembered all of our names throughout service. One of the people I was with had the chowder and said it was wonderful and feelingly. I had a hard time choosing what I wanted so I went with the burger I thought you couldn't go wrong and I was right. The other ladies I was with had wine and I was looking for something like an angry orchard cider or REDDS beer which they did not have but they did have a Stella Cidre which was very identical. I was overall very pleased with my stay I hope to be coming back to this location when I am in St. Louis again on business. The outside of the hotel you could definitely tell it wasn't new once getting inside you could tell it was more modern updatedThis is a no frills hotel. This place charges for basic amenities most places offer complimentary. You have to pay to park, to use Wi-Fi... The room is comfortable, spacious. The location lacks anything remotely resembling civilization, it's only convenience is the Airport location and the freeway.The hotel looks old and dated from the outside, but it was surprisingly clean and modern inside. The proximity to the airport is great. The rooms are nice, clean, with in-room coffee maker which I love. The walls are thin, you can hear any noise in the hall. The restaurant was terrible. Avoid the restaurant, especially in the morning. Buffet food containers constantly empty, terrible service. They seemed annoyed that you even wanted their help.Typical airport, about what you would expect. There was nothing great about it, but it wasn't bad either.I think this place has come a long way. First time I visited I wasn't too impressed. Now the remodeling is done and it's really nice inside. I think the parking needs a better set up. But I understand why they have the key swipe. If you need a place near the airport, check it out. Prices are right and the rooms are very nice. The restaurant has very good food. A few local beers on draft too.Epic fail...It was one bad thing after another here. It all started with my room not being available...My first room had two small beds and smelled like an old shoe..I should have known based on the dehumidifier in the room...After switching to a "better" room, I noticed the ancient furniture and wallpaper peeling of the wall...yuck...To top it off, my alarm clock light did not work, and I did not get a wake up call...If you want to make your flight, this is not the place for you.Polite and respectful service. Larger rooms that were quiet. AC could have worked a little better. Couldn't get cooler than 70 degrees in the room and it was May. My biggest complaint is that of the theft that occurred from my room while I was out of the room for a funeral. The cleaning staff sifted through all my clothes and mixed my dirty clothes and clean clothes together and then stuffed them into one of my bags. Thus far, I have only noticed that they stole a blue Nike running shirt that I wore for a morning run, prior to showering and heading out for a funeral. Don't leave your laptops or credit cards in your room unattended. They will likely go missing. But what else would you expect from St. Louis?$10/night parking.We departed from the hotel at 6:45am our first day and arrived back around 4:45pm that evening. Our room had not been cleaned. Called the front desk and the said they would "send someone right up". 45 min later...no room service. Got back to the hotel that night at 10:30ish and while the room had been somewhat cleaned, they had not replaced the coffee. Also, breakfast buffet was going to be $17.30 per person! Front desk staff and Bona, the concierge, were outstanding. Will not stay there again, and would not recommend it.There is a lot of renovation going on here
review_content_40: This is another place I want to give a 3.5. If you're attending FSI it is close to the school so the drive is short, but anything else you want to do will require a bit of a drive. If you're staying here for less than a week it is a good pick, anything longer you might want to change. If you do pick here you have a choice between 2 towers. The Marquis tower has rooms that were renovated 5 years ago. It has HDTV, but you have to walk to the other tower to access the gym or executive lounge. The Main tower is being renovated as I type this. The rooms are a bit nicer than the Marquis. What gets me is why there isn't HDTV on this side. What is stopping them from putting it in this tower, but the gym and executive lounge are just an elevator away...So, pick your poison on what is more important. In hindsight I'd go to the Marquis tower and just enjoy the walk.It's about 10 minutes from the airport. From the outside you see 2 towers and a motel-type building. They are going through a full lobby remodel and it looks like it's going to be very nice. I was in the tower where check in is located and the lounge is in the opposite tower. Even though I am Marriott Gold, I got a fairly small room, but it's clean and airy with a flat screen TV. I love the Marriott shampoo, conditioner, and hand lotion, but their coffee leaves a lot to be desired. Too bad Starwood has in-room Startbucks coffee locked up.Staff was very friendly & helpful. Wi-Fi in the rooms was fast for about 30 minutes (while I was writing this review) but has since slowed to a c-r-a-w-l.Frankly, most Sheratons are nicer, but you can't beat the location.I needed assistance with an issue related to flight times, and Nikai Travis at the front desk was super. Not only did she help me accommodate my change in schedule, but she was cheerful and pleasant the whole time.It is a pleasure to go to a property and have a friendly staff leader help like this. The property and location are always secondary to service, and she deserves five stars herself.Unused to stay here a lot until I couldn't stand the dinginess and lousy service.  However, today, they had the only room in town.  I forgot why I hate this place.  Damp carpets, desultory service -- cheerful but incompetent -- and now, no Internet in the top floor, last room.  Maybe they could spring for a few extra boxes?  The lobby is being renovated, but the guest rooms and floors are the worst.  I'm ashamed to be a Marriott Platinum Elite -- how can I be loyal to a chain with a hotel that is so consistently lousy?I travel roughly 330 days a year for my job, I always stay with Marriott and was very disappointed in this property. The outside looks horrible, very out of date. Parking is a nightmare and costs $10 a day as a guest. The east tower where the concierge lounge is, it's pathetic, the rooms in the east tower are highly outdated, paint is peeling off the walls. Only thing is this room that was modern was the TV. Internet drops connections all the time, the Wifi literally disappears, laundry is in the west tower on the 3rd floor, if your staying in the east tower be prepared to lug your dirty cloths through the lobby and restaurant area. One your in the west tower you'll be in for a big surprise and pissed. The west tower was recently renovated and looks much nicer. I am a platinum elite member with Marriott, so they automatically put you in the east tower, which is old and run down. Your better off staying at a different Marriott.I stayed here for a convention this weekend. Fortunately, some friends let me stay in the room for free, so all I paid for there was food and convention admission.The lobby and pool areas are beautiful. Also, the staff in the lobby were also very polite and friendly. But that won't make up for the lack of actual service we got.The room looked nothing like the picture, and the cheaply made coffee maker sprayed more water onto the desk and chair than into the cup. Lots of channels on the TV didn't even work, either, they just had a blue screen. The walls were quite thin as well. Another annoyance was that the lock only recognized the keycards about half of the time. Getting into the room was a pain. Despite the fact that I almost bumped into at least one housekeeper every time I left my room, nobody bothered to clean anything. Our tiny trashcans overflowed quickly, and when housekeeping did not change them, one of the girls in my room went down to the lobby to ask for another one. We never got it. So we gathered everything into a trash bag and left it out in the hall, hoping an employee would pick it up.They did not. I also noticed wine glasses that had been outside rooms for at least a day, too. We were also charged an extra $20 for parking, even though none of us had a car with us. Fortunately we were able to sort that out.If I could give ZERO stars I would! After kindly asking Justin, the front desk "manager" to please give us a quiet room in preparation of our long journey of course our room was right next to the ice machine! Oh, plus the smell of pot was strong and potent throughout the hall and seeped through our room. After letting them know via phone and person nothing was done! I should have known from the initial sight with bulbs from the lighted sign burned out. UNACCEPTABLE!Im personally a fan of Hilton. My friend got good rates here for our weekend in STL. The room was clean it just seemed... idk outdated? Maybe it was the location and the hotel. I would stay here again but not by choice. Also, the coffee stand by the front desk serves Starbucks, but it doesnt taste the same. Also their baked goods are definitely NOT Starbucks!A great experience. I travel a lot. All US. I stay at a lot of different hotels. Many  Marriott hotels. Very close to the airport. They run free shuttles every 20 minutes 24/7. Friendly drivers that insist on loading your luggage. Recently renovated; friendly fast check in; great food. Over the top friendly service. A welcome stay for weary travelers. Nice job St. Louis Marriott!It's a hotel by the airport. Basically it's not as nice as staying in the city and people rarely stay more than 1 night. From the outside it looks old and run down. Inside is a little better. Staff was very friendly & helpful. It was clean, but I thought the rooms were a little small. No wifi was a major negative. Bed was comfy but bathroom was very small. Not my first choice to stay, but its better than some of the other options nearby.Great hotel!The staff is so helpful and will go out of their day to make you feel warm and fuzzy. Literally, everyone I encountered was kind and pleasant. The place just has a good energy.I arrived after the convenience shop was closed on my first night and the manager happily offered to open up shop for me anyway. The gym is AWESOME. It's 24hrs and is very modern and a good size. All the new techie treadmills and bikes are a serrious +1. They even offered complimentary cool towels and earbuds that stayed in my ears while I ran. Yes, consider this my confession for taking more free earbuds than I actually needed. The room was comfortable and clean. The internet was fast and reliable. The restaurant even allowed me to order off their menu to satisfy my dietary wants/needs. These folks complaining about $9 for parking (in a secure area) clearly don't travel much. I often pay $20+ when traveling and have to park in far less secure areas for it.Clean and environmentally conscious hotel. Convenient to airport. 24 hour fitness and business center. Affordable rates and amazing customer service. Visited Missouri to resolve complication and the hospitality made this visit quite impressionable. Much thanks to Heather behind the reception.This is a great hotel.  The staff are always helpful and friendly.  The facility and rooms are clean and neat.  Depending on which tower you get assigned to you may have an older tube television vice an upgraded HD set.I was here with my brother for his company's Annual Christmas Party. Food bites worse than mosquitoes in a days old muddles puddle. The staff was friendly, but that did not make up for the less than tasty morsels we were served. The carpet in our section, the East side of the building looked rather dark and dingy. It had recently been vacuumed as evidenced by there being nothing on the rug, except worn down and dingy fibers.A really solid Marriott to stay at if you need to be close to the airport, or if miss the last flight home and need to spend a night at a nearby hotel. The staff is very nice and the ladies who work at the concierge lounge are really nice. If you can stay in the Marquis Tower here I would highly recommend it as it has been somewhat recently updated and has new decor and HDTV in the room. The air conditioner in my room wasn't noisy, the bathrooms are a tad on the small side but nothing can be perfect I suppose. The rates are very very reasonable for a full service Marriott.Impressive convenience shop - they carry every toiletry and minor pharmaceutical, incl diapers, in minipacks. They also have dress socks, dress shirts, swimsuits, and belts; you could nearly outfit yourself for a business meeting from the skin out! Free Internet terminals in there too, just ask for activation. Good soundproofing in the rest of the hotel; we couldn't hear any planes, just the kid screaming in the hallway. Staff were friendly and the decor was nice.I think most have left very forgiving reviews here. What was supposed to be a king bed turned out to be two lumpy double beds and a shower bathtub that doesn't drain. I could hear the rooms as well above and below mine into the early morning. Plumbing volume was sleep prohibitive. This place is a dump.The room was just fine, typical Marriott. Comfortable beds etc. Our room had two doors, one opening from the hall and one to the outdoor pool. It was really nice to pop outside in the morning for a swim. The pool was supposed to be open at 9am. We tried to go at 11am, but all of the little gates were locked. I called the front desk. They accidentally hung up on me. I called again and again, no answer. So, I just jumped over the fence --hey, checkout it at 12, I'm not going to wait!!! Then I was scolded because someone else didn't do their job and open the pool and clean all of the bugs out of it. Our room was really humid. It smelled like mold. There was a dehumidifier in there, but it was full by morning. They charge $8 a night to park. Shouldn't that be included with the room? They also over-sold their parking lot, so there were no spots. We drove around for 15 minutes. The restaurant had really bad service, we waited forever, they forgot stuff blah blah. There were tiles missing over the bathtub so you could see tubes and electrical stuff.Rooms were comfortable and the internet was very solid. Didn't get a chance to use the dining or exercise amenities but everything looked clean and fresh.Typical Marriott hotel.  The customer service was great, I use this hotel every week and they don't even ask for my name when I check in, they already know me by my first name.  The rooms are a bit on the small side, but that isnt very important to me as I only use the hotel to sleep.  They were clean and well maintained, so no complaints there.  The regular rooms have old square TVs, but the one time I was given an upgraded room, they had a nice flat screen LCD monitor.  Ate a few times at the restaurant, decent food but not much of a variety.  Prices are high (10 dollars for a plate of mac and cheese with lobster) but thats too be expected for a hotel.  Overall, a nice stay.
review_content_60: Older Marriott that has been kept up well. Staff is excellent. Location is convenient.Stayed here on an impromptu trip to see the in-laws. Everything was okay, but nothing very impressive. I would have given 4 stars but the $9 extra per night for parking was kind of ridiculous.Our flight was canceled and rescheduled for first thing the next morning, so we needed a cheap airport hotel to shuttle us to and from and get a good night's sleep. We got a great rate, and they have happy hour (3 drinks free!) every night with light snacks. The BBQ place next door is great too, and everyone is SO nice. It was such a relief to not have to worry about shuttles or anything once we found the Pear Tree.It is very rare for me to give five stars. When trying to come up with a reason for one less star, I could  not come up eith anything substantive. I stayed here on business. I hardly ever come across hotel staff that is so nice, cheery and helpful. Hot tub, swimming pool, and a 24-hour gym?! Das good stuff!great atmosphere, friendly staff, shuttle service to the Airport and MetroLink, the only downside is that there are no walking-distance restaurants nearby...so we walked for 2 miles to eat and then got stuck there...we called them and they came and got us - at 3 AM! they held our bags all day for free (some places charge for that) and the entire feel of it left a very good impression on us.

review_content: It's out there, but this Hilton is less expensive than many other St. Louis hotel options in this category. The location is right by the highway which is convenient if you just need a place to stay in St. Louis. The drive to downtown is about 20 minutes, so it's not ideal if you need to shuttle back and forth multiple times each day. The room we had was very clean and large with a huge window. It felt luxurious and secure. A view of the airport runways gives a little bit of entertainment if you're into that sort of thing...The downfall: $10/night parking -even for those staying in the hotel? I would understand this price for those hoping to snag a parking spot before catching a flight but it seems odd for hotel guests given that we're in the boonies and not downtown STL.The hotel is quite large and spread out but easy to navigate. Seems like they frequently have conferences. Our room was clean and I enjoyed the bed and shower pressure. For $100-ish/night 25 minutes outside of town +$10 parking per night, it's hard to say if we'll return next year.Decent place but would never stay here again. I was just getting up to get ready for my flight followed by several business meetings. Some how the fire alarm tripped ( it wasn't a fire) so I had to quickly grab everything and leave. No ironed clothes for the day, I couldn't take a shower so I smelled all day, I went catch the shuttle which couldn't be found and all the cabs were getting snapped up.Since this is yelp and not trip advisor, I am focusing on the food portion of the hotel for this review. I stayed a week and ate breakfast and lunch here most days. The diamond breakfast coupon covered the entire buffet, and it was one of the best I have seen from a Hilton (since I was last at Hilton Anaheim). This is a top notch breakfast buffet. The breakfast service is always questionable, so ask for the check before you're ready to go. The bar/lunch spot has a solid and creative menu. Everything I ordered was above expectations, even though it's not cheap. I was also given 3 drink coupons at check-in which saved me a solid $20, and encourages a nice sized evening crowd in the lobby lounge. Lastly, there was an executive lounge on my floor. It was stocked with some NA drinks all day long, and it was a nice quiet spot to get some work done. They also had a free breakfast. Non-Food tip - get a room far from the elevators...they're pretty loud and the walls are thin.We did a park and fly here. Our car was safe while we were away. The breakfast in the restaurant was beautiful. It was free with the rewards program. The airport shuttle was prompt in both directions. Our room was comfortable with an interesting view.Food is really bad.  The pork belly was cold, not warn but cold.  Their idea of pizza is tomato sauce over a tortilla.  It's a wrap by morning and pizza by lunch and dinner.  I'm starving so I ate it.  I finished and pulled out my credit card and placed it on the corner of the table.  Nothing in the past 15 minutes.  It's a Friday night.  It's not busy here.  Two waiters, a bus boy that walks around with good asking tables if it's for them and a manager.I stayed the weekend with my 8 month old. I will never stay here again.I was meeting up with friends and one of the first to arrive had arranged it so our rooms could be by one another. The lady behind the desks tells me my room is still dirty. I can either wait and she will put an expedite on it or I can be moved to another floor/room. Having just finished a 6 hour drive, alone, with an 8 month old I wasn't exactly quick draw McGraw with my answer while I weighed my options. Before I could answer or ask questions a guy standing there steps in and says there is no "do not hold" my reservation so I can be moved. I say my friend arranged for us to be blocked together and he says no you don't have a block (in retrospect when another friend had called weeks in advance she was told she needed to provide a credit card to reserve our BLOCK of rooms- their terminology not ours.) The girl again tries to offer me the expedite option, I begin to say let me call one of my friends to see if we can wait in their room and the guy says no move me and puts me in another room on another floor. Fine. I don't have the energy to argue and my kid is exhausted. Never asked if I need help with my bags. I pull my car up to the parking gate where I need to use my room card to open it. I slide it. Nothing. I keep sliding it. Nothing. Try both cards as many different ways as possible. I'm only mildly annoyed as I figure this is a glitch as I had just checked in. I finally hit the help button. A voice comes on and I explain I just checked in and my card isn't working. The girl says I need to check in first. I tell her I already did and neither key is working. She begins to talk over me that I need to check in first before I yell "I ALREADY CHECKED IN!!! The keys you gave me ARE NOT working!" Magically the gate goes up. I say thank you and she tells me have a nice day. Ugh. Ok a bump no big. I find a spot thankfully close to the entrance of the hotel. I had noticed there's no luggage carts. I have a rolling suitcase, a rolling cooler, a large duffel bag and a laundry basket with stuff in it. Plus my diaper bag and my son.I strap my son into his carrier and grab my first bag mentally bracing myself for a long trek from parking lot to 6th floor multiple times. As I come into the lobby I see it, like an oasis in the desert- a luggage cart. I snatch it, kinda laughing like Smegal, throw my suitcase on it and head back to my car. Load the cart up and head inside gripping tightly to my precious. At this point a very nice employee steps in and offers to help me up to my room. I almost greedily say no and hiss but contain myself and say yes thank you. He helps me up to my room- very pleasant very nice. Unloads the cart for me and leaves. Crisis averted.It's a hotel room. I can't make up my mind if the decor is just old or chosen to look old so they could save money on renovations and just call it kitschy. The room has no fridge. I push the front desk button on the phone- the number is disconnected. What?!? I notice the menu of charges on the phone for calls and opt to dig for an alternate number and find another spot that says push 0. I do. The lady is pleasant and tells me it'll be $15 for the fridge. WTF. But I need it for my son so I say ok and she says 20 minutes. I decide to hold off on starting his bed and bath routine as we will be at an odd stopping point once the fridge arrives.Fifty minutes later I call down and explain I've been waiting and I'm cut off! "20-30 minutes ma'am." Yes I know but it's been longer and I've delayed putting my kid to bed and she begins to talk over me! Repeating 20-30 minutes. I finally say "either way it's been 50 minutes! My kid is crabby. When is it coming?" No joke her answer-  "you were told 20-30 minutes and it is on its way." I end the call with "it doesn't change that it's been 50."The next evening we return from our day out and there's a car having issues at the gate too. Eventually he somehow gets in. Now it's my turn. Neither card works. Unbelievable. Over 24 hours since I've checked in and it's still not working. After a few minutes of fussing I push the help button. Nothing. I swipe some more more. Nothing. I push the button again. Nothing. I go into this cycle of swipe/push. This whole gate experience takes approx 18 mins (between the guy in front of me and me). By this point my normally good natured kid is bawling. He's got a dirty diaper and he's been sitting in it. So I begin jamming on the button. Finally it opens. I'm fuming.For check out? I called down and asked for help with my bags in about 20 minutes. They send 1 guy (on time) and no cart. How the hell does an AIRPORT HOTEL only have 2 carts?!?Just spoke to a friend- they charged her for 2 rooms when she only reserved one. They tried saying she booked 2 and was a no show for the other. What?? They're telling her it'll be a month to get refunded.This place is a joke.After one night at the Crowne Plaza Downtown, we left really disappointed and wound up at the Hilton by St. Louis Airport.  We used Priceline and got two nights at $60 per night and this Hilton did everything they could to make this a stay we would remember.  The hotel is a lot bigger then it looks from the outside and the rooms were very comfortable.  The food at their restaurant was excellent and the waiter even gave us breakfast vouchers which when we got our bill was worth $35 in free food.  Could not really go wrong with that.  Seems like most hotels have a $10 per day parking charge, but the rental car was totally safe.  I will stay here again in the future.I was going to give four stars but due to my 11 year old son falling through the sofa bed. He wasn't hurt though and the manager was there in 3 seconds flat. They upgraded our room without us asking. Which was kinda nice. The food is expensive there so eat elsewhere. Reviews said hot tub there was none. Room key messed up a few times. Our TV was weird as well...and no free breakfast!! It's close to a lot of things though. Other than that the room was clean and staff was very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.Great front desk staff! Tamara was really helpful and sweet.  She handled my check-in and took care of my parking for the night since they couldn't accommodate me the night before.  The room was very clean, nice and the bed was wayyyy too comfortable! lol  I ended up sleeping in for the first time in years due to that nice bed.  Also, I ate at the bar the night before and had great service from the bartender (john maybe?) anyway, fast service, friendly as well.  Food hit the spot and reasonable.  Paid $20 for a small pizza & bread pudding dessert, with tip.  Not bad!! I used my AMEX points for the stay and it was WELL WORTH IT.This is a great location for a hotel, as it is extremely close to the airport. The staff is friendly and helpful, but this is not my favorite hotel.The bathrooms are some of the smallest I have ever seen. There isn't even really a small shelf to put a towel or clothes on when you are showering. The room seems quite roomy for how small the bathrooms are, which appeared odd.When we got to our room, the temperature was 64 degrees. It was so cold. We tried to turn the thermostat up. We even turned it up as high as it goes, but there was still no change in temperature. We went down to the front desk, and we were told the entire tower was controlled by one central control. She said she would get someone to turn it up within a half an hour. It did warm up -- to 66 degrees. Still not warm enough for us. We dealt with it because it was just one night but more time here would have been miserable. The pool is great. It's incredibly warm, so we spent some time with our feet in that. The hotel does seem dated, but you can tell there have been updates.I only stayed here one night to be close to the airport.I wasn't expecting much and that's what I got. The hotel staff was courteous. My room was somewhat clean if I overlooked dust and crumbs on the floor. The wi-fi was weak and the place could use a facelift to update things such as dingy carpet, wobbly toilet, dirty caulk around shower. On the bright side, the hotel has an airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes. Here's a tip- Avis car rental is right next door, so keep that in mind if you need a rental. Another tip- Planes fly overhead so lower floors may be quieter.Stayed here as we are loyal to hilton and former diamond members - great thing about this property is that it is very close to the airport and rental cars - in fact we should have stayed the night and then rented out car the next morning as not only did we pay for a rental  that sat in the parking lot- they charge for parking- $10!! Property is dated - signage is poor and area is noisy- hilton executives you need to come and inspect this property as  it does not meet your standards across the nationThis was my first time in the Lou. Of course I trusted Yelp to ensure that I got a good nights sleep. I have to say that not only did the city lack a decent amount of reviews; it appeared that no one really liked any of the destinations. I chose the Hilton based on location and the fact that I could rack up a few more miles. The lobby was really nice. Several fruit infused waters. Although tasty, not enough to make up for the humidity in the common areas. Once assigned my room, I was as far from the front door as you could get and this is no exaggeration when I tell you that I was dripping in sweat when I got there. After cleaning up and changing shirts, the AC in the room finally stabilized the heat flashes. The room itself was very nice and comfortable and unlike many hotels I have experienced, the high def TV actually had high def channels. My particular package had two free drinks, free Wi-Fi and free, complete breakfast buffet. The staff was super friendly and buffet was delicious and once the business resort picked me up and I saw all the hotels that I didn't choose, I could tell at least from street appeal, the Hilton was the best choice, if you prefer to stay near the airport. Hilton, if you read this, amp up the AC in hallways. I should always be comfortable inside and not feel like I'm staying in a locker room!They actively block personal WiFi hotspots!Didn't believe it at first but tested it several times over my week long stay. Of course the for-a-fee wifi worked great throughout the facility! Disappointing! My room was clean and looked to be updated recently (new tile in bathroom, etc). The doorframe was not square so there was a huge gap under one side of the door.Breakfast, lots of variety on the buffet and none of it was remarkable, very bland and unexciting for $15.Staff was courteous and helpful and the proximity to the airport is awesome and it doesn't make up for the other shortcomings. In spite of many upcoming trips to St Louis, I wont stay here again.Won't be staying here again, at 1 am our neighbors down the hall started arguing in the hallway. An hour later after many calls to the front desk they were still at it, The hotel has a security guard whom could have taken care of it, but they called the police instead. The staff was friendly but never once apologized for the 1am wake up call. Also if you're charging your guest $12 for breakfast, I shouldn't have to cook my own waffle.3.5 stars.. OK hotel. Our first room was damp and dusty but they were able to get us into the room we reserved the next night. Even comped some meals for our troubles. Which brings me to why I added on the done pts for the stars because the Worlds Away Restaurant more than met my expectations. My visit was in April and I'm still thinking about the pork belly short ribs and cheese grits...a surprisingly good combination. The  breakfast buffet wasn't too shabby either. Now while I will never step foot in St Louis again the staff was also friendly and helpful. The new room was also cleaner than the Westin I stayed in recently in Atlanta.The Hilton is back! I am so pleased with the updated rooms, exceptional service and the food. I decided to come back after a many year boycott and they have won me back. Excellent hotel. I am back!My review is honestly between three and four stars but I'm going with four stars because of the fact that just an "a-okay" rating seems to be a little low especially when you take into consideration the hotel nightmares I've had the past few weeks with traveling in connection with a move.  (Feel free to scroll through my past reviews to laugh at my expense for that).The pros:.1:  The hotel is conveniently located near the airport and offers free shuttle service.  The shuttle runs every 15 minutes and when I used it this morning, it arrived on time and was quite helpful.2. The front desk staff is AMAZINGLY helpful.  I am staying at this airport (in an out) for a few days in conjunction with a move overseas and had several questions upon my initial arrival.  The staff went ABOVE and BEYOND to help me get my answers and made multiple stressful situations for me go smoothly.3. There is a restaurant on site that has a variety of price point meals.  Its good if you don't feel like venturing out.  The food is pretty good quality.4. The gym and pool were also top notch.5. My room was CLEAN (thank you travel gods) and spacious and well stocked.  The bed was also very comfortable.The Cons:1. There is some nickel and diming with the having to pay for wifi...come on now its 2013?2. Walls are pretty thin and at some times it seemed like I could hear anything and everything yet I never heard a plane.3. Paying for parking...meh.....just another annoyance but not the end of the world.In the end, I'd definitely go back to this hotel should I find myself back in the area without hesitation.Had some minor issues with Wifi and plumbing, however, I cannot stress how good their customer service is.  Right in-top of issues.
review_content_20: We recently had a 6am flight home from Saint Louis, so decided to stay at the Hilton St. Louis Airport.   Pros - super close to the airport (5 minutes - only because I hit a red light), comfortable beds, and good service.Cons - run down, broken, and even gross rooms.   I'm a loyal Hilton member, and choose them due to the generally consistent standards that I've come to appreciate and enjoy over the years. The staff was a pleasure to work with, and when I truthfully responded to my how my stay was, they generally seemed sorry for the disappointment, and offered to remove my parking charges and provide me a large amount of HHonors points.   Of course, this was after they mistakenly added almost $40 in internet charges. I doubt we'll be back, but if you just need a place to crash briefly overnight that's quick to the airport.... I guess it's okay.Eating at their "Worlds Away" restaurant in the lobby. Eat the bone in ribeye (39$)! Med'rare....they got it perfect. Almost the best steak I've ever eaten. Would have given five stars and would have said the best had they not put a tiny bit of gravy on it. Other than that amazing!Great prices. 55.00 bucks when the travel lodge down the road is run down and running same with additional cost per person.  The room was serviced every day and the staff was very polite. Really comfy beds. This is. pretty solid hotel.  Decor is St. Louis airport pictures very coolI travel a lot, I'm a gold member with Hilton and they have had my loyalty since 2005.  I'm currently in the hotel as I write this review.  Long story short, I moved rooms on the first night because I was at the end of the hall and I couldn't grab the wifi signal.  Room change was prompt, no complaints.  Now comes the next issue, I was constantly cold in the room.  Its march 18th, its 45 degree in St. Louis, heat should be provided during this time of year.  On the 16th, after days of freezing my tail off at night, I call about the heat, which had been running at the highest setting since the 12th.  Room never got about 67 degrees.  Was I dying, no, but at 67 degree in my pajamas I was cold.  I even brought my shakeweight to keep warm.  Anyhoo, the front desk told me they would send engineering.  6 hours later...nobody came.  I walk to the front desk and the clerk says "yeah the heater was just repaired, they said maybe a few hours and it would be back up".  Comfortable with that answer, I go back to my room.  On the 17th, it was even colder, I call the front desk and the girl has no clue what Im talking about, says the heat never went out.  She says she can send engineering.  I ask to talk to the manager, who confers that the heat was never out, BUT mentions that the first floor rooms don't have working heaters, that the air stays the same ambient temp as the entire first floor,  WHAT THE HECK???  why the lies and story.  I'm pretty upset at this point, but don't really have a temper so I calmly ask the manager for my options.  He offers to move me rooms (which 29 hours b4 checkout.... doenst make the wrong right.  He then send a very very small space heater.  It does nothing except warm your feet.  In the morning, I receive a handwritten note from the manager, gifting me 5000 Hilton points.  Thanks, but 5k points isn't even enough to buy breakfast, let alone book a free night.  Speaking of breakfast, the dining room is right by the front entrance, this hotel might as well serve as a glacier bar, because the entire facility, and room are COLD.  The dining area is so cold!!!  The server, bless her heart (I wont list her name) kept taking things away from me.  She takes away the pot of coffee after I pour a cup, she takes away the ketchup after I leave to get another plate.  You have to ask for water, have to ask for condiments (they aren't anywhere to be found)  Leave for the restroom and she clears the whole table).... strange...strange...service.  Also, perhaps THE WORST WIFI I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE.  Hilton STILL charges for WIFI, and it will ask you to log back in or purchase a plan every 2-5 hours.  Insane annoying.  Good luck trying to download anything large. All in all, not just the worst Hilton experience, but the worst hotel I have ever stayed in... and I stay in hotels 180-220 days out of each calendar year.  If you must stay at this hotel:1. request a room in a tower floor so you have heat during the winter.2. Wear a jacket when you dine in the restaurant in the winter.3.  think about the clever ways to spend 5000 Hilton points :)4.  Don't plan on using WIFI for more than a few hours.This Hilton is located across the street from the airport. Sometimes convenient to stay at if you have an early flight out in the morning.Few things:This place is REALLY BIG.The parking is not free.The front desk staff that I met were the most pretentious and snooty people I have ever met.I still prefer staying DT St Louis.I liked staying at this full service Hilton near the St. Louis Airport. Staff was very courteous and the the establishment was clean with some good amenities. The distance to the Airport will bring me back to this hotel during my next visit to St. Louis area. Hotel has a complimentary shuttle to the Airport which takes less than 3 minutes.Pros: Near airportThermostats seemed to workThe gym had adequate equipmentCons:DirtyOldCharged 10 dollars for basic wifi,16 (plus tax and tip) for continental breakfast buffetDinner restaurant was blandStaff was ok.  Not great. The shuttle driver was very nice.Would not return.I was super nervous to stay somewhere I had never been and alone but I picked the right hotel ! The front desk was amazing after taking a shuttle 2 hours from ft leonard wood they checked me in early . My room was clean and the perfect temperature. I ordered room service for lunch and it was fast and delicious .then later ordered dinner which was amazing . And the employees are so friendly ! I would definitley stay here again !This location is close and convenient to the airport and Hertz.The room felt clean so that is a plus.However, they could use some refreshing.stayed three days at this property and the room was very good except for one problem. The bathroom sink stopper was disconnected so I could not drain the sink. I reported it every day I was there and it was never fixed. Other than that, the room was very comfortable and nicely appointed.There were numerous outlets for charging my various outlets in the room. I had no problem hooking up my phone, iPad, computer and Nook at the same time.The staff is exceptionally friendly and courteous. Everyone I encountered greeted me and exchanged pleasantries.Even with the sink problem, I would return to this hotel for my next trip.No fridge and there was no wifi. definitely think they should make this clear to us. We ended up paying $30 for weak wifi and $20 for parking. This is XXXXPaper thin walls.  Not a good hotel if you plan on using the room as an on the road office.  I could hear my neighbor's entire 2 hour conversation on the phone with his wife while I was trying to work.  Then I could hear him coughing and sneezing all night.  I won't be staying here again because of this.  Otherwise, the staff are very friendly and the hotel is clean.  Free shuttle from airport and back makes for convenient low cost transport.I came back from visiting the Missouri Botanical Garden over Labor day weekend.  My timing was perfect since I was able to catch the Japanese Festival.  However, I was really tired and just wanted to check-in without dealing with airport parking, etc.  After reading some reviews, I opted to park temporarily in the 15 minute space to see whether my Gold membership got me some perks.CHECK-IN AND PARKING ****$10 for 24hr parking but Gold membership got me $5 for parking.  Someone on Yelp mentioned getting free parking but I don't mind the $5 discount.  The front parking gate card reader was denying access after front desk programmed my room keys.  I tried the back parking gate reader as well with same problem.  At least the back parking lot had a speaker button which dialed to front desk so that they could open the gate for me.  Front desk searched a bit for room upgrade.  Eventually, she found corner king suite with 2 rooms- separate bedroom and living room.  YESSS!!! I overheard the guest checkin a few minutes later looking for similar room.  Beat him to the room within minutes.  The front desk also got me free fountain drink voucher, appetizer voucher, and breakfast buffet voucher.  ALL THREE- THE TRIFECTA!!!KING SUITE ****Missing Peter Thomas Roth body wash so called room service.  Got 2 bottles within minutes from housekeeping.  Great view of the airport from both bedroom and living room.  Dropped off my luggage and went downstairs for quick bite to eat.RESTAURANT ****I had a ginger ale with Ahi tuna seared with black sesame seed crusted.  Quick and wonderful service.  Would have liked to try local brew but voucher only good for non-alcoholic drinks.SWIMMING POOL ****Yes, there were many families but loved the 9ft deep end to go for dives.  Housekeeping was there to stock up on towels for us.  I did a couple of laps and then headed to room for the night.FITNESS CENTER ****Woke up early to get a workout in.  Found the stairmaster similar to the one in the Double Tree Chesterfield.  Got my 30 minutes in before a morning shower followed by breakfast buffet.BREAKFAST BUFFET ****Got an omelet made to order at the grill.  The rest of the buffet was wonderful with plenty of fruit.  I also found small boxes of almond milk and chose the chocolate flavor.  I also found a nice spread of smoked salmon but didn't want to risk it.  The coffee was quite bitter.  Overall, I loved this hotel which reminded me alot of George Clooney's "Air Up There".  I would recommend this to anyone who needs a relaxing vacation.We reserved a room with two beds, so I was a bit stunned that this Hilton did not hold my reservation as one would assume is customary. The room we received was nice, but no surprises at check-in is preferable. There is a charge for parking at Hilton St. Louis Airport. Also, a hot breafast is served at 6 a.m. and the lobby bar remains open until 1 a.m. + room service is available until 11:00 p.m.This is a classic, old-school airport hotel. I dig it. The front desk staff members were really friendly and helpful, and even let me borrow an umbrella when the skies looked threatening. The rooms are smaller, but that's what older hotels are known for... remember, this thing was built before every weenie felt entitled to a McMansion.  With that, the bathrooms are microscopic. I'm a scrawny, short little thing, and even I had a tough time navigating the bathroom door versus the toilet. A few mystery-hairs in the sink, but nothing to get wooged out about. Shower was blessedly pube-free, and the bathroom fan is nice and enthusiastic.If I could make this a 4.5-star review, I would. My only gripe is that I'm having a hard time getting comfy, temperature-wise. It's 90 degrees and humid out, and my room is 70 degrees and sticky. I feel like I'm sticking to everything. I don't know if this is even something the hotel can control or what. Bring baby powder to St. Louis in the summer is what I'm saying. Not a fan of having to pay for parking and wifi, but my corporate rate covers it so luckily it didn't impact me. YMMV.Great hotel, nice room, easy parking.  However, stay away from the restaurant!   Medium = rare, water optional, and waitstaff preps the table for the next customer while you're still sitting there.  Very odd...Great front desk staff, courteous concierge and security staff.A favorite hotel. Excellent service and friendly staff. Good is good but pricey. Close to airport but quiet. Free fast shuttle .I love this hotel.  It's a older full service Hilton across the street from the airport.  This was the Hilton filmed in the movie "Up in the Air".They got rid of their hot tub a couple years ago, so no hot tub.  They have an ok pool and a great fitness center.The bar area has a nice ambiance but service is usually difficult.  The bar is best place for service.  You could sit in the restaurant area but its always dead, not sure why.The rooms are nice and clean and very new looking.  I stay here all the time.  There is plenty of space for many types of meeting from very large to very small.I can only comment on the meeting rooms and the bar as I was there for an event and did not stay.  The meeting rooms are very nice and they do have plenty of them and the food they served at the event wasn't bad at all.  Just upset they ran out of the cheesecake before I could get to it - darn!The bar area can get crowded quickly on the weekends but service was plenty quick enough.  What I do not like about this hotel is that they charge you $10 to park!  Geeze!!!  And unless you get lucky and park in the front or very close in the back, you may have a bit of a hike to get into the hotel.This hotel is pretty nice for the price I paid. I think it was only 50 bucks a night. I loved the beautiful rose decor behind the front desk. The beds were nice and clean and so was the bathroom. What I didn't like was the service I got. I came during a night when they had canceled a flight and had to accommodate those passengers. The lines was insanely long with people all over the place. There were only two people in the front to help out three shuttles worth of people. Also, they only had two luggage carts available and it's not like those guests are going to return the carts right away. I was annoyed. I had a lot of luggage that I didn't want to carry to my room. There were no bellhops to be found either. One thing I also don't like is when hotels have rooms on the first floor. I don't know why that bugs me, but it does. The layout of the hotel was a little confusing and we went down the wrong path to our room. At least we didn't have to carry our luggage a far distance I suppose.
review_content_40: Nice staff. $10 a day to park in their lot. Insane. Go elsewhere  until they become sane.  I would never charge my store customers to park.   $10 per device per day wifi. Insane.  Elevators...  Still free.The location and room decor are the two positive things I can mention; however, what you really must know are the negatives. It is obviously an older hotel that has had some renovation, but not enough. To start, it has a strange, almost musty odor in the halls and elevator. The room doors are old, probably original, which means they are lightweight. They don't close automatically, so you must remember to pull them shut. They are also thin, so you hear the hall noise. The area of the bath with toilet and shower was very tiny, and the door would not close because the lights hung too low. So no privacy. Speaking of privacy, our neighbors on the other side of the wall were probably unaware of their lack of privacy. Otherwise, they might have kept the sounds of their fornicating to a minimum.Just not as nice as the decor suggests.  Staff, especially Andy at the front desk, go out of their way to make me feel welcome.  However the pool was closed, no hot tub, and the decor is kind of fake-high end.  The Hampton Inn I stayed in in Columbia for far less per night had 1.  Hot tub2. Nicer rooms3. Free breakfast4. Free fresh baked cookies on arrival5. Pool that was open and workingLiterally the ONLY thing they have going for them is proximity to the airport, and there are like four hotels in that immediate vicinity.Note:  the things that made the visit special are the personal touch of the employees, such as Andy.  I wish the infrestructure of the hotel were 3/4 as impressive as the commitment of the employees to making my stay pleasant.  Sorry I can't give a better review--but don't hold that against the staff.I was upgraded to the executive level.Breakfast is served on the executive level, for the executive level, in the executive lounge. I got free WiFi with my room, and free parking. Minus a star for jenky iron and ironing board. The rooms are a very nice size, the bed is very comfortable, the gym is well stocked with elipticals and treadmills, the lobby has a bar and a restaurant, and the staff is very nice and helpful.All in all I recommend this place to travelers who find themselves in need of a little R&R.Located directly across from the airport. The area around the airport isn't the best and I stayed here for entire week and the highlight of my day was giving people directions to turn left at the Hustler store. Really a 3  1/2 star review because the Staff is friendly and lobby restaurant/bar is awesome. Carpet looks light my grandfather laid it down. The pool should be reclassified as  a wading pool and they need a hot tub.  For business this place is perfect. For pleasure I would stay downtown.Not a great experience, but the service pulled it together enough that I won't give it two stars.Checked in last Sunday night (Easter night) around Midnight.  They took me to my room which was large and exactly what one would expect from the Hilton...one problem: the room was REALLY warm and humid and adjusting the AC did not quickly remedy the situation.  UGH.  It's not 12:30 and I call down.  They say they'll move me up to an executive suite.Security comes quickly enough to take me to my new room.  It is a bit bigger (like I care I just gotta get some shut eye before checking out early in the morning), but same problem.  I set the temp to 65 (lowest it'll go) nothing seems to happen and minutes later the thermostat auto-adjusts up to 67 and stays there.  It was about 74-76 in my room and humid (not 67), so I slept on the covers.  The television would get stuck on a single channel and not move at worst, and in the morning when I was awake enough to notice, every channel kept skipping as if I was streaming.Went to breakfast.  Not amazing buffet for $17 but they did have LOTS of options despite the mediocre quality.I checked out and mentioned the TV and air and she comped my breakfast to her credit and honestly admitted that they were having some problems with temperature control (I hate it when they "comp" you but treat you incredulously as if you were the first person EVER to complain about ________, so some credit is due there).The people were really friendly overall.I was looking forward to flaking out with some beers and bar food after a rough series of meetings. The hotel front clerk asked me three times about aspects of my check in after I had already told her, obvisouly paying NO attention. The bar was fully loaded due to construction in the dining room, no seating. Went to the Waffle House down the road, and it was pretty good! The place is seedy and beat. No iron int eh closet despite there being an ironing board. No foldy thing that holds your suitcase. And this is a full service hotel? It will be a LONG time before I pay a premium to stay in a "full service" hotel. Lousy performance, Hilton. Had to pay for parking and Wi Fi to add to the insult. Next time, Hampton or anywhere else.I am very impressed by this hotel. The hotel doesn't look all that great from the outside, but the inside is actually very attractive. Decor is right on point. Everyone... And I mean everyone was so friendly. We also got a discount for being military. Our parking and breakfast were free.Ugh, I want to rate this 5 stars, but our linens had some dirty stains, my glass cup at breakfast was cracked. The silver wear didn't look like it was cleaned very well.  But overall, I would recommend this place.Hotel was great. The restaurant has to be one of the worst hotel restaurants ever. Food was always cold and tasteless.Amazing staff (Ashley) took care of my colleague and myself after understanding our situation missing our United Airline flight to San Francisco Airport. They honestly took better care of us than the airline. Thank you.While the title Hilton usually inspires a certain level of class and quality, this one does NOT live up to those standards. The lobby is beautiful but once you go past that area, the ceiling tiles are covered in water stains, the furniture is showing it's wear, and the wall paper is even bubbling and falling off in sections. The staff is very friendly but can't erase the stains in the bath tub or the missing knob on the closet...The hotel would have easily had 4 stars had there not been ants in my room, crawling all over my lamp.  The front desk gave me a Starbucks gift card on my way out when I pointed it out in the morning (I had to deal with the ants myself the night before - too tired/too late to call housekeeping to do something I could have done myself).  I have a feeling, from how well-run the rest of the hotel was, that this was a fluke...but a fluke nevertheless.The lobby is absolutely lovely and beautiful, and was part of the George Clooney "Up in the Air" movie.This was one of the places I stayed when I first visited St. Louis.  It's got a convenient shuttle to the airport that departs whenever you want it to and at a regular time during rush times.The hotel staff are fantastic and friendly. The restaurant "World's Away" is great for breakfast but VERY hit and miss on other meals. Overpriced for slow, under-seasoned and off-temp foods.For a hotel next to the airport, it's fine. A bit dates but comfortable. Ask for a tower room. They are more comfortable. Staff is very helpful. Business center, 24 hour fitness center. Good enough for one night.The overall hotel is nice.  However, don't waste your time eating in the bar area.  The service was great.  Mandie our waitress too very good care of everyone.  Now the food... Hmm the best thing was the raviolis & shrimp cocktail in the starters menu.  The  white turkey chili was more like soup than chili and the ahi tuna had zero flavor but lots of sesame seeds.  I needed up going to bed hungry.  At least the wine was good.Very nice room...  no fridge, but still, very comfortable room.  King size bed, couch, granite tabletops.  Nice gym with cardio machines, dumbells universal cables, benches and room to stretch.  Beautiful place to remain indoors while humid heat reigns outside.  Monkey hopes to return early enough to enjoy the bar.The front desk staff-- and in fact, all staff-- are very, very nice and helpful and hospitable. The rooms are okay- a little dated but also a little unclean. The bathroom had a lot of hairs that weren't mine and dust all over the floor. The bathtub and bathroom door were dingy. However, the Phillip Thomas Roth bath products were great. The main problem I had with this hotel is that I just could not get a good night's sleep- there is so much weird noise. The first room I had exposed me to some kind of blower that sounded like a lawn mower starting up every eight minutes or so. I also could hear the person next door snoring! There is no sound proofing at all. In the room I switched to, there seemed to be people taking showers pretty much all night long and slamming doors. There just is no insulation from noise, which sucks when you have to go to meetings after no sleep. I appreciate the shuttle to the airport and other nearby areas and it is very close to the airport. But that's about it. It's not near downtown at all and the restaurant menu is really not very vegetarian-friendly. I will say that the pool is nice and open till 11. I don't know what they can do about the noise at night but that is definitely my biggest problem with this hotel.Great location in terms of airport proximity. Friendly staff. Not exactly comparable to other Hiltons, but it works for those nights when you arrive on a late flight and simply need a bed. It seems as though they also offer a program to rent out parking spots to people as an alternative to airport parking.Good location but ridiculously thin walls in the room. you can here what your next door guests talk on the phone. And parking is not free. Not recommend this hotel. Go somewhere else.I only stayed for a few hours, but I thought it was very nice and upscale compared to most hotels in the area. I felt more comfortable here and the rooms were nice and clean. I did get free parking because I stayed barely 24 hours.
review_content_60: You know, I love Hilton most of the time.  This particular Hilton just doesn't do it for me.The parking, being so close to the airport = not cool.  It's free if you're a Diamond, but you have to check in before you can actually park, as it's keyed.  I can understand why, but that is annoying.Also, as a Diamond, I'm usually used to getting decent room placement/etc.  The last 2 times, near the elevator.  Although you would think that 3 rooms away from the elevator would prevent the elevator noise.  Right?  Negatory.  The first hour I really thought I was hearing something, or that there was a strange construction event happening.  Nope, it was the elevator.The food here was decent for a big Hilton, but not terrific.  It feels like they just mailed it in a little bit at this Hilton, knowing they'd get tons of traffic no matter what, as they are RIGHT next to Lambert and they'll capture the business and airline travelers.  Disappointing.  At least I still racked up points to eventually use at a kick-ass Hilton, like the one we used in France.  Or Rome.  Fo reals. :)Very nice renovation from my last visit. I look forward to my next stay. Good Job!I am a Hilton Honors member, and wanted to use some accumulated points to stay the night in St Louis, since I was out there for business.  I tried to book my 'rewards' stay at the Hampton Inn, but was forced to settle on the Hilton St Louis Airport.Upon arrival, I noticed that this hotel was pretty 'state of the art'... for 1978 (or whatever year it was built).Side Note: I've stayed at Hilton's before, using my rewards points.  Other locations have a specific Hilton Honors desk, to allow members quick check-in, check-out, or issue resolution.This hotel didn't have the Honors desk, but they did have an Honors kiosk.  Good enough, right?  So I proceeded to use the automated screen to facilitate my check-in.  I made it all the way through, and was waiting for it to encode my room keys, but it must not have been my lucky day.  Instead, I received a printed scrap of paper instructing me to complete my check-in at the registration desk.I think there might have been a seminar and a large family reunion going on that day, given the amount of people waiting in line at the registration desk.  I gathered up my bags, and tottered to the end of the line with my slip of parchment.While waiting in line, I struck up a conversation with another Hilton Honors member, relishing our newfound experience with the latest in guest hospitality technology.I eventually received my room key (#302), and headed to the elevator.  As I made my way down the 3rd floor hallway to my room, (which was all the way at the end, but I really needed the walk) I came across a sizable mess (on the carpet) with disclaimers posted all around (see hotel pictures).Once I walked into my non-smoking room #302, I ascertained the distinctive aroma of cigarette smoke.  The bouquet became more pungent as I made my way into the bathroom.  I called the front desk and explained my situation, and a very nice associated told me to come back to the front desk for a room change.With my second set of room keys in hand (#308), I charted a course for the elevator.  Walking down the 3rd floor hallway once more, I spied some Tootsie Roll wrappers strewn about the mess on the carpet.Note to Self: If you don't want to clean something up, just post several 8 1/2 " x 11" notices in the general vicinity.This room was much better smelling.  I dropped my bags on the bed and was about to head out to catch a Cardinals game, when I felt an impending force on my nether regions.  I felt it prudent to resolve the situation prior to the 40 minute Metro Link ride.  That's about the time I was introduced to the Hilton brand 'Tight Squeeze' toilet.  That, my friend, can only be described as one leg constrained by the tub, and the other by the wall.When I returned to the hotel, after the game, I headed straight to the lounge for a few Hefeweizens.  I ended up ordering the Beef Tenderloin Tapas appetizer, which was delicious, yet not too expensive (around $11).I headed up to the room and hit the shower which maintained a good amount of water pressure.  The towels were fairly soft.  After adjusting the thermostat, I fell into bed, which I must say was very comfy.I awoke a little before 9am to housekeeping knocking on my door.  I yelled out something to the effect that checkout time wasn't for another three hours, which seemed to satisfy their aspirations to further whack the door.I rolled out of bed, flipped on the news, and filled the sink with water so I could shave.  Unbeknown to me, the sink was slowly draining, causing me to momentarily rush the razor blades across my jugular area.  Fortunate for me, I was using the Gillette Fusion 5-blade battery operated razor, which always gives a comfortable close shave.I headed down to check my bags, so I wouldn't have to lug them around the Anheuser Busch tour.  A very friendly associate tagged and stored my belongings in a secured area.  When I arrived back, I picked up my articles without incident.Swoop Says: If you don't expect much, and can get the room for $55 or less through Hotwire, I'd consider it a deal.  However, I wouldn't blow 20,000 Hilton Honors points, unless you absolutely can't get into anything else.~SwoopExcellent hotel. Although it is an "airport" hotel, it is located off of a freeway with easy access to the attractions in St. Louis. The employees are very friendly. One of the employees from reception even remembered my name as she wished me good night. I stayed in a very spacious room with 2 queen beds. The hotel was recently renovated so expect to see new furnishings and a clean, sleek look. The hotel bar in the lobby gets crowded on the weekend. I'm not sure if these folks were locals or guests attending a convention at the hotel. Regardless, eat dinner and have a drink at the bar. The wait staff and bartender were very attentive. Get the Caesar Salad! It's super yummy.Overnight parking for hotel guests is $10 each day. The airport is a short 2 minute car ride away or take the airport shuttle offered by the hotel.Today I will be checking out of Hilton St. Louis Airport. My stay was okay considering I am leaving for a deployment today. The front desk staff and concierge was top notch. Especially the airport shuttle attendants. Oscar and Tommy went out of their to assist many times. I did have a few issues. Housekeeping almost always came by at early in the morning. I usually was awakened by their loud talking in the hallway before they even got to my door. One day specifically I heard one talk on the phone as she told the person on the line to hold on while she knocked on a door. Granted it is holiday season and a lot of people are usually communicating with families to make arrangements but i don't think the hallway is the appropriate setting for doing that. Also if I called for housekeeping, the housekeeper would not come until maybe 3 hours later. I understand the hotel has had renovations but the housekeeping section maybe a little under par. Other than that my hotel stay was okay. Not the quite the Hilton experience I was going for but it will have to do. The location was alright considering that the Airport was connected to the public transportation train. That was great. $7 for a day pass and it is well worth it! St. Louis did not have as much sightseeing as I thought it would but it is a great city. Might not comeback but it was nice to say I came.I love, love, love this hotel!!  Seriously, if I ever come back to STL, I am definitely staying here!!The staff is SO nice, friendly, and helpful.  Anytime I saw someone they would greet me with a smile and ask what they could do for me--even when there was nothing to do!  They were all so awesome.For example, my friend and I went down to the "gift shop" to get some milk one evening for the kids to have with dinner.  There were three staff members stocking the area, but I didn't see milk.  I was in the middle of telling my friend that I would just go to the gas station for milk, and my hero, Adriana, asks me what I am looking for.
