When I explained what I needed, she went to the back and got us SIX cartons of milk!  FOR FREE.  We were ready to pay gas station prices for them.  I was SO grateful, and I know my son was, too.The only problem we had was Saturday when we came back from the zoo for our kids to nap.  Housekeeping had just started cleaning the room, and she said she would be back in two hours to finish and that it was no problem because she was there til 6.  Well, she never came back.  So we had to call and ask for towels, and a garbage bag, etc.  But if that's my only issue, I will take it!I LOVED our stay here, and I know my friend feels the same!Q: What happens when a lot of people are trying very hard, but not quite succeeding?A: A 3 star Yelp review gets written.I really feel like that sums it up. Pretty much everybody here was trying hard to make this a good experience. Everybody was courteous and polite. But they kept messing up.Good: Great selection of fresh fruit at breakfast buffetBad: Really expensive breakfast buffet ($16 I think?)Good: Clean, large room. Cleaning staff that go out of their way to make sure your room stays clean.Bad: Front desk people give different answers at different times, some were smart, some were clueless. They called the worst cab driver of my life.Good: Punctual, free shuttle every 15 minutes to the airport. Shuttle driver, when asked about what he thinks about the womenfolk of STL, says "Well... They're all lesbians. This here's the lesbian capital of the midwest, probably the country, maybe the world."Bad: $10/day wifi. Seriously guys? Seriously?!? You mean to tell me that something that Starbucks offers for free after you've bought a couple dollar coffee you'll charge me $10 for after I've rented a hundred dollar room? Thank god for cell phone tethering.Good: Comfortable bed.Bad: They charged a dollar for a minute long local phone call.Good: Location is very close to the airportBad: Airport is close to nothing whatsoever.So yeah - plenty of good and bad. I dunno - I'd stay here again if the price was right. But the nickle and diming needs to stop. And they just need to get their act together in general.40 Minute shuttle wait at the (cold and rainy) airport  Called the hotel but was served unresponsive, disconnected, if lazy phone assistance, all the time saying dismissively "he'll be right there". 10 others who were also waiting and calling, were similarly frustrated. Clearly the octogenarian driver had other things to do than attend to customers.  Arriving at the hotel, come to find our that there is no power near the desk (it's behind it, which you can get to if you get on the floor and reach up). Next the internet didn't work. I expect Hilton to be at the top of the hospitality game. Unfortunately I got (and others) a Motel 6 effort and even worse display of professionalism and hospitality. There are plenty of other spots around the airport. I suggest that you try those first. Stay away from Hilton - St. Louis Airport. David BantlyHilton Diamond; Marriott Plat; Holiday Plat; Hyatt Plat...it's not my first rodeo but this is my first blog complaint. Don't like "hating" but this is an unacceptable performance.Friendliest, most welcoming staff in recent travel experiences! Clean, smart decor. Will DEFINITELY stay here again - family or business travel.This hotel is horrible. They nickle and dime you for everything. Parking? $10. Internet? $10. Per device. That's right. Want to use your work laptop? $10. iPad? That's another $10. Personal laptop? Another $10. In the year of our lord two thousand and twelve. Other issues: The rooms don't have mini-refrigerators, which I find very frustrating. There is no handsoap in the bathrooms. There is no channel listings in the rooms. The TV in the room is slow, and does not have an onscreen guide. Just changing the channels is a chore. Also the thermostat did not work in my room. I was sweating. In February.Rarely do you find an airport hotel worthy of 5 stars-but this one just hits all the right notes!  The staff is friendly, even cleaning staff is socially spot on!  The rooms are consistently nice, clean, fully stocked with amenities.  In 5 years of staying here a few times a year I've never encountered a room that wasn't picture perfect.  Now that's consistency!  The bar/restaurant area is modern with a classy yet comfortable feel.  Our server last night, Eric, was outstanding and saved one of our folks from getting a lap full of wine.  The gym has just about everything you need; free weights, standard assortment of cardio equipment, strength training station and medicine balls.  Plus, it's just spacious enough to have your own space without feeling claustrophobic.  5 years and going strong, a great hotel pick here in STL!This hotel could very easily be a 4.5 star property, if not for a couple of minor issues. First, the rooms are very nicely updated, with excellent beds, LCD TVs and couches. Unfortunately, I had a slow sink leak, which I reported at checkout. The thing that really bothered me, however, was the lack of maid service. I had the DND sign on my door until about Noon on my second day, and upon returning to the room at 5:30 PM, there had been no maid service. No refreshed towels, coffee, etc. A phone call would've been nice if they intended not to provide the service because of the sign on the door, but nothing.The lounge was nice (Stacy and Lena were excellent waitresses), the meeting rooms were great, and the fitness center was superb, with disinfectant wipes and plenty of water and towels. The front desk staff was just okay; when my room key failed to get me in the fitness center, I was greeted with scrutiny but no apology. Unfortunately, at least for my experience, any one employee can negatively impact a guest's stay.Rooms were typical but always stocked with water daily. Eric in the bar is amazing!! Great service with a smile!! Ask the front desk for appetizer and drink coupons upon check-in!!Apparently, they sold out last night, so no early check in for me. I think I'm officially done with this Hilton.I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member. With this status, Hilton hotels will usually go out of their way to accommodate you. Not this one. While most things are pretty standard, I didn't get that next level of service I have grown accustom to.And my biggest pet peeve is their separate wing. I travel with lots of luggage. It is not easy getting all the way to the rooms on the other wing of the hotel.3 stars. My experience with this hotel has never been better than just ok.This is a beautifully decorated Hilton, large plush chairs and vintage photos of the St. Louis airport and plane travel. Gilded floor-length mirrors took my breath away and my room was more than comfortable. So what happened to all the stars?? Bar: I ate at the bar. Well, kind of. I ordered at the bar and nibbled my food before I got grossed out and left. I ordered a drink, which was way too strong, but I guess a strong drink is better than a weak one. Next, I ordered some meat skewers and just before they arrived, I hear someone hock a loogie in the kitchen. SERIOUSLY?!?!??! Needless to say, I thoroughly inspected my food, nibbled the tip and left the whole dish sitting there. I paid and left the waiter staring at my full cocktail glass and untouched plate of food. I took away the third star for the expensive parking (~$20) each night!I am sure there are better hotels in the STL area, I love this city......but I don't want to stay at this hotel ever again.This is a pretty nice hotel by St. Louis standards! It's really classy and the lobby, bar, restaurant are all pretty fancy! Especially for the area around the airportEasy Location and friendly staff but that's about itOkay, so we arrived via the rental car agency (see review Alamo St Louis Airport). Pulling in to the parking lot you have to park in the front of the building and go check in before you can park for good which is weird as it takes a room key and $10 overnight to park. In addition getting out of the poled off parking section was difficult. Every day I left I had to make a 3 point turn in order to pick up my elderly family members at the door because the exit is positioned to leave the premise. Check in was smooth and the clerk was nice. For this trip which was a funeral, I booked an executive king which at this hotel is situated on the top floor (9th). The decor of the small lobby seemed pleasant but plain. Located across from the checkout counter is the restaurant which was decorated in a 1970's color and lighting theme and not on purpose I'm afraid, a few seats and the bar area is also dated decor. The bar area does contain a couple of flat screen HDTVs and the area seemed okay but because it is open and not really isolated from the main corridor to the rooms, not very inviting. I was told that the concierge service for the executive rooms is not available for the weekend and I was given 4 soft drink or tea coupons and 4 appetizer coupons which I used in the Constellations restaurant (see review) with my relatives on the last day. This gesture, dollar wise was a great deal but the food, well more on that later. The bar is not staffed or served during the day which seemed odd. Overall, the food served at this hotel seemed just so so. Some of my relatives ate at the all you can eat breakfast buffet for $14.95 and said it was good. I ordered muffins from room service one day which were kind of dry and expensive at $8 so for the money and the overall foodie breakfast thing , I'd say you'd be better off walking or driving a block down to the Golden Pancake  (see review).  As for the room (934), it was nicely decorated and laid out well with the position of the couch, tables and king sized bed. It took me a minute to find the TV remote which was on the bedside table closest to the wall. The picture on the 32" HDTV set was decent but was satellite and kept going in and out for no reason. The bathroom is the same layout as most of the Hiltons I have been in recently with the door opening inward to the tub which makes for close quarters, marble tops and a drop white sink. In my room the faucet was loose on the cold side and took a bit to come on. The shower is a basic one knob turn kind with fine jets or thicker jets as the only settings. Every shower had good hot water and like other Hilton properties they used the new name brand natural soap that I have grown to love. The room does not have a microwave, or a mini fridge and only a small no name coffee maker that seemed to do the trick for my wife but was nothing to brag about. The only Internet service offered was for HHonors members like me, and the service was slow and only wireless.  The real problems arose in the room with sleeping. First you will discover that the curtain is backward with the shears inside so to open the curtain and let some light in you must open the shears and let everyone gaze upon your Adonis. Next up for the darkness factor, the light that pours from the door is just crazy insane. On my 1 to 10 scale with 10 being pitch dark this is like a 5. It's not totally un-sleepable, but really it's a lot of hallway light and a towel in front of it only blocks 3 out of the 4 laser beams! The bed itself is a true king with pillows and duvet matching all Hiltons at this time (white fluffy and feather pillows) however this bed was lumpy and had a divot and my wife and I were forced apart on the edges of the bed in order to not keep rolling into one another. I would expect this in a lower class hotel but not here.  The room was cool, but not cold and I later found out that the weird noise that kept me up all night was a frozen over air conditioner which explains why it said it was 65f all the time when it really didn't feel like it. So overall if you are looking to do a quick an easy stay close to the airport, say you were an airline employee, then sure this is your place but short of that I was not impressed at all.The hotel seemed OK, nice lobby and clean appearance. The parking fee of $!0 on your room every night was OK - but really an open lot without security? The room was nice - but a ridiculous fee for wireless internet access even if you are a Hilton Honors member - I have been to many Hiltons that were nice - you are taking down a good name.  Oh, and get a restaurant in that huge lobby - what a waste of space!Once again I had a great stay at this location. I stayed for the weekend, for a wedding I was attending/planning. Check in was a breeze. I was greeted with a "welcome back". That was a great touch to acknowledge that I am a returning customer! When I got to my room, I had a personalized note from the staff, welcoming me back and provided a phone number to call in case I had any issues....again perfect!!! Along with a couple of meal/drink tickets!!! Once again I love this location. The attention to detail and care taken to acknowledge the customer is great!So while at this point I won't  change the rating review - I will certainly give them a second chance. The way the management responded was A+.
review_content_80: I stayed at this hotel for two weeks for sales training... The staff was very friendly and professional... They were also very helpful in getting us to the local galleria mall on the weekend... The food was not great, but it was decent.  Overall, a good experience.My review will be based on the rooms, food, and service Hotel includes restaurant, buffet, bar, lounge and pool Room - pleasant and comfortable. I did not have many issues. The only one being my bathroom flush didn't work well. Besides that everything ran smoothly. Food - good selection but WAY overpriced. $18 for a breakfast buffet is not reasonable. I only had breakfast and lunch at the buffet and they were both pretty good. Lunch did not have much selection however it was good quality. The menu in the bar and restaurant is the same. I had dinner at the bar and the menu did not have many non-meat selections. Gym - small gym with most of the essential machines. The pool was indoor and medium size with no jacuzzi. Service was GREAT. They were very helpful. Whether it was the front desk, room service or the restaurant, they were always willing to assist you! Overall, I would stay here if I was not planning on being in the hotel for long periods of time and I would not recommend staying here if you are vacationing. The hotel is located in an area where there is not much to do in terms of entertainment. If you want to be in a central location stay at the Hilton at ballpark in downtown. However, this hotel is a good place for meetings and executive events. It has good rooms for meetings with food and beverages that are restocked often.I slept better in this hotel than in any other hotel in years.  I have been meaning to try this hotel for a long time, but the opportunity never presented itself until just this weekend when I needed a place to stay after arriving from a long flight.  You know how it can be arriving late at a hotel.  I was sleepy, tired and just ready to go to bed.  I picked up my car at Hertz next door to the hotel and drove to the hotel and parked in the designated check in spaces.  The front desk personnel kindly explained the parking and how to get to the room.  The parking lot is huge, but I managed fine.  The things I, as a business traveler - but this time as a personal traveler - value are a good bed, quiet and a great breakfast.  Theyreally hit the target for me on all counts.I found the room, which was on the executive floor, very well appointed.  I liked that I could change the temperature in the room to what it needed to be for me to make it comfortable.  I had to take a shower since I had a late flight and felt sweaty - the bathroom was nicely appointed with towels, soap (for both the sink and the bath), shampoo, and a very welcome handle on the shower to hold on to.  This is one of those hotels which is solidly built not to have plumbing noise come into the room and the bathroom felt well built.  The sink was one of those new ones and very nice to use.  The bed was wonderful.  The bedding was genuinely comfortable and the pillows made it easy for me to not only sleep, but all through the night without disturbance.   This hardly happens to me on the first night in any hotel, but it happened here and that is, after all, what a hotel is primarily for.The breakfast in the morning was delicious and fresh.  It was a buffet, but this was one of the best ones I have seen where the food is really nicely done.  I loved the variety and the service by the waiters in the dining area was exceptional.  This really was one of the best breakfasts I have enjoyed at a hotel buffet.The personnel I encountered at the front desk were very attentive and helpful.  All around, I had a great overnight here and when the occasion comes again as surely it will when I have to arrive late again and need a place to stay before embarking on a long drive in the morning - I will use the St. Louis Airport Hilton again.Great hotel for a pretty good price. Great workout facility, very nice lobby and lobby bar. Was surprised how good the food was in the restaurant there. Free wifi in the lobby always helps too. Rooms were a little dated feeling, but nice. Staff were all very nice.Love the renovation.  Was here on a coaching/speaking event.  Love the staff!!  Was here for 5 days and they just make you feel like family!!  From the front desk to the kitchen staff!!!  BRAVO to you all!!!Very nice airport hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for future "park and fly" trips. They have a gated secure parking area in the back for long term parking. They give you a pass if you stay at the hotel for parking in long term. Shuttle was very quick. The room was very nice. The bed was top notch, very comfy! nice lcd tv screen, carpet, and pillows! Only thing that I didn't like was the toilet was super loud when you flushed. I like not having a clogged toilet don't get me wrong, but this thing sounded like a jet take off when you flush! kinda made it hard when you don't wanna wake other people in the room or even next door.Food was terrible, but the service was outstanding. The staff went above and beyond, and they were completely pleasant. The hotel was lovely, and bed was comfortable. I would consider staying here again...just not eating here.Very nice hotel with very helpful and courteous staff.   WiFi free to Diamond members.Nice hotel set up.  Very clean and well organized.  Rooms, as always were great.  Friendly staff but very inefficient bell hops.  Restaurant was pretty good but a limited selection.Loved my room. Comfy bed with heavenly pillows. Place is fairly clean and well decorated. Lobby restaurant could use some type of door entry and not just open to the lobby. There was a constant draft coming in. Staff is very friendly and welcoming. Minus a star for expensive and not so great internet.This hotel was recently renovated and is amazing. The rooms are very comfortable and very very comfortable. The food is great as well. It is one of the nicest Hilton properties I have ever stayed in. The rooms are all decorated with TWA memories and is very charming!Terrible. We were placed in a room that was on the ground floor and seemed to have an overall dampness. Not sure if the AC just couldn't handle the heat or if something else was going on. Upon requesting another room, we were moved across the hall. Same thing (not that I expected much different). As nice as the hotel was (beautiful interior, that is - the exterior leaves much to be desired), I was surprised by the service we received from the front desk staff. We left the hotel and stayed elsewhere. If we go back to St. Louis, we'll probably stay closer to downtown. If we MUST stay near the airport, maybe I'll try the Renaissance.Price was OK as we have a corporate discount. Hotel needs a good manager. Dishes at breakfast buffet were washed but not clean. Coffee machine in room still had previous guests coffee in it. Room had a vent in the closet that was allowing cold air in.Staff was nice. Decorations were nice. When I come to St. Louis again, I will stay somewhere else.Stay here for the week for business and got special deal at executive floor. The whole place has been renovated, how ever my bathroom toilet didn't flush properly, the room is kinda small with no fridge. However you do get LCD TV, and lobby has Mac with free internet access. There's $10 for internet access daily and parking as well. The room service food is bad, I suggest you go out of hotel if you got an car. Bandanna BBQ is an great place to go just 2 minutes away.  It's next to Hertz car rental which is really convenient .Our team stayed here during our MRL weekend in St. Louis and we were very pleased. Location, partking and amenities were first-rate, as was the customer service. Staff always said "yes" to everything we asked and never made an issue of it. Our rooms were very comfortable, the breakfast buffet was very good and the prices were reasonable for a hotel of this type.

review_content: The Crown Plaza - Downtown Hotel has it's positives and negatives. But its an decent place to stay.Lets talk about the positives. The hotel location is great!  You are within walking distance to all the good stuff like the stadiums, museums and restaurants. You have to pay for parking, but its only 10 bucks per night and that's not bad for downtown. The hotel also has a roof top pool and observation deck with a killer view of the Gateway Arch. The staff of the hotel is really friendly too. They set me up with a room looking right at the arch when I asked for it. So don't hesitate to ask for what you want to look at :-) Most of my pictures below are of the stuff I liked.The main negative for this hotel is that its old... It looks like they are doing some renovations, but the overall feel is still meh. The room itself and bathroom was nice and modern. But the hallway getting to the room was super dated, with a loud ice machine. Try not staying in rooms ending with 06, 07, or 20 since they are right next to the loud ice machine. The flooring throughout the hotel is old and there is a lot of cracked tile everywhere. I don't believe that the negatives will keep me from coming back. It's an OK hotel, that's right in the center where you want to be, and at a good rate.I have to say I was disappointed overall in my experience at the Crowne Plaza.  I'd like to give you a recount of my weekend at the hotel, so you can get a whole picture.  When I checked in to room 2111, the room I was in felt warm, but I figured the air conditioning just hadn't been on and it would cool down.  It was a pretty warm day in STL, so I wanted to give the room time to cool off, as it was hot in there.  I also noticed dust on the dresser where the TV was and dirt on the makeup mirror in the bathroom, which is not my previous experiences with IHG hotels.  I didn't say anything that first day, thinking I was only there for two nights and if the room cooled down I could overlook the other issues.  I brought my own wipes and cleaned things off myself.  My general impression that first day was that this hotel really needs to be renovated and updated.  I stay in hotels a lot all around the U.S. and I have never seen a hotel that needed updating as much as this one.Unfortunately, that first night was pretty unbearable.  Both myself and my friend with me were really hot all night long.  Neither one of us got much sleep that night at all.  The next morning, I called the front desk and was told the air conditioning is off for the winter.  Whoever I talked to apologized and said she would send the engineer to my room to have them turn on the air conditioner in my room.  I left for a few hours and was hoping the air would be on when I got back.  Unfortunately, when I returned the engineer had been in my room, but the air was not on.  The only thing that had been done was a box fan was left in the room and the curtains closed to keep the heat out.  I then called the front desk and spoke with someone else, who told me the air conditioning is off for the whole hotel for the winter and it wasn't coming back on.  It would have been nice if the first person had told me this.  I asked if I could at least get another fan in the room, since there were two of us staying in two beds.  I was told another fan would be brought up.  I was again leaving for a few hours and was hoping at least for a second fan when I returned.When I got back the second time, the second fan was still not there.  This is when I called IHG and let them know this hotel is not in line with the standards of IHG.  Emili then promptly called me and offered me an upgraded suite, which she said is usually cooler.  The problem is there were two of us staying in the hotel.  The suite only had one bed and neither one of us wanted to sleep on a sofa bed.  I declined the suite and asked Emili again if I could just please get another fan for the room.  She agreed and said someone would bring one up.  She also told me the air conditioning would be coming on that night.  I again left for a while and when I returned, I still didn't have a second fan in the room.  I called the front desk when I returned and told them I needed a second fan in the room; and also expressed that I was told twice earlier in the day I would be getting one and still didn't have one.  The person I talked to said someone would bring one up immediately.  That second fan never came.  The good thing that happened that second night is the air conditioning did come on, so it was a little more bearable to sleep that second night.  After a long day, my friend and I went to watch some TV and the TV didn't work either.  When I called for help with the TV, a very friendly gentleman came up and switched out the remote controls to make it work.  He was very nice and I appreciated at least one thing getting fixed during my stay. I have to tell you if I had been staying more than two nights, I would have checked out and went to get a room next door at the Hyatt, even if I had to pay.  That is where I spent all of my time outside of my room at a hotel that weekend.  I know it's not entirely your fault, but I would convey to whoever needs told that this hotel is dingy, dirty, and quite honestly the attitude of the staff is mixed.  Emili was very nice when she called, but a few others at the front desk seemed to just generally have an attitude.  I will say the gentleman who checked me in was very friendly.  As you can imagine, this gives me a generally poor impression of IHG.  I find this whole experience surprising because the Crowne Plaza is supposed to be IHG' s luxury hotel.When I called IHG, I was hoping they would at least refund half of my points for the first night.  They have not and I can understand this, since I did stay there.  When I return to St Louis, I will definitely not stay at the Crowne Plaza againDidn't have much interaction with employees. Was in town for a concert weekend. This place needs a serious renovation. Faded paint , dirty carpet, broken bathroom fixtures. We had no heat during our stay, in winter? Should be priced more like Motel6 At least our floor was relatively quiet and hotel is a decent location.Not a bad hotel for a good price. The lobby and bar area looked nice, but the corridors and elevators were as some of the other reviewers have stated, "old-school". Their were definitely some cleaning issues as well. The place looked a bit shabby in quite a few places around the hotel. The room layout was a bit odd, but my room had a great balcony with a not so bad view of the Gateway Arch (a leg of it anyway LOL). The shower was a mixed bag. It had really good water pressure and was capable of good and hot temperatures. Unfortunately it had a bad temperature control valve. There were only two temperatures; SCALDING HOT & FREEZING COLD...  I made the mistake of having breakfast in the Union Grill hotel restaurant. It had the same cleaning issues as the rest of the hotel with a hotel priced sub-par buffet. I think that I would probably stay here again if the price was right. Although I would like to try another hotel on my next visit to STL. I used Orbitz and came in about thirty bucks cheaper than CP's advertised price.Average. That's the word I keep coming back to. There are parts of this hotel that look incredibly dated, and the first impression I got walking in is that it's an old hotel. Once you get into the room it looks like the furniture is recent but the wallpaper and air conditioner are not. The bathroom is small and old but clean. The room itself is good sized. Service is a mixed bag. Some people are good at customer service, some aren't. It's the luck of the draw. The hallways aren't as clean as they should be. But the bed is comfortable and the sheets clean. Breakfast is fairly good. As is typical for a hotel it's overpriced for what you get. The restaurant staff is attentive and there's a nice view of the arch in the dining room. I ate in the lounge one night; the food wasn't bad but wasn't outstanding. The service at the bar was lacking. The bartender doted on regulars and talked to her friends but left me waiting a lot. Pro tip: self park your car. Besides the self parking being $10/day instead of $20 for valet, the valet situation is horrid. You're recommended to call down for your car 20 minutes ahead of time. So the drive fills up with cars waiting to be claimed. Meanwhile the attendant will leave you waiting. And waiting. And waiting longer than 20 minutes. Don't bother. The rates here are cheaper than the others nearby, but the other hotels are nicer. It's not a dump, but just know that there are some trade offs for a low rate.Seven stars for an incredible staff. Nice lobby. Reasonable parking for its location ($10). Minus five for the room.There's no nice way to say this: the building is a dilapidated relic. The newest thing in the room is the tv, at least it is a flat screen. Fridge and microwave are a nice touch, still old. Room was clean and large, crazy with wasted space, old furniture, crappy old fixtures. My room was right next to the elevator. You could hear it all night long, like there wasn't even a wall there. Slamming, people whistling, talking loudly, it went on all night. That stunk.The bathroom. Ugh. Seriously dated, thinking 1970's remodel? The shower had two temperatures: glacier-fed and scalding. I ended up having to devise a kind of sponge bath because I'm just not into torture. The soaps were nice.The furnace, God bless it, tried. Too bad it isn't adjustable. Brrr.The view from the balcony is spectacular. There is a lot of potential here. I hope a major overhaul is in the works. Until then, it is way overpriced for a glorified Motel 6.This place is going to make me withdraw from the IHG Rewards program,  We had a family meet up here to have a good weekend and a Father's Day celebration. It was awful, the place was dirty, the staff was surly and I will never return.When we arrived in our room (2BR  suite with a sitting room) we had 1 towela busted lamp shadea fist hole in the bathroom door2 Pair of dirty underwear1 wash cloth tossed behind the couch that was all stuck together (you figure it out)In the morning we had two leaks in the ceiling.The staff made no attempt to correct this and then they locked us out of our room and resold it, giving us a room with two beds and a couch. DO NOT STAY HERE!This is probably one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at, they had a deal to stay here for for about $60 a night, boy was that a bad idea.  The lobby and downstairs are nice but the rooms are gross and disgusting. It definitely needs to be renovated. While it is convenient next to the arch, Pay a little more and stay at the Hyatt or the Hilton just next door. The furniture is all scratched and dented, the bed is on a metal box spring so it is super noisy. The closet door was even broken so you couldn't close it after opening it. STAY AWAY!Not staying here again.Our group came to St. Louis to attend Mardi Gras festivities. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza in 2014 (during this stay our room type had been overbooked so we were upgraded complimentary, at which we were surprised about but still content). During this stay, though, we had requested a roll-away to be placed in the room. The roll-away was not in the room at check-in so we reminded the front desk as we left for dinner. Upon returning much later at night (~11pm), our roll-away was still not in the room. I went down to the front desk to remind the agent one more time. Now, I work as a front desk manager as well and I believe there is a certain manner in which you handle disgruntled guests. The MOD at the time notified me that I could not get a roll-away because we had 5 beds in the room! 5! We were in your suite which came with a king bed, a queen bed and a pull-out. The woman did not even bother checking before she stated this. When I proceeded to tell her we only had 3 beds in the room, I was given the reply "Alright, well he's got a LONG list of stuff to do so it's going to be a while." Again, at least tell me that you are working as fast as you can - don't give me the impression that chances are slim of me even getting the roll-away I had REQUESTED WHEN I MADE THE RESERVATION! At this point I clearly saw that the woman did not want to deal with me and told me that I would be "taken care of." I reminded her that this was not my first time requesting the item at which point she started to walk away. I have video/audio proof of this entire conversation and am highly disappointed with the training here - especially for your MOD (who should be setting an example for the rest of her GSA's). I understand that it is Mardi Gras and that you do not want to deal with inebriated guests - this was not my case. What baffles me the most is that upon having a side-conversation with my colleague regarding your agent's attitude, she overheard me mention that I took a video of the proceedings. She then called me aside and stated that "I do not appreciate being video taped, I'm going to call the police." She proceeded to pick up the phone and imitate calling the police - at which point I told her I would wait in the lobby for them to show. I'm assuming she never called them because no one ever came. We will not be staying at your hotel anymore - not because of the rooms or any issues with the facility - but because your staff needs to be trained better in interacting with customers even in late hours or on busy days.Just not a great experience at all. Yes we got a great deal of $42 on Priceline buttt..... it definitely wasn't worth the 2 fire alarms at 230am and 3 am or the loud guest screaming off the balcony around 1130pm. Pros: Big RoomsGood size TVRefrigerator/ Microwave in roomCons:Small BathroomNo control of temperature (Heater was blasting so we had to open windows when is was 20 degrees out)Rowdy guest + hallways smelling like weed= 2 fire alarms!Breakfast was good but only had one guy hustling the whole room. He did a great job but had way to many things going on. Wifi was ok.I was here for a convention. Yes, it's convenient if you are Ok with a $40 cab ride from the airport. No shuttle service. This is the only hotel that my car was broken into. The hotel security didn't even see it, the hotel across the street did when one of their security guards went out for a smoke break. No video surveillance. No offer to discount the room or pay for the window. This place can eat a bag of ......What a joke this place is. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here.I made my reservation through Expedia for a king bed/non smoking room about a month before my stay. On my arrival, I was told that there wasn't any non-smoking rooms left. I had just driven over 6 hours and was exhausted; figured "how bad could it be?!"Well, it was terrible. Not only was the smoking floor stinky and causing me to have itchy red eyes right away, it was old, things were broken, including my TV, and it just felt dirty.I had called Expedia to see if they could get me a non smoking room in the hotel. To my disbelief, Henry, the incompetent manager, had informed Expedia that since I already checked in, I would be charged $50. $50 to stay in a room for 15 minutes that I didn't want, didn't reserve and was literally making my skin crawl. Ridiculous.I paid the $50 to just get the heck out of this disaster of a hotel. Should have read the reviews on the place, in the first place.Stay at the St Louis City Center instead, people. They were very nice which was a warm welcome to the crap service at the Crowne.The only good thing about this hotel was the view of the arch. Bid on this room on Priceline and got it for $60. Parking was another $10 and the parking garage was a confusing maze. The room was pretty gross, found a fake diamond earring on the bathroom floor in plain view. The deadbolt on our door had been ripped off. The wifi did not work at all, and when I called downstairs about it I got hung up on, they did not care. There was central heating because the building was so old, and the room was very hot and we could not make it cooler. There was a used condom outside the parking garage. Just a bad/gross experience overall. Thank god we only got that hotel for one night!!Couldn't handle it. This place is so bad I had to leave. The first room we went to was huge... On the 4th floor with a watermelon sized stain in the middle of the room. It smelled awful. The light was broken in the bathroom so we asked to switch. Then we went to a room that looked fine but on the sheets there was hair and yellow body fluids. Disgusting. The elevators felt like they would break, the halls had chipped paint left and right, the doors hard to open. I left this hotel. I've stayed in 3rd world countries with better hotel cleanliness.A super 8 is better then this dump. No air conditioning. Has a nasty smell through out.  Curtains falling off the rods. Wall paper coming off the walls. Rude lady at the front desk. RUDE as in doesn't deserve to be in the public. Beware before you book a room here.... they definitely need to do some repairs to this whole.Just gonna hit the quick details of my experience:-smells old and dirty -climate control is not adjustable-internet doesn't work 99% of the time-20% chance of getting a decent view-any complaints will get "looked in to" and you'll never hear back-location is great for tourism only-not recommended for business trips-room rate and quality are not equal. Overpriced for sure-I've stayed in super 8's nicer than this placeThe staff is at best incompetent and inattentive, at worst downright hostile. The guest rooms haven't been updated since the 90s. Peeling wallpaper, loose bathroom fixtures, window AC units that struggle to adequately cool rooms. When we arrived our room was 84F (90F outside) and there was no toilet paper or bath towels. Several of the elevators are broken. The crowd here this weekend (drunk and obnoxious Cardinals and Pirates fans) but the paper thin walls that allow their idiocy at 3am disrupt everyone. To the staff and management of this hotel: If the lines for your elevators extend through the entire lobby and into the bar, maybe some active management of that system is required to have any sort of pleasant experience for your guests. If guest rooms aren't available for fully three hours after the stated check-in time, perhaps you should extend some hospitality to the affected guest by a comp at the bar or restaurant. Maybe you should have a checklist for housekeeping to make sure little details like toilet paper aren't missed. Maybe management shouldn't be renting rooms without functional HVAC systems.PS: The wi-fi also doesn't work correctly. Their certificate systems are broken so auth doesn't complete. I notified the front desk, but it was like asking a house cat to do calculus.There is a less than zero chance I will ever return to this property.We booked a room as did another couple for the night (we were in a wedding downtown). Our room had a beautiful view, nonsmoking (per our request) and a king bed. Our friends, got a smoking room (despite their request) and at midnight when we arrived post reception there was nothing else available. Not happy. Futhermore, only 1 of the 6 elevators was working so there was quite a long wait to get up to our room. When we did get to our room, the AC was broken (which really wasn't a big deal bc it was lovely outside) but it made cranking noises all night.  The rest of the wedding party stayed at the Hyatt next door. It was a little pricier but WOAH way nicer. In the future I won't be so cheap bc it definitely wasn't worth saving the 20 bucks.Great location. Clean room. Parking on site for $10. Rooftop pool nice view but pool is small.Small refrigerator is ice cold. Small microwave in room also. Room service available. Bar in lobby.Poor St.Louis. This hotel probably shouldn't be open. Certainly not a Crown Plaza hotel experience. Tired, worn, and indite need of a total do over!Pass on this place.
review_content_20: I am a priority club member and normally like the Crown Plaza brand. This hotel is in need of a remodel. Our room, even though it was a suite, was tired. The Wi-Fi was spotty, the room temperature controls did not work, they ran out of pillows and blankets. Also ran out of hot water during peak period around 8:30am. There is a sign posted for valet service and none available. There was substantial freeway noise and also construction sounds audible from the nearby arch. Upon check out there was apparently a problem with my credit card but after calling my company twice and waiting 30 minutes, it was finally processed. Overall, a disappointing experience. Check out the Hyatt and Hilton nearby.Wifi had no resemblance of working...at all. Also, if you get the free Priority Club breakfast, pass. It is the most limited, fly-infested joke. I have seen better at a Super 8. Are you rewarding valued customers or punishing them? ...but nice view of the Arch.The lobby and bar area are great. Valet parking is a decent price. But the hallways and rooms are pretty old school. Our heat and air seem stuck on air (unless they have a central thermostat). Our TV looses satellite signal a bunch.Please read all the reviews about this hotel after my review. The only positive thing about this experience was the view of the arch. Outside of that, the entire experience will be like staying at a haunted hotel that had been a long time abandoned. The wifi required you sign into a hotel homepage that was never created. This goes back to 2013, so it's not as if they didn't have ample time to correct the problem. The entire hotel looks as if kids came in at night with Walmart carts and played crash-up derby in every corridor in the hotel. The heater/air conditioner was preset and broken and the table had little stick-on stars which my 1st grade teacher gave on tests. Soda machine ate my two dollars which was given in change because it would not accept my bills. The room layout was strange even though the beds were clean, the housekeeping did a half assed job on the rest of the room. And the parking garage was not only a maze of ridiculousness but after going down two levels to go up three levels, the actual exit was two blocks away from the hotel by the time you made and exit. If misery = Missouri, here is your guarantee.This was probably the worst hotel stay of my entire life (for some perspective I am a consultant who is traveling about 25% of the time so that's really saying something...) The reason for one star is because some the staff were great in trying to resolve our issues and it had a convenient location with a great view but still it was an overall bad experience. From the moment of check in we regretted our choice of hotel. The lobby was filled with high school age groups and extremely drunk sports fans. We were in St Louis to celebrate and meet with my future in laws. We arrived Friday and checked in the early afternoon. My in laws room had two other parties attempt to get in because they overbooked the room to two other guests. The first time it happened the people actually went in the room and were able to shower and change clothes before the hotel figured out what was going on. The security guard explained he had to go through their luggage because they didn't know who was in the room. They had to get new room keys 4 times that day. The second time someone tried to get in their room was at midnight. They had a horrible night dealing with security and other guests trying to get in their room. So not once but twice the front desk rented out an already occupied room. I spent the next morning speaking with the manager who moved them to an upgraded suite which was great but the issues didn't stop there. (On a side note the balcony door was broken and they sent someone to replace it quickly.) they did offer us free drink tickets as well but we found out later they were for drinks, just beer. We witnessed a drinker guest fall on the pavement in front of the hotel that night and break her nose. I ran to the hotel to get some help and it took them over ten minutes to send someone. A medical emergency deserves more than a tired look and complacency from the security staff. That same day we watched an underage drunk kid get arrested in the lobby. The next day our stay did not improve. Our floor was filled with unsupervised high school age children who found it fun to go between rooms all night. This would not be so bad if the rooms weren't 50 years old and the doors weren't hollow and need to be slammed to close (literally have signs on the doors saying close with force because they do not close on their own). So after asking them to keep it down and after I was done being yelled at by their "supervising" adult (who was staying on a different floor from their three unsupervised teenage rooms) they decided it would be funny to knock on our door every 15-30 minutes. So for the next three hours we kept being woken constantly by knocking at the door. After 1am I finally got security to come up and try and get it to stop (after several calls). I would not recommend this place to anyone!! Although they have a wonderful view of the arch, the hotel is very old and in extreme disrepair. The elevator system was so whacked that people were waiting upwards of 30 minutes just to get on one to their room. It didn't help that there were unsupervised kids playing games and pressing the buttons to every single floor causing havoc on the elevators. We seriously rode an elevator from floor 15 to the lobby that stopped at EVERY SINGLE floor because someone decided to press every single button. The location was convenient but that's pretty much where the one star comes into effect. If you like drunk and rowdy people, a broken down transport system and an old decrepit room (stocked with your own pet cockroach) this is your place. We literally had the same room service remnants in the hall of our room the entire stay - that's three days with rotting food sitting right by the elevator with no attention paid by staff at all!!! We had to carry all of bags down 12 flights of stairs to check out after waiting for 20 minute and seeing 8 full elevators pass our floor. We checked out early and got flights home early because it was so terrible we couldn't stand another night. Seriously I never thought I could have such a bad stay somewhere but if you want the stay from hell, the crowne plaza is your ideal destination.After looking at some of the negative reviews I didn't know what to expect but after staying here I can't say I had the same experience. I thought the staff was very polite and accommodating. The rooms were basically what you would expect from a hotel and we had a fantastic view of The Arch.The only issue was I prepaid for the room and they asked for my card upon arrival to cover any incidentals if there were any after the stay. When I left the next morning I checked my credit statement and there was a charge for $50 from the hotel and I tried throughout the day to reach someone but they were consistently unavailable and was transferred to a voicemail. I checked the following day and the charge had been removed so not sure what the deal was but was a minor inconvenience that could have been solved with transparency up frontWe made a 2-night reservation for a family weekend in St. Louis on hotels.com and requested a crib when making our reservation. We did not have one in our room upon arrival but we're tired and did not want to bother with requesting one that night. The next day we asked for a crib at the front desk and the woman there said she'd send one up right away. It never came. When we took our 3 kids up to the outdoor rooftop poi on the 29th floor we had to wait about 15 minutes for an elevator--they were slow in coming and when they did arrive they were too full for us. Finally we got on one that was going down, rode to the lobby with other guests and then took it up to the 29th floor. When we got to the top floor there was a piece of cardboard with the words POOL and an arrow spray painted pointing us through a stairway to the outdoor pool. When we walked outside I immediately noticed that the entire surrounding area was covered in outdoor carpet that was originally blue (the far outskirts of the area were still blue) but most of it--especially in heavy traffic areas--were black from slimy mildew or algae or whatever grows on chronically wet surfaces. Both of our boys fell just walking between the pool and my chair. Plus little black specks of slime got all over everyone's feet and were, of course, tracked into the pool. The pool water was gross and extremely cold. I did not go in at all and my husband could barely stand being in there with our kids. When we got back to our room we put all the kids in the shower with their suits still on and had them was off with soap. All over the hotel were signs of neglect. It seemed like the hotel had been rather nice at one time, but has not been well maintained in a while. Our toilet was running when we came in the room for the first time and continued running for our entire stay. Our TV remote did not work so we could not watch the TV at all. One of the lamps in our room did not work. The closure door's paint was chipped off noticeably, tiles in the lobby were chipped and missing. Even the woodwork on the front desk was full of scratches and nicks. The only plus is that our room itself was not visibly dirty.Worse hotel I've ever stayed in. Poorly maintained and worn. Peeling ceiling in bathroom. Staff is lackadaisical and has a "do not care" attitude.I was sharing the room with two friends. We came back to the room late on our first night to find a note under the door instructing us we had to leave the room due to a sewage backup within the hotel. Need I say more? In addition the note told us the hotel was full and we would have to relocate to a different hotel somewhere in the city! We refused and were then instructed NOT to flush the toilet. We had to use the bathroom located on the 3rd floor. We were on 20.There are no positives. NEVER stay here!Great location... Run down rooms... incompetent staff.. This hotel sucks!First off, I called for a cot before we arrived-- It wasn't in the room. I asked the concierge to please bring one to our room by the time we were ready for bed. We get back from a night on the town, it wasn't there. I call again and here's the response I get-- "Sir we don't have cots". Another issue is that you don't have central air in your room's. It was probably 80-85 degrees in our room due to a very mild November here in the Midwest. I was irritated at this point and called down to the front desk again-- "Sir, it's Fall.. we don't have air conditioning" So we had to settle for a fan. So the 1 of us had to sleep on the floor in an 80 degree room. I highly recommend you don't stay at this hotel, It absolutely sucks. I was stuck with this place after using Priceline's name your own price. Do not book here!!!!The only reason this hotel gets 2 stars and not 1 is because the concierge suite on the top floor has awesome views of the arch, free happy hour, and free breakfast. It made me feel like a luxe business traveller.Otherwise this place needs some serious help and some serious updating. The rooms are way old, they look like they could belong in the 50s. The AC is seriously old too. The sheets were way too thin and I tended to be too cold at night. They have a smoking floor - what is this Europe? I asked for a wake up call one morning and never got it. And when they gave me my final receipt under my door on my departure day they didn't zero out my balance so I had to go down and get another printed. Seriously, how difficult is this? The Cards were playing three nights in a row when I was there and everyday at the front desk it was pure chaos without enough staff to help everyone check in.Go elsewhere.The hotel was very clean. The staff is very friendly. I reserved our room on Priceline and was a bit nervous to what I would get. My room was spacious. With 2 queen beds. The bathroom was huge. Didn't hear any traffic noise and other guest noise was barely audible. There is valet parking for $20 and plenty of self parking for $10. Room service ends at 11pm. The hotel is within walking distance to the Edward Jones Dome. The bartender Sam was great and chit chatted with all that came to order drinks. The only con to the room was the shower. It's a walk in shower and had 2 shower heads. But the main one didn't work. The hand held shower head can only be pointed to the wall so water doesn't stream out to the bathroom floor.I am an IHG expert. In the last 18 months I have about 170 IHG hotel nights, many of them in Crowne Plazas. I am a Platinum Priority Club member so I know what I'm talking about. I usually give Crowne Plazas four stars but I'm sad to say these folks get three from me.I have many good things to say-* The location is awesome. It's easy to walk to dozens of restaurants and bars.* This property is almost 30 stories tall. Ask for a room with and Arch view. You will be OMG completely blown away.* Even better, ask for a room with a balcony. Can you imagine a balcony view from the 25th floor? It's incredible!* The staff is wonderfully trained and friendly and competent. Kudos to the management for their efforts.* There is a pool on the roof and as you might expect the Arch view is stunning. In season, it doesn't get much better than enjoying the pool and the view with a cooler of adult libations.I know you can hear the "but" coming and here it is-* This property is tired. It's old. It's clear that it is has had a remodel but it is not up to Crowne Plaza standards.* The rooms are spotless and huge but were designed decades ago. That has consequences. See the next bullet.* The bathrooms are tiny. No, that's inaccurate, they're minuscule! I could stretch my arms out one way and touch both walls. Stretch the other way and I could touch the wall and the shower. If you were sharing this room with your significant other it would be almost impossible.So would I stay here again? Yes but it's a seasonal recommendation. In warm weather the balconies and roof top pool are killer. I'd stay here in a heartbeat. In the colder months I'd look elsewhere.After reading the reviews for this place i was a little skeptical about our stay, but found myself to be pleasantly surprised. The view of the Arch and the old courthouse from our window and balcony was amazing. The location is within walking distance to a bunch to the Arch, even with the construction going on, the Cardinals stadium and many other attractions. Also not too far from some great food. The hotel is in need of some updates, I mean the burnt orange carpet is just hideous and the public style toilets was a little wierd, but overall we found the hotel to be clean. One BIG upside was the friendly and accommodating staff. I can't say that we were very needy on this trip, but every interaction in the lobby and even riding the elevators was a pleasant one.One reason I am giving the hotel 4 stars is because the wifi would not work on my laptop or cell phone, but somehow worked on my tablet? The website never popped up to allow me to sign in. We were here on pleasure, so this did not bother me too much.Another reason is there was no furniture on the balconies, I mean a couple lawn chairs and an end table would suffice.My husband and I were very pleased with our stay and would stay here again in the future.Looking at the reviews for Crowne Plaza, I was really expecting the worst. But maybe that's how all good experiences start, by having low expectations. So I was downtown looking for a place to stay, calling around for the best price for the night. (You would think that hotels would lower the price just to sell a room for the night, right??) Well, when we called Crowne Plaza, they were polite and courteous, answering all of the questions.When we finally got there, Sharhonda is amazing and helped us out. She made the experience easy and fun. We got a room for the night overlooking the arc in all it's glory and beauty. It definitely made my last night in Downtown Saint Louis the best it could have been! The room was large (2 beds) & clean, and although the sheets felt a bit starchy it was comfortable enough.Reserved and pre-paid for a non-smoking king suite. Upon arriving at the room found used and broken cigarette butt in the middle of the bedroom doorway. Waited over 15 minutes at the front to speak with the manager on-duty. The room smelled like smoke. Room decor was extremely outdated and sad. Elevators extremely slow. Really really really disappointed. Won't stay there again.Staff was courteous but man this hotel was filthy. Not only were there spiderwebs above the beds but the rug was filled with critter nests in every corner. Sheets were stained with God know what. We told the front desk after our first night and they tries their best but they can only do so much when the hotel is falling apart slowly but surely.Long story short: Long wait, ugly rooms and at least one bed bug. Full review belowSo, I wanted to like this hotel. It's in a great location, and I was there for a wedding. I should have known the stay would be rocky the minute I pulled in the parking garage. They have about four spots in front to park and check in. This is for a huge hotel. So, I decided to just pull into the garage. It is the worst parking garage I have ever been in. The directions make no sense. It was dirty. It was mysteriously wet. There was insulation falling from pipes. It was so bad that we decided to just valet the other two times we had to park. That was strike one. Strike two was the 45 minute wait to check in. Now, it was a busy weekend. The hotel was fully booked. But 45 minutes?! There was no order, no line, no ropes to help guide the crowds. So there was just a mob mad rushing to get to the counter when a place opened. Luckily, I got there early enough that I wasn't late for the rehearsal. I've stayed in hotels in LA, Chicago, New York, and every place in between. I've never had a wait like that to check in. So after the 45 minute wait to check in came the 8 minute wait for an elevator (At this point I was staring at my clock, so I knew how long it took). The place is 28 stories. They have six elevators. All of them are slow. All of them go to all the floors. I don't mind a brief wait. I work in a skyscraper in Chicago. But good lord. Ever time we left our room we had to budget time to wait for the elevators. Then the room itself was.... OK. It was dated. The bed was fine, the chairs were awful. It was a weird layout, but whatever. They're claiming to be updating, but I didn't see much work being done.The final nail in their coffin was the picture my friend, who stayed on a different floor, sent me today. It was the stack of paperwork she was doing in her room Saturday morning, complete with a bed bug. Gross. I checked my room when we got there, and I'm confident I didn't. I will say the staff was very, very friendly.I was very disappointed with my stay at Crowne Plaza downtown. From the moment we arrived it was an unpleasant experience. The valet was extremely rude, then when I went to the front desk the only room they had ready was handicap assessable. Which isn't a big deal however my check in time was at 3pm and I arrived at 4. When we finally got to the room. Half the light switches did nothing. And a few towels had stains on them.When we got back to the room that night to sleep it was freezing. I have the "heater control" if you can call it that, at the warmest it will go and I don't think it did anything. So I called the front desk, took me 3 try's to get someone to answer. I told them that our room was freezing and I wanted some more blankets. All they said was "sure they will be right up". Not once was there any question of "is the heater not working" or any apologetic "I'm sorry to hear that, is there anything else we can do" I was very upset with my stay at Crowne Plaza and I would not recommend to anyone.Stay away from this place!I unfortunately booked this place with too much confidence in the Crown Plaza name. I spent a terrible 3 nights here and found myself toying with the idea of checking in at the Hyatt next door every night as my my window faced their hotel and I could see how much nicer they had it. I started my tormented stay here by being introduced to the hideously confusing and dangerous establishment they called their parking garage. After figuring out the poorly signed ups and downs of this garage, I parked my car and entered the hotel lobby. I finally checked into the hotel after my tiring journey and waited 10 minutes to get to my room on the 17th floor. The hallways were filled with trash and room service remains from the morning. After attempting to open the hotel room door I realized that my room keys weren't activated. I called the lobby and they asked be to come back down for reactivation. I waited another 7 minutes for the elevator and once I was in the lobby I had to wait on line for 30 minutes until they got to me. The keys worked on the second round. At this point I had already been at the hotel for over an hour and had just gotten the chance to enter my room....I was at least expecting a decent room. Instead my room looked like it had been rotting from the inside. I was greeted by old, disgusting carpet, poor thread count bed sheets with stains and holes in them, a dirty grimy tub, a super tiny closet with NO ironing board or suitcase stand, and the most ancient AC system I have ever seen. The only saving grace was my view of the arch. I took a little nap on the corner of the bed where there was no staining on the sheets. I woke up freezing several times bc the AC unit would not adjust. I then decided to run an errand and found myself in their maze of a parking garage once more. Upon trying to exit the garage , the garage teller told me that the front desk has to give me a stamp on my ticket in order for me to be able to exit without having to pay for the garage. I was super annoyed that the front desk didn't tell me this during my one hour check in drama. I distinctly remember mentioning that I parked my car. The teller informed me that this situation happens a lot with the guests of the Crown Plaza. At this point I didn't care. I payed the extra fee and made sure to get my ticket stamped thereafter.This hotel was a glorified motel. The halls were always dirty, the carpets old, and the service terrible. I will never stay at another crown plaza again. It is obvious to me that they do not abide by standards. Even a Holiday Inn is more of a predictable choice.I was expecting something decent. I can barely shut my eyes I am so against sleeping here. The walls, floors, and everything in between are filth. There was only one hand towel left in our room, no shower towels or wash cloths! I would like to add we have been on a road trip for a week, stayed in 1-Star up to 5-Star hotels and motels and I wish we were sleeping in the car tonight. This building is THAT filthy.First, I sincerely hate when room service trays are left in the hallway for hours on end. That's why there are bugs! Even the doorway in our room looks like it has never had a vacuum run over it. Dust and dirt piled, PILED in the corner. Ew. I can also smell the must from the carpet. Same review about the bathroom as other yelpers. Tinier than a closet, the fan is caked with dust and mold, the tub is dirty. I sincerely wish I had brought a bottle of bleach. Actually, just wish I had stayed somewhere else. Don't stay here!
review_content_40: Unless you are booking a reward night (and even then consider saving your points for another time), don't bother. Quite dated. Also double charged me. Positives:  location walking distance to ArchNegatives: everything elseWill never go back. Horrible experience.  They tell you one thing & then say another.  Room was blah & everything was old style not updated. The lobby area was only area I thought was nice. Carpet in room  seemed gross. A/C didn't work. Engineering had to come & fix & it still sucked. They told us when we checked in free breakfast included but when we went to go eat they then saif not free. Just a horrible experience & won't go back.This was, by far and away, start-to-finish, the worst hotel experience I have ever had to endure.First of all, I was the best man at my friend's wedding this weekend; the couple set aside 20 rooms for the wedding 4 months in advance at a discounted price. The hotel lost the groomsmen's room reservation and we weren't made aware until 2 days before the wedding. On top of that; they had no open rooms for us and we were asked to pay almost double the group price for a room that was worse than the one we'd originally reserved. I had a long conversation with the person making my reservation about downtown St. Louis and whether or not we'd have an Arch-view room. I get finished overpaying and the reservation is for the Crowne Plaza in Costa Mesa, CA, approximately 1,800 miles west of the correct hotel. I call up to the Crowne in downtown St. Louis and the woman hangs up on me! At this point I was livid. I had to call the hotel repeatedly and finally got a hold of the woman with the reservation department who helped me cancel the bad reservation and set up the appropriate reservation in St. Louis for over $100 more than the discounted price we were supposed to receive for being part of the wedding party.They lost the Newlywed's reservation! Seriously! They lost the reservation for the couple that helped them book about 20 rooms for a weekend. They ended up upgrading them for the trouble but the rooms were an even more ridiculous issue. (See paragraphs below)The flower girl almost missed the wedding entirely because her mother's car was locked in the garage and the hotel would not validate her parking until her "room was finalized." The groom's aunt had to take a $50 round-trip cab ride from the wedding hall to the Crowne to pick up the flower girl and go back. Her mother missed her daughter being in the wedding entirely. The hotel offered nothing to make this right.The towels were left over from the the previous people because they were still dirty with make-up and what I can only hope was snot. The shower had a leak that never stopped and just dripped all night long! There was some red, blood-like substance on the wall that was not cleaned up. There was a spider that had been smashed into the wall but not scraped off. It was probably the same spider who had built the elaborate webs in every corner of the ceiling. There were beetles in the bathtub that ran into the bedroom and disappeared under the beds within 5 minutes of checking in.We took pictures of this nonsense. I have never been so appalled at the condition of a hotel. I could have gotten over the awful wallpaper that hasn't been changed since WW2. I could have gotten past the fact that the bathroom looked like one from the basement in my high school. But you lost the room reservations for the bride, the groom, and the groomsmen. You made me pay $210 for a room that was negotiated for a price of $110. You put me in a filthy hotel room with the groom the night before the wedding and never found my "missing" hotel room for the night of the wedding. I had to book a different hotel and move all my stuff amid the craziness of the wedding day. There are literally no excuses that a hotel could possibly make. I was downgraded from a suite to a double queen room and paid $100 more than the agreed-upon price and the hotel didn't even try to acknowledge what had happened. They offered no recompense for all of the costly errors and disgusting conditions of the rooms.I will literally never ever ever stay here again. I will never recommend it to anyone. I will never stay at another Crowne Plaza location. And whenever anyone asks about hotels in St. Louis, I will make sure they know what happened at the downtown Crowne location so they never stay there either.My name is Luke and I stayed in Room 1817 on Friday night, 8/14.Like many others, I had a sub-optimal experience here for 3 nights. Upon check-in, they confirmed my 3 night stay in a non-smoking room & then proceeded to tell me there were no non-smoking rooms left. Staying in a smoking room is torture for a non-smoker. I kept my clothes in my luggage with the hope they wouldn't all be contaminated (fat chance). You'd think they'd give me a nice room to make up for the inconvenience, right? Well you'd be wrong - I could barely squeeze between the bed and the dresser, and I'm not a large person. I did switch to a non-smoking (larger) room the next day. They weren't apologetic about the hassle.This place is in serious need of an overhaul. You can't control the temp. in your room - it's controlled centrally for the entire hotel. Too hot? Too bad. Too cold? Put on every piece of clothing you brought with you. And then we have the rest of the "WTF" items: single paned windows mean lots of street noise, water damage on the ceiling where the acoustic material is discolored and falling off, a closet with 2 hangers, a missing hairdryer, a missing iron, a shower that doesn't work. Now those weren't all in my room, but compiled from the comments of others I was with. But it gives you an overall picture of the care & maintenance, or lack thereof, of the place.I won't even go on to describe the food other than to call it virtually inedible. Don't eat here.The upside (yes, there are a few): close to the arch, views of the arch from some rooms, convenient to Busch stadium for Cardinals games, and within easy walking distance of lots of restaurant choices.To sum it all up: stay somewhere else.IHG properties are usually well kept. My room had an amazing view of the arch, but inside the room i was missing my desk chair, had wall paper falling down and paint chips. Definitely time to renovate. (Frequent travel with IHG, 100 nights a year)Girl comes back to the bar after getting punched In her face by her boyfriend. She is vocal about what happens, Security does nothing. Although I always stay here someone should say out loud that the almighty dollar should take a back seat to domestic violence.Overview: Spent almost $500 on two nights to stay in a downtown location with a pool (roof top). -Rained during our entire stay so we couldn't use the pool (understandably) but could also not use the t.v. since they rely on a satellite for service. Also, to order a kid's movie cost $17. Remote control for t.v. did not work. -Our room had large stains on the floor, stains on the bathroom wall, and had a broken door for the balcony, so we couldn't go out. We did have a nice view of the Arch.-The bathroom was tiny, just enough room for one person to turn around, and the hair dryer was broken. There was an extra one in the room, but it took up what little counter space was available. -The wifi doesn't work so don't count on using it while you're there. -If you call the front desk, expect to be put on hold for half an hour and shuttled around from person to person during your call. -Some of the buttons on the elevators don't work so you have to switch elevators to get to the correct floor. -The heating element in the room doesn't actually heat the room. We were there during a cold, rainy weekend and the room was damp and cold. The staff is nice but it certainly didn't make up for the overpriced dump of a room we were given. I've stayed in motels nicer than this. Do yourself a favor and choose one of the other downtown hotels. I wish we had.One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at.  Dirty. Smells bad. Bizarre room layout.  Old and broken furniture.  Awful food.  Scary parking garage. Stay away.  This place should be closed and completely redone.I've stayed at many Crowne Plaza Hotels in my line of work. When it came time to plan a weekend get away to St. Louis I decided to book this hotel via Priceline.   Upon arrival into St Louis we called requesting to be picked up from the Amtrak station and were told that the hotel does not offer any shuttle service (despite having a picture of one on its website). We decide to hop in a cab. We were given a warm welcome and to our surprise upgraded to a superior room.  The excitement quickly came to an end upon walking off of the elevator on to the 11th floor.  The hallways were dark, dirty and dated. Upon entering our room, the age of the hotel was truly revealed. The suite was in need of serious updating.  From the carpet, painting, furniture and decor. Everything was dated including the forced heating/air conditioning. The closet doors appeared to be the original doors.   While I did not take photos as many others have, I can attest that my suite resembled those of others.I did have a great view of The Arc however!This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. My group and I get there at 3:30 to check in (check-in is at 3) and they tell me the rooms aren't ready, I decided to just wait in the lobby until everything was in order. 5:30 finally rolls around and we got one room. The second room wasn't ready until almost 7:00. Check out is at noon.. The second room had a beautiful view of the arch. It also had a mini fridge which the 1st room did not have (same price for both rooms mind you). Unfortunately the air conditioner did not work and the lock for the door malfunctioned forcing us to have to get new cards for our room everytime we needed back in. This next part isn't exactly the hotel's fault but it added to the "wonderful" stay we had. Lucky for my group and I we got  what seemed like a whole fraternity in the room next to one of ours. They enjoyed playing soccer inside and slamming against the wall. And lastly we left early one morning during our 3 night stay to go to six flags. When we got back much later that evening room service did us a favor by leaving the  door open to our room. Saving us a trip down stairs to get new cards I suppose.I would not recommend this hotel.. just saying. Put a irritating damper on my brother's 21st birthday celebration.Friendly staff at check in.  Good location. Our room was huge!!! 1709. Had a nice view of the Arch. No thermostat controls and our room was very hot    Got the room on Priceline for $57 so can't complain much. Would definitely stay here againI give this hotel three stars...location is fantastic can't beat the views of the arch and the river.  The price is good for a downtown hotel and the rooms are spacious and that's a big plus, considering I'm from Chicago and you spend almost twice as much for a downtown postage stamp size room.  The reason it doesn't get more stars, the hotel is old and need some cosmetic touch ups.  The curtains in our room are ripped...and the toilet needs a new seat....yes a new TOILET SEAT.  For a weekend stay visiting family, or catching a Cardinals game can't beat it..but it needs work.I wasn't a huge fan of this place. It wasn't the worst hotel I have stayed at. The rooms were clean and the TV was very nice. The balcony was big, but very bare. There wasn't even any places to sit, but the view of the Arch was one of the best I have seen. The pool was about the size of a bath tub, perhaps a little smaller. Even though it was on the roof, which is cool, there was no room to move and only about 3 people could fit in there and forget about having your own space or being comfortable.I come out to visit the city of St. Louis and I now know to never stay at this hotel again.Service was very slow. The amenities were very very basic for this being in the down town area. I asked if there was a gift shop and the response was the only one is blocks away. The only reason i will rate it 2 stars is because if your lucky enough for a balcony. The view of the arch is awesome.I don't write a lot of reviews for hotels, but my experience has been so bad that I just have to warn people. I stayed here on a business trip in Jan. 2014. It's an average hotel. Nothing great / nothing horrible (except the heat in the rooms was really loud and either full blast or not working at all, but whatever, right? Not worth complaining about.)... or so I thought.On Friday March 28, 2014 at 11am my credit card was fraudulently charged for a second visit while I was home in MA. I called the hotel and asked to speak to the manager (who was unavailable), so I left a voicemail. The hotel has not bothered to respond to me. I am working with my bank to dispute the charge. I've had to cancel my debit card, I have to update my payment info in a bunch of places... this is really annoying! I'm just glad I regularly check my bank account and found the bogus charge. This is almost definitely someone at the hotel stealing credit card info; either to let a friend stay for free or to run some kind of refund scam. The fact that the manager hasn't responded means they aren't taking this seriously or they might even be involved. I wouldn't be surprised to find out I'm not the only one who's been stolen from!IF YOU'VE STAYED HERE IN THE LAST SEVERAL MONTHS, KEEP A VERY CLOSE EYE ON YOUR BANK STATEMENTS!Decent hotel in a great downtown location. I really don't have a lot to say about it because I didn't spend a lot of time in it. I will say these few things though:1. That parking lot is kind of scary. I was expecting someone in a hoodie and ski mask, holding a hatchet to appear at any moment. 2. That bed was pretty comfy. 3. I didn't expect a whole lot of frills but uhhh, a mini fridge would have been nice. Some rooms have them, some don't. I can't for the life of me figure out why any of them wouldn't. I get to sleep in this comfy king sized bed, but I have to sip room temp water? If I was expecting to spend a lot of time in my room, I don't know if I'd  choose the Crowne. But for easy access to downtown, a place to lay your head at night, and a decent bar area, this place isn't too shabby.Nice downtown hotel & centrally located. My room was very clean and the lounge is beautiful. One downside was that my room had no thermostat...when I travel I do like having my room around 60. If I had stayed more than one night it may have angered me more than it did.Wow. I have way higher expectations for a Crowne Plaza. The other reviews really hit the nail on the head. This hotel is in desperate need of an update. The bathroom in our room was awful... granite countertops could not hide the awful black-mildew covered time around the bathtub. Ugh.
