The room was clean enough (thank heavens) but so outdated. We were definitely disappointed. We did ask for a room with temperature control and got that thanks to the girl at the front desk. Wouldn't stay here again unless the hotel gets a major overhaul.I am not one who likes to throw disrespect to businesses for that is how their employees earn the money. My bothers and I came down to St. Louis for some family business and catch a Sox n Cards game. I being the Red Sox fan was happy but a cloud tried it's best to mess up our 3 day stay @the plaza. After parking the car in a paid lot then checking in went to our room which was clean. We relaxed for a few then went to get a bite to eat came back to the room to relax. Next morning we go to the car only to find we were robbed security came police rode up on a bicycle. The Plaza did little to help they didn't even make the necessary calls nor did they seem to care. I take it they didn't want to alarm their customers that were checking in. This hotel is the worst place an outer towners to stay. Criminals target out of state vehicles and the hotel and parking lot owner must been friends with the thieves. I will not tell not to stay here but I will tell you if you do borrow some Missouri plates so the thieves don't target your car in a paid lot adjoint to the Plaza. The housekeepers never came to make our beds or clean the room. They should rename it Crowne Plaza Motel sorry motels cause this place doesn't deserve to be in business. One and only good thing is it is within walking distance to both stadiums.My guess is they get there business on convenience and location.  The rooms are small and awkward, they offer no breakfast, and parking is a mess.  The view is stellar though.  At least from my room
review_content_60: I have stayed at this location once before and am still kicking myself for making such a bad decision. Waited 30 minutes for someone to valet my car upon check in. There were others waiting as well and it's like the guy just disappears every now and then. Staff didn't even know when I asked the front desk but they really didn't care. Messed up my reservation and tried giving me a crappy room without deducting the extra I paid for a suite. Tried to find someone again to get my bag that the airline dropped off. Waited almost 1/2 hour for that as the bell mans excuse was he was parking cars. There was also several rooms with breakfast crap outside of their doors upon going to my room at 6:00pm. Sadly, this crap still existed the next morning (24 hours later). The room service food was crappy. Suggest going to the Irish pub right down the street (Tigin Irish Pub) only a 5 minute walk or Tony's Italian which is another good place. Liked Tigrin better with the live entertainment and good bar food. Another thing with the crown, my patio door don't lock no matter how much I try. The bed was cozy but the so called suite was outdated and worn. Careful not to get stuck in the bathroom as it's very, very, very small.Also had a worker walk right in two hours after I checked in. She never even knocked and just stood their when I said someone is in here and then approached her. Seemed a little fishy to me. Planning on scanning my belongings??Bottom line, I am convinced the Crown Plaza is a crap hole. Had similar issues with two other Crowns in WI. I am done with Crown Plaza's! They are all crap holes!!When I first checked into this hotel I was already disappointed. I was given a room that wasn't clean, the service and staff there needs more training on how to do there job and be professional. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone that is staying more than a 2 days. I was more concerned with the lack of cameras that's in the hotel more than anything. I can name a list of problems until I checked out. Never again. The only thing nice about this hotel is the lobby otherwise than that don't even waste your money.Booked a group of 10, relatively easy. Stayed Oct 20 for one night. The check-in was a nightmare. Apparently the first time the front desk team handled 5 rooms, 10 people? They couldn't get the process right within the property management system, issued keys to the same room for half of our group, and confused themselves on the credit card processing/billing (more to come on this later).Staff did not know the public transportation schedule/options to the airport. (Really?) When I asked about how to arrange transportation, two staff answered "not sure." Had to look it up myself. Received bank statement, found that they charged me twice for the same room. Called hotel three times. The operator transferred me to the "Manager-on-duty voicemail". You've got to be kidding!!! The voice mail stated they would call me back by the end of the current day. I called three days in a row and have yet to receive a returned phone call!!!!! Called the GM. No surprise, voicemail, no returned call.This is by far the worse guest response I have encountered. Avoid this hotel, they don't know how to run the basics.So, we called to make sure our sweet would be ready for us. We requested a room with an arch view and a crib and sheets and blanket for the pullout bed. All were confirmed to be waiting for our arrival. None of which we got without a room change and two calls to the front desk. Not to mention the urine decorated toilet seat, left up, after the room cleaning. Don't even get me started on how long it took us to get our car out of the garage.I was here for a few days for a conference. I wasn't expecting much as a college student. And i know there was a lot of us there too. But the customer service was very poor. Whether is was an attitude, or the fact that they took our towels and never replaced them and the AC didn't work in our room and the internet barely worked. And overall the rooms weren't that great.My friends and I came here for Cardinals game and this hotel was within walking distance. I was a nice hotel. I would come here again when I am in town.The hotel isn't in a bad location, but I definitely had a less than pleasant experience, and I'm pretty sure it wasn't an isolated experience.My biggest complaint has to be other guests. I understand that the hotel can't control who is staying at their hotel, and I get that if you can pay the hotel rates you should be able to stay there, but there should be some limits. I was at the hotel for a wedding, but the wedding block was spread out and I got stuck on a floor of drunk teenagers. A drunk man tried to break into my room at 2 am, swore at me through the door when I told him that he was at the wrong room and I had to have security to make sure he didn't actually get in my room. However, instead of putting him in the right room and asking his friends to shut down their party, security simply told him to stay away from my room. Never mind the fact that after he tried to break in I actually wanted to be able to sleep peacefully.The hotel parking garage needs complete reconstruction. It's very confusing, not easy to navigate and the further down you go the less safe it becomes. I think part of the problem is that the Crowne Plaza shares the garage with another business, but there's got to be a better way to straighten out the parking.The view of the Arch was the best feature of the room, but if I were to stay downtown again I would definitely consider a different hotel.I see a lot of negative reviews on here, but I just stayed at this hotel recently after getting a good deal on Priceline and had a great experience. All of the employees I came into contact with were extremely helpful and provided great customer service. My room was also spotless when I arrived. Based on my experience, I'd recommend this hotel!Terrible stay! We left a day early. Pool dirty and small, whole hotel dirty, room smelled like mildew. We will never go back. Messed up 4 of 5 room service orders. Parking garage is sketchy. Don't try to go right to the restaurant, just terrible.This place was terrible. When we got back to the room after a long exhausting day there were no towels in the room. It looked like housekeeping started cleaning the room and quit. The beds were not finished being made. They were started but not finished. We called to get more blankets and towels. We were told that they ran out of blankets and we did get towels. we got five, asked for three. Was told that they run out of towels. Sounded like it was a common occurrence. We did valet parking since we were so tired. It took over twenty minutes to get my car. I heard different reasons. It takes that long, your car didn't get in the system properly. We did get the cost of the valet parking taken off due to the housekeeping issue. That was ironic since then parking was also a problem. Also getting an elevator was a problem. Wound up passing up four elevators before deciding to take one up to go down. It took forty minutes to get out of there and therefore I missed part of my conference. Would not recommend unless you like to be frustrated.Really disappointed in our stay here this weekend. First of all there were no thermostats, just two outdated vents that you could not turn off. If I had to guess, I'd say our room was about 85 degrees, and opening the windows did not do a lick of good because we were on the 22nd floor. Without the door open there's no air flow at all. All they could manage was to bring us a fan which was barely enough to get us through the night, which is all we were staying or else I would have made them give us a new room.When I was checking out, I told the woman at the front desk about how hot it was and she made no effort to compensate us for our discomfort, in fact the next words out of her mouth were "It looks like you have a $10 charge for parking." I will not stay here again, and I wish I would have checked the reviews before making my reservation.I should have read the reviews before booking this instead of trusting the crowne plaza name.First, the good: The room itself was nice with a great view, unfortunately the balcony was completely barren. I guess I was lucky to be in a recently renovated one (2306). You'll get the same view in the neighboring hotels, so that's not really a selling point.Some of the staff, including the manager, are very nice.Now the bad: I booked the room for 3 people in a room with one king bed and one sofa bed weeks in advance. (They charge extra for people after 2 guests, bear that in mind for later)When I drove in, I was left to wonder where to park my car. Finally, I was told to go around the block to get in through an other entrance which brought me back to the original parking lot. Go figure! Directions in the parking lot are nowhere to be found and very confusing. The garage is badly lit and disgusting stuff is dangling from the pipes along the ceiling. Creepy! There is no elevator in the 6 level garage, so if you haven't dropped off your luggage, you'll have to haul it on the ramps where cars are going up and down.There was only 1 towel set in the room, so we had to request 2 more.The sofa bed wasn't made and there was no linens for it in the room, so I had to call the front desk/housekeeping again. Reaching anyone at either desk took forever. It'll just keep ringing. Wait for it. When you get someone to finally pick up, don't expect a greeting. I had to talk to someone 3 times to get linens. The third time, I asked how long it'd take since I was waiting to go to bed and it had been over 30 minutes since the last call that was answered. I was told in a very unpleasant way that I was the 6th person in line for house keeping duty! It was after 11pm!!!When the linens came (probably took a solid hour since the first call), I wasn't offered for the bed to be made, I was just dumped sheets that weren't ironed and a blanket - I closed my eyes hoping that they were clean ones... Fine, I was gonna make my bed myself anyways, since 2 of us were already sleeping and I was in my PJs, but I'd like at least to be asked... No sorry, no nothing.If you know 3 people are checking in, please be prepared to receive 3 people in the room!Also, the wifi connection just doesn't work, or is so slow that you can forget about it. I saw a flyer next to the tv cabinet advertising hi speed internet on the tv. Yeah right, as if streaming is going to work when I can't even connect my phone and read emails.One more complaint: the elevator system desperately needs upgrade for this 29-storied building. The wait time can be very long because of it, with a messy flock of people in the lobby getting aggravated... Splitting the elevators between those servicing the higher or lower floors could be helpful...Bottom line: look elsewhere, don't go there! You've been warned.And that's how my first yelp review goes down. It took a terrible place like this to get me worked up enough to write one.I'll give two stars because of the great view and location. Otherwise this hotel leaves much to be desired. The decor is old and dated. The paint is chipping. The carpet was stained and dirty. My white socks were grey after walking around the room. The worst part was the bathroom. The shower was marginal and had minimal pressure. There was a vent over the shower with mold literally hanging out of it in clumps. Disgusting!! The sink in the bathroom would not drain. Parking was a nightmare in an old confusing filthy parking structure attached to the hotel. Despite the fact the we parked ourselves, we found a ten dollar valet parking charge on our bill, which we had to go to the desk to have removed. The TV was nice and modern, but it was tucked into a corner of the room and there was no place to sit and watch it. Overall- not someplace that I would ever stay again.Let me start off by saying that I have stayed a several Crowne Plazas and have enjoyed the experiences, but when my wife and I used priceline and got this place as an express deal for 45/ a night i should have known. There is NO WAY this place is a 3 1/2 star hotel its more like a 2 star. The hotel staff is very nice but the rooms were in such need of a makeover. We found what looked like blood spots over the wall, mold in the bathroom and a thermostat that didn't work. Oh and i forgot to mention the first night, no sleep at all. People slamming doors and partying all night long. Reminded me of 15 years ago in a frat house when i was a student. Called security twice with no solution, The next morning i asked to move rooms. The manager in the morning said she would call me when the room was ready for us to move.... you guessed it no call. when we got back from our day out we were given a room on a higher floor with an arch view but same issue, slamming doors all night, broken thermostat and dirty room. We ended up leaving a day early and just ate the last night on our bill. This place was way below our expectations for the crowne plaza name. Don't waste time or money staying at this place. Going to contact the GM and have this resolved..... VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!!!We got a great deal on priceline for the Crowne Plaza, so we left the toddler with Grandma and Grandpa and went out for a last pre-baby adventure. The room was huge, but the heater/ac did not work and because we were in a Priceline room, they would not move us. Finally after having to let his inner Papa Bear come out, they moved us to a room with working a/c. Once I landed in the oh-so-comfy king sized bed, I was out like a light. I would have given it four stars had they not given us so much grief over using priceline. That was the biggest bummer for me.This is the second time I have been here, very enjoyable. People are friendly. Rooms are nice. Will be back again. Great bar. And bartender. I give Restaurant (Union Grill) 3.5 Stars. Food was decent.Pros:Great location. We walked to good restaurants (within 10 blocks)View of the arch.Big rooms.Cons:Air conditioner was weird.Housekeeping seemed confused about any request.We could hear everything in the hallway.The front desk did not know about their shuttle that was supposed to take us to the wedding. The parking garage was a disgusting maze with water leaking everywhere. The floor in our room was dirty. After a shower my feet were visibly dirty within a half hour. The bathroom was tiny. The counter space was so small, I feared dropping things in the toilet. When I put the toilet seat lid down condensation built up and then dripped all over the seat when put back up. You had to put the lid down in order to flush the toilet. No conditioner. $2 for hot water and a tea bag. What happened to continental breakfasts?I stayed at this hotel for a wedding recently. The location of this hotel is great -- right in the heart of St. Louis and you can walk to both Busch Stadium and the dome where the Rams play. You can see the Arch from some views. The bedroom area itself was of good quality. What I didn't care for was the quality of the bathroom. The bathroom is very small and the handles to flush the toilet are like those from a public bathroom, which I absolutely hate.A few other negatives: The lobby seemed to be very crowded, like fire code violation crowded. Taking the elevator to a room is annoying, as the elevators run slow and you often have to wait to take the next lift since the first one is already full of people. It's very annoying to take a crowded elevator that stops at every floor only for the person who was waiting on it to be unable to get on it due to capacity. For a hotel with something like six elevators, the service should be quicker and better.Lastly, the parking garage situation is rough in a lot of ways.I admit I tend to dwell on the negative aspects. There are worse hotels, but I don't know if this one is good for the cost.Stayed here on 8-31-14 after attending Card /Cub game..room was not available before the game as promised so I asked to use upstairs Lobby restroom to wash my hands.It was being cleaned and even though someone was in a stall the housekeeper snarled at me for asking to wash my hands. Nice customer service. They stored our luggage and preregistered us so we only needed to show our ID to get the room ..only 1 evening attendant at the desk..I waited 2nd in line..and older couple rudely butted in front of me and another desk clerk came to help them instead of me..my husband was told that THEY were first..I assured them they were not..there was NO apology making us wait..again..the day staff in the front desk was OK ..the evening..awful. The bellman was very good and took bags to our room.The only bartender moved like a snail with MANY patrons waiting for a drink. We went down to the Hyatt where they know how to hire a bartender that knows how to move and serve a crowd. They should staff accordingly ..knowing when the Cubs are in town there will be MANY people willing to spend money. Bad management.The room was OK..on floor 15..one coffee packet for a double occupancy however. The toilet tissue dispenser was broken..so the roll had to be up on the small sink where it got wet..really tacky in my opinion and it would have been an easy fix.The whole place could use remodeling..carpet is nasty and it has an odor. Maybe they need to watch a couple episodes of HOTEL IMPOSSIBLE to get some guidance.I think the staff of this hotel needs some serious education about the hospitality business,as there are MANY other choices in the area..We stayed at the Hyatt the night before and sorry we left there to stay here. From the other reviews it seems this is their standardBeautiful hotel. We our room was clean and prepared to our liking but the view, well, where else can you view the arch up so close. Definitely have to work on the food though. We didnt finish even though we were starving. We had a sandwich and a salad, which had wilty rotty veggies, terrible :(
review_content_80: I stayed at this hotel Oct 28-Nov 3 2013 and on the last evening I found TWO roaches in the bed. This was on the 25th floor and I had a friend staying on the 4th floor who also had the same problem. The hotel did remove one night off the bill and the complaint seemed the norm. This hotel is in a great location but needs serious upgrading and a full fumigation.I stayed here a few weeks ago.  I had stayed here before and it was fine.  But this trip was pretty bad.  We needed a cheap box fan to stay cool, house keeping didn't clean our room or bathroom, I had to call down twice for towels, when the room was cleaned, they forgot to leave towels.  I called housekeeping and management but no one called back.   The toilet had to be flushed 4 or 5 times to empty.  Pretty sure we won't be back.This place is a dump, and may have the slowest workers I have ever seen. Everything about this place was disappointing. It started with arriving during a huge traffic jam as the cardinals game was getting let out. Yes this was not the hotels fault, but it forced me to use the Valet witch took 35 min to come get my car. Only one other car was ahead of me.  Then when I finally got into the lobby I was greeted by several other unhappy customers.  The wait to Check in was 45 min. Once again there was only a few people ahead of me.   I decided to stay hear since it had great views of the arch and the rest of the city. I called several months In advance to book a room with a balcony that faced the arch with a king bed. Of course they gave me a Room without a balcony and Faced away from the arch and had 2 full size beds.  When i called  the front desk to ask if i could be moved she told me there was nothing she could Do and hung up on me.  On top of it all the a/c did not work,  several bulbs were burnt out, the rooms were outdated, dirty, and smelled. The next morning the slow workers continued to disappoint me by taking over an hour to pull my truck up from the valet.    I was so disappointed with my stay that I decided to write and email to cooperate crown plaza asking for a partial refund.  Keep in mind that I am the type of person that never complains and have never done anything like this before.   Even they were slow to get back to me. After 3.5 weeks I received an email that basically said they were sorry for my negative experience. No compensation or discount.  Never again will I stay at another crown plaza hotel.This is by far one of the WORST hotels I've ever stayed in. When I arrived at 6pm after already requesting a single king size bed for me and my partner we opened the room to find that it had not been cleaned and there were 2 twin beds side by side. I went down to the lobby and the person at the front desk said there were no more rooms available. When I told him that I was traveling with a certain touring company... All of a sudden a room appeared. The towels in the room were stained, the air conditioning was barely coming out. This hotel looks like dump. It's old and not taken care of. Since I'm not from here I asked for directions and NO ONE that worked there seemed to know ANYTHING that was around their own place of business. The staff that I encountered were rude and unprofessional. Right down to the housekeeper that basically got mad that she had to clean my room ( which is her job) and by clean all I needed were towels and my bed made. All of the employees take smoke breaks in the parking garage making the hotel look and smell like a trashy bar. I've worked in hospitality before so I know what GOOD service is and I know how to handle hi volume. This hotel and its staff need a good attitude adjustment and face lift. You can guarantee that my company will NEVER stay here again and I will make sure that other touring companies know about this place. Boo.....!!!!Great hotel, really close to everything St. Louis has to offer, nice big bar with TV's huge workout room. Love that its like as soon as you drive into St. Louis, you are in the hotel. Parking could use some work, maybe a parking garage reno? Seems like it was developed for a smaller hotel. Stayed with a wedding group so no idea what the actual rates are.Ugh. This will be my last visit to any Crowne Plaza. They all are like this one.The lobby is deceiving - it's nice and looks like the hotel would be a good place to stay. The hallways and the rooms are old and dingy. The decor is dated, it's dinged up and has seen better days. The room appeared mostly clean so that's a plus. The room itself was poorly laid out but it was a fairly large room. There was a nook behind the TV. Yep, behind it. Big enough for a chair but that's it. But for the life of me, I can't understand why the room was spacious but they made the bathroom so tiny.  The toilet was almost under the sink.  This hotel is over priced. I don't know why Crowne's are old & run down but they still charge like a higher class hotel.First stay at a Crowne Plaza, we usually stay at 4 star + properties but the price and location were fine for our firSt trip to St Louis.Parking: they charge for self park, $10.00 per night. The garage is pretty old and leaks water from the roof (it's not raining) and is pretty old and ghetto.Lobby & Service: The MOD checked us in and was very nice and helpful with area resturaunts, the lobby is nice and clean.Room: it appears to have been referbished within the past 5 years but it was cheap and poorly done. The tub is blue and the finish is wearing off, the paint is yellow, the wall coverings are tan and the white tile is poorly refinished bright white with with putty patches throughout.The mattress and box springs squeak something fearce, the old windows don't block the street noise and worst of all the A/C was not keeping us cool through the night. I would hate to try sleeping in the summer months.The hallway on the 21st floor is unvacuumed and stained and the room doors are chipped and dirty, it's not very nice to see this condition when you have just checked in and going to your room after an exhausting day of travel.I would not stay here again in the future, pretty disappointed.More like 2.5 stars. The only reason they get that high is the location, and the room size. Really the location is great 17th floor room with a balcony looking at the arch that's nice. Larger than average rooms. Lucky we had a killer fire works show and concert at the arch it was fun to watch from such a great location. Things seam to go down hill from there.The street noise was overly loud I've stayed in other hotels that didn't seam to have this problem even in Downtown Chicago .Then there was the towel thing like the next day 14 hours later after several calls and broken promises finally got some clean towels. Ok great location but in serious need of some remodeling and general cleaning. My room was less than clean and I wouldn't even sit in the chair I'm not sure what happened in it. No flat screen TV ?Ok great location but the parking thing is like a maze and dirty, and who would put a dumpster by the only door leading in from the parking garage nice in the 100 degree heat. Ok great location walk to the Arch and some very good restaurants near by but needs some help.I actually bunked up with Rachel S. on her 2nd stay at the Crown Plaza Downtown STL, and for those wondering minds out there, we shared beds with our hubbies, not each other...I know you are all sorely disappointed! I have to agree with Rachel S. that our room, while decent, was nothing to get too excited about.  It was decent size and our beds were comfortable, though a full is never quite big enough for my hubby and me.  The carpet and decor needs an update, but we did score it on Hotwire for less than $100 a night, so it was well worth it.The service was fine for us from bell boy to reception desk to valet, we had no issues and I always think that is a plus.I don't know that I would pay the listed price on the website to stay here, but it wasn't bad for what we needed - a place to shower and lay our heads over Halloween weekend. :)It definitely worked and I would not be disappointed if Hotwire planted me here again.The Crowne Plaza seems to be one of the more overlooked hotels in downtown St. Louis, but it does not have as much to offer as some of the other higher end hotels in the area. The rooms are actually very large. The hotel is old, and you can tell that they have renovated the rooms, but you can still easily tell that they are old. The thermostat in our room was broken, but we were too intoxicated to bother getting another room so late at night. The customer service was friendly and accommodating. We were on the 21st floor and had an awesome view of the arch, which was nice! The bar was completely empty on a Friday evening and so was the lobby in general. I would prefer to stay at the Hyatt, Hilton, or Millennium any day, but the prices were cheap and service was good, so I'll give The Crowne and A-Ok.This place almost got a 5-star from me!  The staff was super-friendly and even upgraded my room for free to a corner room on the 27th facing the Arch...AWESOME VIEW!The previous complaints I'd read about the hot water were never an issue for me.  If anything, I had to watch how hot the water was when I started the shower or I would've probably lost a layer of skin!My room was a suite and it rivaled many apartments I've rented in terms of size.  It was spacious, clean, and nice.The hotel restaurant was not busy but the staff was very friendly. I ate alone while I waited for my party to arrive and my waiter and I passed the time talking about the NBA Finals that were going on.  The food was tasty and well-portioned - I ordered the 1/2 rack St. Louis style ribs.Con's time:The TV's are still tube ones and remind you of the hotel's age.  LCD/LED TV's would've been nice.  I did notice that there were some TV's stashed in some places so maybe they're in the process of replacing them.There is only free wired Internet in your room.  If you want wireless, you'll need to go to the bar or a few other places in the hotel and pay for it (listed in their Guest Directory).  I brought my iPad 2 and was pretty much screwed because I didn't own an Airport Express yet.They were skimpy on towels. I had 2 in the room and no wash cloths. The gym is nice and most of the equipment have attached TV's so you can pass the time. Unfortunately, the equipment is older and not gym quality and some of the equipment and TV's and equipment were OOC. Lastly, the path from the parking lot to the hotel goes past a dumpster and there is no way to avoid the smell.This is an older hotel, and I am used to staying in newer ones, so that may have colored my perceptions.  The staff was friendly.  The rooms were clean (and huge!) with inexplicably small bathrooms.  The pool was on the roof, and was really cool.  We had a catered dinner at the event we were attending, and the food was delicious.  They had a chocolate layered cake that was phenomenal!  Internet was free, which you don't usually get from a higher-end hotel.  Aside from the age of the hotel, and some iffy-ness with the air conditioner (it worked, but not well), I had few major complaints.  Specifically, the elevators were slow and inefficient.  I seemed only a couple were working at a time, and all were incredibly crowded, especially if you had luggage.  The parking garage was dirty, smelly, and dirty condensation leaked from above, which was pretty nasty if it hit you.  The buffet breakfast was very expensive, and seemed no different than the free continental breakfast you can get at other hotels.  Very overpriced.   It served its purpose, and the pool was cool, but nothing else was too special.  Fun tidbit: my mom returned to her room on Saturday night, to find approximately 20 towels, and an extra mattress sitting in her room, partially blocking her fridge/microwave/coffee access.  The front desk was puzzled, no explanation was offered, and the staff did not come to get them until the next day, despite several phone calls.  So they might have an elf problem or something, I'm not sure.I was very pleased with this place.  We were on the 23rd floor with a great view of the Arch.  We had a balcony, which, from what I understood, means we had a smoking room.  You can smoke on the balcony but not in the actual room.  Neither of us smoke, but the balcony was cool!  The room was HUGE.  We had 2 queen beds, a couch, chair and coffee table, desk/office area, a microwave, mini fridge, iron, coffee pot.  The wifi is free.  The bed was super comfortable.  The only gripes I have are 1) the bathroom is small and no fan, and 2). we couldn't adjust the a/c, it wasn't an option, and 3). the elevators were kinda slow.  The parking is $10, but the front office will validate your tickets.  I was overall pleased and will be going back soon.  It's in a great location, we walked to the Arch, and it took us less than 10 min.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.******Need to update and renovate.My stay was from July 31 to August 6.1. Lobby had awful smell.2. Too many flies in the lobby area.3. Escalator in lobby to the PR level was not working the entire time of our stay (6nights).4. Shuttle service provided has a 3 mile radius.5. Bartender, Sylester was nasty and rude - no tip.6. Bartender, Martiz is great. Friendly and very informative and knowledgeable of the city. Told us of great places to eat and to listen to music.7. Restaurant meals to expensive. Hotel offered meal discounts, which was not worth the service.8. Elevators were very slow.9. Unable to control thermostat in hotel room.10. Great view of "The Arch".11. Lobby furniture needs to be updated.12. Close to Monty's sandwich shop - great food.13. Hallways are very drab.14. Observation deck nice view of the city.15. Pool amd observation deck not handicap accessible.16. Most pay to use the computers in the business area.17. Laundry room is not a room. In the hallway on the 4th floor. Lost money in the machine to get detergent. This is not a secure area.18. Had to pay by credit card to use the computer on the PR level.We stayed here with two other couples last July. It took 45 minutes to stand in line to check in, only to be told there was not a room ready for us, but one was opening up soon. The other couples were able to go up to their rooms.  After an hour I called back and spoke to the manager who said  our original clerk must be lying to us because there was not a room being prepared for us. Really? Bad, bad, bad customer service. Not something you want happening after a long day of traveling. We finally got a room at 8pm at night. It was a nice room with a view of the arch, but I would not book here again.Another couple had a room on the smoking floor, which smelled very musty, and the air conditioning did not workMy husband and I opted for a Stay-cation and stayed at the Crown Plaza. It is crazy to me that I have lived here for 5 years and every once in a while I feel like a get a totally different view of the city!Pros: Great locationWonderful view of the arch and downtown from the rooftop. Most rooms have a balcony Pricing is reasonableWalking distance from several local attractionsCons: Decor is a bit tacky Rooftop pool is tinyHotel Restaurant has little options for healthy eatersThe bathrooms in the rooms are just kind of weirdWonderful service. Nice comfortable beds as expected at the Crowne Plaza.  The room is quite spacious and clean.  Awsome view of the Gateway Arch! The hotel is within walking distance to many historical sites.Whenever I stay at hotels, I will admit I only use Hotwire. I always get an awesome rate and it has never failed me. My stay at the Crowne Plaza was no different. When we got there, they gave us a king size bed (ooo wink,wink). The room was on the 10th floor and close to the elevator although we never had an issue with noise which was nice. The room was also very spacious. I honeslty can't complain about the room.My favorite thing about this hotel though is that it is literally like two blocks from Laclede's Landing and the Lumiere. Perfect! I don't want to take a cab, I'd rather walk and it was conducive staying here.A negative: the cleaning lady tried to come into our room twice when we had told them we were not leaving until check out AND I had the door hanger on there saying do not disturb..oh well..So we booked two nights at this place... and only stayed one(unwillingly)  We got into town super late.  Once we got to the room we tried to turn on the AC.  To our surprise there was no AC in the room.  You don't get to control your own room temp settings.  After we called to figure out what the deal was we then found out they have a 48 HOUR cancellation policy... So I thought we were going to be stuck staying there.  They promised to move us to a room that should be cooler and give us a fan.  While its not there fault the temp outside was unseasonably warm they should have some sort of alternative to make things better.Even worse the room they moved us to had a leak in the ceiling and when we woke up our bag was wet and so were some of our stuff.  Not a huge deal but still a pain in the a**.  The manager promised a refund for our troubles but its been over a month and I haven't heard anything.  Also, I keep calling and leaving messages and no one ever returns my calls...Update-  Just spoke to Samantha.  I dealt with Felicia the day that the carpet was wet.  Samantha now informs me that there was no leak from the ceiling that both security and an engineer said they didn't see a leak.  I stood there with security and the engineer and the engineer checked the non-functioning AC unit then confirmed the water mark on the wall and said it must be the unit above our room leaking down... DO NOT STAY HEAROlder hotel with newer furnishings. I had a room with a balcony which had a great view of the arch. Parking was $10/night. Overall my stay was decent.

review_content: Had a good stay here this week. The location was convenient and we had a nice view of the stadium and the heart of downtown. The room was beautiful, modern, and BIG! (I freaked out over the high ceilings... I loved them so much.) Everything was clean, service was good, and when there was no bacon or mayo on my fiance's club sandwich at the restaurant downstairs they fixed it immediately and didn't charge us for it, which was really nice of them (we actually ate in the restaurant twice and both times the food was great). We would absolutely stay here again.We spent 3 nights at the Westin next to Bush stadium. Her are the pluses and minuses. On the plus side the staff was all friendly that we dealt with. The room was large and clean, and the price with our group rate ($109) was very reasonable. We had a large bathroom with nice walkin shower. it is located right downtown with easy access (except for some construction). The food we were served at our business dinner was good. On the negative side we had a poor view (I realize not every room can have a gorgeous view of area) and the window was filthy/maybe they did it that way to obscure the view? The elevators are horrible slow and the bedside light was miswired where the wrong lights came on together. The thermostat was very touchy and you could not tell what temp you had it set for. I would really prefer that the toilet and or sink were located separately from tub and shower so you can sped up morning rush. The $30/ valet parking seemed a bit high to me. Overall it was worth the money we spent though I have tried to book here before and the price was like $400 at which point it would be grossly overpriced. .They say everything's bigger in Texas, but I've found that hotel rooms are bigger in St. Louis. A standard king room was big enough to be a suite at this joint. The bathroom is bigger than my apartment, and it sports a serious shower and a SEPARATE bath so nice that my wife ran out and bought some weird bath salts (but not the fun kind). I did find that despite many, many, many lights in the room, the lighting is actually terrible. On the other hand however, the blackout curtains do the trick and I could've slept in the fantastic bed for the rest of my life if I didn't have to fly home.The only thing sad about our stay was that some ignoramus has defiled the artwork* that was in our bathroom, but other than that, it was a beautiful stay. _____________*There was a lot of random writing on the painting, and above where it reads "dry like an oil well" someone has scrawled in, "My lady parts are..."Great LocationAmazing BedQuiet RoomsI stayed at the Westin this past weekend 9/18 - 9/20. I read a few other reviews about the art in this hotel and I can agree that it's intriguing, repulsive, and borderline offensive (primarily speaking about the bathroom). The rest of the room and bathroom were beautiful. The room was spacious with large windows. The king size bed was luxurious and comfortable to say the least!There were some large stains on the carpet either blood or wine but large enough to notice. The shower and tub were clean and neat.Getting in the hotel was fine, parking was $20 a night but that's comparable for most hotels of that caliber and location. Both parking lots were full so I called the front desk, they directed me to the valet who told me to park in their lot. Getting to the room was a MAZE I walked over a sky walk and around the entire hotel before I got to my room. Needless to say the front desk didn't tell me about the easier way to get to my room.... :/We didn't get maid service for whatever reason so I had to call down to the front desk to get towels around 4pm on Saturday. An hour and a half later I had to call back because I didn't get new towels yet, 20 min later they arrived. PROHotel BedLocation Room SizeBathroom AmenitiesQuietCONStained Carpets - professional cleaner/replaced it was either blood or wine lol Lack of Housekeeping- Discuss with maids, timeliness of requests should be addressedRepulsive Bathroom "art" mentioning suicide and homicide - remove/replaceExpensive Bar - Get me out of my room and spending money with some enticement!I read the reviews posted here and thought this would be a great place. Wrong! They couldnt find my reservation. The room was dirty and dated. They tried to overcharge me in the restaurant. Will not stay here again, felt we were being scammed every step of the way. Paid an extra 10$ for a room upgrade? So for 10$ they put a fridge full of over priced shit for me to pay for? So where's the upgrade? Criminal!!! Is there a good Hotel chain out there? $21 a day for self parking? This isnt Chicago!! Just Criminal! Shady Hotel!!Extremely hard to find with construction all around it.  The rooms are very nice but I will use the Millenium, Hyatt or dried plaza next time.  This hotel just sucked to get to and when checking out the front desk could not do basic math.  My checkout was over a half hour or more.  The girl could not figure out how to give me a detailed bill with each charge.  She said they don't do that, I said you can't add right I had 4 things from the mini bar and at one glance I could tell it was around $13 and parking was $20.  She added 4 different times with 4 different figures then said you owe $47.13.  Lady you can't ad 20 +13 without a calculator or a computer.  WTF!  STAY IN SCHOOL KIDS you may need it to keep your job.  Never again too many better choices in St. Louis.  2 for the room only.One of the worst hotels I've stayed in, in a long time. The valet hit our car with someone else's luggage, the coffee maker in the room (king size bed in room) is in the bathroom, the shampoo and conditioner bottles in the shower were not full leading us to believe they had been used before and the artwork in the bathroom was extremely dark and had graffiti on it. There is no fridge in the room but there is Starbucks coffee and tea.Hmm pretty disappointing for a Westin.CONS- concierge said 4am the metro opened. wrong. good thing my friend told me that the first train wasn't until 5am...otherwise I would've missed flight.- housekeeping didn't replace our shampoo/conditioner- not sound proof. there was a concert by the ball park and you can hear everything perfectly inside the room- confusing layout... there are two buildings and only the 2,3, and 4th floors have bridge access between buildings.- no one is ever at the front desk...why??- took them like 2 minutes to finally answer the phone when I called- super expensive food in the restaurant- for some reason the tissue box (and all the tissues inside as well) was SOAKED- we had a 200 person conference, and the water pitchers were constantly empty. Definitely didn't fill them enough.PROS- overhead showers (i don't know what they're called, but it made you feel like you were showering in a waterfall...amazing)- decent sized rooms with big windows- large cardio room AND a separate weight training room with a good amount of equipment- walking distance to a lot of attractionsIn conclusion, either the hotel is understaffed, or the staff doesn't bother to provide good service. I wasn't impressed.My first time visiting St Louis and also my first time trying this hotel. I really like the location of the hotel. They are very close to every single thing so there was no need to take a car because everything was in walking distance. The hotel staff is very very friendly which is always a plus. Even the housekeeping staff came back to clean our room once we decided to go to breakfast even after we changed our mind with no complaints. Also room service at any hour they came in were very nice and respectful. The room was great beds oh my gosh were magnificent and the bathroom was cute. The price tag could be better, I tried going thru them first and it was not what I wanted to pay. You can do like I did and find a deal. Will I stay here again? Hands down yes I would and when I tell you hey are good. They are. GOOD!A return to the scene of the crime. I haven't stayed here since my bachelor party, nearly ten years ago. In fact, I made my wife make the reservation as I was afraid that I might be persona non grata. Kidding...sort of.When we arrived, the hotel was exactly how I remembered it- swanky, with an industrial touch. The hotel bar...uh, yeah, thank God, it's been ten years, and I'm sure none of the same employees still work here. I could opine, but I'll leave it brief and say that the "morning after" consisted of my group, and other guests that we befriended, drinking this establishment out of bloody Mary's and mimosas. Seriously, we drank them dry. The rooms. Still looked brand new. Spacious, with huge windows, and Westin's famous "Heavenly Bed," which is the comfiest bed in any hotel. The bathroom. Uh, yeah- pretty f'n cool, with the glass doors, and a rainfall showerhead. Luckily, there was no random drunk girl, popping xanax like candy, bathing, uninvited in my bath tub this go around. Another story, in itself.Friendly employees, easy, reasonably priced valet, great modern, spacious rooms. No better location to catch a Cards game. Ten years later, it's still a great hotel.This place is baller. Like super baller. We arrived late on a Friday night (1 am), and despite out frustrations of 2 delayed flights, we were fairly tipsy and ready to go out. The guy at the front desk was super helpful, giving us recommendations for places to go out near the hotel. Best part ever... They upgraded us to the 7th floor, suite with pool table and amazing bedroom and bathroom. He have us a wink as he handed us out keys, and we had no idea that we were getting a free upgrade. Awesome sauce. The hotel is gorgeous. Great views of Busch Stadium, the Arch, and Ballpark Village. The breakfast buffet (we didn't get there until 11:30) was delicious, and although I never feel like I eat enough for the price, hubby are 3 plates and sent himself into a good coma. Great food for $15/ each. The ballroom (we went to a wedding) was gorgeous.Great customer service, great rooms an a great value for the location. Careful with parking, valet is $30 and there's a lot across the street for $15/day. Westin wins in my book.This hotel was wonderful!  I was in town for one night and had the lovely opportunity of staying here for the first time (Westin virgin!).  The staff at the front desk (valet and concierge included) were the epitome of excellent customer service.  Anyone in the service industry could take notes from this staff in how pleasant and helpful they are.  My room was spacious, comfortable, clean, and quiet, all very, very important to me with how much I travel.  I don't think I could find anything negative to say about this hotel if I tried!  I will most definitely stay here again my next trip to STL.Good view overseeing the stadium. Spacious room. Love all the layout with clean new bedding and huge bathroom. Service is good that they were fast to deliver the slippers we needed. We ordered room service, it was fast too and they can accommodate your need like.. i only want half dozen of the wings and they did so. Might be bc they only have the boneless ones while I originally wanted the bones. Food itself is just so so. We were there on a Thanksgiving night, hence we won't bother to look for a restaurant opens that night. You need to pay extra for parking though. And there's no laundry onsite and they sent us to Hilton next door instead.Nice place, comfortable beds. Way over priced for the tiny room though. Bathroom was really nice and the view of the stadium arch was really neat. Staff was very great and bartenders and waiters downstairs were fun and nice. Glen the bartender was super funny and very personable. The manager guy who was working was a complete jerk and very rude when any of the ball players were around acting like he was the FBI and nobody could even look their way. All in all, I have stayed in better places and for $584 bucks a night should have been top notch!We are currently staying at your Westin in St. Louis. We wanted to notify you that we were in room 373 in which the carpet and beds were covered in fleas. We had fleas hopping on our feet as we walked. The called the front desk who sent someone over to give us new room keys. The representative, who was very nice, had no idea why he was coming over. We called again to tell the front desk to make sure they were clear on the situation and all they told us that the room was now closed out. We were upset about the customer service until the manager called to express his concern a bit later and provided us vouchers due to our experience.Really not the best place I've stayed in St. Louis. The entire hotel is done up in so many shades of brown. Browns I never knew existed. Browns swirled together. Brown walls, brown floors, brown carpets, brown elevators, I felt suddenly color blind! The saddest part is that it looks newly redecorated! Apparently by someone with an obsession with doo doo. Lobby front desk is tucked away a bit oddly and there is NO COFFEE SHOP here. Be forewarned there will only be carafes of burned Starbucks to greet you in the morning.  But there does happen to be a juice bar where you can order up fresh made juices and smoothies. I guess outfitting that joint to include an espresso machine wasn't in the designers budget. But c'mon, espresso is BROWN, it's so logical!Room was meh. Sheets very scratchy and pillows all thinly stuffed feather (i.e. will flatten out in 10 seconds of head weight). TV was set very low for lying in bed watching, would have to sit up against the headboard to see anything. ZERO outlets at the bedsides, charge all electronics clear across the room. Room thermostat is a 70's relic where you move a lever back and forth between 65 and 75 and hope you re achieving something comfortable. Single sink in the giant bathroom along with a tub made for Jack Sprat but definitely not his wife. Shower had a cool rainfall design but rain isn't going to wash that shampoo right out of my hair now is it?? One entire star is awarded to my friend in the bar who was friendly and helpful with neighborhood tips and poured a stiff drink. You, my good friend, should go apply at the Cheshire where you will be appreciated!We only stayed one night- we arrived semi late and left pretty early in the morning so I didn't have the chance to see many amenities but we had excellent service. The bartender and all the staff were extremely friendly and we felt very welcome. Right next to Busch stadium which is exciting. Great rooms with plenty of space, all very clean and nice. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who needs a place to stay in Saint Louis.Great view of the Arch from here. Came with a girlfriend who was SPG Gold or something like that, so they upgraded us to a suit, which was great!Location was very convenient-- right next to the Stadium MetroLink stop, right across from Ballpark Village (which is great to go out at on the weekend), and the gym is pretty nice too, with full length mirrors (useful for shadow boxing). Breakfast was pretty good too!If you like baseball and it is the season, then having the stadium across the road has its benefits. This one of the cleaner hotels in St Louis.The downside. The rooms with x19 are sandwiched between what sounds like the kitchen extractor fan exhaust as it makes it way to the roof and the railway station outside. The electric hum of the trains and announcements do wear on you and start waaayyy early and end early morning too. Not exactly a relaxing or quiet room. The corridor in the morning is littered with the trays from guests that have ordered room service.I met a friend at the hotel bar and they were out of Ginger beer.  This was after a ten plus minute just for service. The breakfast service is a lot better but doesn't make up for the rest. Overall, I would much rather stay at the Hyatt or Hilton, both are downtown.Great hotel, service, and location. I was in town on a non-baseball game night and got a room for half off (~$100) via Trivago.
review_content_20: The bathtub has hair and garbage which did not get any clean.It should not be seen in the Westin as I supposed.It was horrible.I had to call room service to clean it at night.Very nice hotel however the filthy bathroom left a bad taste in my mouth. I expect a 4 star room to be spotless. In addition, you have to pay for wifi and parking. In the future the Drury's will be earning my business.I expected better, to be honest. $20/person to park started off the rather unmemorable experience. There's no direction signs to show you where the front desk is so I stood for a couple minutes like a moron. The room was gorgeous and modern and spacious with plenty of light. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The bed was lovely and comfortable. But. The WiFi is expensive, they charged $1.99 for a local call made from the room, and the tub was narrow for a soaker. Everything was outrageously expensive, which I expected. I didn't expect so many nickel and dime tactics from a superior-rated hotel. Honestly, I don't think I'll be back.Oops! I accidently rated the other hotel we stayed at and got them confused.... (it was a blonde moment).The Westin is a great location if you're walking to the game. I always find that staying at a Westin property is normally quite a good experience.This hotel by far does not disappoint. The room is spacious, beds are comfy, love the toiletries and the gym at this hotel is super. Lots of machines and all of the equipment is new.Loved it. The only downfall is they totally need to upgrade the towels.... those suckers are rough!Nice comfortable rooms, great service from front desk and doorman. I can't recall his name but very good with kids- they want to go back to visit.Ultra-mod hotelFood wasn't all that swellFor as much as the priceIt would have been niceHad they bought 'happy' paintings on sale.Note: Giant rendering in bathroom (as reviewers on another site noted) has a serpent and an oozing limb, along with various handwritten notes from someone in a deep, dark depression over a failed romantic relationship. I guess it's in all the bathrooms. Makes you leave there pondering the mental state of the artist, as well as that of The Westin's management team.We stayed at this hotel being two adults and a 10-year-old with two queen beds we truly felt like 1 million bucks, The hotel staff was very friendly, they had an on-site restaurant and bar, and the location was pretty cool. Right across the street from Busch Stadium, and within walking distance from the Gateway arch and the old courthouse and well near the Soulard district. Up-to-date modern clean and well designed, this was a great place to stay in St. Louis. Everything about the hotel was fantastic except for one single thing that left a bad taste in my mouth, and that was paid parking. It's very hard to feel as a "guest" when one of the first things you do when you arrive is get charged before you even walk into your own hotel room. I know that this is common practice for many large hotels however it is a practice that in my opinion is in very poor taste, and thus loses a Star just because of that. we stayed on the seventh floor opposite the stadium and yet our view was still interesting and captivating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to many people when staying in St. Louis.Our room was lovely, and very comfortable. The parking staff was friendly and prompt, and front desk staff were courteous and helpful, which was good because there was no concierge on duty, at 4:00 on a Friday.After a day's worth of driving, then walking for two hours to see the Arch, we went down to the restaurant to eat, instead of going out, because we were exhausted. The hostess seated us, and we then waited fifteen minutes and had received no water, and no acknowledgment from any serving staff; there were only two other tables seated in the dining room. We never saw a server and we couldn't find the hostess, either. So, we just got up and left. I'm sure they thought we didn't want to pay their prices, but we gladly would have paid. They may as well not even have a restaurant. (Perhaps the staff was providing room service?)We were not warned, when we checked at 4:00, that our room was directly across the street from a rock concert. When we returned after walking the neighborhood to find a place to eat (which we would have preferred not to do), we asked a second desk clerk about the music and he said, "Yep... there's lots of music. They have concerts all the time." We could not even hear the television in our room. Mercifully, the racket ended at 10:00 pm.All in all, this hotel stay was acceptable, and the physical environment was five-star. But the racket across the street and the dining room experience put a serious ratings-dent in this review.When I stay at a Westin, from the time of booking to the time of check-in, I start a slow chant:"Heavenly Bed. Heavenly Bed. Heavenly Bed."For you see, I am a big dude, married to a big dude, and we have two big dogs, with whom we share our bed. I am a light sleeper, and I toss and turn. I essentially never get a good night's sleep, and the Heavenly Bed cures that. But when I checked in to room 460, my bed was decidedly not Heavenly. It was more just like "bed." I wept.But notice that 4 stars I still gave the hotel? That's because regular-bed aside, this place is great! I'm assuming it's newly remodeled, because both the lobby and our room were really great. The room's bathroom was HUGE, with a massive soaking tub and also a glassed in stand-alone shower. Oh, one thing: the towels were pretty dang rough. boo. Locationwise, it can't be beat. Literally across the street from Busch Stadium and on the very same corner as a metro stop, it's convenient as can be. It's a really good hotel.And the cherry on top? We got this badboy on Hotwire for like $60 a night after taxes. That's just an unreasonably good price.Westins always surprise me. They don't have the branding like Four Seasons or the Peninsulas or the Knickerbocker...but they always manage to dazzle me.The Westin may be my new favorite downtown St. Louis hotel.I needed a staycation room. I was thinking of the Cheshire at first because that's where I usually put people up at, but there were people joining me that hadn't been to St. Louis, and I really wanted them downtown. So I hopped onto Hotwire, crossed my fingers, and got this 4-star Downtown hotel for approximately $70 for a Saturday night in December after taxes. The stay rocked. The good:*It's a gorgeous room! Roomy and really nice and sleek.*Heavenly Beds ARE heavenly! I could stay in one forever. Also, they tell me that the rollaways are made from the same material as the Heavenly Beds and are supposedly better than the rollout couches. *I could live in the bathroom alone. You could fit an entire group of people in the shower (not that you would want to) and the deep soak tub looks amazing! I wish the bathroom had a vent thing though. *It's really really quiet. But it's the off season, so I imagine that on a game night, it would be really really loud. *It's a little off the main downtown traffic routes so you do get some privacy in the off season while being really close to 64/40. The bad:*If I hadn't know where it was, I'd never have found it. The main entrance faces south towards 64/40 and to the left of it is the Metrolink and then Busch stadium.*Parking is $27 for valet, $22 for self parking. There are some lots that are cheaper around the area, especially during baseball season. *Internet is $11/day. *It's so close to Busch. I think it wouldn't be so relaxing during the summer. *Obviously, since it's a nice hotel, the attached restaurant has pretty high prices for average food. *Nothing else really nearby. Check in is at 3 PM, check out is at noon. At some Westins, they may allow for a late checkout on the weekends, but I'm not sure if this one is one of those that do it. 24 hour fitness center with spa options during the day. They also do participate in the Run Westin program where they do have a running route for you if you're interested, and sometimes you can even borrow running shoes. I'd definitely be back for another staycation.We booked this hotel for a RIDICULOUS deal thought hotwire. I think it was no more than $80 bucks a night WITH taxes, so that was a plus to begin with. This hotel is HUGE - I think it is in an old factory or something, and there appears to be only one elevator to each floor - our room was a bit of a walk from the elevator and near a skywalk or something that went to even more rooms. (Please note that this was NOT an issue though). The room was spacious, and clean (albeit for one stain on the carpet, that again, didn't phase us really, and when we let the front desk know about it, the immediately offered to move us to another room). Our room did NOT have a view of the arch (not all rooms do, only the ones on the side of the hotel closest to the ballpark).The bathroom - OMG. Large soaking tub, HUGE rain/steam shower (I seriously still miss it).We had such a great time in St. Louis, that we decided to stay an extra day - no issues, front desk team was above and beyond helpful, even sending mail for us, arranging for a taxi for us when we went out (don't want to drink and drive, right?) :)Would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat when we return to STL! Only comment - in this day and age, WiFi should be free.It's nice place , but not clean as you expect it , there is dust on lamps and other areas , bar cooler its not clean They didn't clean the room till 3ish ! For the price they charging people I deserve more ,,,We had breakfast and service and food was okay not excellentWe live right across the river in IL, and with bad weather coming in and floor seats to Frozen on Ice at the Scottrade Center for my daughter's 4th birthday, we booked a last minute room in St Louis for the night to avoid the drive in the snow and ice. We booked through Hotwire.com and got this room for a STEAL. We paid 75 bucks for the room and since we had never stayed at the hotel, we didn't know exactly what we were getting into. We arrived and the valet immediately helped us in with our luggage so we could grab our kids. We checked in and were upgraded to a king suite for no additional charge. We got to our room and it was HUGE! Giant bed with a view of the Scottrade Center (most want to see the arch, but we were fine with our view because we got a good idea of the traffic we would be battling the next day to get to the show). We ordered pizza and spent the entire evening in our room with our family. There was a giant soaker tub that was super comfortable and a glass encased rainfall shower. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was glorious. They brought a roll away bed upstairs for my 4 year old, and I was thinking it would be something like a hard little cot. NO WAY. It was a twin sized bed with an equally comfortable mattress and luxurious bedding! It was probably one of our best hotel stays ever. The next morning after 6+ inches of snowfall, the valet was waiting and helped clean off our vehicle while we loaded up our kiddos. I couldn't be more pleased with the staff, cleanliness and value we got.The only complaint that I have is that WiFi cost close to 12.00 for 24 hours of access. That's literally all I can find to complain about, and its not a big enough deal to lose a star! 5 stars Westin! Great job! We will be back!I booked this room using Priceline's Name Your Price, and I must say, this has been the best deal I ran into, by far. When we got there, we were approached and greeted by the valet outside. They were very helpful in getting our bags out of the car and helping us into the hotel. Since I already paid via Priceline, check in was a breeze. The front desk clerk was incredibly helpful and efficient. He let us know we had a "great room" on the top floor. And great room we had! We had a GIANT corner room with floor to ceiling windows on one wall, two very large beds, a giant bathroom complete with a soaking tub and a huge glass-encased shower with a fabulous shower head. We were blown away by the deal we got. Everything was sheer perfection. The beds were super comfortable, the pillows plenty, a lot of TV choices, and the bathroom shower was phenomenal. Overall, I would DEFINITELY stay here again!!This is my first stay here. The hotel is a nice modern look to it. The bed is very comfortable and the bathrooms are really large. The house cleaning service was really fast and did a great job.My only complaint is the front desk and front desk manager. This is the only Westin I felt that was not friendly, the business center was where they told me go the person have me the wrong directions. I asked if it needed a key and she said no. Then when I walked up there it was locked and required a key. The sign in the business says if you need copies you can go to the front desk. I was there first and ask the front desk for a copy. I tried calling the front desk for information it took 5 mins of a ring just to get someone to pick up the phone. It is really great location. Just horrible customer service for a Westin!Totally just left my laptop in a cab. Told the bellhop. Guy straight takes off running, jumped in another cab and began to chase my cab down, ran two red lights in downtown STL, caught the guy and retuned my laptop in 7 minutes flat. Freaking ridiculous. Shawn is the damn Navy Seals of bellhops. Very impressed.If you are traveling for business, this is not a normal Starwood property. The rooms are massive and beds comfortable. Staff are very friendly. On the other hand, you can hear your neighbor's every move, the bathrooms are poorly lit, business desks only so-so and accessing the fridge requires that you use the minibar key which may incur a charge.Quality hotel; far less than quality service.I had a very negative first impression when it took the hotel 2.5 hours to get my room ready after I came to check in after 3:30pm. I came with a large group of people who booked our rooms well in advance, and still they weren't ready by the time of check-in? I've heard very rude and unflattering remarks of how staff treated some party members of our group when they tried to check in early ahead of the group because they were traveling separately. (Please understand: our group is coming from Philly via an 18 hour road trip to get here to St. Louis for a FIRST Robotics Championship competition that's been hosted here for several years now and that has been alerting businesses in the area of our 30k-40k people incoming presence.) I find it ridiculous that it took them so long to clean up our rooms when we booked in advance, they knew that they were going to receive several groups of 30 ish people, and y wet it still took them so long. Absolutely ridiculous.It really continue to roll downhill from there after that initial impression. Breakfast is a "buffet" for $18.40 every morning. Wi-Fi is not free in your rooms; you have to pay $14.99 per night to have Wi-Fi access and you are only allowed to use up to 3 devices to use such services. Access to the room bar/fridge is very expensive, adding an 18% service fee plus additional 10% tax on whatever alcohol or candy you found worth it enough to rake up such prices. Lobby food and drink that are kept behind the desk is expensive as well. $4 for a standard plastic water bottle. $2 for soda can; $2-4 for any of the candy bars or boxes. They carry various bathroom products for anyone who found that they forgot something or needed something. It seems well prepared and well stocked. You can have free Wi-Fi access in the lobby, which have okay seating and space, but is definitely not ideal for the businessperson who needs privacy and quiet to work. You may consider me a bit cheap from how much I paid attention to those cost details, but I'll inform you that these prices are absolutely ridiculous. They'd later run our water bottles so I eventually resorted to drinking the tap water for mostly free.I was placed in a room on the fourth floor, which is an adventure to get to everytime I need to leave the floor to go to the lobby. I have to walk across a connecting bridge after taking three turns to get there. It was very spacious and had a great bathroom (i included bathtub that is a bit tall, shower with fold-up seat, toliet with lots of space around it, singular sink with shampoo products, towels, and hotel blow dryer). Bed was comfortable, sheets were of a scratchy and thin blanket and a thick and much better duvet over it. You can't see the television from laying down; you'd have to sit up to do it. No outlets near the bed, you'd have to consult the desks set up across the room away from the bed. Lights are well placed in the room, Hotel cleaning service is accomodating to your requests if you leave specific instructions for what you'd rather they not do. For example, I specifically wrote a request down that my sheets did not need to be made, and they accomodating that for the rest of my duration so as long I kept it stuck to the television through the complimentary hotel post-it notes. They also seem to provide a laundry cleaning service for fees.This hotel was very nice and all, but I had such a poor impression. From check-in, to my terrible allergic reactions to the dry and windy conditions of St. Louis, to my complete disappointment in the lack of quality food services and places around Downtown St. Louis, and overall would reccomend this hotel to people who have the money and time to not care about the deets that I've pointed out.Decided to stay here for my birthday this past year. Bumped up my opinion from 4 to 5 stars. I had a bath tub this time.. Sweet relief. One of my favorite things has always been a big luxurious bathroom and this one is great. One thing I'd like to add is that I had the delicious breakfast buffet downstairs. It was so good. Loved all the fresh fruit. This is the best place to stay when going to a Cardinals game, especially if you have seats on the first base side - VERY close walk between that stadium entrance and the hotel.Stayed here when we were road-tripping during our move from Los Angeles to Chicago, and this place felt like pure luxury after staying in tiny motels in the middle of America. The room was huge, bed was very comfortable and we had views of the city. We were able to bring our pooch in with no pet fee, and they gave her a doggy bed, dog bowls & a treat. They get 5 stars for giving our dog 5 star treatment! The location was great and was walking distance to the arch & the ballpark. Room price was reasonable, and we got a deal for under $200 including parking at the last minute during the middle of the week. I believe this hotel costs more if you plan ahead and on the weekends. This was exactly the treatment that we needed after spending 25 hours in the car and the motels we had been staying in the previous 2 nights.
review_content_40: We arrived in town, did a quick walk around looking at the St Louis sites and for a restaurant for dinner.  Hemmed and hawed about going to Mike Shannon's or Carmine's but saw a sign in the Westin elevator about their bar menu and it was perfect. Didn't have to venture out on the streets and had a great dinner of superb apps and wine.  Crab cakes were fabulous  as were the other selections and wines. and waiter was really great.Had a very pleasant short stay. Always love this hotel. It has a very substantial amount of space! Love the lay out, the high ceiling, the bed and of course the roomy clean bathroom!Fantastic rooms, and service overall. The beds are amazing like all of the Westins. I have only one complaint and it seems it is rampant in St Louis, as it happens at the Four Seasons as well. When I pull my car up to Valet, why in the world don't the Valet attendants open the door for my wife? It happens every single time. I still give great tips, but it would be nice if they open her door, not mine. I don't need my door opened.Either way, thanks for a great stay!Great experience. Large room with ample plug-ins you don't have to be a gymnast to find...HUGE bathroom with separate walk-in shower and soaker tub...and the perfect bed. Check-in/out was fast and easy. We enjoyed the bar for a couple of hours after the Red Sox game, too - worth the price for convenience and a very friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was also yummy. The best hotel valet parking experience ever - super nice guy, WAY faster than most (I'm looking at you, Intercontinental Chicago) and very reasonable. This easily the best place to stay if you're going to Busch Stadium. It looks like it opened a month ago and everyone acted like they actually enjoy working there.Great room, large and spacious with big beds. Everything was clean and very nice, we were able to check in and out quickly. Just beware of the breakfast buffet,  it was $ 50 for two people and I'm almost certain they used powdered eggs for the scramble eggs.Great location but they charge you for everything possible- Internet, bottled water (even though it looks complimentary), parking, etc. For being a 4-star hotel, I expected more. It was not as clean as it should have been (black spots in white duvet cover, shower head, hallways/elevator smelled and needed to be vacuumed). I visit STL often and will not be coming back. Customer service is of little to zero help and I spoke with 3 different people who treated me like I knew nothing. Unfortunate.Loved this hotel. Booked with a wedding block and the price was fantastic. The location is wonderful (even though I'm a Cubs fan) and all the amenities were wonderful. The beds were amazing---I don't think I've stayed at many Westins, but they are definitely up to something with their Heavenly beds. The bathrooms in our room were lovely---the deep soaking tub was irresistible. We ordered room service and the employees were great. Wish the wifi didn't cost an arm and a leg. It always surprises me that more expensive hotels charge so much for wifi, but cheaper hotels include it. But it was nice to unplug for a few days. Although if I needed to use wifi, I would have been really disappointed. My only complaint was that I called ahead of time to ask where my mother and I might be able to get a manicure/pedicure prior to the wedding and we were told "I don't know....." How does a hotel staff member not know where someone can get their nails done? I can't believe we were the first ones to ask. And no offer to ask someone else, or find out for us. Oh well---we ended up at the Four Seasons Spa and it was fantastic.Charged for little things that are usually complimentary at Marriott or Hiltons. Hairspray, nail files and shaving cream. Ok- it wasnt that much. But when I had to ship my sandals back after forgetting them (my fault, I know), they shipped them the most expensive way after specifically asking them to be shipped the cheapest way possible. Its the little things that matter- I wont be staying at a Westin any time soon.Amazing rooms , huge bathrooms & just amazing service!! The rooms were big enough for any size family & the breakfast was hot & delicious!Our stay over Christmas at the Westin was fantastic!  If you are in town for a baseball game, you can't get any more convenient to Busch Stadium.  It is also close to the other sites in downtown like the Arch, Citygarden and the old courthouse.    The rooms in this place are huge!  The bathrooms, likewise, are also very spacious.  They also had a rainfall shower head which was a nice touch.We tried both dinner and breakfast here.  The breakfast was just so-so.  The dinner, however, was really good.  The toasted raviolis were good, which is something everyone must try while in St. Louis.  I also had a salmon salad, which had an Asian-style dressing, which was fantastic.   This place is also pet friendly, which is nice.  Our dog got welcomed with a giant milk bone and they provided a dog bowls and a dog bed too.Wonderful hotel!! My favorite place to stay when visiting downtown St Louis. Rooms spacious, staff wonderful, bathrooms are amazing. Highly recommend. Also make every effort to visit the spa while staying (even go to spa if I have to stay at another downtown hotel). Affordable, polite staff, and Jen is incredible. The best massage I have ever had.Thank you Westin! Nothing worse than not feeling well when traveling for business. Your customer service is ALWAYS the best in the business. From the upgraded suite with some of the most comfortable bedding in the industry to your (free) breakfast which was one of the best/healthiest I've had all year, you made me feel as close to being at home as possible. And you found me an urgent care 5 minutes away!  #starwood #platinumforlifeA really nice place to stay especially if you are trying to go to cardinals games. Pretty clean and good service. Love the proximity to Busch stadium and flying saucer and joe bucks. But other then that not much around  cuz it's pretty much on the highway.Really nice place with outstanding customer service.  Rooms were very nice, though the 2 Queen beds seemed more like 2 full size beds to me and my family, they were very comfortable.  We got a good deal on the room for 100.00 a night including free valet parking and breakfast for 2. We were visiting family for Christmas and the staff were very friendly and accomodating even though it was a holiday.  The bath rooms come with a deep soaking tub and a seperate shower both were very stylish and very pretty to look at.  We loved it!There is no pool on site but the front desk clerk said we could use another nearby hotels pool which was just fine.I would recomend this room, as it is a very nice place for the money.  Also loved the Starbucks with the in room coffee maker.    Very nice touch!I have now stayed here three times and every time my stay is better than the previous stay.
