Service- from the valet, bell men, front desk and Clark Grille staff- everyone is helpful And seems genuinely happy to be there.  Great rooms with a really nice bathroom dual shower head option, massive bathtub, and updates. Without asking was granted a platinum upgrade to a great room. The location is near the ballpark and great eats and drinks on Washington street and 15 minutes from "The Hill"- the historic and amazing Italian Mecca of the Midwest! The lobby is cozy with a roaring fireplace and the hotel always smells like a Westin- yes I believe it is a special delightful scent.My fav place to stay in the Lou!!!My boyfriend and I stayed here over Valentine's Day and it was great!!We got a room through Travelocity and the price was a little high, but it was kind of last minute and i guess bc of valentine's Day, prices were a little higher than usual.  At least, that was my guess.We got a king bed room, which was on the 5th floor, but our view was not that great.  When looking out the window, it was a view of the parking garage.  if you looked to your right though, you could see the Arch and the new ballpark village that's being built.Our room was really big and the bathroom was huge! The shower was really nice and clean and so was the tub!The bed was also comfortable and big and I slept really great.  I definitely want to stay here again when i get the chance!We arrived just before a baseball game (the hotel is across the street from the stadium). It was a zoo outside, but we were able to valet the car with no issue. I think you'll want to valet if there's anything going on downtown. We found the staff friendly and the hotel in great shape. Comfortable bed, big bathroom with both a tub and a shower. No complaints here, all good.I loved my stay here. The staff here are fantastic - incredibly welcoming and helpful. The rooms are beautiful - I got the opportunity to stay in one of their king-sized luxury suites. I wish my apartment looked like the room! No joke. They have Starbucks coffee for you to make in the room, and there's Showtime provided for on TV. The rom came with a comfy couch, an executive style desk, and lots of storage. The bathroom is fantastic as well. It comes with a shower and tub; really large. The Westin made my stay in St. Louis really relaxing while I was here for a conference. I had some really long days, so it was great to come here and feel like I could rest well and retreat. I'm actually sad I couldn't take more advantage of my room and the hotel's amenities. I chose for them not to clean my room during my stay there. Each night you choose that, they provide a $5 gift card for you. The gift cards are redeemable at the front desk for snacks and drinks or at the restaurant downstairs. On my last day, I chose to use it at the restaurant and treated myself to their breakfast buffet. Yum. It came with sausage, eggs, bacon, oatmeal, fruit, and more. The Metrolink has a stop right at the Westin, so it's incredibly easy to get here from the airport. There's a computer in the downstairs lobby for you to print out boarding passes when you check out, or you can actually get the front desk to print them out for you. If you're reading this, I hope you find your stay at the Westin as relaxing and convenient as I did!Best Hotel in STL! The rooms are larger than your avg hotel rooms and the housekeeping dept keeps them very clean. The front desk is very nice and they always provide the best recommendations on where to have dinner to confirm what I read on yelp.. Stay here if coming to St. Louis. It is the place to stay for sure.Nice spacious room. Employees are friendly. It is one of the better Westins.Valets are pretty slow, so make sure you give them ample of time.
review_content_60: Had a great experience at the Westin. Great old building that has had a refurb inside. Great downtown location fairly close to the trolly line which made it easy to get to the arch, city gardens, dinner etc. Room was really nice, clean, and bright. The workout facility is nice and the only downside compared to competitors is they don't have a pool. I thought the breakfast was really well done although one day they were understaffed and service was really slow. We didn't complain but they noticed, apologized, and paid for a breakfast. A real nice gesture.Great hotel!! I would recommend staying here. We did have an issue with housekeeping not cleaning our room the first night, and a miscommunication on not replenishing our coffee stock and cups. But overall it was a good experience. The restaurant there has some AWESOME BBQ sandwich and sweet potato fries! I would definitely stay again!This was our 4th stay here and two of the four weren't good; however, this last time we were given a huge suite, away from the freeway off-ramp and the room was clean and everything was in good working order. The staff here is phenomenal -very helpful, friendly and seemingly sincere in their happiness and desire to provide quality service. The restaurant was ok...convenient but somewhat pricey for the quality of food (the food quality is ok, the price is high). Ultimately, we will definitely stay here again when in the area. It's convenient to the freeway and pet friendly!Great room. Nice hotel. Very swanky. Great view of downtown. Very friendly staff. Only downside is 20 bucks on top of room just to park in an unguarded and halfway plowed parking lot. Parking should be free for guests in my opinion. If parking was free this would be 5 stars.I had my wedding at the Westin in August, and it was fantastic. The rooms we stayed in were beautiful and well kept. The ceremony space was phenomenal, and the Promenade was absolutely perfect for cocktails and the reception. With the help of the event planners Heather and Shannon, everything was perfect. I couldn't have asked for an easier day in a better venue.I didn't want to leave my room! It was so huge and relaxing. I could have lived in the bathroom, it was so big. There was a nice bathtub separate from the shower. The shower had a giant shower head that made me feel like I was under a mini water fall.The bed was a whole other world. I didn't want to get out of it once I got in. It was so comfortable and the thick, fluffy comforter kept me warm and cozy on a cold, St. Louis night.The people at the front desk were very helpful and made the check-in and check-out process very easy.I would definitely stay there again.Great place to stay, and a great location too! First Class All The Way!I love this place! The rooms are huge, the decor is really nice, and the staff has always been very nice. Since it's right across the street from Busch Stadium, it would be a great place to stay if you are going to a game, and needing to stay the night. But I can imagine that they fill up in advance, so plan ahead.We stayed at the Westin in St. Louis on the 29th of November. My wife and I were in Missouri to see her brother graduate from basic training and AIT for the army and wanted to stay in St. Louis one night before we left. We reserved a room with a view of the stadium, as my wife is a huge baseball fan and loves seeing different stadiums.We got to the hotel a bit early. 1:15 PM to be precise. We fully expected that the room might not be a ready and we may have to wait a little while. We checked in and the young woman stated that it was not ready, but that she would contact house keeping. She did offer me another room, without the view, but I stated that we could wait a little while. She swiped my credit card, and we sat in the lobby. While we waited, my in-laws who were staying down the street at the Hyatt showed up. They had no problems checking in early there. At 2:45 PM, a full hour and a half later, I approached the desk again. I was admittedly a bit angry by then. The young woman I had spoken to before was no longer at the desk. It was apparent to me immediately that the young man at the desk had no idea we had been waiting. He also offered us a different room, at which point I explained how long we had been waiting and asked how close they planned on cutting it, since their official check-in time is at 3:00 PM.He apologized profusely and contacted house keeping. The room was ready. I think he could tell that I was angry for waiting so long, so he offered to add breakfast to the reservation for no charge. I told him I had already added it and paid for it. He then offered me two beers and an appetizer at the Clark Street Grill. I accepted them, but to be honest - I had never been to St. Louis before. I was only there one day and flying out the next morning and this hotel wasted an hour and a half (nearly two hours by the time we got in the room) of my time. To me, that's worth more than some food and drink coupons, but I fully understand that he probably wasn't authorized to do much more.We got to the room. It was spacious, clean, and the bathroom looked great. I immediately noticed we had no refrigerator in our room. I know I could have called the front desk, but when you pay as much as you do at a Westin I shouldn't need to make a call to have a refrigerator. The windows were dirty, but the view of the stadium was still decent.This is the one hotel I've stayed at and had my entire stay ruined at check-in. Additionally, we had been in the Ft. Leonard Wood area the two nights previous to this, and I paid less for two nights (total) at the Hampton Inn in St. Robert. For that price, I had a jacuzzi and a king size bed. I had no problems at check-in. Check-in in general was more efficient and friendly. Breakfast was included. I had a fridge.This is a luxury hotel?? I'm sorry I cheated on the Hampton Inn, but the Westin looked so nice and the location was right. I will not make this mistake again.The spacious bathroom with both a tub and a shower is the premier feature of the room. The cheap AM/FM radio was useless.Checkout was a disaster. I thought standing in line at the front desk to checkout was a thing of the past. Not hereVery Noisy! The hotel was located next to Ball Park Village which was great! It was snowing and cold but it's so close to the entertainment it was a very short easy walk to all the fun. I attempted to get some sleep from the time we got back at midnight to 4am. Finally I had to take a sleeping pill because the noise outside. Everyone is leaving the bars and they seem to stand in the parking lot screaming and yelling for long periods of time. The windows do Not provide any noise reduction at all it was ridiculous! I was on the 4th floor and I could hear peoples whole conversations outside (drunks tend to talk Very Loud!) ALL NIGHT LONG I heard screeching tires in the parking lot.. car alarms going off.. people honking at each other. It's really a shame when I stayed back in 07 it was the best nights sleep ever! It was quiet and cozy but now that all the bars parking lots are directly next to the hotel its nearly impossible to get any sleep! We are not very picky people my husband and I are both 30 so we understand the whole night life thing. For the cost I was VERY unhappy that I was woken up the whole night.Still my favorite hotel in the midwest. Following a few prior visits, the Misses and i celebrated a wedding Ann over a weekend here following my last review. One of the attendant/ valets--Kris asked us why we were staying; upon arriving back to the room, we found a small champagne and chocolate platter waiting for us.I emailed the GM upon returning to say "thanks" and compliment Kris for his friendliness; as well as the goodies. Have stayed at the hotel a few times subsequent since the review. Seen Kris everytime--point is not about stalking! Rather, people--staff is awesome here. They are tenured; they like their jobs; they stick around.Also want to compliment bartender Orlando this time. Had to send a past-prime Fat Tire back (that stuff has a "best by" date-- to my surprise, it was well past and tasted a little past. Orlando was great about it; comped the replacement drink. When i visited the bar a subsequent time, he tried to pass on a tip for my single drink that time (saying i was "too kind to him last time.") Good people at this hotel.Great hotel, stayed only a night, but man it was awesome, HUGE room size as well as bathroom space. Customer service was great and it is literally 10 steps from Busch stadium as I could hear the baseball game and the fireworks, which maybe a problem if you're a early sleeper or something. Very clean and I would use again!What a great hotel experience!-Huge rooms-Friendly staff-Quick room service -Comfy beds It's an all around phenomenal experience for pretty inexpensive. I'm not sure if this is the norm in St. Louis, but if it is the my standards are set pretty high for future visits.In SD now visiting family. And our hotel here is so so. But this place was awesome. All I can say is Jacuzzi bath tub!!! Very nice staff and comfy beds.One of the best parts of this hotel was the staff, extremely friendly and helpful. They accommodated us very well.We ended up getting a room on hotels.com for about $100. We called and requested a room with a view. Our room was amazing, very spacious bedroom and bathroom and we had view of the Cardinal's stadium. The bar downstairs was good as well, recommended the mixed drinks! The breakfast was also delicious with a high selection to accommodate everyone. The location is great too, so many things within walking distance. When I go back I will definitely stay here.The only downside was the parking was a little creepy, but nothing to really complain about.Much nicer and more comfortable than the average hotel. It's a chain, but luxurious enough to feel special. Great fitness room. We found a good deal online and were very glad we stayed here.Stayed here a couple weeks ago. Here's the rundown from a biz traveler standpoint:-interesting location, perfect for a game, not sure how good it is for meetings-great internet speed - 2.53Mb/s down speedtest.net/result/118... -Gym was really odd - it seems like a relatively new hotel but all the gym equipment is 20-30 years old-Heavenly bed delivered a good night's sleep-Solid breakfast that's included if you're platinumNo brainer if you're here for a gameWe stayed here last night on our way home from Atlanta. We selected it first because it was a Westin, but secondly because they accept dogs up to 50# and we had pour Boxer with us. We were very happy with how nice the property was. When we checked in we signed a waiver about our dog but it was very basic. They asked if we wanted food and water bowls and a Heavenly dog bed and directed us to a park just across the street where we could walk the dog. We had dinner in the bar -- appetizer of potato skins and dinner -- a wood fired sausage pizza. It was all good! The room was very cleansed larger than w expected. No pet smell at all. In fact, you would never guess you could have a pet in a hotel this nice!We would definitely stay here again. It's also just across the street from Busch stadium!!I do not have any other hotels in St. Louis to compare this one to, and I wont.Starwood at it's greatest. Look out my window and I see Busch Field, close the drapes and I don't have to be reminded this is where the Cardinals play.Very big rooms and huge bathrooms with separate tubs. Excellent showers.It's your choice, walk down to the Arc or whatever and stand in line with the other tube sock to the knee fanny pack crowd, or walk down 7th and discover an American classic neighborhood with bars and restaurants catering to locals and the Cardinal baseball religious.And then look up and see where Budweiser Beer was born. You can't miss it.St. Louis might be on to something.
review_content_80: I was pleasantly surprise by this hotel.  The room was spacious and the bathroom was very nice also.  The check in was pretty slow and we waited about 1/2 hour before our room was ready.  I had asked for an upgrade to a suite, but was declined because they had a group that took the rooms.  We found out later that the "group" was a professional hockey team.  We were also there for four days and the staff graciously offered to have a refrigerator delivered to our room.  It was bigger than the minibar fridge, so we were able to store food and drinks for the entire weekend.  The beds were not as comfortable as other hotels, but the bathroom made up for it.  The separate bath and shower was a nice touch, as was the over-sized bathroom counter space.  The outside of the building looked much like the rest of St. Louis, ie drab, but once inside, it was modern and new.  The gym is separated into three different rooms.  Some of the machines were out of order.  There is no pool.  The cafe downstairs served buffet breakfast.  For the $15.99 price, it is pretty limited.  If we ever have another reason to return to St. Louis, we will definitely try this hotel again.Spacious Room, Great Atmosphere, Awesome Decor and the customer service was Excellent. I cant believe I paid less than $90.00 with free parking and breakfast. This was a great deal. If they had a refrigerator and microwave in the room, it would be the best hotel ever.Enjoyed my visit very much. Huge room, nice decor, good food, great drinks, friendly staff, best location to Busch Stadium. All around great experience.My three friends and I decided to take a road trip from chicago to st louis for the blackhawks vs blues game this past saturday! The westin in conveniently located about 4 blocks from the scotttrade center. It's only about a 10 minute walk from the arch and right across from busch stadium.The room was huge and so was the bathroom, and the beds were very comfy! They have overnight parking for 20 bucks which is not bad at all for hotel parking!I will definitely be back next year for another hawks/blues matchup!Nice rooms.Ridiculously convenient to Busch Stadium.Friendly + helpful restaurant team, even right @ 6am when they've just opened.very clean and comfortable. Great location..checking out today to go back to LA, but highly recommend !@!My son and I visited St Louis to tour St Louis University and enjoy a Rockies vs Cardinals series. We decided on The Westin for its convenient location for both purposes and the Metrolink access. We did not rent a car. The Westin allows for easy walking access to most everything you'd need for a weekend stay.The facility interior is beautiful. The rooms are surprisingly large. The restaurant and bar area is clean, open-air and convenient for a full day from breakfast to post-game nightcap and snack. The visiting team stays here so if you're a fan it doesn't get any better for being up close to the stars.The staff is very friendly, approachable and helpful in every way. We needed directions to the university and around construction that had closed the Metrolink stop. Meranda (I believe) took all the time needed to specifically direct us.- and with a nice smile. We ate a few meals in the hotel and all were excellent. (I wasn't crazy about our waiter Ronnie's technique and lack of organization, but he sure is friendly). I know that if we do return to St Louis, either for a campus visit or a baseball trip, The Westin will be our priority choice.My wife and I are staying here for our first anniversary. At check in, we informed Yvette S., the front desk agent, that we are celebrating our anniversary. When we came back to the hotel after lunch, we received a phone call from Yvette asking politely if we drink alcohol. We confirmed, and she told us that she would send up a couple of complimentary drink tickets or something to celebrate. A few hours later, after we had dinner, we came back to our room and discovered a bottle of champagne and a fruit plate along with a very personal handwritten card. We feel so welcome and will definitely book another stay at a Westin Hotel. Thank you to Yvette and the staff for the wonderful hospitality.My husband's birthday weekend, thought we'd splurge a little on a nice hotel for our road trip across I-70. It was worth it.Our room (a single king) was big and beautiful. We are about to remodel our attic into a master suite, and I will definitely be taking some design ques from the Westin. Great reading lights - little sconces on the nightstands, and additional small pendants that hang above the bed from the ceiling. Brilliant! I want to take the Heavenly Bathroom and plunk it down in the second floor of my house.The Heavenly Bed was very comfy - not too firm, not too soft - but the sheets were just ok. Seemed a little stiff, and not super soft - hence the four star rating. We were on the third floor with a view straight down the driveway, right over the front awning. Not great, not terrible. Parking was pretty convenient - it's right across the street, and there isn't a lot of traffic or anything. I don't recall seeing any mention of the parking situation on their website when I booked it, so I did have to call to figure this out for sure. The parking attendants at the lot are all super friendly.We did not eat at the Clark Street Grill; we opted to go out and about for all our meals, so I can't really comment there.The Cardinal's were actually in Kansas City playing the Royals this past weekend, but I'd love to go back to STL for a ball game when the Card's are in town, and I'd totally stay at The Westin, then, too. The location right across from the ballpark is great.A Westin is a Westin is a Westin (unless you're in Seattle, in which case it's more like a Motel 6).  I mean that in a good way though, they're consistently good quality - friendly staffs, nice clean interiors, comfy beds, decent gyms and edible restaurants.  This property is no different - definitely a quality option in STL.P.S.  If you're a baseball groupie this is THE place to be.  The hotel is right across the street from the stadium and there's a good chance you'll be shacking up alongside the visiting team when they're in town for a series.  I was here back when the All-Star Game was in town and the whole NL (or was it AL?) roster was there....Prestige hotel and extremely nice rooms!! Extra big bathroom!!!!I have not stayed at this hotel, but I did have occasion to eat at the restaurant twice. On the first occasion, more than two years ago, the place happened to be packed to the rafters, seeing as how it was a game night. Even so, the service was quick and professional and the food was above average, especially by hotel restaurant standards. My second visit to the restaurant is fresher in my mind, as it was last Sunday, before a matinee performance at the newly restored Peabody Opera House. The restaurant was decidedly less crowded on this visit--in fact, I was the only patron. Even so, the service was attentive and I did not feel rushed or under a microscope. My order was relatively pedestrian  (potato and leek soup along with a glass of the house chardonnay). The soup was good, though it could have been a bit warmer by temperature. Considering that my options that day were fairly narrow--between a hot dog table outside of the Scottrade Center and the fast food alley setup within Union Station--I am forever grateful to the Westin for providing a civilized, pre-show dining experience.I am reviewing the RESTAURANT only.  Absolutely...NEVER had a bad meal here.  In fact...the food here has been outstanding.  Hotels are normally not known for there restaurants...but believe me...this place is impressive.  I had the French Onion soup.  Normally...I never order soup at a restaurant.  I have to say...bar none...the best I've ever had.  The onions were tasty the cheese was oozing off the bowl...  Go!  You will be impressed.I'm in StL for work, and I must admit, I love Westin rooms.  Their showers are amazing.  And so are the bathtubs.  Beds are comfy, and the rooms are spacious.But.  There's always a but, right?What's up with housekeeping?  Is my room always last to be done?  Is that why you arbitrarily pick things to make up? My bed is always made, and I thank you for that, dear housekeeping ladies and gents.  But why must you give me a different number of towels each time?  Can you at least give me more toiletries on a consistent basis? I have thick hair, so I need a new tiny bottle of conditioner every night.  Please? Pretty please?  Perhaps new glasses sometimes would be nice, I don't like reusing my glasses everyday.Worst customer service I have ever experienced at a Westin. Upon arrival the first day room was not prepared, had to wait 2 hours. Took 45 minutes after requesting room service menu for someone to bring it to our room. Took and hour to receive our breakfast that we placed an order for the evening prior. Would have expected a little more from a westin.The good: really nice room and at a good rate ($99 + tax, etc); more space than I imagined I would have and, yes, the bathroom is large. The bad: when I called for a room the same day, the representative told me only one room was left and it would be $139. Luckily, I knew about the Internet rate (and that is was available) but since I was driving, I opted to call. Curious though. More bad, food is so-so and definitely overpriced, even by hotel standards. Chicken and asparagus were both overcooked. Bathroom soaps, etc smell awful. But that's probably just me.  I'm sure some people love them.  But this is unusual for me.  Typically I am neutral to these sorts of things.  This alone would keep me from staying there again, unless I brought my own bathroom supplies!All in all, great room, questionable service/booking policies, good price in the end.Pro:The location-As long as you are a baseball fan. We were there over the Cubs-Cards series weekend and the place and parking lot were packed all the time. So it just depends on your reason for being in STL whether or not this is a plus.The rooms-They are nice and decorated in the typical Westin fashion. Very quiet with a spacious bathroom. There is a separate shower & tub in the room.Parking-Plenty of parking due to the self parking lot for hotel guests and employees only across the street. Metro-The stadium metro stop is right next to the hotel which made using the train really easy. Con: Long hallways-It takes a while to get to your room because of the layout of the hotel. Next time, I would request a room closer to the elevator.Pay Internet-I don't use my laptop too often out of the house, so it is bother that you have to pay $17 a day to use their internet, but it is free at the cheaper Four Point Sheraton hotels by Starwood.No bad things to say about this place! I travelled with three friends watch the Blackhawks vs. Blues game and the room exceeded our expectations. The beds were large and oh so comfortable. I normally have an extremely hard time sleeping in foreign beds since I'm so in love with my own but I had no problem falling asleep. The bathroom was huge with a full bathtub that I later enjoyed a relaxing bubble bath in. The parking was only $20 for the night, not bad at all. The Wi-FI was pay per use but we weren't concerned with that since we were only there for the night. It was within walking distance of the arch, several restaurants, the Scott Trade Center, and is directly across the street from Busch stadium. The concierge was extremely friendly and gave great walking directions and suggestions. I can't wait to be back next year!Nice hotel with spacious, well-designed rooms and on-par Westin service.  The location isn't the best if you're not a baseball fan (up along Washington Avenue would be more in the thick of things) but the MetroLink station certainly is convenient.  Speaking of that station, why isn't there a lower-level connection from the hotel to that platform?I'm a bit disappointed that the character of this old warehouse has been preserved only on the exterior.  The rooms might as well be new construction, save for the high ceilings and generous windows.Very cool hotel in a kind of large warehouse / loft type building.  Very nice staff.  We had a bit of an issue I won't elaborate on but they handled it well above and beyond the call of duty.Amazing bathroom.  Out of this world.  Huge.  Very cool, spa-like, modern tub at one end.  Very big glass enclosed shower on the other end.  His and her wash basins with black stone top.  Thick luxurious towels.The room was very large with high ceilings.  Bed was top notch.

review_content: Another fun NYE at the Crowne Plaza Clayton!This rating of four stars is due to the quality service and the nice room; it would have been three stars if I relied solely on my experience with the dinner and bands for the 2015/2016 NYE celebration.Having said that, this was our second year in a row to partake of the NYE festivities at the Crowne-Clayton. Our first experience, food-wise, was much better!We purchased the top tier package: Room, steak and lobster dinner, unlimited drinks, 3 bands, NY Day brunch. The cost was $170 per person.Let me tell you, for $170 I need a much better dining experience! My steak was mealy (you know, when the cut is sub-par and too much tenderizer has been used) for a supposed filet. The lobster was extremely fishy and chewy. Face it, I LOVE to eat and this just wasn't up to par. I ate only portions of each and that's not normal for me! The twice baked potato was meh, and the salad and dessert (cheesecake) being average. And normally, the brunch the next morning is the true highlight as it's a feast for the eyes as well as the taste buds. Well, this year it was beautiful to look at, but so, I don't know...weird? Odd combinations of things, maybe trying too hard to have too many ethnically diverse choices? One example that was odd is that there were tons of sliced cheeses and meats. Sounds great! But NO crackers to eat them with. Was I supposed to put them on the waffles or pancakes? The cold pitas maybe? Who knew. And one section of the dessert table was raised (maybe for aesthetics?) so high that I couldn't reach anything on it. I'm not 2 feet, 4 inches! I'm a normal height woman at 5'4" so this was just weird. I will say there were lots of choices, I just found many of them odd and without continuity. Last year's was MUCH better!Now, for the bands. Two years in a row we've been in the main ballroom where the "headliner" band is. That's two years in a row that the band has, well, frankly, sucked. We found the DJ in the basement and the band on the first floor to be much better, but such small rooms that everyone was trying to pack themselves onto tiny dance floors. End of music rant.The room! The room was VERY nice! King sized bed, tons of extra floor space, counter space, room in the bathroom. There was a microwave and fridge. The TV was incredibly small and outdated, but we weren't there to watch TV. The room was also clean and there were plenty of towels in the bathroom. Two downsides to the room: the bed was SO high off the ground I needed the ottoman to get up on it. I'm really not THAT short folks! What is it with the tall stuff at this hotel? And the make up mirror in the bathroom was sitting on the counter, not mounted on the wall. That was back-breaking to use! Terrible design.The service! The service was GREAT!!! Seriously, from check-in, to dinner, to drinks, to the servers at the brunch...all top notch! Even thought the drinks were included, I gave the bartender I went to a $20 because he was busting his butt to keep the line moving!The lobby, etc., are very beautiful and clean. They need more elevators, but it's an old building and it's been an add-on process so I can see how this has happened. Parking is convenient and attached to the building.Overall, it wasn't too bad. I think my better experience the previous year is what is keeping me from rating it much lower. That, and the great service and the friends we've made from doing this two years in a row. However, I don't think we'll try it for a third year. I would stay here again, just not do the NYE thing.This hotel is conveniently located if you are looking for a place close to WUSTL or if you want to stay in Clayton. The hotel is kind of old, but good enough provided it is not super expensive. Definitely it is not a 4-star one: no 4-star hotel gives plastic bowls in the breakfast buffet. Besides that, the breakfast is good, with plenty of options. My room was big and clean, with a comfortable bed, although the A/C was old.Very pleased with this hotel.   There was a large loud wedding tonight but that made it nice and lively with a lot of drinking and bass pumping music that ended before midnight.   Both the indoor and outdoor pools were open late - nice.  One of my pet peeves about hotels is when the pool closes like at 8-9 when we never get home before dinner and like to swim late before bed.    For a 50 year old hotel it's been preserved quite well and is in great condition.  Beautiful hardwood floors and carpets, lovely lobby with abundant chandeliers and mirrors everywhere even in the rooms.  Great HD TV and channel line up, fridge and microwave, clean restrooms and bed.   Fast WI-FI (on it now and uploaded dozens of photos to Yelp real fast).The shuttles are fast and friendly and will take you where you want to go in downtown Clayton (small) free until 11 pm.   When we called for a pickup our driver was there in less than 5 minutes.   Nice guy that knows the area.The AC is pretty loud (you operate it from the wall controls, not the ones on it).   When we asked the front desk how to operate it the lady was obviously tired of answering that question and told us to read the sign on it saying that you have to use the wall controls (there is no sign), but other than that the staff is friendly enough.   Only a two block walk to hop onto the metro line and scoot on into downtown STL.Free parking garage on weekends, free breakfast buffet (EXCELLENT!) and a one block walk from some of the hottest restaurants and night life.  Reasonably priced compared to downtown Saint Louis.  Excellent service easily squeaks out a 4.5 rounded up to 5.   Love the staff here.What a great staff !!!!   The made the stay awesome !!!!   Rooms were large and very clean.  Rooms come with TV, mini fridge, coffee pot, and microwave.   With your stay, you get complimentary breakfast buffet.   There is Fresh fruit, eggs, dougnuts, and all the fixings.  You can also get waffles and omelets upon request.   There is also a gym and pool.  The hotel is in the nice part of town, a little ways from main down town.  But the metro is right around the corner to make transportation easy.  Make sure you get the green tickets from the front desk so that you can get in and out of the parking garage during the day.As someone loyal to the Hilton brand I was initially skeptical of staying at the Crowne Plaza (IHG). The skepticism was undeserved as the Crowne provided a solid 4 star experience for our conference.Pros:On-site restaurant and bar with happy hour. (Breakfast buffet with made to order omlets made for a hearty breakfast)Up to date amenities including: LG flat screens w/ HD, mini fridge and microwave, safe, and desk. Variety of restaurants that are walking distance including Starbucks, Subway, Ruth Christ, Morton's Steakhouse, Sushi AI, etc.Great white glove service during catered meals Great front office customer service (from shuttle pickup to housekeeping)Complimentary ArcadeHeated indoor/outdoor poolCons:Property feels a bit dated (Its an older property)*Crystal Ballroom AC sounds like car slamming on breaks every time it comes on*Overall a successful conference thanks to the staff!Thank you for the great hospitality!Extraordinary service is hard to come by, but I think we all appreciate it when we find it. It's usually the little things that matter most. The Crowne Plaza certainly met the criteria for outstanding service, and here are the little moments that mattered to me:- Free shuttle ride to/from the airport (just call the front desk)- Allowing us to enjoy the breakfast buffet while we waited for our rooms to be ready despite not staying at the hotel the night before- Getting our room ready for early check in before 1pm- The maid introducing herself and telling me to let her know if I need anythingI would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, and I will most likely stay here again when I come back to St. Louis.This review is in regard to the venue services.  We worked with Brenda Hinton here to host our wedding reception.  We were thrilled at the affordability of this place especially in comparison to the price per person at other locations in St. Louis.  There is a minimum of how much you can spend here, however, but after that there is no room fee.  Brenda is amazingly helpful and nice.  She met us to tour the lower ballroom where our reception would be held and she was great about answering our questions.  She continued to offer us excellent customer service as we planned our menu, drinks, appetizers, everything.  She also had unending patience with us as we changed our head count several times!  At our reception, the service was phenomenal.  Many of my guests complimented the "white glove" service and loved having a seated dinner.  We were very happy with how our food turned out and the room was set up perfectly!  We also had many guests who stayed here for the wedding.  The front desk assistants were helpful in handing out our guest bags.  There is also a complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning for overnight guests. I highly recommend the Crowne Plaza as a reception venue.  I think the best part is Brenda, she is amazing!Very nice Hotel!!! Big rooms, we stayed in a 2 queen it was nice and clean comes with a mini fridge, coffee pot and microwave.. They have complementary breakfast very good and made to order omelettes and waffles, the owner was at breakfast greeting everyone and introducing him self asking how was are stay and if there was anything he can do for us. I thought that was very nice you don't see that so often in this big Hotels... Over all our stay here was very nice and most definitely will be coming back..... One last thing they have a pool in door and outdoor and the best thing of all in the FREE arcade games they are old school but it was sooo fun playing with the kiddosI'm putting 5 stars simply because of the customer service. The doorman was a pleasant surprise on greeting, the front desk lady was very helpful and nice. The opener of the hotel even came down to real fast one morning and spoke with me and others and handed out his business card. Great service!The hotel itself is by no means a 5 star resort. It's clearly old. But the service far surpasses any need for speedy luxury. I'll definitely stay here again when I'm back in the St. Louis area.This hotel is wonderful. It's truly my home away from home. The staff is the BEST part of the hotel.From the managers to the staff in the restaurant they either know me by name or at least recognize who I am when I arrive. They restaurant breakfast is phenomenal. When I walk in they already know how I like my eggs prepared and are ready for me.The hotel proprietor, Pete, is an amazing, courteous, gentle soul. Special thanks to Erik for ease of booking a room and always taking care of me. Now that they have improved the fitness facility, the upgrades meet my daily work out needs.While the rooms are a bit dated, they are classic and classy.I love the perks of complementary breakfast and evening cocktails and apps (earned for frequent visitors). I think my only criticisms would be sometimes noise issues as the walls are not very sound proof. And I'm super bummed not to accumulate IHG points as they are privately branding at the end of the month (hopefully they keep the other perks). Thanks Crown Team for making me feel at home!Couple things about this hotel -- Everyone I interacted was crazy, super, genuinely friendly. Someones people who are crazy super friendly are creepy and ungenuine. All these people were legit. From housekeeping to front desk to restaurant people.- The owner, a nice old man who looks like everyone's favorite grandpa in a suit, walks around the restaurant in the morning to greet people, say hello and give out his card. It's cute.- The breakfast buffet is amazing for a free hotel breakfast. They have real eggs, an omelet station with VEGETABLES, and the buffet line also had VEGETABLES. VEGETABLES ON A FREE HOTEL BREAKFAST BUFFET OMG. I ate dinner at the restaurant one night as well and while it wasn't the most tasty or gourmet thing ever it was a good value and came with, you guessed it, a good amount of VEGETABLES.- Negative - there was some sort of drip from the room above to my room, outside the window, and it drove me freaking nuts, so I kept the fan on the whole time I tried to sleep. Also one night the person next to me was watching TV kinda loud but that is not the hotel's fault. It was her fault.I'd totally stay here again.First, I will say I wish I could rate this hotel with 5 stars.   We spent 3 nights at this hotel and were pleasantly surprised by the hardwood floors in the room as well as the overall cleanliness. The staff was absolutely excellent and helpful (not like it was a difficult check in process) and all amenities were in very great condition.  The pool was perfect temperature for the St. Louis heat and fresh towels were available pool side. The hotel is in a prime location and everything from Chipotle and subway to fancy 5 star restaurants are within walking distance. Also, the Metro station is only 2 blocks away, making travel quick and convenient.The free breakfast is a full hot buffet. It was classic American breakfast foods and was well worth it, enough said. The only reasons why I removed a star are relatively minor except for one major bump. The minor; There was no air fan in the relatively small bathroom (which was small enough you were unable to get into the bathtub without shutting the door first).  Even though the signs say the front desk would have quarters for the coin operated laundry, no one had any and we had to venture out to get some (no coin machine on site). The major point (in bold) , DO NOT BOOK IF YOU HAVE AN EARLY AM FLIGHT.  When booking online the amenities include a free Airport Shuttle, however not listed in the information was that the shuttle didn't start running until 6am (with an average travel time to the airport of 15 minutes). We were unable to book a custom trip time and ended up using the metro train to save money we would have spent on a cab. Dragging our luggage through the metro wasn't unbearable,  however when booking the hotel we were under the impression that we would have an available shuttle. Overall,  it's a Damn fantastic hotel and I would stay again.This hotel is excellent. The staff and service were extraordinary. From the rooms to the conference accommodations to the complimentary breakfast, I was impressed beyond belief. I travel to STL quite often. This hotel will be my choice every time.I arrived after business close (11PM), but the desk clerk was helpful and attentive. This hotel had deck parking under/beside the hotel, but it had a nominal ($6) charge. I'm not sure if that was listed in the booking. My room was beautiful with crisp white linens on a King-sized bed, chair/ottoman, desk, and spacious bathroom. The AC never turned off! It was a little chilly with it on, even in the summer heat. The lobby and restaurant are beautiful. The breakfast included a chef-attended waffle and omelette bar-- which was extra nice. There was a HUGE variety of hot and cold food with a friendly wait-staff, even though it was a buffet. This hotel was a little bit pricey, but it was well-worth it for the lovely room, large breakfast, and convenient location.Not a bad hotel. Definitely very nice in terms of design and layout. Gym wasn't bad for a hotel either. Front desk customer service was excellent, however, the restaurant's left a bit to be desired. The room was nice, but old. Overall, I'd recommend for another visit.I stayed at the Crowne in Clayton for a wedding this past weekend. It was a treat. Here's why:* Parking was easy and presented no challenges.* The breakfast (make sure you get tickets when you check-in) was great and high value. I'd urge you to save money and do this instead of going out to breakfast.* Free bottled waters on demand at the front desk. Coming in after a late night? Make sure you swing by the front desk so you can have that bottled water on your nightstand when you finally retire.* Convenient location enabled us to walk to plenty of good bars/restaurants in Clayton.* Friendly and attentive staff. Danielle was the standout.My one con:* Late check-in time. It's not until 4:00pm, so make sure you are aware of this.For those looking to find a high-value hotel in the Clayton area, I'd urge you to consider the Crowne Plaza Clayton.I booked a room in St. Louis at what I thought was a nice hotel for one night for my family. We got to the hotel and I stated there were 4 of us and had to have two beds. The lady was rude and stated they were booked and I bought a cheap room off price line and I get what I get.I told her there were 4 of us and we could not fit in a single bed, she said they would send up a roll away bed. We got to the room after getting lost in the parking garage because she had me park in a different building's parking garage. The room was tiny, and when they brought up the roll away bed there was not enough room to set it up, so they took it back out and left us hanging with a $140 room that would not work for my family. I tried calling priceline, I tried calling the insurance protection, and then tried to get a new room through the front desk.  No one cared or would help. We ended up having to buy another room at a different hotel for the evening. This was the worst experience I have ever had on vacation and I really don't appreciate that we ended up having to leave the hotel and spend another $200 to stay somewhere else. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!I stayed here with my family for 3 nights last week and we really enjoyed our stay! The front desk was nice upon check-in, they greeted us with water bottles. Rooms were spacious and clean, the hardwood floor was great! I liked the thermostat being on the wall, it was easy to keep the room at a nice temperature. Room service cleaned our room thoroughly every day. TV's were nice, with a good selection of channels. Mini fridge and microwave come in the room as well! Our room had 2 sinks, one of the sinks is outside of the bathroom which was great! I always hate getting ready in a foggy mirror while someone else is showering. The FREE breakfast buffet is what really won me over... They have everything! Fresh fruit, waffles and omelets upon request, hashbrowns, pancakes, muffins! I was so excited to wake up and eat breakfast every day; our stay was during the week so there was always a spot to sit in the dining area with no wait. The hotel is in a nice/safe area, about 20 minutes from downtown. The only complaints I had- no bathroom fan, both the indoor & outdoor pool were WAY too cold to enjoy (front desk told us the pools were heated) and the blankets could have been more comfortable. Luckily I brought a soft blanket from home, I found myself waking up a few times in the middle of the night because their blankets were so uncomfortable. Overall, I'm very pleased with our stay! --Be sure to get a few of the green tickets from the front desk so that you can get in and out of the parking garage during the day!I booked this hotel as a way to be close to the downtown area, but to save a few bucks. It was a 15 minute drive from the main downtown, which was awesome, and the area it's in is nice, but it did shut down early- hardly anything open at 8pm on a Saturday night!!We had a double room in the 'executive tower', with clean and comfy beds, extra pillows already in the closet, and a bathroom that offered a tub and a separate shower!The front desk for check in and check out were beyond nice and gave us free bottles of water on arrival.The free continental breakfast the next day was awesome! Eggs, two kinds of sausage, two kinds of potatoes, pancakes, french toast, pastries, and a build your own omelette bar. I would've loved to have had one of those omelettes, the looked amazing, but we didn't want to wait. The food was pretty good, overall. The reason I give this 4/5 stars was because of the parking. There is valet, and a free garage that's connected, but the entry way into the garage is so narrow and awkward of a turn in, with a steep ramp down beside it, we had trouble seeing due to the logistics while turning in to the garage- a little scary!! Also, the walls are thin- we identified at least 3 kids in the room next to us. Very easy to hear into the next room!Other than that, super impressive place to stay. I would definitely return.Your experience here will vastly differ depending on who check you in at the front desk. One person from our group got superstar treatment from the receptionist, she was able to check in at 9 am (normal check in is 4 pm), upgraded room (make sure you sign up for a free membership there and you could get a free upgrade too!), free bottled water and maps to local restaurants.A different person checked us in, we couldnt check in until 4 pm, no water, maps or anything else. She wasn't unpleasant, just not as thorough or as friendly.The room is nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel itself is a bit older and it shows on the weathered carpet and faded decorations. Great WiFi connection.Huge breakfast selection with tableside service for drinks. The owner, a nice senior gentleman told me about the omelet and waffle station. Walking distance to a few eateries, 15 min walk to the Galleria Mall. Safe neighborhood.
review_content_20: I stayed here recently while on a business trip. I was a little nervous when the trip was booked because I read the reviews and there were a lot of complaints about noise. Being a light sleeper as it is this made me sad. But I'm a problem solver and so went to the store and purchased some ear plugs for my trip. No noise issues for me. I slept straight through the night each night. I could tell that the room I was in had been remodeled but it was nice. The room has hardwood floors which I thought was pretty cool. You don't normally see that in hotel rooms.The lobby is grand looking with a huge staircase heading up to the second floor. And for a hotel their gym was pretty decent and open 24 hours (yay me). You do have to pay for parking which is a bummer. In the past I have only encountered this in hotels in much larger cities like Chicago, Dallas or SF. It wasn't crazy expensive, something like 8 bucks a day but still a bummer. I had breakfast included with my reservation. I generally skip the hotel provided breakfast because they are buffet of cheap pastries but these guys go all out. The cheap pastries are still present but there is a hot breakfast buffet and omelet station. The staff working in the restaurant were also super nice. The owner even stopped by table the last morning of my stay to ask how I liked the hotel and if I was enjoying my stay. Nice touch.When I'm in St. Louis for business again, I'll ask to be booked here.I'm in-house as I write this review.In short, the value for your money is incredible. The staff is first rate. The rooms are a slightly older decor, but they are 100% clean, the water is hot and water pressure is good. The area is safe. The breakfast is one of the best I've ever seen for a comp breakfast.Soon the property will be going independent, changing flags from Crowne Plaza to being just the "Clayton". I certainly hope they do well as they are worthy of everyone's patronage.The staff here is amazing. I stayed here for two weeks with a big group for work, and management, front desk, servers, and drivers were friendly and accommodating. There is a clean and decently equipped gym with tvs; the laundry room was equipped with 4-5 washers and dryers and a TV; and breakfast offered excellent choices. The stand out is definitely the customer service here. Everyone always had a smile, and they even gave free bottles of cold water, which is a nice touch considering the 90+ degree weather in the summer. The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars is the bedding. This may be more of a preference, but I prefer fluffier blankets (like down) and pillows that do not sink all the way down. It would have also been nice to have some rotating options for breakfast over the course of two weeks. To end on a positive, this hotel has $2-3 happy hour drinks and is located next to a metro stop and chic restaurants.This poor girl is tired. In desperate need of rejuvenation. She was once a beauty in the 80's, but is now dated and overdue for a major renovation. The rooms have received a modest updating, but the bathrooms haven't been touched. However.... The staff was incredibly friendly and professional, and the amenities made up for the shortcomings. Free wifi, water bottles at check-in, and a full buffet breakfast - not just yogurt and cereal, but made to order omelets, waffles, and hot breakfast items to make other budget chains jealous. If you can look past the dated decor, this is a decent value in a great location.I'll preface this review by saying all other experiences with Crowne hotels have been pleasant. However, this particular hotel and stay was anything but.Negatives: hotel is old, room was not clean and in a general state of disrepair. We found LOTS of hair on our shower walls, nasty stains on the bedding, and things just falling apart everywhere. What's worse? The management decided to have some contracting work done this morning. Soooo...at around 7:00 am I was roused to the sound of drills and hammers throughout my hallway. I'm encouraged that they are fixing things but need to find a better day/time to do it. Parking was not free and cost $6 for our stay.Positives: location is great...roughly halfway between the airport and city center. There is plenty to do and see within a 20 minute driving radius. The included breakfast is good and the fitness center is adequate if that's your thing. Pool looks nice but we didn't use it. Finally, while at breakfast, the owner was there walking around and talking with guests. He didn't specifically ask about our stay, and we didn't offer any suggestions, but it was a nice gesture.I took my kids here for a little St. Louis mini-cation. I chose this hotel based on it's location close to the Galleria, the Zoo, and the City Museum. The location was perfect. You do need to be aware that the hotel is in the middle of the city and there is a lot of traffic and city driving. The parking garage for the hotel is large and they do not have accessible carts for self loading. They have lots of friendly valets available to assist you for $$ of course. The breakfast buffet was the best I have seen for one included in your room price. They had a made to order omelet station and Belgian waffle press. The room was clean and spacious. For families traveling with kids, the pool and free video game room was a huge highlight. The pool is half inside and half outside which is quite a novelty for kids. Not sure how that works in the winter. I might have given a 5 star review but I was a little disappointed in the bedding in the rooms. The pillows and sheets were premium but the coverlet was paper thin and we all had to request extra blankets.Worst.  Service.  Ever.  I've stayed here twice before for two extended stays with work (a federal agency) and had a good experience, so I thought it would be a safe bet for a one night stay as a private citizen.  Oh how very wrong I was.  I would've rather stayed at a no tell motel on the side of the interstate in the middle of nowhere (and probably would've been treated better). Should we ever be in St. Louis again and this is the only available hotel, I will sleep in my car first. First, we were not recognized as IHG rewards members (platinum level) and we're not offered our choice of a welcome snack bag or welcome points, as is customary in IHG properties.   More importantly, they were rude and completely lacking in common sense when it came to our room.  We booked a king but were placed in a two queen room.  My first call to the front desk resulted in being told that the central reservations indicated that we asked for a two queen room.  After finding my confirmation email, I called back, provided my confirmation number and asked to be placed in the room type that we reserved.   I expected it to be an easy fix, after all I had a confirmation email. WRONG!  I was basically told that I was lying and that no king rooms were available, and I immediately expressed both my frustration and concern about the problem.   The desk clerk then said that he would have to see something in writing before he could do anything.  Really?  He just told me a minute earlier that there were no king rooms available, so why not just fix the problem instead of demanding written proof????   Sooooooo, I walked down to the lobby, handed over my phone and allowed him to see that I was not a liar and had in fact been confirmed for a king room.  With the click of a button, we were placed in a king room (again after being told that none were available).  Absolutely unacceptable!   Add to this the fact that the king room had greasy foot prints on the laminate flooring and the fact that the parking garage was incredibly iffy as far as safety given the random people walking around looking at the cars (had I been traveling alone as a female, there is now way that I would've felt comfortable in it).   I even called the IHG customer service number to report my concerns, and a week later I still have not received a courtesy call from management at this property, which further suggests a lack of commitment to customer satisfaction.  We will not be back at this property.  Ever.My meeting at the Ritz: but rooms were sold out so I saw this was close and booked it.  First off, the neighborhood is safe and quiet but rather dull, fortunately you are between 2 stops on the Metrolink to hightail it out of there for something more stimulating.  The hotel lobby and entrance is fine enough, a bit old fashioned but well polished and clean, appears to be a common place for weddings and parties.  Once you get beyond this however there are a variety of sights and smells that betray a less well-kept establishment.  Strange dentist-office like fumes waft in the halls.  The doors appear poorly painted from the outside.  The pool area is difficult to figure out how to get in and the key card machine looks like it is falling off.  The sauna did not get very hot at all.  There were people yelling intermittently out the window all night, a deep throbbing mechanical sound from underneath, and cooing pigeons that sounded like they lived inside the wall. The interior of the room itself was standard and the bed was nice, the external elements around the rooms were just discouraging.   There is an attached restaurant where you can get complementary breakfast buffet food, which was standard and nothing extravagant.Very dated, not very clean and not kept up. Antiseptic smell. Would not stay there again. Parking is cumbersome.The hotel is very beautiful and in a very good location near forest park.  the area is walk-able and if we had wanted to I believe there was a free shuttle the we could have used.  The Breakfast was excellent and the owner even came out and greeted us himself.  It was also a very reasonable price.  We had a great time here!I stayed at this hotel last year (2014) in February. They have a nice breakfast in the morning as well as good food at the restaurant later on in the evening. I ordered room service once and it was wonderful. The pool was a bit noisy with all the kids in there but that's ok. The pool was very well maintained, heated, and part of it was indoors which was great because it was during the winter. The only thing I did not like was when housekeeping came to my door repeatedly during the last hour before check-out, knocking on the door twice reminding me it was almost time to go and I was in the shower. I do not like to feel rushed. Despite this, I would go back if the price is right.Ok, I just HAD to write a review about my experience here! First of all, free shuttle to and from the airport? Chyea! Gettin off on the right foot already crowney p! Second, free WiFi with easy login worked flawlessly. This may seem like a weird thing to notice, but I travel a lot for work and this is crucial! Thirdly, a story for you...After I was done with a late work call I wanted to grab some dinner. It was about 10ish, so what do I do? Yelp it of course, to eateries in the area with kitchens open late and decent food. After settling on a tapas place, I head down to the lobby and ask the concierge if it's safe to walk in the neighborhood at this time because I'm not familiar with the area. He asks where I'm going, and then what happens next? He actually gets up and personally walks me the 5/6 blocks to the restaurant. Then we get there and he actually knows the owner too - hands me off and tells him I'm a guest at the hotel so he should take good care of me. Are you kidding me? If that ain't some southern hospitality for ya, I don't know what is. Concierge of the month award anyone? Good service like that always overshadows the little things, like an outdated room or less than impressive breakfast. I'll be back just for the great staff.This Crowne Plaza was the fanciest one I've been to.  The lobby was beautiful and our room had hardwood floors.  I slept very well here.  The desk was very helpful also.  The entire hotel was updated, clean and friendly staff.  I'd stay here again in a heartbeat and also recommend it to anyone going to St. Louis.I get off my flight, call the hotel, and they send a free shuttle to pick me up from the airport. The driver was nice, but the front desk lady was even nicer. Superb staff here, even got free bottles of water from the front desk upon checking in. After I checked out, the concierge took my luggage for safekeeping as I visited Washington University. He was extremely nice and helpful and walked outside to show me where the bus stop was. The room is comfy with a fridge and a microwave. Plus the free breakfast is good! The entire atmosphere here is very nice and I'm very pleased with my experience here. Would definitely recommend it!This is 3.5 starsLocation and price are unbeatable. The hotel is in a great location. Downtown Clayton is packed with restaurants an things to do. Also, it's located right by the train, which takes you straight to wash u, Busch stadium, or many other attractions.  The rooms are clean, but small.  Nothing to complain about. The maid service didn't come one day, but no big deal...Bonus: the free breakfast is very good but on weekends is a complete zoo. Get there early!!! Great coffee.Came to St. Louis for a wedding and they had booked a block of rooms at this hotel.Pros:- Free shuttle to and from airport- Free breakfast buffet (omelet chef, anyone?)- Free wifi - Nice lobby area- Dry sauna- Arcade room with free games (although at time of review, Mortal Kombat was broken)- Walking distance from several good bars- Comfortable bedCons: - Far away from downtown St. Louis- Hard to find your way around their multiple towers- Pool area is in the bowels of the hotel and the hallway to the pool is either under construction or is the set of a horror movieReally, the pros outweigh the cons.Miss C., her friend and I went for an after-wedding brunch Sunday, sponsored by friends of the groom. Signage helped us know where to go as soon as we walked into the lobby of the hotel. That was incredibly helpful.The room was spectacular. The food was great. Fresh fruit (grapes, strawberries, pineapple, cantaloupe, maybe some honeydew), wonderful scrambled eggs that were still moist and topped with parsley and red (roasted red peppers?) so they didn't look so yellow.Bacon perfectly cooked ultra-crispy yum. Sausage links I didn't try. Waffles I didn't try. Many, many muffins and croissants and Danish I didn't try -- they were all beautiful. Bagels, cream cheese in many varieties.Grapefruit juice. BINGO!! Orange juice, cranberry juice.What was so spectacular -- besides the food I got ('cause I got the food in the buffet that I wanted) -- was the service.Making sure we had coffee and juice at the table, clearing plates, bringing a glass of ice. Filling waters. Checking all the time to ensure we were getting what we wanted and needed. Incredibly polite. Coffee service was important, 'cause I believe we emptied the carafe at the table pretty quickly.And it was great to talk with more of the wedding guests after such a spectacular event Saturday.We had a wonderful stay with our large dog and 7 year daughter. The staff was outstanding, helping us with anything we needed. The room was comfortable and the breakfast far exceeded our expectations.This hotel is the perfect example of "Don't Judge a Book by Its Cover", but in a negative way.When we walked into the hotel, the lobby was beautiful. Nice chandeliers and great customer service. I was surprised that this hotel was actually 3 stars because it look like 4 stars and up.Then I walked up to my room and then that's when things got bad.Here is my breakdown of my hotel experience.Pros:- Free self parking- Free breakfast buffet- Free wifi (even though it didn't work for me)- Nice lobby areaCons:- The floors with the rooms are ancient looking. Ugly carpeting and the hallways smell terrible. - The rooms were small and ancient as well.- The bathroom was dirty! We found cheez-its on the bathroom floor. - To access the parking garage, you have to go through the second floor then walk down the stairs to the first floor lobby and then go through the silver elevators. You can't access it through the second floor. I got this hotel through priceline so I'm not super surprised by the appearance. They did a very good job of decorating the lobby because that is where the first impressions come in. I would probably stay here again if I needed to be close to the Galleria, but that's about it. There are a lot better hotels around.Our room (a suite) was dirty, the fridge was leaking all over the floor, the bathroom was falling apart, and the decor was so old!
review_content_40: Your mileage may vary couldn't be more true than for the Crowne Plaza. I'd stayed here numerous times over the past year and had given up on the place due to small, outdated rooms. Fortunately, the competition in the area has major maintenance/upkeep issues, so I gave the Crowne another try. This go around was the first time that I've stay in the newer/upgraded section of the hotel (over at least 8 previous stays)...I must say that this part of the hotel is night and day difference. For the area, this is a 4+ as it's much nicer (wood floors, larger rooms, updated, etc.)...However, if you get the smaller outdated rooms, you're in the 2 range.My dad and I took a trip to St. Louis to watch the Cardinals and I went through Priceline to get a room.  I was very pleased to find out our hotel was the Crowne Plaza.  Upon check in the attendant was very pleasant and helpful.  The room was small but very clean.  All of the staff was very nice to deal with. The free breakfast was as good as free breakfasts gets.  On the second morning Pete Zes, the owner, stopped by our table to make sure we were having a good stay.  He was very sincere and very interesting to talk to.  He made a great impression and along with our experience I would definitely recommend staying here.I stayed here for a week. The breakfast is hands-down the best I've had. There is a made to order omelet and waffle area as well as a ton of hot dishes (corn beef hash, biscuits and gravy, sausage, etc.), oatmeal, fresh fruit, baked goods, etc. The rooms are also very nice. I was in a double queen (free upgrade) with climate control thermostat (as opposed to off/on), fridge, microwave, and safe. The complaints I have with the room is that the bathroom is so small it feels like you are always hitting the door and there is no fan in the bathroom. Since there is no fan in the bathroom, I can see evidence of mold growth that looks like it was covered up at one point. Lastly, I was really excited about the indoor/outdoor pool and sauna, but the pool was not maintained and you could see stuff floating in it. The outdoor area is also in the corner  lower level of the hotel so it doesnt get a lot of sun. Overall though the rooms were good, breakfast great, and hotel staff very friendly and helpful.Good stay. Free parking, wifi, and breakfast buffet. Greeted promptly and courteously. Room was clean, large, had amenities, and in working condition. Would stay again. Decent price.Stayed overnight on our way back to West palm beach, our room was clean and a/c unit worked great! We were able to be walking distance to the metrolink. We enjoyed the stay and loved the breakfast buffet in the morning and the hospitality was great! The owner Pete was in the restaurant going table to table greating the guests! How often do you see that? We took the hotel shuttle to Stl for our flight home and we will definitely stay again!I would recommend this hotel as a stay for a night of partying nearby in the Loop only. There are a lot of pros to this hotel but one MAJOR con. Pros: - Free breakfast buffet with hot, cooked foods!- Indoor heated pool and FREE arcade games!- Free self parking- Comfy bedsCON:- Absolutely NO sound proofing anywhere. Seriously, you will wake up in a cold sweat thinking people are in your room shouting at you when in reality, they are in the hallway just talking like normal. I think the walls are constructed of paper mache. Thankfully, we had been out on the town and were just exhausted and drunk enough to manage 5 hours of sleep through the hallway noise. But if you have kids or are on a romantic trip or doing anything besides getting drunk, not gonna work. Our room was one of the renovated ones but it obviously didn't include any work on wall insulation. The pool is pretty hard to find and most of the staff is really lazy and will not show you where it is. If you are in a dank twisty stairwell into the basement, you are on the right track. BRING EARPLUGS!! And noise cancelling headphones. And your iPod. And a white noise machine.Rooms are not that clean, especially the restrooms. Every wall, elevators in this hotel looks beaten and I believe this building is really old!   Personally, I would never stay here again.We stayed two nights. I booked the room through Priceline two months in advance. I read some reviews that said the walls were thin and to request a room in a quiet area. So, I sent an email to the hotel to that effect. We were given a room on the fifth floor in the Executive Tower. The room was huge. Two beds, large bathtub with separate shower, comfortable beds, plenty of room. We noticed some noise, but nothing out of the norm for a hotel. It was perfect. Some friends of ours had a room in the part of the hotel, and their room was rather small.You get vouchers for the free breakfast buffet located in the onsite restaurant. The food is delicious for being a buffet. You can also order an omelet and/or waffles made to order. We ordered a pizza through room service. Fresh ingredients and good flavor.Also, they have shuttle service anywhere within a 3-5 mile area. We were able to go out without having to pay cab fare. We encountered many members of the staff throughout our stay and each person was courteous and helpful.Overall, this place was amazing and beautiful and we had a great experience there. If we are ever in the area again I will definitely book here.Stayed for four nights at the Crowne Plaza Clayton and had a very solid experience. Perks include free wireless and a free, enormous breakfast (omelet station, hot line, cold line). The staff were extremely friendly and the location convenient. Complimentary shuttle to the airport. The physical plant is in the midst of a refurb but it's mostly quite nice. Comfortable bed. My floor (8) was a little loud with early risers and families. I think they offer quiet floors -- worth asking about. Great value for the money and I would stay here again.Have stayed here twice before because the rates are great for Clayton. It's an older hotel but clean with a free hot buffet breakfast. Rooms are a little small but nicely decorated and service was good. However, there is no sound insulation between rooms so we've had trouble sleeping through the night both times. The first visit we had a room by the elevator, and doors opening and shutting sounded like rumbling thunder. The second visit we were further away, but noise from the hallway and other rooms still woke us up. I think next time we'll try staying somewhere else in search of a quieter environment.My kids and I stayed here for 4 nights 10/21-10/25. We had a pleasant stay without too many complaint.The Good: Staff was friendly. The heated Indoor/outdoor pool was excellent especially for swimming in the middle of October. Free arcade room connected to the pool area was great entertainment for the kids. They are old games from the 80's but my kids enjoyed them and it was kind of fun for me to play games that I used to play when I was their age. Free breakfast buffet everyday. The owner of hotel was at the buffet every morning greeting guests which shows he cares about his customers. One morning the fire alarm went off and we had to evacuate out into the cold weather. My daughter had just gotten out of the shower and was wet and cold. One of the ladies from the cleaning staff gave her coat to her to keep warm while we waited. It ended up being a false alarm but it was a nice gesture from the staff member. Hotel restaurant was not bad and was not pricey like most hotels restaurants are.Not so good: Walls are thin so you can hear most everything going on in next room. We had a room at the end of the hall so we only had one side to worry about. Honestly it did not wake my kids up when neighbor used blow dryer so it was not that big of an issue. Pancakes at breakfast buffet were hard and not easy to cut. With buffet being free it was not that big of a deal to me.I got the room for a great price through Priceline. I would definitely stay here again.cons: Single room was small with very small bathroom.  Older building so we could hear everything out in the hallway. If noise is an issue for you, I'd ask for a room in a quiet area (ours was close to elevator).pros: Decent sized fridge and a small microwave! Service was excellent! Very nice helpful staff. Room was clean and bed was very comfy.Had a stay-cation in clayton where they have some cute shops and restaurants. The suite was very reasonably prices but you get what you pay for. The hotel is older. Pool was heated, very chlorinated, older but clean. Good for the kids- there were several playing in the pool. The reason it got a two star is for cleanliness. The fridge had not been emptied and the coffee cup was filled with someone else coffee!! I was not expecting it to have coffee and spilled it on myself- gross!!  There was a boogie wipes empty pack under the couch.This hotel was very nice. The place was clean and spacious. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was great with many options. Great stay.I lost my jacket in one of the rooms after the chess tournament. I gave them a call the next day and told me they did not see my jacket, but gave me a call a day after and told me they found it. They are very honest, courteous and helpful.Despite mixed feelings based on the reviews here, I made a reservation under my Priority Club membership (which is free) and when I got to the hotel, they'd upgraded me from a queen room to a king room at no charge. Check-in was fast and friendly. They asked if we wanted to stay on a lower level or higher level and we chose higher level. I'm glad we did because they put us on the eighth floor, so we didn't have anyone stomping around above us.What others have said about the noise level is true. We happened to stay there while it was quiet with the usual type of guests on the floor (couples, families with kids), but unfortunately, while we got a renovated room with digital temperature control (we blasted the A/C!), "hardwood" floors (laminate), and the bed was amazingly comfortable, the walls and door are paper thin. It takes away from the comfort of the experience when you can hear someone urinating in the next room over and you're laying in bed. Space wise, the room was totally fine, but because the room we were in wasn't very deep, the door was only a handful of feet away and so any and all noise was heard on the hall (and that's a two-way street). Also, we were on the eighth floor but we could hear sounds from the street below. The building is old and not well insulated.I think they are still renovating certain wings because the second floor hallway near the door that leads out to the parking garage still REEKS of smoke, despite the fact that it's a non-smoking hotel. A great perk for staying here, especially in Clayton, is that the parking garage was free all weekend. We were also given vouchers for the breakfast buffet, though we didn't end up using them because we were headed out to brunch the next morning. Check-out was fast and easy, though we were not asked how our stay was. I would have said fine but still. I'm giving it four stars because our experience was fine and it's a very convenient place to stay but I will caution those who are sensitive to noise (as I am) to not stay here if you really want it QUIET. However, the bed was insanely comfortable and the bathroom was lovely! All depends on how you weigh out these pros against the cons.This place was really a disappointment.  First, there are no deadbolts on the doors...I don't like that. I was traveling with a coworker who ended up in a terrible room immediately off the lobby and where you enter from the parking lot... Very noisy. When we checked in she asked to be moved, they said they were sold out but that if she was unhappy with the room to come back and they'd see what they could do. So she asked them to just see what they could do now, and the guy at the desk says "well we're sold out so we can't do anything." Um, so why the heck did you offer to do something????  I'm in my room getting ready for bed, and can't stop sneezing.  Finally realize all the pillows are down, which I'm allergic to. Call the front desk..."well, I probably can't get you one tonight but I can do it tomorrow." 25 mins later, no pillow. 11 pillows in the room, finally found one foam one mixed in with the rest so I got to spend the next day with bloodshot eyes and sniffles.  And then despite the hardwood floors there was hair everywhere in the room...floor, bed, shower...and mildew all on the shower curtain liner.  Seriously, never going here again. The one by the airport is a million times better. What a disappointment.The Good: 1) Great location. Located close to Forest Park, Washington University, and Delmar St.2) Affordable pricing.3) Old building, yet updated facility.The Bad:1) NO Air Conditioning! Let me say it another way- you have no control over the temperature. I am typically cold natured, but I was sweating at points in the room.2) No fan. Only noisy construction in the morning. I need sound to sleep soundly.3) On our 3rd day, I asked that the sheets be changed, which they did. Yet, they then failed to touch our bathroom besides changing out the towels. I can live without a streak free bathroom- but should I have to when I am paying?
